title: V3053 OPPEDE
body:
Set against the dramatic backdrop of the Luberon mountains and within walking distance of Oppède, this extraordinary estate stands as one of the most prestigious properties the Luberon has to offer. Enjoying utter privacy, the property encompasses a magnificent 18th-century bastide, five independent guest houses, a professional tennis court, and a luxurious pool house - set at the heart of over 11 acres of exquisitely landscaped grounds. Renovated throughout to an exceptional standard, the estate exudes understated luxury, with natural materials, refined design, and every possible contemporary amenity. This is the epitome of Provençal elegance - a landmark residence in the heart of the Luberon Valley.

The Bastide
Dating back to 1789, the bastide has been masterfully restored, preserving its architectural grandeur while subtly introducing modern comforts. The bastide enjoys a vast courtyard garden, centred around a traditional stone fountain and shaded by a centuries-old fig tree. Covered terraces, large dining areas, and a fully equipped summer kitchen line the edges of the courtyard, creating an enchanting setting for outdoor dining and entertaining guests.

The ground floor comprises: entrance hall with cloakroom and guest WC; kitchen with Lacornue gas range, fireplace, and breakfast area; formal dining room; elegant sitting room with ornate stone fireplace; TV room; office with direct access to the garden.

The first floor presents an impressive master suite, composed of a generous double bedroom, vast dressing room, and en-suite bathroom. Two further suites are located on this floor, each with its own en-suite bathroom. A staircase leads to the upper level, comprising a mezzanine office and dedicated accommodation for a childminder or live-in help, complete with bathroom and WC.

The lower level accommodates: utility room; technical room; wine cellar; larder; and a walk-in safe.

Guest Accommodation & Annexes
Five beautifully appointed, and air-conditioned, guest houses are located on the grounds, each offering charm, comfort, and privacy. Three feature a double bedroom and stylish shower room, while a two-bedroom gîte offers a private kitchen and sitting room - ideal for extended stays. A separate caretaker's apartment includes a kitchen, bedroom, and bathroom.

The Pool House
The pool house is a luxurious retreat in its own right, with a full kitchen and sun-drenched living area lined with French doors. This space also includes a sauna, cold plunge, and a spacious bathroom with a wood-burning stove - perfect for unwinding after a swim. Two double bedrooms complete the pool house. The 12m x 6m heated swimming pool is fitted with a submerged electric cover.

Grounds & Amenities
The gardens have been meticulously landscaped, with vast lawns, a superb variety of indigenous trees, formal fountains, and wonderfully tended orchard and vegetable gardens. Meandering paths lead through the 'Jardin Bleu', planted beside the bastide, which offers a quiet elegance. A private pine woodland borders the grounds, adding to the property's superb sense of privacy. A professional tennis court with pavilion offers further recreational space, while a carport and a series of technical rooms ensure day-to-day functionality. Over 200 olive trees yield up to 450 litres of oil per year.

Amenities include: central heating; reversible air conditioning throughout; fibre-optic internet; safes in every bedroom; mains water; Canal de Provence connection; private well (forage); electric entrance gate; electric fencing; comprehensive security system.

This is a property of exceptional stature - a rare blend of Provençal authenticity, architectural grace, and modern luxury, offering a privileged lifestyle in the heart of the Luberon.
summary: Remarkable Luberon estate with bastide, guest houses & 11 acres of landscaped grounds.

title: V2862 OPPEDE
body:
This quintessential 18th-century property is bathed in effortlessly elegant decor and surrounded by lush gardens, benefitting from a rural setting in the serene countryside of Oppede. A masterful renovation has transformed this traditional farmhouse into one of the Luberon's most coveted properties. Terrific views of the Luberon valley can be enjoyed throughout the estate.

The accommodation on the ground floor comprises: opulent 126m2 drawing room adorned with cathedral ceilings, tall French doors, and a grand stone fireplace; gorgeous kitchen fitted with a La Cornue stove and professional-grade appliances, and rear access for staff; scullery kitchen; formal dining room embellished by a handsome stone fireplace; orangerie; guest loos; laundry room.

An independently accessed wing of the property offers accommodation for guests: charming sitting room with an adjoining kitchen and dining area; beautifully proportioned double bedroom suite with a private shower room; south facing terrace.

The accommodation on the first floor comprises: two exquisite suites with adjoining bathrooms, loos, and dressing rooms; two double bedrooms, each with an ensuite shower room.

The second floor accommodates two prestigious master suites, each composed of: regally-sized double bedroom; spacious sitting room; dressing room; ensuite bathroom.

A guest house annex provides additional accommodation for guests. The ground floor of the guest house features large living spaces, with a contemporary kitchen, spacious dining area, and a gorgeous sitting room overlooking the swimming pool and gardens. The first floor is composed of a lovely double bedroom suite with a quaint balcony, and an ensuite bathroom.

Meticulously landscaped grounds and formal gardens encompass the property, whilst a picturesque courtyard provides a more intimate setting for large gatherings and festivities. To the south of the property lies the 'piece de la resistance', a luxurious 15m x 8m heated swimming pool with surrounding terraces and an integrated Jacuzzi. Overlooking the idyllic scenery, a rooftop terrace offers elevated views of the grounds and Luberon mountains, making it the perfect place to enjoy sunrises, sunsets, and the surrounding landscape in all its splendour.

Amenities include: underfloor heating and cooling; reversible air conditioning; bespoke wood-framed double glazing; electric gates; private water source; alarm system; automatic watering.

With unequivocally refined taste and timeless elegance, this Luberon property is the epitome of sophistication. A remarkable residence in one of the most beautiful parts of the South of France.

Please contact us for a printed brochure.
summary: Exquisite 18th century property with sumptuous grounds.

title: V3071 MENERBES
body:
This exceptional estate occupies a commanding position on the edge of the village of Ménerbes and has been the subject of a recent and masterful renovation. Comprising a magnificent bastide - with origins dating back to 1573 - an independent guest house, and outbuildings, the property offers a rare combination of architectural grandeur, refined interiors, and panoramic views over the village of Ménerbes and the surrounding countryside.

The accommodation in the main bastide begins with an impressive entrance hall, where a sweeping Dordogne-stone staircase leads up to the first and second floors. The ground floor features: stunning sitting room with a dressed stone fireplace and oversized wrought-iron French windows framing the view of the village; kitchen fitted with a Lacanche induction range; formal dining room enjoying a triple aspect; guest WC; cloakroom. Throughout the living spaces and bedrooms, floors are laid in beautiful Bourgogne stone.

The first floor offers: superb principal suite comprising a private sitting room, a large double bedroom, and an elegant shower room; second suite with double bedroom, shower room, and a vast triple-aspect sitting room/study. The second floor accommodates: additional principal suite with private sitting room, double bedroom, and shower room; further double bedroom suite with shower room. All bedrooms feature bespoke hardwood doors, custom-fitted cabinetry, and luxurious shower rooms with high-end fittings. Every bedroom benefits from air-conditioning.

Set apart from the bastide, the beautifully proportioned guest house comprises a vast sitting room with high ceilings and oversized wrought-iron windows overlooking the gardens and views, a spacious double bedroom, and an adjoining shower room. The property also boasts a vaulted wine cellar.

To the front of the bastide, formal French gardens and rose beds, centred around an elegant fountain, extend towards the olive groves, set against the magnificent backdrop of Ménerbes. Expansive dining terraces and more intimate seating areas are thoughtfully placed along the façade, each capturing the changing light over the village. Meandering pathways lead to the swimming pool area, where a 17m x 5.5m heated pool with electric cover is surrounded by a generous sunbathing terrace, complemented by a raised west-facing terrace designed for enjoying the Provençal sunsets. Beneath this terrace are rooms housing the laundry facilities, guest WC, and pool technical room.

The grounds encompass olive groves with centenary trees, lush lawns, and private woodland, all combining to guarantee an exceptional sense of privacy.

Amenities include: smart home system; underfloor heating and cooling throughout the ground floor, staircases, landings, and all shower rooms; air-conditioning in all bedrooms and in the guest house; alarm system; private borehole and water source; mains water; electric gates; fully fenced and hedged gardens.

Undoubtedly one of the most prestigious and expertly renovated properties in the Luberon, this estate offers an extraordinary blend of elegance, comfort, and Provençal charm.
summary: Magnificent bastide with guest house, formal gardens, and panoramic views of Ménerbes.

title: V3115 GOULT
body:
Confidential listing – please contact us to obtain the Virtual Viewing, full set of photos and the property video.

Set in one of the Luberon’s most sought-after positions, this superb stone property enjoys an extraordinary natural backdrop, with sweeping views that extend across the valley and toward the distant mountain ranges. The property has been the subject of a masterful renovation, resulting in a harmonious blend of authentic Provençal architecture and understated contemporary elegance.

Set at the heart of more than 6.9 acres of landscaped grounds, the estate encompasses a spacious main farmhouse, an independent stone guest house, and a separate atelier/gîte outbuilding – offering superb flexibility for hosting family and friends. The interiors have been thoughtfully reimagined using natural materials, bespoke fittings, and curated design elements, resulting in an inviting retreat equally suited to relaxed daily living and entertaining on a grand scale.

The terraced gardens unfold around the buildings in a series of beautifully composed outdoor spaces, with vast lawns, dry-stone walls, shaded seating areas, and expansive dining terraces all oriented toward the sweeping Luberon panorama. A swimming pool, set just below the house and accompanied by a large covered terrace and barbecue area, provides an idyllic vantage point. The grounds further include mature truffle oaks, vibrant Provençal planting, and approximately 150 olive trees.

This is an estate of rare calibre – an exquisitely restored Provençal property offering remarkable privacy, architectural charm, and truly outstanding views, all in one of the most sought-after settings in the Luberon.
summary: Remarkable Luberon hamlet with uninterrupted views.

title: V3081 GORDES
body:
Commanding an exceptional position overlooking the Luberon valley, this remarkable hamlet property enjoys a breathtaking natural setting, with panoramic views stretching from the eastern tip of the Luberon to the Cévennes in the west. Widely regarded as one of the most prestigious locations the region has to offer, the property combines an unrivalled sense of seclusion with timeless character and modern comfort. The estate spans over 650m2, comprising a spacious main farmhouse, an independent stone guest house, and a separate atelier/gîte outbuilding – all set at the heart of more than 6.9 acres of expertly landscaped private grounds. Entirely renovated and reimagined in 2007 with meticulous attention to detail, the interiors marry authentic character with carefully curated natural materials and bespoke contemporary fittings. Equally suited to intimate Provençal living or large-scale entertaining, this is a superb Luberon retreat of rare stature.

The Main House

The ground floor accommodates a large family kitchen fitted with a Lacanche range, a central island, and modern wrought-iron doors opening directly onto the dining terrace, revealing far-reaching views, as well as west-facing picture windows overlooking the manicured gardens. To one side, the kitchen flows through to the dining room with lovely Provençal ceilings; to the other, a traditional 'Borie' – an impressive feature room – leads into the spacious sitting room, arranged around a central suspended fireplace and framed by picture windows.

A staircase leads up to the principal suite, composed of: double bedroom with private terrace draped in vines and offering views as far as the eye can see ; dressing room with fitted cupboards; bathroom with bathtub and walk-in shower; adjoining office (or additional double bedroom). Two further double bedrooms, sharing a shower room, enjoy independent access and a private west-facing terrace – ideal for guests seeking extra privacy.

The ground floor further comprises: library; cozy 'petit salon'; bright office; utility room, guest WC; impressive, temperature-controlled, wine cellar; two guest WC. The ground floor of the main house also provides access to the adjoining 'Mazet', which provides a ground-floor double bedroom with en-suite shower room and, above, a south-facing suite with private terrace granting a direct view of the Luberon mountains.

Guest Accommodation & Annexes

The guest house offers complete independence, comprising: fully equipped kitchen; sitting room with fireplace; adjoining dining room; utility room. Two air-conditioned double bedrooms sharing a bathroom are located on the first floor.

A second guest house, the 'atelier' serves as an inspiring creative space, with a large open-plan artist's workshop bathed in natural light, separate living space with a kitchenette, and a shower room and WC. A rooftop terrace crowns the building, delivering an impressive vantage point with panoramic views reaching as far as the Cévennes and Montpellier's Pic Saint-Loup – quite possibly one of the most remarkable views the Luberon valley has to offer.

Grounds & Gardens

A wooded path leads through the grounds to the house, creating a terrific sense of arrival, with the Luberon panorama as a constant backdrop. The terraced grounds spill away from the house in thoughtfully composed layers, with uninterrupted views at every turn. Vast lawns shaded by mature truffle oaks are interwoven with traditional stone-paved terraces, intimate seating spots, and generously scaled dining areas – perfectly in proportion with the property’s accommodation.

Planting is distinctly Provençal and meticulously executed - colourful hydrangeas, sculpted shrubs, agapanthus, and oleanders line the dry-stone walls and meandering pathways. Set below the house, the swimming pool is located just a few steps away from a large covered terrace with a barbecue area – an ideal setting for long, languid lunches and evening gatherings. Approximately 150 olive trees are dotted across the grounds.

Amenities

Amenities include: underfloor heating and cooling throughout the main house; air-conditioning in the guest house and the atelier; wood and modern wrought-iron double glazing; mains water; Canal de Provence for the garden; fibre-optic internet; electric gates; automatic watering system; garden fencing; extensive outdoor lighting.

This is a property of exceptional calibre – a rare example of Provençal authenticity, architectural charm, and modern comfort – commanding one of the finest views in the Luberon.
summary: Exceptional Luberon retreat with unrivalled panoramic views.

title: V2966 GOULT
body:
This former 17th-century coaching inn lies in the heart of the picturesque Goult countryside, close to the renowned villages of Lacoste, Goult, and Ménerbes. Surrounded by over 10 acres of private woodland and grounds, this handsome stone property offers extraordinary volumes, exquisite authentic features, and exceptional versatility and business potential. While in need of refreshing, the property remains structurally sound and retains the timeless craftsmanship of a renovation celebrated in Côté Sud magazine.

The ground floor comprises: inviting foyer; awe-inspiring 214m² grand room adorned with tall arches and vaulted ceilings; dining kitchen equipped with a La Cornue gas cooker and adjoining traditional wine cellar; large scullery kitchen and utility rooms; heated indoor swimming pool; office; former caretaker’s apartment. The entire ground floor is embellished by an exquisite pierre de Banon stone flooring and benefits from underfloor heating.

A magnificent stone staircase leads to the first and second floors. The south wing houses the master suite, a luxurious 157m² space featuring a double-height ceiling bedroom, a sitting room with a stone fireplace, a private kitchen, and a gorgeous bathroom with a wrought-iron bathtub and a walk-in shower. Traditional terracotta parefeuille flooring adds warmth and charm throughout. The first floor further comprises seven generously sized double bedrooms (the largest measuring 51m²), six bathrooms and a sitting room.

The second floor accommodates a second master suite with a regal double bedroom and an opulent adjoining bathroom. This level also includes two additional bedrooms, one of which features a private office, and a shared bathroom.

The grounds offer a serene walled swimming pool area with a covered terrace, enveloped by wild greenery to ensure complete privacy. The vaulted grand room and kitchen open into a charming central courtyard, shaded by a centuries-old plane tree, providing the perfect setting for al fresco dining and gatherings.

Whether envisioned as an opulent bed and breakfast or a unique business venture, this property holds extraordinary potential. While restoration is required to return it to its former glory, the breathtaking volumes, privileged location in the heart of the Golden Triangle, and exceptional character guarantee a remarkable result.
summary: Majestic 17th-century coaching inn in the heart of the Luberon countryside.

title: V2982 LACOSTE
body:
This exceptional 18th-century stone farmhouse is perfectly located in the heart of the Luberon valley, close to the sought-after villages of Lacoste, Bonnieux, and Goult. Formerly a traditional ‘magnanerie’ (a Provençal silk farm), the property offers incredible volumes and has been extensively remodelled with gorgeous natural materials and outstanding craftsmanship – set against the backdrop of sweeping vineyard views.

Set on nearly 25 acres of land, including a remarkable 18-acre organic vineyard, the estate offers both bucolic privacy and unique potential for winemaking. The landscaped grounds surrounding the farmhouse are planted with a rich array of mature trees, including a magnificent plane tree and a bicentenary linden tree, as well as colourful shrubs and aromatic herbs. A heated swimming pool (11m x 6m), overlooking the surrounding Luberon villages and rolling hills, offers the perfect spot to relax.

The entrance hall flows through to a remarkable 90m² open-plan kitchen and dining area, beautifully fitted with a central island, a Lacornue gas range, and a white marble sink, complemented by an ornate Italian wood-burning stove – tall arched French doors on either side of this space flood the interior with natural light and offer uninterrupted views and seamless access to both the courtyard and garden. The ground floor is further composed of: cosy sitting room with hardwood floors; guest WC; independent wine cellar; utility room.

The first floor comprises: stylish study, adorned with green leather wallpaper and gilded, hand-painted details; impressive double-height grand room, complete with a library, bar, and an eye-catching gas fireplace; generous master bedroom suite, featuring a luxurious teak floor, gas fireplace, generous dressing area, and an expansive ensuite bathroom complete with walk-in shower and double vanity; additional double bedroom suite with adjoining bathroom, enjoying its own independent exterior access.

The second floor accommodates: two spacious double bedrooms, each with a private ensuite bathroom and distinctive decorative details; spiral staircase leading to a further bedroom with its own shower room - ideal for guests seeking extra privacy.

Beyond the main house, the organic vineyard currently produces a variety of unique cuvées, classified under ‘IGP Vaucluse.’ With renowned grape varieties such as Pinot Noir, Carmenère, and Viognier, the estate enjoys an excellent reputation and an average production of 100,000 bottles annually. Architectural plans have been drawn up for a proposed 1,200m² winery, offering exciting scope for further development of the viticultural activities on-site.

The garden encompassing the farmhouse is adorned with a greenhouse, a decorative pond and pavilion, a vegetable plot, and an expansive outdoor dining terrace - perfect for summertime dining with stunning views of the perched villages of Lacoste and Bonnieux. Additional outbuildings (~ 100m²) include a workshop, garage, and a gym that could be converted into an independent studio.

Amenities include: heat pump-backed central heating system; private well; mains water; Canal de Provence water for the garden and the vines; security system; fibre-optic internet.

This magnificent Luberon estate represents a quintessentially Provençal lifestyle – gorgeous architecture steeped in history, beautifully curated interiors, a distinguished vineyard, and spectacular panoramic views, all tucked away in complete privacy yet only a short distance from the coveted villages of the region’s Golden Triangle.
summary: Historic Luberon mas with vineyard and panoramic views.

title: V3097 GORDES
body:
This superb stone property enjoys an exceptional position just above one of the most prized villages the Luberon has to offer, within walking distance of the local shops, cafés and restaurants. The house commands a spectacular panorama, with far-reaching views across the Luberon Valley to Mont Sainte-Victoire. Designed and built in 2010 with meticulous attention to detail, the property combines the authentic character of a Provençal hamlet with understated contemporary refinement and comfort.

Upon entry, you are greeted by an impressive double-height entrance hall, framing the view over the valley and flowing effortlessly through to the living spaces. The ground floor comprises: grand sitting room with central fireplace and oversized wrought-iron French windows; sleek modern kitchen with black granite worktops, island dining unit, and adjoining scullery kitchen; cosy secondary sitting room with fireplace; guest WC. The ground floor also features a double bedroom suite with shower room, and a large office that could readily serve as an additional bedroom. The pipework for a bathroom has already been installed in the small room adjacent to the office. Each of the ground floor living areas opens onto vast terraces with covered dining and seating areas, oriented towards the extraordinary view.

The first floor accommodates a luxurious principal suite, comprising a large double bedroom, dressing room, light-filled office, and bathroom with double vanity, freestanding bathtub, and walk-in shower. The suite opens onto a private south-facing terrace with stone steps leading down to the dining terraces and swimming pool below. Two further double bedrooms, each with an adjoining bathroom or shower room and access to a private rooftop terrace, complete the first floor.

The garden level provides independent accommodation ideal for guests, with generous reception spaces opening directly onto the pool area. This floor includes: a living space lined with patio doors (66 m² - currently used as a games room); an additional living area that could be fitted as a secondary kitchen; utility room; shower room; guest WC; and two gorgeous double bedroom suites with en suite shower rooms and arched French windows overlooking the gardens, with direct access to the swimming pool.

The grounds extend over 2.6 acres and have been beautifully landscaped to provide complete privacy and an impressive variety of outdoor living areas. The focal point is a magnificent 18m × 5m heated swimming pool surrounded by generous sunbathing terraces, complemented by intimate seating areas, expansive dining terraces, and views that stretch endlessly across the Luberon. A lovely meandering path leads through the gardens, complemented by a superb array of colourful Provençal plantings, drystone walls, mature olive trees, and green lawns. An olive grove with over 100 mature trees produces the property's own olive oil.

Amenities include: underfloor heating and cooling throughout (Bourgogne stone on the ground floor and oak flooring in the first-floor bedrooms); air conditioning in the bedrooms; wrought-iron double glazing; mains water and drainage; fibre-optic internet; electric gates; automatic watering system; water softener; sophisticated alarm system; fully fenced garden; covered parking.

Of exceptional calibre and set in one of the most sought-after locations in the Luberon, this exquisite property combines timeless Provençal architecture with refined contemporary design and incredible views.
summary: Contemporary stone property with panoramic Luberon views.

title: V2910 FORCALQUIER
body:
Surrounded by 15 hectares of landscaped gardens and grounds, the château is accessed by a stately treelined boulevard.

As you approach this exceptional château, you're greeted by the impressive and majestic dimensions epitomizing the purest tradition of eighteenth-century architecture.

The sumptuous central hall leads us into the heart of this stunning property with its high ceilings and equally impressive windows. The "grand salon" measuring over 60m2 enjoys views of the newly landscaped french gardens. The adjoining dining room is dominated by the fabulous 'Viollet-le-Duc' fireplace and resonates the opulence of the epoch. The music room has also been restored to its former grandeur by the present owners. A private chapelle, second sitting room and the owners quarters make up the rest of the ground floor.

On the first floor, the Grand Gallery stretches almost forty meters, crossing the entire length of the Château. 'La chambre du Marquis' and the 'chambre du marquises have both been painstakingly restored to their former glory.
Each bedroom and antechamber is a fabulous glimpse of the opulent 18th century.

The Orangerie 
South west facing and with a private garden the 'Orangerie' boasts a vast reception room that can accommodate 150 seated guests and can be extended to the gardens.
The Orangerie, equipped with a professional kitchen, is the perfect venue for a wide range of events: weddings, seminars, cocktail parties, conferences, corporate meals, etc.

The Gardens
The current owners have ambitiously recreated the original gardens from antiques images and plans and restored them to their former splendour. 
A superb bassin measuring 35m x 20m, mirrors the majestic beauty of the castle.

The Grand Gîte
With a vast private courtyard and views of the Château's parkland, the gîte offers 90m² of living space. It features a hallway, kitchen, bathroom, spacious living room, master bedroom and second bedroom.

The Petit Gîte
With its own private courtyard and west facing views it offers 55m² of living space, and includes a kitchen, bathroom, living room, and a double bedroom.

A Unique Opportunity
This magnificent Château is an outstanding testament to the timeless elegance of eighteenth-century architecture. The independent annexes offer a unique opportunity to develop a fabulous hospitality venue.

Information on the risks to which this property is exposed is available on the géorisques website www.georisques.gouv.fr.

Virtual Viewing on request.
summary: Magnificent XVIII Château with stunning grounds and independent annexes.

title: V2990 L'ISLE-SUR-LA-SORGUE
body:
This handsome 18th-century Luberonais hamlet, including a magnanery and six independent guest houses, is located on the outskirts of the lauded Isle-sur-la-Sorgue antique markets, bustling commerce and numerous restaurants. This secluded property boasts 6.4 acres of meticulously kept land with a Roman tumulus with two generous swimming pools. A masterful renovation has transformed this collection of traditional farmhouses and swath of agricultural land into one of the Luberon's most sought-after homes or business opportunities as a bed and breakfast, chef's table dining experience, private vineyard, or boutique hotel.

The accommodation on the ground floor of the main house is composed of : elegant magnanery hosting a salon with double height ceilings, exposed beams and dining space with mezzanine; spacious and newly renovated dine-in Fabre kitchen with Gaggenau fridges, and lava countertops; bedroom with south entrance and view of the custom-built, temperature-controlled wine cave; ensuite shower and toilet; utility room with cellar space. 

The accommodation on the first floor comprises : master suite with downstairs dressing room, impressive downstairs shower with jacuzzi; double bedroom with ensuite bathroom shower and bathtub; vast mezzanine with office space and outdoor balcony with sweeping views; double bedroom with ensuite sauna and shower room.

Each of the five houses, ranging from jewel-box gites to larger, independent homes, have been thoughtfully updated with Fabre kitchens, luxurious bathrooms with superb local tiles, comfortable sleeping arrangements with multiple bedrooms, private terraces and outdoor relaxation areas. This property also offers a caretaker’s gîte, complete with sitting room, kitchenette, bedroom and bathroom. Thanks to this air-conditioned collection of stone houses, one can imagine multiple family-friendly configurations while maintaining a sense of privileged calm. 

The two, independent swimming pools are accompanied by their own respective pool houses with seating areas. The guest pool house is equipped with an envious, expertly equipped summer kitchen with semi-professional cooking range, double fridge, full bar, large dining table and separate seating area with views on the Roman tumulus and the Ventoux mountains. A private petanque court will fill your evenings with raucous laughter and an unexpected outdoor dining moment can be experienced on the top of the Roman tumulus. Breathtaking views of the Luberon and the Alpilles can also be enjoyed throughout this estate. 

An absolute haven of peace and tranquillity, this luscious property boasts the best of Provence : a secluded property with authentic, luxurious renovations, panoramic views, a historic monument on-site, and only a few minute’s drive to the lively Isle-sur-la-Sorgue and Avignon.
summary: Quintessential 18th-century private Provencal hamlet with two pools close to Isle-sur-la-Sorgue.

title: V2416 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
This stunning property has been renovated to the very highest standard and with exquisite taste.

The living accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: entrance hall with fabulous stone stairs; reception room with exceptionally high ceilings and impressive fireplace;  2 sitting rooms with high vaulted ceilings; library and reading room; vaulted dining room with open fireplace; fully equipped and light filled kitchen; utility room; games room; cloak room; 2 guest wc.

On the first floor: 4 double bedrooms with en suite bathrooms and 2 shared dressing rooms; generous sitting room with open fireplace; study/storage room.

On the second floor: 3 double bedrooms each with en suite bathrooms and one with a "secret room"; 2 further double bedrooms; family bathroom; spacious study; 2 rooms, presently unused.

No castle would be complete without a towers and a dungeon (presently used as a wine cellar and gym)

The gardens include two swimming pools, tennis court, vegetable garden and a profusion of idyllic spots to relax in absolute privacy. The grounds are home to a spacious guest house with its own separate entrance and a contemporary olive mill.

The walled castle, surrounded by the remnants of a moat has retained many, fabulous original features.
The meticulous renovation has also given this superb property modern comforts like the underfloor heating system hidden beneath the beautiful stone floors. 

A breathtaking property just waiting to be discovered!
summary: Authentic 12th century castle fully restored with swimming pools and tennis court.

title: V3092 L'ISLE-SUR-LA-SORGUE
body:
Just a short drive from the renowned market town of L'Isle-sur-la-Sorgue, this extraordinary estate lies amidst 36 acres of landscaped grounds and manicured woodland, offering an exceptional blend of Provençal charm and modern luxury. The property has been the subject of a masterful renovation of the highest calibre, where authentic materials meet sleek contemporary finishes to create an interior of remarkable refinement and comfort. Inside and out, the property exudes elegance and an inviting sense of grandeur - a Provençal retreat of rare distinction.

Spanning approximately 600 m², the property comprises a grand bastide, an independent pigeonnier guest house, a caretaker's apartment, garage and carport, as well as a stone farmhouse offering untapped potential.

The bastide features sun-drenched, superbly proportioned interiors designed with both style and comfort in mind. Traditional elements - exposed beams, natural stone accents, and wrought ironwork - blend seamlessly with the highest quality materials and finishes.

Upon entering through the antique door, a large foyer leads to the kitchen on one side and the living spaces on the other. The custom-designed kitchen combines outstanding craftsmanship, including a bespoke Murano glass chandelier, with high-end Miele appliances. It flows through to a dining area framed by floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking the grounds, creating a stunning backdrop for meals and gatherings. On the opposite side, the spacious sitting room, centred around a handsome stone fireplace, offers an inviting space for entertaining, with an adjoining home cinema.

The ground floor also accommodates the principal suite - a large double bedroom with walk-in dressing room and a lovely ensuite bathroom fitted with a bathtub and walk-in large shower. A second lavish suite is located on this floor, with adjoining dressing room and bathroom.

A magnificent stone spiral staircase, worthy of a château, leads up to the first floor. The first floor comprises: double bedroom suite with generous dressing room and ensuite bathroom featuring walk-in shower, double vanity, and gorgeous fittings; family suite includes two bedrooms, a shared dressing area, and an ensuite bathroom. Completing the bastide are an office, gym with adjoining shower room, wine cellar, and laundry room.

A self-contained apartment provides comfortable accommodation for staff, family, or guests. With its own living area, equipped kitchen, bedroom, bathroom, and private parking, it ensures independence without compromising style.

The sense of grandeur is immediate - tall iron gates open onto a superb driveway lined with perfectly sculpted cypress trees. The 36-acre grounds have been landscaped with great care and diligence, dotted with mature oaks, olive and almond trees, and vast expanses of lawn. The grounds offer a peaceful setting for outdoor living. A 13 m x 6 m swimming pool is surrounded by a vast terrace in Sinai stone, complete with a vast adjoining shaded summer living area with a fully equipped kitchen and barbecue. The pigeonnier guest house provides two independent bedrooms with a shared bathroom, ideal for guests.

The property also includes a 130 m² six-car garage and a large carport providing additional covered parking.

A 176 m² independent stone bergerie remains to be renovated, offering exciting potential as a guesthouse, artist's studio, or wellness retreat.

The renovation has been carried out to the highest standard. Amenities include: underfloor heating and cooling; air-conditioning for additional comfort; electric shutters; Schüco aluminium joinery; home automation system; thermodynamic hot water heating; mains water with softener; canal water for irrigation; high-tech security system; and a regulation-compliant septic tank.

An estate of rare scale and refinement, this property embodies the very best of modern Provençal living: architectural grace, luxurious materials and impeccable finishes, all set within a serene natural environment. Whether as an exceptional primary residence or a luxurious retreat, it represents a truly remarkable opportunity in one of Provence's most sought-after regions.
summary: Exceptional Provençal estate near L'Isle-sur-la-Sorgue

title: V3075 GOULT
body:
Commanding a dominant position on the edge of the lively Luberon village of Goult, this remarkable stone property boasts panoramic views across the valley, utterly unobstructed from east to west. The property is composed of a handsome stone farmhouse, independent suites for guests, and a state-of-the-art gym and spa complex. Offering a terrific sense of privacy and outstanding amenities, it stands as a luxurious retreat in the heart of the Luberon valley. Elegant Provençal architecture, natural materials and the highest grade of modern comforts combine here to create a spectacular property.

An imposing hardwood door opens to reveal the foyer, where you are immediately greeted with a breathtaking view of the Luberon mountains. A stone staircase winds elegantly to the first floor. The entrance flows into a magnificent 72m² open-plan living space, lined with wrought-iron French doors that flood the interior with natural light and open seamlessly onto the main dining terrace. This expansive living area is anchored by a fireplace with sitting room on one side, and a sleek kitchen with quartz countertops on the other. The floors are beautifully clad in local Oppède stone.

The ground floor further comprises: generous office with superb views - an excellent setting for remote working; guest WC; spacious utility room; two smaller bedrooms (ideal for staff or nanny) sharing a shower room; and access to the double garage.

The first floor is composed of: master suite with dressing room and adjoining shower room with WC; second double bedroom suite with private shower room, WC and rooftop terrace – enjoying an extraordinary panorama of the Luberon valley; two further beautifully proportioned double bedrooms and two bathrooms with WC. Rich oak floors bring warmth throughout, while cathedral ceilings and sweeping views add grandeur to the suites.

The pièce de résistance is an exceptional detached stone building offering an 80m² open-plan space, fronted by oversized arched French windows that frame uninterrupted views of the landscape. This incredible space features oak flooring, soaring ceilings, and exposed beams and tiles. Currently serving as a private gym and leisure complex, it includes a bespoke bar and TV area. Adjoining this space is a superb spa, complete with sunken Jacuzzi, picture windows overlooking the southern and western views, a marble-tiled hammam, shower room, utility area and WC. A spiral staircase leads to a mezzanine bedroom, and the ground floor also houses a garage with an electric door. The entire building is fully air-conditioned and centrally heated.

Two further independent bedroom suites complete the property, each offering guests the privacy of their own shower room, together with easy access to the swimming pool.

The main house opens entirely to the south, with wrought-iron French doors leading out to the vast stone dining terrace. Panoramas stretch endlessly in every direction. Part of the terrace is covered and equipped with a summer kitchen, creating an ideal space for outdoor entertaining. From here, the lawn extends towards the grandly proportioned 17m x 7m heated swimming pool, fitted with an electric cover. A large surrounding terrace provides the perfect setting for soaking up the Provençal sun.

Amenities include: full air-conditioning; underfloor heating and cooling on the ground floor of the main house; double glazing with security glass; mains water; septic tank conforming to current regulations; fibre-optic internet; sophisticated alarm system; water softener. The property is entirely enclosed with electric fencing and accessed via two electric gates. There are two garages – a double garage for the main house and a separate garage for the gym annex.

This is an exquisite stone property, just a short distance from one of the Luberon’s most sought-after villages, with its bustling market, excellent restaurants, charming shops and bakery. Luxury, character, and contemporary comfort are brought together in an outstanding setting.
summary: Luxurious Goult retreat with spa, guest suites and sweeping Luberon views.

title: V3083 PERNES LES FONTAINES
body:
This exceptional manor house is situated just a short walk from the charming and historic town of Pernes-les-Fontaines. This stately residence, a perfect blend of historical charm and modern comfort, offers an elegant lifestyle in the heart of the Vaucluse countryside.

Dating back to the 1700s, this manor house was meticulously renovated from top to bottom. Spanning 478 m², the home features six bedrooms and four bathrooms, thoughtfully laid out over two floors and a magnificent tower. Upon entering, you're greeted by a grand hall with a striking walnut door. The main living spaces are defined by a classic Provençal aesthetic, with outstanding attention to detail, marble floors, and authentic fireplaces throughout the property. A "papillon" staircase made from pierre d'Estaillades adds a stunning architectural feature. The kitchen is fitted with elegant pear wood cabinetry and polished granite countertops.

The main staircase leads to the master suite, which boasts an opulent bathroom finished in onyx stone and a private office. This level also features two further bedrooms, each with its own en-suite bathroom. A second-floor bedroom and two additional rooms are accessed via a staircase that continues up to the iconic tower. The first floor also includes a spacious room above the garage with a chimney conduit and fabulous exposed oak beams. This vast room, with its high ceilings and enormous potential, would be perfect for a library or independent studio.

Modern comforts include an automatic watering system, an air-conditioned wine cellar, oil-fired heating, fiber internet, double glazing, an alarm system with cameras, and a video intercom.

The estate is set within 16 hectares of beautifully maintained grounds, offering a private and tranquil setting. The gardens are a true highlight, with 48 olive trees and a private source of water, in addition to city water and a connection to the Canal de Provence. The grounds are secured by an electric fence and feature an automatic irrigation system with a drip system for the gardens and olive trees. For parking, the property offers a garage and a separate carport with space for up to five cars.

This property would suit someone looking for an opulent Provençal estate.
summary: Beautifully renovated manor house in idyllic countryside location

title: V2805 GORDES
body:
This exquisite property is an architectural marvel, nestled in the heart of the picturesque village of Gordes. Combining Provencal charm with modern amenities, this truly spectacular property offers breathtaking views of the Luberon and the Alpilles mountain ranges.

An impressive antique hardwood front door greets you upon entry, opening to reveal an expansive 'grand room.' This lavish living space features a gorgeous sitting room, large kitchen, and bright dining room, opening onto a balcony with a stunning 180-degree view of the landscape below. The ground floor also includes a guest WC.

Accessible via a beautiful spiral staircase, the lower floor accommodates a master suite with an en suite bathroom, WC, and dressing room, as well as a generous double bedroom with an en suite bathroom.

The luxury continues on the garden level, with two double bedrooms, each with its own en suite bathroom, a laundry room, and a lovely vaulted wine cellar—perfect for connoisseurs of fine wines.

The first floor comprises a master suite, which enjoys a vast terrace with particularly spectacular views. The second floor features a magnificent suite with a spacious 27m² bathroom, offering a truly luxurious experience.

Outside, the property showcases its splendour with a superb heated pool measuring 11m x 5m, providing gorgeous views from the Luberon to the Alpilles. A beautiful private garden, adorned with centennial olive trees, and a covered terrace draped with wisteria promise shaded areas and the perfect spot for entertaining family and friends in a superbly intimate setting, right in the heart of this legendary village.

Amenities include mains water, mains drainage, fibre optic internet, and private parking. The property also benefits from a garage.

The property enjoys an exceptional location, close to the shops and restaurants in the village's central area, offering a perfect balance between tranquillity and convenience. With its authentic Provencal features, remarkable quality of renovation work, and unrivalled beauty, it offers a peaceful retreat in the heart of the village.
summary: Lavish stone property in the heart of the picturesque village of Gordes.

title: V2902 APT
body:
This exceptional property, located close to the picturesque village of Bonnieux, embodies refined elegance and timeless grandeur. Nestled in the heart of the Luberon Valley, the manor house and its annexes are surrounded by over 16 acres of beautifully landscaped grounds and formal gardens, granting an unparalleled setting.

The estate comprises a gorgeous 18th-century bastide, an elegant orangery with two bedroom suites, and an independent farmhouse composed of two separate gîtes.

The Bastide
The ground floor of the bastide is composed of: majestic entrance; spacious and bright sitting room adorned with a marble fireplace; formal dining room flowing through to the kitchens; large dining kitchen, accompanied by a fully-equipped secondary kitchen with a cold room. Arched French doors open out onto the formal gardens and the vast dining terrace.

The first floor comprises: magnificent master suite, with a lovely bathroom fitted with a shower and bathtub; charming south-facing double bedroom, bathed in natural light with an adjoining shower room; two spacious double bedrooms; bathroom with a bathtub and shower.

Annexes
An enchanting orangery has been transformed to provide luxurious accommodation for guests in a fabulous setting. The pièce de résistance is the exceptional living area, lined with oversized wrought-iron windows and embellished by a water feature fed by a natural spring, ensuring a captivating atmosphere. The orangery also features a kitchen and two beautiful suites, each beautifully decorated and furnished and featuring an en-suite bathroom.

The farmhouse accommodates two independent gîtes, both newly renovated and offering privacy from the rest of the property. The first gîte comprises: sitting room with a contemporary kitchen; two double bedrooms; and a bathroom. The second includes: sitting room with an adjoining kitchenette, equipped with a wood-burning stove; double bedroom; bathroom.

Please contact us to obtain the Virtual Viewing for the farmhouse.

A vast dining terrace adorns the property, with ornate stone stairs leading up to reveal superbly landscaped formal gardens. This lovely terrace enjoys a pergola draped with climbing vines, offering an escape from the hot Provençal sun and the perfect spot to entertain family and guests on a grand scale. The formal gardens that stretch out beyond are adorned with two majestic Japanese pagoda trees and a decorative stone fountain. Cobblestone paths meander through the manicured grounds, leading up to the pool area, surrounded by a lawn and encompassed by wonderfully pruned hedges and trees. The 16m x 5m bassin-style swimming pool is heated and equipped with a submerged cover. The grounds span over 16 acres, ensuring the utmost privacy, and are home to olive groves, a pétanque court, and a large vegetable garden.

Amenities include: oil-fired central heating; ducted air conditioning in the bastide's bedrooms; reversible air conditioning in the orangery and the farmhouse; mains water, natural spring, and Provence Canal; water softener; automatic watering; a septic tank that conforms to current regulations; and fibre optic internet.

This remarkable property exudes elegance and understated luxury, with mesmerising grounds, terrific innate character, and superb views.
summary: Gorgeous 18th century Luberon manor house with formal grounds.

title: V2989 BEDOIN
body:
Located in the heart of Provence, at the foothills of Mont Ventoux near the picturesque village of Bédoin, this domaine offers a rare opportunity to own a turnkey, fully operational organic vineyard estate in one of southern France’s most scenic and sought-after wine regions.

Founded in 1992 and certified organic since 1995, the domaine is widely recognized as a trailblazer in sustainable viticulture in the Ventoux AOP. The estate has also embraced biodynamic principles since 2008, ensuring vibrant, terroir-expressive wines that resonate with today’s quality- and eco-conscious wine market.
Set across 14 hectares of prime vineyard land, the Domaine benefits from two distinct soil types—limestone alluvium and silty-clay—enabling a well-rounded production of white, rosé, and red wines. Just 30 minutes from Avignon and its TGV links, the domaine offers both rural charm and strategic accessibility. Certified organic and biodynamic (Ecocert and Demeter), it holds strong appeal in today’s eco-conscious markets. The property includes a fully equipped winery with stainless steel tanks, oak barrels, and temperature control, alongside a stylish tasting room ideal for direct sales and boutique wine tourism growth.

With a verdant surround of trees, grass and vineyards, the property is set back from the road, accessible via a long driveway lined with cedars. The tasting room, and the main house, were reimagined in 2014, with an adjacent gîte. There’s a total of 320m2 of living space on two floors, offering panoramic views, and south and west facing terraces.

The property’s interior is defined by its neutral tones, clean architectural lines, and beautiful use of natural materials, including exposed beams and attractive tiling. Subtle nods to modern design are seamlessly integrated, creating a calm and elegant aesthetic that remains consistent with its natural surroundings. Large windows frame spectacular views of the landscape, allowing light to flood the space and creating a harmonious connection between the indoors and the beauty of the Provençal countryside outside. 

The ground floor of the main house is composed of a generous 35m2 living space; chic galley kitchen opening out onto a shaded terrace and the pool area; further sitting room and three bedrooms, one with ensuite, the others sharing a bathroom. The ground floor also comprises linen and laundry rooms; guest WC. The tasting room is accessible from this floor. 

On the first floor: two spacious bedrooms with ensuites.

The gîte comprises: entryway leading to spacious living area with kitchen; three bedrooms; family bathroom; laundry room.

Indoor/outdoor living is ensured as you step from the kitchen through to the shaded terrace and out onto the patio with views towards the Ventoux. The gorgeous 13m x 4.5m infinity pool provides an elegant area for relaxing.

Amenities include: heat pump for air and water; double glazing; septic tank meeting current regulatory standards; possibility to be hooked up to mains water; borehole-fed water system for house and winery; fibre internet; security camera; automatic watering and drip system. Ample parking space. 

Opportunities like this are rare. The domaine combines a legacy of excellence with untapped potential for the right buyer. Whether you continue its organic tradition or bring your own vision, this estate is poised for continued success.

Virtual tour of the winery available upon request.
summary: Prestigious organic winery with guest house and swimming pool at the foot of the Mont Ventoux.

title: V2804 GORDES
body:
Nestled in the commune of Gordes, known as one of the most beautiful villages in France, this traditional 'mas' is surrounded by 12 acres of lavender fields and superbly maintained private grounds. The interior of the farmhouse offers a graceful balance of authentic character, modern panache and refined luxury.

The property comprises a luxuriously-proportioned main house, three magnificent gîtes, and additional accommodation - offering an unrivalled level of comfort and independence for family and guests. 

The front door opens to reveal a spectacular 110m² grand room, composed of a sleek contemporary kitchen with black granite worktops and a vast island unit, a stunning "orangery-style" dining room flooded with natural light, and a fabulous sitting room with double-height ceilings and a floating staircase. The ground floor also features a WC, a larder and a study.

The first floor accommodates: lavish master suite with shower room, walk-in dressing room, and a private terrace; three spacious double bedrooms; two shower rooms.

The first gîte enjoys: open-plan living space fitted with a contemporary kitchen, a dining room and a sitting room, leading out to a private terrace; two double bedrooms, one with private terrace; shower room; WC.

The second gîte is composed of: open concept living room with a modern kitchen, dining area and relaxed seating; master suite with adjoining dressing room and shower room; suite with adjoining shower room.

The third gîte comprises: elegant sitting room, with an adjoining kitchen, and patio doors leading out to a large dining terrace; two lovely suites, each with its own shower room and dressing room. 

The property also features an independent suite with a private sitting room, large double bedroom, and a shower room. 

The garden boasts two magnificent heated swimming pools, a tennis court and a pétanque court. Twelve acres of gorgeous grounds encompass the property, ensuring an idyllic and relaxing setting .

Amenities include: reversible air-conditioning; fireplace in the grand room; double glazing; fibre optic internet; mains water. The property has electric gates and ample parking.

This superb rural property enjoys picturesque natural surroundings and offers an enchanting retreat in the heart of the Provencal countryside.
summary: Luxurious farmhouse property and guest houses, set on over 12 acres of grounds.

title: V2883 BONNIEUX
body:
Elegant Estate Overlooking the Luberon

Set in the peaceful countryside of Bonnieux, this unique estate enjoys far-reaching views of the Luberon and combines Provençal charm with quiet sophistication. The property is made up of two distinct residences: a beautifully restored stone farmhouse with a private swimming pool, and a separate stone bastide, also with its own pool.

The Stone Farmhouse

The ground floor includes an entrance hall leading to a bright, spacious sitting room with a fireplace and a mezzanine office area above. Adjoining this is an orangerie with large wrought-iron French doors opening onto the 13m x 5m swimming pool and pool house. This outdoor space is well screened from the rest of the property and offers an ideal setting for outdoor dining and entertaining.
The fully equipped kitchen opens onto a charming, flower-filled courtyard, perfect for breakfast or morning coffee. This level also includes a dining room, utility room, and guest WC.
Upstairs, the principal suite features a large bathroom, dressing room, and a private roof terrace with wonderful views over the Luberon. Two further bedrooms, each with en suite bathrooms, complete this floor.

The Stone Bastide

The adjacent, independent bastide includes a 10m x 5m pool and spacious living areas across three levels.
On the ground floor: an entrance hall and a bright open-plan kitchen, dining and sitting area, all leading directly to the terrace. A guest WC and laundry room complete this level.
The first floor comprises four large bedroom suites. On the second floor, there is a double bedroom with bathroom, and a 50 sqm multi-purpose space—perfect for use as a studio, gym, or office.
The bastide also includes a separate caretaker’s gîte with a sitting room, kitchen, bedroom and bathroom.

The Grounds

The property sits in around six acres of landscaped grounds planted with mature trees and native plants, and bordered by vineyards. The views of the Luberon hills are exceptional.
The two residences can function independently or together as one large, comfortable family home.
This is a rare opportunity to acquire a substantial and beautifully designed estate, ideal as a family residence, a Provençal retreat, or a premium holiday rental.
summary: Beautiful 18th-century estate with 2 renovated houses, 2 pools and views.

title: V3041 OPPEDE
body:
Set amid the serene landscapes of Oppède, this exceptional Provençal mas combines timeless charm with modern refinement. Behind its striking stone façade lies a home that has been meticulously renovated to the highest standards, using premium materials and showcasing an effortless blend of traditional architecture and contemporary elegance. 

A grand, cypress-lined driveway framed by olive groves and vineyards creates an unforgettable sense of arrival. Through an impressive stone arch and wooden gate, you enter a stunning courtyard centered around a graceful fountain shaded by mature trees - an atmosphere infused with Mediterranean scents and tranquility.

Inside, generous volumes and natural light define the living spaces. Traditional elements – exposed beams, Provencal ceilings, and natural stone archways – blend seamlessly with modern design choices and contemporary materials. The ground floor offers a spacious living room that opens onto the courtyard and pool terrace through large sliding doors, a sleek modern kitchen with a central island flowing into the dining room, two en suite bedrooms, a cozy sitting room with fireplace, guest loo, and utility room.

The grand staircase located in the main entrance leads to the first floor, which hosts two elegant en suite bedrooms and a principal suite with a bathroom, dressing room, and lovely Juliette balcony. A second staircase from the dining room leads to an impressive suite with lofted mezzanine, luxurious en suite bathroom, private terrace with independent courtyard access, and another en suite bedroom and sitting room - perfect for guests or family.

The property also includes a charming independent guest house with open-plan living and kitchen area, mezzanine bedroom, and shower room.

Outdoors, Provençal living is celebrated to perfection: a shaded terrace with summer kitchen overlooks the courtyard, ideal for outdoor dining and entertaining. To the west, a heated 12m x 5m pool blends seamlessly with the stone terrace, offering unobstructed views of the surrounding countryside.

The renovation has been carried out to the highest standard, incorporating underfloor heating and cooling on the ground floor, double insulation, aluminium joinery, seven hot water heaters, and reversible air-conditioning on the first floor for additional comfort. Additional amenities include: wine cellar; mains and well water; automatic watering; electric gates; ample parking with carport; regulation-compliant septic tank.

Every detail of this home has been thoughtfully crafted to combine authenticity, elegance, and modern comfort, offering a lifestyle of unmatched serenity and luxury in the heart of Provence.
summary: Magnificent farmhouse, fully renovated to the highest standards, in Oppède.

title: V3072 GORDES
body:
This superbly renovated stone property enjoys an exceptional location, perched above the renowned village of Gordes, within walking distance of the local restaurants, cafes, bars and shops. Entirely renovated in 2024 to an exceptional standard, the property combines bespoke craftsmanship, exquisite choice of materials, and striking architectural features to create a unique Luberon retreat. The property offers unrivalled panoramic views stretching from the Alpilles mountain range to Mont Saint Victoire to the south, and across to the easternmost point of the Luberon valley. Likely the finest view the Luberon has to offer.

At the centre of the property lies an impressive open-plan living space, comprising a voluminous sitting room with insert fireplace, a dining area, and a bespoke kitchen with marble countertops, fitted cupboards and high-quality appliances. Vast motorised patio doors open fully to reveal the landscape beyond, framing panoramic views of the Alpilles, the Luberon valley and Mont Saint Victoire. This incredible living space opens directly onto a large dining and seating terrace, overlooking the valley below. Adjoining the kitchen, a utility room offers additional fitted storage, a wine fridge, and laundry appliances.

The ground floor further comprises: double bedroom with ensuite shower room, featuring Zellige tiling and a walk-in shower; second double bedroom with a Juliette balcony and adjoining bathroom with walk-in shower, bathtub and WC; private office; meditation/yoga room; guest WC.

The first floor is composed of a spacious principal suite, offering a double bedroom with fitted cupboards, a beautifully appointed shower room, and a private rooftop terrace that commands a spectacular panorama – as far as the eye can reach, from east to west. The first floor also accommodates a large mezzanine living space, with office area and artistic workspace.

The garden level provides independent guest accommodation, composed of a fully equipped kitchen and two generously proportioned double bedrooms, each with a shower room ensuite. This level also includes a large storage area and direct access to the garden.

The south-facing gardens have been thoughtfully landscaped to include a generous variety of Provencal plantings, including rose beds, centenary olive trees (producing your very own oil), a mature fig tree, and a charming vegetable garden. A superb 15m x 5m heated saltwater swimming pool with submerged cover enjoys far-reaching views of the surrounding countryside, with an expansive terrace. A covered dining terrace, petanque court, extensive exterior lighting, and private woodland complete the gardens.

Amenities include: underfloor heating/cooling throughout; mains water and mains drainage; air-conditioning; fibre-optic internet; double glazing; comprehensive alarm system; electric gates; carport for two vehicles; automatic watering system.

This elegant and remarkably well-located stone property offers a rare combination of tranquillity, spectacular views, and easy access to one of the most sought-after villages in the Luberon.
summary: Exceptional stone property with unrivalled views over the Luberon and the Alpilles.

title: V3119 L'ISLE-SUR-LA-SORGUE
body:
Just five minutes from the vibrant cafés and antique markets of L’Isle-sur-la-Sorgue - and only 30 minutes from the Avignon TGV and 45 minutes from Marseille Airport - this exceptional Provençal estate offers a rare combination of historical character, accessibility, and established business potential.

Set within 2.8 acres of landscaped grounds, the property centers around a former 14th-century priory whose quiet elegance has been carefully preserved. Spanning approximately 787 m², the residence blends authentic architectural features with the comfort and functionality required for both private living and hospitality use.

The ground floor is designed around elegant reception and operational spaces. It opens onto an entrance hall leading to a charming petit salon, ideal for guest reception or quiet moments. A fully equipped professional Fabre kitchen, complete with an arrière-cuisine, allows for seamless commercial operation. A grand salon with fireplace and a spacious dining room provide warm, inviting areas for entertaining or hosting guests. This floor also includes an independent gite with its own kitchen, en-suite bathroom and private terrace. An additional bedroom suite, with en-suite bathroom and private terrace, as well as laundry facilities, guest WC, and technical room complete this level. 

The upper floors are dedicated to accommodation and flexibility of use. They comprise eight additional bedroom suites, all with en-suite bathrooms, offering comfort and privacy for guests. An independent apartment - featuring a kitchen, bedroom, bathroom, and WC - provides ideal accommodation for an owner, manager, or staff. A storage room completes these floors.

The landscaped gardens offer a peaceful and refined outdoor setting, featuring a heated 16m × 6m swimming pool surrounded by generous terraces, ideal for relaxation. A natural spring, 14 meters deep, supplies the automatic irrigation system. A dedicated spa area - including hammam, sauna, jacuzzi, shower, and WC - adds an additional layer of luxury and wellness appeal.

Additional outbuildings, including an outdoor gym and pool house, provide further potential for expansion or creative use.

Currently operated as a boutique hotel, the property benefits from a strong reputation and proven income, allowing for an immediate continuation of the business or the development of a bespoke hospitality or wellness concept.

Steeped in history yet perfectly suited to modern use, this rare estate stands out for its charm, strategic location, and exceptional commercial potential - an outstanding opportunity in one of Provence’s most sought-after regions.

Please contact us for more information.
summary: Former 14th-Century Priory with Spa, Pool and Guest Accommodations near L'Isle-Sur-La-Sorgue.

title: V2897 LACOSTE
body:
This exquisite and impressive 17th century farmhouse enjoys an exceptional setting, with striking views of the Luberon valley , the Mont Ventoux, the beautiful village of Lacoste with its artistic community, and Bonnieux. The property is set within 17 acres (7 hectares) of grounds, with a beautifully landscaped garden which merges into private woodland with direct access to the surrounding hillside.

Fully renovated to an impeccable standard, this elegant stylish stone property provides around 350m2 of living space, but also a 15m swimming pool, a hard tennis court, a gated entrance and a double garage - all combining to create the perfect Luberon retreat. 

The accommodation, on the ground floor, comprises: elegant sitting room with beamed Provençal ceilings, a handsome fireplace, and a paved terrace with stunning views of the valley; large games room; stylish dining-room with a Provençal ceiling and double doors opening onto another paved terrace; fully equipped kitchen with Banon stone worktops, a fireplace, and French doors opening onto a covered terrace that overlooks the garden’s delightful water feature and the large swimming pool. Off the entrance is a walk-in cloakroom, a utility room with access to the garden, and a guest WC.

The first floor is composed of: fabulous galleried library with fireplace and floor to ceiling bookshelves; well-appointed study; spacious master bedroom suite with double-height ceilings, incorporating  a bathroom with separate shower, double wash-hand basins, and dressing area. 

On the top floor are two double bedrooms, each with cupboards, a shower room and separate WC.

The mezzanine floor accommodates a spacious double bedroom with fitted cupboards, a charming twin bedroom, a bathroom with separate shower, separate WC.

The exterior of the property features landscaped mature gardens planted with trees, shrubs, roses and a variety of flowering plants, along with a lovely decorative water feature. A large salt-water swimming-pool  measuring 15mx5m, complete with electric cover, a pétanque court and a gated driveway further enhance the property’s appeal. At one end of the garden, a short stroll from the house, is the well maintained hard tennis court. Beyond the garden, the grounds extend into rolling woodland, seamlessly blending into the surrounding countryside.

A separate entrance leads to a large stone-built cellar, featuring three separate storage areas and an air-conditioned wine cellar. At the rear of the property, is a large boiler room. The double garage is located at the top of the driveway with connecting access to the cellar. 

Amenities include: central heating with a newly fitted heat pump; air-conditioning in the bedrooms; mains water; water from the Canal de Provence; automatic watering system; alarm system; water softener; double glazing throughout; electric gates.

This meticulously renovated property, offering exceptional comfort, timeless elegance, and an unparalleled natural setting, represents the essence of Provençal living at its very finest.
summary: Exquisite detached farmhouse in the heart of the Luberon.

title: V3006 L'ISLE-SUR-LA-SORGUE
body:
Nestled between the renowned Luberon villages and just moments from the picturesque l'Isle-sur-la-Sorgue, this meticulously renovated traditional farmhouse offers a harmonious blend of charm, luxury, and investment potential. The property is centred around a serene courtyard, with three independent guesthouses, a spacious master apartment, and a wealth of exceptional amenities.

This epitome of relaxation features lush gardens, a stunning swimming pool, a private gym, a Hammam, and a spa - ensuring an unparalleled sense of tranquility. A double-vaulted 'chai' (a barn formerly used for storing wine) adds further potential, whether for conversion into an indoor pool, a tennis court, or even a sophisticated wine-tasting room. Currently operating as a successful B&B, the property presents an outstanding opportunity for conversion into a seasonal accommodation or as a family compound, offering multiple homes within a single estate.

The heart of the property is the sun-drenched courtyard, ideal for enjoying leisurely breakfasts or evening aperitifs. At the centre lies a welcoming office space, currently serving as the reception area for guests. 

Wellness centre and first guesthouse:  
On the exterior of the left wing, a wellness centre offers a sanctuary for relaxation, with a Hammam, fitness room, and massage room. A beautifully designed guesthouse on this side of farmhouse includes a spacious open-plan kitchen and salon; bedroom; bathroom; wc. A remarkable double-height chai, which spans the length of the property, can be converted into numerous opportunities. 

Second Guesthouse:  
This light and airy guesthouse features a grand double-height foyer with original carreaux de ciment and a classic tomette staircase. The open-plan dining salon, with French atelier doors leading to the kitchen, overlooks the garden and private terrace. The second floor of this guesthouse is air-conditioned and comprises: salon; master suite; ensuite bathroom with bathtub and shower; laundry room; second bedroom; dressing room; third bedroom; bathroom with shower; wc. The second floor is fully air-conditioned for optimal comfort.

Master apartment:  
An independent, central entrance provides access to the private apartment, comprising: spacious master bedroom with ensuite bathroom; second bedroom; bathroom; WC; a large loft with open kitchen and salon; private terrace with stunning views of the courtyard and the Luberon.

Third guesthouse: 
The third guesthouse is equally impressive, with a living space on the ground floor and four beautifully appointed bedrooms on the first floor.  The ground floor comprises: private terrace under the climbing roses; cosy entryway with a classic tomette staircase; open kitchen and salon; sun-filled bedroom with adjacent bathroom; wc. On the first floor, the guesthouse features three additional bedroom suites, and a fourth bedroom with a private balcony and panoramic views of the surrounding landscape. 

The property is surrounded by exquisite gardens with box hedges, Provencal cane, climbing roses, lavender, fruit trees, and centenary olives, all framing the generously sized swimming pool. This idyllic outdoor space offers the perfect setting for relaxation or entertaining guests.

Amenities include: reversible air-conditioning; double-glazed windows; automatic watering system via the canal de Provence; alarm system; automatic Husvarna lawnmower on the principal lawn next to the swimming pool. A large gravel drive provides parking to the east of the house. 

The thoughtful design and meticulous quality of the renovations make this property incredibly versatile. The spaces can be used independently or combined into one grand family home, with each wing offering its own distinct sense of privacy. The property’s configuration lends itself perfectly to a high-end guesthouse, or multi-family living, offering excellent rental potential. An efficient storage space and laundry facilities make entertaining all the easier. 

This property represents a rare opportunity to own a luxurious estate in one of Provence’s most sought-after locations, combining outstanding comfort, style, and the potential for a highly lucrative investment.
summary: Exquisite Luberon farmhouse with guesthouses, luxury amenities & investment potential.

title: V3122 GORDES
body:
This contemporary stone property, located on the edge of the village and overlooking the valley, consists of a spacious main house, gîte, pool house, and swimming pool. Set on 1.38 acres of land planted with over 300 olive trees, it offers spectacular views of the Luberon, as well as the villages of Gordes, Roussillon, and Bonnieux, while enjoying a south-facing exposure.

The independent accommodation will appeal to future owners as an ideal setting for entertaining family and friends or seasonal rentals. Each part of the property has its own entrance and has been designed to take full advantage of the panoramic views. With the centre of Gordes just a 15-minute walk away, the property enjoys absolute privacy and tranquillity. It offers high-end amenities over approximately 330 m² of living space, including two garages that can accommodate up to five cars - a major asset for enthusiasts. 

The ground floor, adorned with Carrara marble flooring, boasts large sliding bay windows that bathe the living rooms in natural light. The house overlooks the Luberon valley, with stunning views through the wisteria draped pergola framed by a sea of olive trees. An elegant dining room and fully equipped open-plan kitchen create a convivial space, perfect for entertaining. An office, laundry room, and separate wing comprising a bedroom, large sitting room, en-suite bathroom, and kitchenette complete this level. The first floor is composed of two majestic suites with floor-to-ceiling picture windows, each fitted with large bathrooms equipped with underfloor heating.

The exterior is equally remarkable, with a 13m x 6.5m tiled Émaux de Briare swimming pool, from which the house and the village of Gordes stand out in the background - a picture-postcard view. Surrounded by a large terrace offering superb vistas, it is the perfect place to enjoy the sun or dine thanks to its fully equipped pool house. The pool house also offers a gîte with two bedrooms, bright sitting room with bay windows, open kitchen, and bathroom.

Features include: mains water; double glazing; sliding bay windows; reversible air conditioning; Acova oil-filled radiators; fireplace; central control of roller shutters on the ground floor; four water heaters; 13m x 6.5m saltwater swimming pool with electric cover; two garages, one with a mechanical pit; cellar and storage space; vegetable garden and greenhouse; outdoor lighting; automatic watering system; water softener; alarm system; fibre internet.

With its dominant position, panoramic views of the Luberon, easy access to the village of Gordes, complete privacy and high-end amenities, this property is a rare find on the market - an idyllic retreat in one of the most beautiful villages in France.
summary: Stone house in an exceptional location, with breathtaking views of Gordes - close to the village.

title: V3026 MURS
body:
Perched above the renowned village of Gordes, in the sought-after and tranquil commune of Murs, this superb rural estate is surrounded by acres of lavender fields and private woodland - with a babbling stream running along the property's boundary. Uninterrupted panoramic views, complete privacy and lovely wildlife make this property stand out. Thoughtfully renovated to deliver every modern comfort, the property offers everything one could wish for in a Provençal retreat. It would serve equally well as a high‑end seasonal rental, an idyllic Luberon second home, or an inspiring setting for artistic and meditation retreats.

The property comprises a spacious main residence - the Bastide - a detached guest house set well apart for independence, and large garages that could be converted into further accommodation if desired.

The Bastide

With a commanding position at the heart of the estate, the Bastide is surrounded by private grounds. The accommodation on the ground floor comprises: large 47 m² sitting room arranged around a fireplace, with arched French doors framing the valley view and opening onto the dining terrace; light‑filled dining room with garden access; adjoining kitchen; principal suite offering generous volumes and a private bathroom (bathtub, walk‑in shower and WC). The ground floor also includes: utility room; games room; technical room; guest WC; access to the wine cellar and basement.

The first floor accommodates four further double bedrooms, each benefiting from an adjoining shower room (walk‑in shower and WC). This level leads out to the rear of the property, with a private terrace and access to the garages.

All bedrooms are air‑conditioned, while under‑floor heating serves the entire ground floor.

The lower level offers a wine cellar and an additional storage room (previously fitted with a Jacuzzi).

The guest house - deliberately set away from the Bastide to guarantee privacy - comprises: living area with kitchen, dining space and sitting area; double bedroom; shower room; guest WC; vast adjoining space (58 m²) that could be converted to provide additional bedrooms.

The 17 acres of grounds surrounding the property are a wonderfully idyllic section of the Luberon valley, with glorious views throughout and not a single other house in sight. A gentle stream meanders along the bottom of the grounds, fed by a pond. South of the Bastide, vast terraces offer the perfect spot for outdoor dining and large‑scale entertaining. Steps take you down to the salt-water swimming pool (10 m × 5 m, with an electric cover). The land is planted with hectares of lavender, mature olives and truffle oaks.
