Amenities include: air‑conditioning in all bedrooms; under‑floor heating on the Bastide’s ground floor; mains water; aluminium‑framed double glazing; fibre‑optic internet; security system; electric fence around the garden.

With outstanding views of the surrounding countryside, unrivalled seclusion and a refined level of modern comfort, this is the quintessential hideaway for those seeking an unspoilt and privileged piece of the Luberon countryside.
summary: 17-acre rural retreat, near Gordes, with breathtaking views.

title: V2918 L'ISLE-SUR-LA-SORGUE
body:
Set on over 1.8 acres of land, this exquisite 19th-century Provençal farmhouse seamlessly blends traditional charm with high-end amenities, to ensure an excellent standard of modern living. The property's remarkable volumes and gorgeous original features are complemented by a tastefully understated décor.

The ground floor of the house comprises: stunning dining room flowing through to a spacious bespoke kitchen; large sitting room with a lovely dressed stone fireplace; warm and welcoming drawing room with Provençal ceilings; dining room; utility room; larder.

The ground floor also features a lovely independently accessed 'orangeraie', bathed in natural light through large wrought iron glass doors.

The accommodation on the first floor is composed of: lavishly sized master suite with a large en suite bathroom and adjoining dressing room; three spacious double bedrooms, each with an en suite shower room; guest loo.

The second floor accommodates two generously proportioned double bedrooms and a shower room.

A charming 'guest house' offers additional accommodation for guests, comprising: sitting room with an adjoining kitchen; double bedroom; shower room.

The garden is exceptionally picturesque, with a magnificent terrace shaded by two century-old plane trees and a luxurious 12m x 6m heated swimming pool lined with Bali stone tiles. The meticulously landscaped grounds include elegant olive and pine trees, and a variety of terraces draped in vine leaves and adorned with pergolas, providing a serene and private setting.

Amenities include: oil-fired central heating; reversible air conditioning in the bedrooms; three boreholes (serving the pool, garden, and house); automatic watering ; automatic gate; fully fenced; garage; sheds; pool house.

This terrific farmhouse property harmoniously combines luxury and natural beauty, creating an authentic and refined atmosphere. With its timeless elegance and potential for seasonal rental, it offers not only a attractive investment but also an exceptional living environment.
summary: Exquisite 19th century Provencal farmhouse with 1.8 acres of grounds.

title: V3048 GORDES
body:
This handsome stone property, poised in oak woodlands near Gordes, enjoys a remarkably tranquil setting and commands uninterrupted panoramas over the Luberon valley, from sunrise to sunset. The interiors have been meticulously remodelled, integrating high-quality fittings and natural materials with a fantastic array of modern comforts - contemporary living at its finest amid unspoilt countryside. Gordes and Coustellet are only a few kilometres away, and both the TGV station and the airport are within easy reach.

Arranged on a single level, the living spaces and bedrooms are bathed in natural light and oriented to capture the view. The entrance opens into a welcoming double-height living room, with views straight through and over to the Luberon mountains. Aged beams, a characterful stone fireplace and Maize stone floors lend warmth and authenticity. The sitting area flows into the dining kitchen, crafted by a local cabinet-maker and topped with marble work surfaces. Both spaces spill out onto south-facing dining terraces overlooking the valley below - an extraordinary backdrop for al-fresco meals and entertaining guests. A WC and cloakroom complete the entrance hall.

The west wing accommodates a luxurious principal suite: beautifully proportioned bedroom, a bathroom with freestanding tub and generous walk-in shower clad in hand-cut Zellige, a private office and ample built-in storage and closets. The east side of the property offers three further bedrooms, each with its own stylish shower room finished in the same artisan tiling, double vanity units and quality fittings, guaranteeing consistent comfort throughout.

The landscaped grounds seem to merge with the Luberon mountains, with no neighbouring roofs in sight, creating an exceptional sense of privacy. The 10m × 5m swimming pool faces the view and is edged by decking, perfect for sun lounging and pool-side entertaining; an electric cover ensures safety. The 3.4-acre plot has been designed for ease of upkeep, featuring dry plantings, mature olive trees and a pocket of private oak forest. A garden studio, lined with wrought-iron windows, offers an inspiring space for creative work.

Amenities include: air-conditioning and central heating; under-floor heating in the bathrooms for additional comfort; high-speed fibre-optic internet; mains water; private water source; automated irrigation; recently installed septic tank; wood-framed double glazing; electric perimeter fence and automatic entrance gates.

This impeccably re-imagined stone house occupies a sublime natural setting and delivers a rare balance of seclusion and convenience, close to vibrant villages and all amenities. Meticulous attention to detail and design elevates the property, making it a tremendously chic and stand-out home in the heart of Provence.
summary: Renovated hilltop stone property with magnificent views.

title: V2727 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
Rich in history and character, this remarkable property captures the essence of Provençal authenticity, with sweeping views over the iconic Luberon landscape.

The main house (approx. 400 m²) comprises, on the ground floor: majestic entrance hall with Burgundy stone flooring; spacious, light-filled sitting room with fireplace and traditional beamed ceilings; large, fully equipped kitchen with high ceilings, fireplace, and direct access to the garden and courtyard; office opening onto the outdoors; guest WC; cellar; superb vaulted dining room opening onto the courtyard; generously sized bedroom with walk-in closet and en suite bathroom.

Upstairs, you'll find a large bedroom with private bathroom; a master suite with fireplace, private terrace, en suite bathroom, and mezzanine sleeping area; two additional spacious bedrooms with high ceilings, direct access to the courtyard, and a family bathroom.

The grounds include a charming stone-built 'mas' of approximately 234 m², with a brand new roof and insulation. Accessible via a separate entrance and featuring a barn, it offers numerous possibilities for conversion—guest accommodation, seasonal rental, or a bespoke project.

The landscaped gardens surround a traditional-style swimming pool (12 m x 5 m), beautifully integrated into its surroundings and ideal for relaxation. The summer kitchen and outdoor dining area enjoy sweeping views and offer the perfect setting for entertaining or simply enjoying sunny days in comfort. The inner courtyard, with its original fountain and various outbuildings, is a true Provençal tableau—an ideal additional space for outside dining.

Features and amenities:
- Mains water, canal water, and well  
- Automatic irrigation system  
- Air conditioning  
- Fibre optic internet  
- Electric pool cover  
- Electric gate  

This exceptional property offers the perfect blend of historic charm and modern comfort, making it an extraordinary opportunity for those seeking an authentic Provençal lifestyle. Whether you're looking for a tranquil retreat, a family home with ample space, or a property with potential for guest accommodation or rental income, this home offers endless possibilities. With its prime location, stunning views, and character-filled spaces, it’s a rare find that promises to captivate all who visit.
summary: Traditional farmhouse set in wonderful grounds with breathtaking views of the Luberon.

title: V2635 APT
body:
Located near a bustling Luberon market town, and just a short drive from the surrounding perched villages, this beautiful hotel and restaurant offers terrific potential with a wide variety of options to explore.

The hotel guest accommodation comprises 20 air-conditioned bedrooms, that have been renovated and soundproofed, with four different levels of comfort.

The first floor comprises a spacious reception room that leads through to the restaurant dining room (offering a capacity of 50 seats). A recently installed breakfast buffet area completes this dining space.

The large and impressively equipped professional kitchens would allow for the capacity of the restaurant to be increased should the new owners desire to do so.

An air-conditioned bar-lounge as well as five bedroom suites, are also located on the first floor.

The second floor accommodates fifteen further bedroom suites, some of which benefit from a private roof terrace overlooking the swimming pool and the surrounding countryside.

The lower floor (approximately 500 m2) would be ideally suited for conversion into a wellness centre, fitness room or a reception room for corporate events or weddings.

The property sits on 2.5 acres of grounds, offering a variety of outdoor spaces; several paved terraces, two swimming pools, and a "pétanque court". A parking area is located to the front of the property.

An adjoining stone 'mas' of 600 sqm currently offers independent living and could provide a further 15 bedrooms or be used for staff accommodation. This 'mas' is composed of three floors and benefits from its own private swimming pool and a separate gated entrance and parking area.

This well-maintained establishment offers great scalability, with the possibility to expand the Hotel's current capacity, convert the property into a bed and breakfast, or create a reception hall for social or business events.
summary: Hotel-restaurant and Bastide with swimming pools in the heart of the Luberon.

title: V3008 ST SATURNIN LES APT
body:
A rare opportunity to acquire a private estate set on nearly two acres of beautifully landscaped grounds just outside the village of Saint-Saturnin-lès-Apt. This property comprises two residences - the main house and a fully independent two-bedroom cottage - offering a total of 503 m² of interior space, a manicured garden with mature trees and koi carp ponds, and two private swimming pools.

Main Residence (approx. 288 m²)

The main house offers spacious, light-filled interiors, high ceilings, and seamless transitions to the outdoor living spaces. Comfort is ensured year-round through underfloor heating (via air-sourced heat pump) and A/C units in all bedrooms.

The accommodation, on the ground floor, is composed of: an entrance hall; open-plan living space with Luberon views, including a dining room with French windows to the terrace, and a fully equipped kitchen flowing out to the alfresco dining area; ground-floor master suite including a dressing room and a private WC. The ground floor also comprises: guest WC, utility/laundry room, and extensive storage.

The first floor offers four double bedrooms, each with ensuite bathrooms.

Adjoining Wing (approx. 109 m²)

A two-storey space attached to the main house, currently undeveloped but with existing plumbing and electrics - ideal for conversion into a gym, office, studio, or additional accommodation.

Guest Cottage (approx. 79 m²)

Set apart from the main house, this self-contained cottage offers privacy, versatility, and strong rental potential. The ground floor includes a generous living/dining area, a fully equipped kitchen, and a shower room with WC. Upstairs, two bedrooms share a WC. The cottage has its own entrance, a private terrace, and a heated saltwater pool (8m x 4m), making it ideal for hosting guests, extended family, or a live-in caretaker.

Grounds & Garden

The garden is a standout feature of the property. The grounds are meticulously maintained and include expansive lawns and vibrant flowerbeds. A series of shaded terraces offer inviting spaces for outdoor dining and entertaining, overlooking the ornamental koi carp ponds. Home to around 400 koi, the ponds are connected by a stream that winds its way through the garden.

There is a lovely mixture of mature trees which provide excellent shade and a cool microclimate to unwind in summer. The rich soils and abundance of water from the Canal de Provence ensures the lawn, trees, roses and hanging wisteria are well maintained and vibrant in full bloom.

A holding of this size and quality, in such close proximity to the village, is a true rarity in today’s market. The appeal of the grounds cannot be overstated.

Amenities include: Canal de Provence and mains water; mains drainage; underfloor heating (main house); A/C units in all bedrooms; fibre internet; electric shutters in the main house; electric gates; two-car garage; large parking area for guests.

Located just a short distance from the lively village of Saint-Saturnin-lès-Apt, the property offers convenience as well as privacy. The village features a new medical centre, pharmacy, restaurants, bars, shops, and two boulangeries.
summary: Stunning property in the heart of the Luberon.

title: V3080 GORDES
body:
This handsome stone farmhouse lies in the heart of the Gordes countryside and has been the subject of a complete and masterful renovation. Nestled within 7.4 acres of private fruit orchards, olive groves, and landscaped gardens, the property offers remarkable privacy and superb views of the Luberon mountain range. The craftsmanship throughout is exemplary, combining high-quality materials, a refreshingly contemporary palette, gorgeous original features, and refined décor – all working together to create a harmonious blend of authenticity and modern comfort.

The accommodation begins with a welcoming open-plan living space, where a striking floating stone staircase and a glass-walled wine cellar set the tone. This great room comprises: bespoke contemporary kitchen by Fabre with black quartz countertops; sun-drenched sitting room benefitting from triple-aspect French windows framing views over the countryside towards the Luberon; generous dining area. The ground floor also includes a principal suite with adjoining shower room and fitted cupboards. Floors throughout are laid in beautiful Jerusalem stone.

The first floor comprises two spacious double bedrooms sharing a shower room with WC and walk-in shower. Two further independent suites on the garden level complete the accommodation, each benefitting from its own private shower room and WC, as well as direct access to the terraces and gardens.

The landscaped grounds are beautifully designed, with flowering plants and manicured shrubs ensuring both privacy and colour throughout the year. A variety of terraces encompass the farmhouse, providing different areas for entertaining family and friends. The main living spaces open directly onto a dining terrace shaded by a pergola and overlooking the gardens. A cypress-lined avenue leads to a west-facing seating area, perfectly positioned to enjoy sunsets among the olive trees. To the east, a charming courtyard shaded by two plane trees and planted with boxwood and flowering shrubs creates a picturesque Provençal setting.

Overlooking the grounds, the heated saltwater swimming pool (10m x 5m) is equipped with a submerged electric cover and a heat pump, and is complemented by a shaded seating area and a generous wrap-around terrace.

Amenities include: reversible air-conditioning throughout the house; mains water and Canal de Provence irrigation for the garden; compliant septic system; fibre-optic internet; double glazing with bespoke wood and wrought-iron frames; carport.

Perfectly located in the Gordes countryside, within easy reach of Coustellet, Ménerbes, Goult, and Cabrières-d'Avignon, this property represents an outstanding blend of Provençal charm, architectural refinement, and modern convenience. It would serve equally well as a luxurious holiday retreat or as an attractive rental investment opportunity.
summary: Exceptional 7-acre Gordes farmhouse property combining authenticity and modern comfort.

title: V3005 L'ISLE-SUR-LA-SORGUE
body:
A luxurious renovation harmoniously blends original features and contemporary elegance in this 18th century bastide. The fully-enclosed garden, adorned with an impressive pool, provides a serene and peaceful setting. An independent guest house, an independent bedroom, and a newly renovated kitchen make this property a perfect retreat for hosting friends and family whilst maintaining a calm and private atmosphere.

The accommodation, on the ground floor, comprises: entrance hall with the original staircase; sitting room with floor-to-ceiling french doors that open to the south and west; wc; sleek open-plan kitchen that opens onto the dining room and the south facing terrace; renovated pocket pantry.

The first floor boasts: 75m2 master suite with pristine bathroom; two further double bedrooms both with ensuite bathrooms.

The second floor enjoys: master bedroom with ensuite bathroom; two double bedrooms, both with ensuite bathrooms; converted 'Pigeonnier', now a gym, offering panoramic views.

The bastide's amenities include: state of the art security system; electric gates; air conditioning; pool house equipped with a summer kitchen; pétanque court; single-car garage. 

A separate guest house, to the left of the bastide, is composed of: welcoming open-plan kitchen and living space; wc; shower. Upstairs, a spacious room offers versatile potential, whether as a generously sized bedroom, a yoga studio, atelier or office. 

An independent bedroom completes this ensemble, located to the right of the main house, featuring a small salon, a mezzanine with bedroom and the possibility to add a kitchenette. 

The lush and immaculately maintained gardens are a true testament to the care and attention given to this outdoor space. Rows of centenary plane trees create a majestic ambiance, while rose gardens add a lovely variety of colours and fragrances. Large lawns and well-established shrubs complete the grounds, all benefitting from an automatic watering system. Tall wrought-iron gates provide a grand entrance, perfectly framing the charm of this exquisite garden.

This gorgeous bastide is a 5 minute drive from the famous antiquing centre of L'Isle-sur-la-Sorgue with multiple commerces open all week long. 

Every aspect of this property has been meticulously renovated to an extraordinary standard, with the expertise of an architect and an interior designer. The results are nothing short of breathtaking, creating a bastide that is as functional as it is beautiful.
summary: An outstanding 18th century 'bastide' surrounded by 1.25 acres of land.

title: V2581 L'ISLE-SUR-LA-SORGUE
body:
Located less than 10 minutes from the ever-desirable market town of L’Isle sur la Sorgue, and set on over 7 acres of manicured gardens and private grounds, stands this magnificent 19th century Mas.

Spread over two levels, the ground floor is dedicated to living spaces and features a spacious lounge with a fireplace, a cozy TV room with a wood-burning stove, a dining room, a fully equipped kitchen, a utility room, a laundry room, and two guest toilets. These generously proportioned rooms are adorned with large arched French windows, bringing in natural light and a sense of grandeur. A garden-facing suite with its own bathroom and WC completes this level.

Accessible via two separate staircases, the upper floor offers four large en-suite bedrooms with showers and WCs, two additional double bedrooms, a dormitory, a bathroom, and a separate toilet.

At the entrance of the property, an automated gate opens onto a beautiful driveway that winds through lavender fields and orchards, leading to the house.

A large, landscaped parking area can accommodate several vehicles and includes a four-space carport, a Tesla charging station, and a water supply point.

The 2.8-hectare estate boasts a beautifully maintained landscaped garden with numerous leisure and relaxation areas, a pétanque court, and a heated 12m x 6m swimming pool with counter-current swimming system—perfect for enjoying this exceptional setting.

At the front of the house, beneath five century-old plane trees, a shaded terrace with a fully equipped outdoor kitchen provides an ideal setting to gather with family and friends for memorable al fresco meals.

The property is equipped with: automatic irrigation system, recent electric heating, reversible air conditioning in each bedroom, a videophone system, internet connection, new roofing, and wooden double-glazed windows. The house benefits from two water wells—one supplying the house and the other for garden use.

The innate charm and striking majesty of this estate ensure that it would make a terrific Proveçal retreat or luxurious residence. It would be equally suitable as seasonal rental investment or a bed & breakfast.
summary: Stunning 19th century Mas with meticulously landscaped grounds.

title: V3109 GORDES
body:
Set within walking distance of the renowned village of Gordes, this exquisite stone property offers a rare combination of privacy, refined living, and Provençal authenticity. Enclosed within 0.95 acres of expertly landscaped grounds, the property comprises a luxurious main house, an independent gîte, artist's atelier, and a picturesque stone tower offering guest accommodation – each blending harmoniously into the manicured gardens planted with centuries-old olive trees, cypress, acacia, and boxwood.

The main house offers superb volumes, drenched in natural light, striking an effortless balance between traditional charm and contemporary comfort. French windows open onto the terraces and gardens, ensuring a seamless transition between indoor and outdoor living. The ground floor comprises: inviting sitting room with an oversized picture window granting unobstructed views of the Luberon mountains; formal dining area; spacious kitchen with adjoining larder and breakfast terrace; ground-floor bedroom suite (currently used as an office), ideal for guests or family members.

The first floor accommodates: lavish principal suite, with vast windows looking out over the formal gardens and Luberon Valley, and an adjoining shower room; second double bedroom suite, with private shower room. Throughout, the interiors are characterised by lovely natural materials, bespoke joinery, and superb fittings and furnishings that complement the property’s Provençal architecture. The living spaces and the principal bedroom benefit from underfloor heating/cooling; the rest of the property is fitted with reversible air conditioning.

Across the garden, a self-contained guest house offers a private living space, kitchenette, and double bedroom suite – the perfect retreat for visiting family or friends. Beyond, a charming stone tower, the property's pièce de résistance – once a romantic folly, now converted into a unique guest house – exudes authenticity. With its own orangery-style living area, bedroom, and private garden terrace with spectacular views, it provides independent accommodation in a setting of rare character and charm.

Paths lead through the ancient olive groves, adorned with sculpted boxwood and fragrant planting. At the lower edge of the property, the bassin-style swimming pool sits gracefully within its landscaped surrounds, framed by stone terraces and mature planting. The property is fenced and gated and enjoys an unrivalled sense of privacy.

Amenities include: underfloor heating and cooling in the living spaces and the principal suite; reversible air conditioning throughout the rest of the property; fibre-optic internet; mains water; automatic watering; electric gates; an alarm system. The property also benefits from a historic natural spring, which feeds the stone well during the wetter months – an evocative reminder of the property’s history.

Peaceful, authentic, and gorgeously elegant, this estate captures the timeless appeal of Provençal living – morning walks to the village bakery, leisurely lunches beneath the shade of olive trees, and evening apéritifs whilst enjoying the mesmerising views and sunsets. A rare and refined property, just a short walk from Gordes yet offering complete privacy – the perfect retreat.
summary: Superbly private Gordes estate with unobstructed Luberon views.

title: V2834 MENERBES
body:
Perched on top of the legendary Luberon village of Ménerbes, this unique property includes a guest house and a 500 m² constructible plot of land and enjoys sweeping 360-degree views across the surrounding valley. Complete privacy and tranquillity are assured, whilst the village’s shops, restaurants, cafés and bars lie just a few steps away.

The ground floor comprises: large and sun-drenched 56 m² sitting room with dining area and handsome stone fireplace; well-equipped adjoining kitchen with island unit; bedroom (currently used as a sitting room); adjoining shower room; separate WC.

The first floor accommodates: spacious principal suite with adjoining bathroom, WC and office; second double bedroom with ensuite bathroom, WC, office and private terrace; storage room. Both offices could readily serve as dressing rooms if desired.

The property also features a completely independent 150 m² guest house, comprising: generous entrance hall; kitchen and dining room; laundry room; sitting room with fireplace; WC; two double bedrooms, each with an ensuite bathroom; large second floor awaiting conversion. The guest house requires renovation works but offers tremendous untapped potential.

The main house could easily be connected to the independent guest house, creating a seamless link between the two living spaces. A lift could also be installed in the lower house, providing convenient access whilst leading up to the upper property and uniting both units.

The carefully landscaped 0.15-acre garden, planted with a variety of Mediterranean trees and flowering plants, is threaded with a winding path that leads past a wrought-iron pavilion. A spacious terrace runs along the façade of the house, offering the perfect spot for outdoor dining and entertaining with breathtaking views of the village below. The swimming pool is framed by a large sunbathing terrace.

The property also boasts an authentic dovecote that has been converted to provide: sitting room; bedroom; shower room; adjoining summer kitchen, located behind the tower.

Amenities include: reversible air conditioning; fireplace; mains water; automatic watering system; fibre-optic internet; mains drainage. The property is entirely fenced and benefits from four private parking spaces as well as a large double garage.

With its exceptional character, generous accommodation, superb potential and panoramic views, this is a truly outstanding property in one of the most renowned villages of the Luberon — with the added advantage of a constructible plot of land.
summary: Superb property, with guest house, garage and constructible plot of land, perched above the sought-after village of Ménerbes.

title: V3070 OPPEDE
body:
Located in the peaceful countryside of Oppède – a short drive from the shops and weekly market of Coustellet and the perched villages of Ménerbes and Oppède-le-Vieux – this Provençal farmhouse has undergone a complete and masterful renovation, blending authentic charm with contemporary comfort. Offering four generous air-conditioned suites, a heated swimming pool and a garage, and set amid private woodland, orchards and rolling hills, the property enjoys absolute privacy and sweeping views towards the rugged Luberon mountains.

The ground floor is composed of: entrance hall with fitted cupboards and guest WC; bright sitting room with open fireplace and wrought-iron French doors opening directly onto the main dining terrace and walled garden; contemporary Fabre kitchen equipped with a Lacanche induction range, featuring exposed stone walls and an adjoining rear kitchen / pantry. A guest suite completes the ground floor, benefiting from an en suite shower room and direct access to the garden.

The upper floors are divided into two wings, each served by its own staircase. The first staircase, rising from the sitting room, serves: principal suite of generous proportions with adjoining shower room and WC; spacious double bedroom with bathroom fitted with a bathtub, walk-in shower, double vanity and WC. The second staircase serves: one further double suites, with its own shower room; cathedral-ceilinged sitting room with lovely original beams – equally suited as a fifth bedroom or office.

The gardens have been landscaped into a series of welcoming outdoor spaces, including a wonderfully private walled garden wrapped around the swimming pool. The heated pool (12m × 4m), fitted with a submerged cover, is surrounded by natural stone terraces and enjoys lovely views over the surrounding countryside. A raised terrace accommodates a fully equipped summer kitchen – ideal for outdoor dining and entertaining – while additional terraces, some shaded by a gorgeous pine tree, provide a choice of relaxing spots throughout the day. The plots of land to the south offer further potential (orchard, truffle oaks, vines, etc.).

Amenities include: reversible air-conditioning; mains water; newly installed septic system; fibre-optic internet; wood and wrought-iron double-glazed windows. The property also benefits from a 35 m² garage with electric door and electric car charging point, together with a separate carport.

Thanks to its stylish renovation, four en-suite bedrooms and myriad of outdoor living areas, this property offers an elegant and private Provençal retreat with excellent seasonal-rental potential.
summary: Renovated Oppède farmhouse – four suites, heated pool & Luberon views.

title: V2738 RUSTREL
body:
This magnificent 18th century Bastide offers plentiful living space includes five bedrooms and is set in a beautiful rural location with lovely views to the  surrounding Luberon countryside. The property offers an unusual and stunning Orangery of about 79m2 which provides the house with an enviable light-filled entertaining room. The Orangery’s nine arched double doors allow views to the garden and the room has been decorated with elegance and style to include a custom made chandelier and an impressive stone fireplace.

Meticulously maintained, the large walled garden features an elegant lavender and cypress-lined driveway. Several courtyards wrap around the property, providing a choice of different areas for outside dining, relaxation or enjoyment of the Provençal sunshine. The heated 11m x 5m pool and summer kitchen are located at one end of the garden. The Bastide is set in a beautiful rural location, with views to the famous ochre hills of the Colorado.

The ground floor comprises: a vast beamed Orangery with an impressive stone fireplace, its own service kitchen, WC and a hallway leading to the garden or into the main house;  a second entrance hall; a sitting-room with fireplace;  a library;  an office area; open plan kitchen and dining area with fireplace; and a laundry. 

On the first floor:  a spacious light-filled bedroom with bathroom; a second sizable airy bedroom with bathroom and separate shower; and a third bright bedroom. 

The second floor: two more large bedrooms, featuring exposed beams, both with ensuite shower rooms.

The exterior of the property includes: extensive gardens with three paved courtyards wrapping around the house; automatic gates opening onto parking space for several vehicles plus an awning offering shade for 3 cars; a heated pool, resurfaced at the beginning of 2025; pool-house comprising a dining terrace, kitchen, shower room and WC; an outbuilding for storage which incorporates a fully-fitted wine cellar. Above the stone outbuilding is a good-sized terrace with views to the ochre hills of the Colorado.

In addition to the main house: a constructible plot of land to the north east of the property of around 1637m2 with separate independent access.

Technical information: underfloor heating throughout the ground floor; oil central heating; electric entrance gates; mains water; mains drainage; an automatic irrigation system; a private well; an alarm system.

This very impressive and spacious Bastide incorporates elegant living with all the authentic charm of an 18th century Provençal property. The house has been well maintained by the current owners and is located only a few minutes from the charming village of Rustrel with its cafés, shops and thriving artistic community.
summary: Beautiful 18th century bastide with pool and walled garden.

title: V2828 MENERBES
body:
Perched at the summit of the legendary Luberon village of Ménerbes, this remarkable property enjoys sweeping 360-degree views across the surrounding valley. The house benefits from complete privacy and tranquillity, yet lies only a few steps from the village’s shops, restaurants, cafés and bars.

The ground floor comprises: large and luminous 56m² sitting room with dining area and handsome stone fireplace; well-equipped adjoining kitchen with an island unit; bedroom (currently used as a petit salon) with adjoining shower room; separate WC.

The first floor accommodates: spacious master suite with adjoining bathroom, WC and office; second double bedroom with ensuite bathroom, WC, office and private terrace; storage room. Both offices could readily be converted into dressing rooms if desired.

The property also features a completely independent 150m² guest house, comprising: generous entrance hall; kitchen and dining room; laundry room; sitting room with fireplace; WC; two double bedrooms, each with an ensuite bathroom; large second floor awaiting conversion. The guest house requires renovation but offers superb untapped potential. 

The main house could easily be connected to the independent guest house, creating a seamless link between the two living spaces. A lift could also be installed in the lower house, providing convenient access whilst leading up to the upper property and uniting both units.

The carefully landscaped 0.15-acre garden, with a meandering path leading to a wrought-iron pavilion, is planted with a wonderful variety of trees and flowering plants. A spacious terrace runs along the front of the house, providing the ideal spot for outdoor dining and entertaining, with breathtaking views of the village below. The swimming pool is framed by a large sunbathing terrace.

The property also boasts an authentic pigeonnier outbuilding, comprising: sitting room; bedroom; shower room; adjoining summer kitchen.

Amenities include: reversible air conditioning; fireplace; mains water; automatic watering system; fibre-optic internet; mains drainage. The property is entirely fenced and benefits from three private parking spaces, and a large double garage.

With its character, generous accommodation, exceptional potential and unrivalled panoramic views, this is a truly outstanding property in one of the Luberon’s most desirable villages.
summary: Exceptional village property with guest house, pool, garage and panoramic views

title: V3093 GORDES
body:
Tucked away in a quiet and picturesque part of the Gordes countryside, this handsome stone property stands on 1.2 acres of beautifully landscaped and utterly private grounds - encompassed by a tall hedge to ensure complete intimacy. The house combines authentic Provençal character with gorgeous natural materials, high-end amenities and modern comforts and superb proportions. Whether as a comfortable family home or a luxurious Luberon retreat, the property is a rare find, remodelled and maintained to an exceptional standard. The gardens feature shaded dining terraces, a lovely swimming pool area, pétanque court, fully equipped pool house and mature olive groves.

Upon entry you are welcomed by a spacious hall with fitted cupboards, guest WC and a pretty stone staircase leading to the first floor. The ground floor enjoys an excellent flow, comprising: generous living area with dining space and adjoining sitting room arranged around a striking antique stone fireplace; sun-drenched kitchen with bespoke cabinetry, Lacanche gas range, stone fireplace and top-quality appliances (a dream for any passionate cook); secondary sitting room with light streaming in through orangery-style wrought-iron windows and doors; large larder with ample storage; utility room with access to the wine cellar, also accommodating the technical and heating systems; home gym with oversized wrought-iron doors (this space could equally serve as a ground floor bedroom or a superb office).

The first floor accommodates the bedrooms, of which the principal suite is particularly impressive - a beautifully proportioned double bedroom with high ceilings, vast walk-in dressing room, bathroom with bathtub, shower and double vanity, and a private rooftop terrace with pretty views of the Luberon mountains. The first floor further comprises: double bedroom suite with private shower room; double bedroom with mezzanine level and access to the attic (a very usable storage space); two additional double bedrooms (one currently used as an office); family bathroom with bathtub and walk-in shower; guest WC.

The grounds are landscaped and maintained to an extraordinary standard, with expansive lawns, olive groves, fruit trees and a wealth of Provençal planting (all created to ensure relative ease of maintenance). Extensive exterior lighting allows the gardens to be enjoyed well into the hot summer evenings. The living areas all open seamlessly to the gardens and terraces, with the main dining terrace draped in Lady Banks Roses - a particularly picturesque setting. Stone steps lead down to the swimming pool (10m x 5m) framed by stone surrounds, and complemented by a pool house and covered terrace with fridge, sink and barbecue area. Beyond lies the pétanque court with professional lighting. There is covered parking for two cars. The olive groves provide an annual harvest of around 125 kilos.

Amenities include: underfloor heating and cooling throughout; air-conditioning in the principal suite and two further bedrooms; thermodynamic water heater; mains water; water softener; Canal de Provence for the garden; septic tank in conformity with current regulations; sophisticated alarm and surveillance system; wood and wrought-iron double glazing; fibre optic internet. The property is fully enclosed and secured by electric gates.

This is an outstanding property, offering a unique opportunity to enjoy the best of Provençal living in a privileged setting. Conveniently located close to Gordes, Goult and Cabrières-d’Avignon, and only a short drive or cycle to Coustellet for all amenities. Understated luxury, with everything one could wish for.
summary: Exceptional Gordes retreat with landscaped grounds and refined interiors.

title: V3009 GORDES
body:
This gorgeous property with its stunning grounds, surrounded by an enchanting canopy of oak trees, is just a ten minute walk from the picturesque village of Gordes. The spacious interior is bathed in natural sunlight flooding in through the generous French windows, which overlook the lovely Provençal gardens. 

The accommodation is composed of, on the ground floor: entrance hall; converted garage studio/bedroom with ensuite shower room; fully equipped renovated kitchen; dining room with access to terrace; large sitting room with fireplace;  master suite with shower room and dressing room; laundry/utility and boiler room. 

The first floor comprises: bedroom with ensuite shower room; second bedroom with ensuite shower room and access to terrace; two further bedrooms with Jack and Jill shower room; WC. 

The garden covers over 0.6 acres of beautifully terraced, landscaped grounds, and includes a heated, tiled swimming pool of 10m x 5m. The pool is enhanced by a summer kitchen, with a Lacornue rotisserie, plenty of shade under the veranda, and a utility room. There is a separate carport and storage shed. The property is fully enclosed with electric fences.

Amenities include: underfloor heating; automatic watering systems; alarm system; extensive garden lighting; mains drainage and water; fibre internet; electric gate.

In close reach to the culture, history and sights of one of the most beloved villages in the Luberon, this idyllic retreat would make a wonderful family residence or second home.
summary: Stunning stone property with pool and pretty gardens; walk to village centre.

title: V3030 L'ISLE-SUR-LA-SORGUE
body:
Spacious and drenched in natural light, this stone l’Isle-sur-la-Sorgue property benefits from a terrific location, close to the centre yet away from the bustle of this vibrant Provençal market town. Nestled behind gates and tall hedges, the property enjoys exceptional privacy, complemented by lovely gardens and a superb swimming pool area. The property has been beautifully remodelled, with no expense spared, thoroughly modernising the interiors to the highest standards. The result is a refreshingly contemporary home, ideal for year-round living or as a luxurious Provençal retreat.

The ground floor is composed of: welcoming foyer with guest WC; impressive living area structured around a central fireplace, featuring a generous formal dining area and sitting room - oversized arched French doors lead out to the terrace and swimming pool, seamlessly blending indoor-outdoor living; gorgeous bespoke kitchen adorned with granite countertops, a stunning Lacanche stove, and Zelige tile backsplash - complemented by a small scullery kitchen. The ground floor also accommodates the master suite, with arched wrought-iron French doors and oak flooring, a large adjoining dressing room and bathroom equipped with a freestanding bathtub and walk-in shower.

The first floor comprises three south-facing double bedrooms (the largest measuring 21m²), sharing two spacious bathrooms. Two of these bedrooms currently serve as inspiring office spaces.

A large secondary building (64m²) currently functions as a music room with its own WC. This versatile space could easily be transformed into an independent guest house, lavish private gym, yoga or meditation studio, or artist's atelier. The possibilities are numerous.

A separate guest suite with direct access to the swimming pool provides additional accommodation for guests, featuring air-conditioning and a private shower room with WC.

The property's basement (82m²) houses the heating system, utility space, and wine cellar. Additional storage spaces for garden furniture and equipment are available, including a hand-crafted wooden chalet ideal for storing bicycles.

A large terrace runs along the property's southern façade, shaded by a pergola draped in grape vines, perfect for outdoor dining and entertaining. Steps lead down to the redesigned pool area, featuring a superb 10m x 5m heated swimming pool with electric submerged cover, encompassed by terraces. The fully-equipped summer kitchen (complete with pizza oven, open fireplace, and all necessary appliances) extends into a spacious covered seating area. The garden surrounds the house, ensuring complete privacy, and features a lovely variety of trees, indigenous flowering plants, and manicured shrubs.

Amenities include: carport for several vehicles; underfloor heating and cooling in living spaces; air-conditioning throughout; wood-framed double glazing; StarLink high-speed internet; thermodynamic water boiler; alarm system; mains water supply; Canal de Provence water for the garden; newly installed septic tank. The property is fully fenced and secured by electric gates.

This is an outstanding property, filled with natural light and generous spaces, ideally located near the area's most coveted town - renowned for its Michelin-starred restaurants, celebrated antiques market, and numerous shops. Additionally, the property is within walking distance of a local farmer’s shop offering fresh seasonal produce.
summary: Spacious contemporary stone property, on the edge of l'Isle-sur-la-Sorgue.

title: V2857 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
This magnificent stone property lies in the heart of a desirable Luberon village. Once the village's coaching inn (or 'Relais de Poste'), this grandiose property has been the subject of a masterful renovation project, incorporating gorgeous natural materials, a variety of modern comforts, and refined décor.

The accommodation on the ground floor comprises: spacious kitchen with a large peninsula and an adjoining dining area; formal dining room; sitting room with handsome stone fireplace and vaulted ceilings; billiard room, that could serve as a ground floor bedroom if desired; scullery kitchen; technical room; guest WC.

The first floor accommodates: particularly grand master suite (50m2) with an adjoining bathroom featuring a wrought-iron bathtub and a walk-in shower, and stone steps leading down to the garden; second double bedroom suite with an adjoining shower room; atelier/workshop; sitting room/dressing room.

The second floor is composed of: two spacious double bedroom suites, each benefitting from a bathroom ensuite; additional room; attic space currently used for storage (that could easily serve as a bedroom or office).

On 514m2 of land, the property enjoys 250m2 of  wonderfully landscaped walled garden, embellished by exotic palm trees and centenary olive trees, a lovely swimming pool and large covered terrace. Despite the central location within the village, the house and garden enjoy the utmost privacy, tranquility and intimacy. The traditional 'bassin-style' swimming pool is heated and measures 7m x 5m. Views of the Luberon mountains, the surrounding rooftops, and the village's château can be enjoyed from the upper floors. The property is south-facing and is located just a few steps from the local amenities.

Amenities include: mains water; main drainage; bespoke wood-framed double glazing; geothermal underfloor heating/cooling system.

This property is exceptional in its authenticity and has been renovated to an extraordinary standard. It would serve as an easy to maintain, and extremely well located, Luberon retreat, a large family home or an attractive rental investment opportunity.
summary: Gorgeous village house with lavish garden and pool.

title: V3065 TAILLADES
body:
Set within a beautifully preserved natural landscape on the edge of Les Taillades, this distinguished property offers an exceptional standard of comfort, total seclusion, and timeless Provençal character. The property comprises a charming stone farmhouse, two independent guest houses, independent guest suites, two swimming pools and a tennis court.

The main house, a handsome mas surrounded by mature trees and landscaped grounds, enjoys complete privacy. Designed for refined yet relaxed living, the ground floor comprises: large living area with large dressed stone fireplace, exposed stone walls and beams; large dining room with stone walls and beams; additional dining area with large arched doors leading out to the terrace; spacious kitchen with Lacanche oven range and wrought-iron glass doors granting access to the pool area; double bedroom with ensuite bathroom and sliding doors out to the pool area; double bedroom with adjoining shower room; laundry room; storage room / cellar; sports room; guest WC. 

The first floor accommodates a further four ensuite bedrooms, two of which benefit from independent access to the garden. There is also a self-contained suite, located in the garden, living area and bathroom.

The pool area is particularly impressive - offering the perfect spot to entertain guests or relax under the hot Provençal sun - with a series of stone terraces arranged across several levels, a large covered terrace with Pizza oven and summer kitchen, and an inviting gazebo overlooking the swimming pool. The swimming pool (12m x 6m) is tiled and heated.

In addition to the main house, the estate includes two further guest houses:

The first guest house, with access to its own pool (10m x 5m), has been renovated to a high standard with modern décor and appliances. The accommodation, on the ground floor, comprises: large, open-plan living dining; modern kitchen with French doors leading to the garden; two ensuite double rooms; guest WC. The first floor accommodates a further two spacious bedroom suites.

A third dwelling, perfect for use as a caretaker’s cottage or additional guest accommodation, offers an open-plan kitchen living area, two further bedrooms and a bathroom.

A tennis court completes the grounds of this impressive Luberon property.

The entire estate has been maintained to a high standard, complemented by terrific authentic character and modern comfort throughout. Amenities include: underfloor heating and cooling via heat pump on the ground floor of the main house; reversible air conditioning throughout; garage; mains and Canal de Provence water in addition to a private water source (borehole).

Rare on the market, this substantial property offers a unique chance to enjoy the tranquillity and charm of Provence - whether as a sizeable family home or a lucrative rental/B&B in the heart of the Luberon. The location is especially advantageous for hospitality: proximity to Les Taillades’ village centre, minutes from the Luberon’s famous hill top villages, and an easy drive to the lively market town of L’Isle sur la Sorgue, the airport, and the Avignon TGV station.

Information on the risks to which this property is exposed is available on the Géorisques website: http://www.georisques.gouv.fr
summary: Elegant Provençal property with guest houses, two pools, tennis court and complete privacy.

title: V2788 MENERBES
body:
Perched at the top of the legendary Luberon village of Ménerbes, this exceptional property enjoys utterly breathtaking views across the surrounding valley. Nestled just above Ménerbes’ famed Citadel, the house offers absolute privacy and tranquillity whilst lying only a short stroll from the village’s shops, restaurants, cafés and bars. Simply put, this is one of the most exclusive settings that the Luberon valley can offer.

The ground floor comprises: superb 56m² sitting/dining room, bathed in natural light from large French windows and centred around a handsome stone fireplace; the dining area flows through to a well-equipped kitchen with an island unit; bedroom (currently used as a petit salon) with adjoining shower room; guest loo.

The first floor comprises: spacious principal suite with adjoining bathroom, loo and office; second double bedroom suite with adjoining bathroom, loo, office and private terrace overlooking the garden and pool. The offices in both suites could readily serve as dressing rooms if preferred.

The landscaped garden is planted with a wonderful variety of trees and flowering plants, creating a particularly bucolic setting. A generous terrace extends along the façade, offering the perfect spot for al fresco dining and entertaining. A pathway winds through the garden, past a charming water feature, to reach a wrought-iron pavilion that frames a remarkable view of the village of Ménerbes. The 0.15-acre grounds also feature a swimming pool (8.5m x 5.5m) with a large sunbathing terrace.

The property further includes an authentic pigeonnier outbuilding, comprising a cosy sitting room, a bedroom, a shower room and an adjoining summer kitchen. Its elevated position above Ménerbes affords sweeping 360-degree views across the surrounding countryside.

Amenities include: reversible air conditioning; working fireplace; mains water; automatic watering system; fibre-optic internet; mains drainage. The property is entirely fenced and benefits from two private parking spaces.

With its outstanding panoramic views, refined décor, generous living spaces and abundance of character, this is a truly remarkable property in one of Provence’s most sought-after villages.
summary: Superbly positioned village property, with swimming pool and panoramic views.

title: V3103 GORDES
body:
This former stone farmhouse, full of charm and built in stone, is just steps from the central square of Gordes yet offers complete tranquillity in a preserved natural setting. It combines the intimacy of the countryside with all the advantages of a village house, making it a true hidden gem. Once you pass through the gate, the proximity to the village is very quickly forgotten.

The setting is idyllic, and the main house - set on one floor - features generous, bright volumes with a modern layout. Facing due south, the house has a shaded terrace under a wrought-iron pergola, overlooking a delightful terraced Provençal garden planted with olive and fig trees, lavender, and vines. The open view is superb, stretching all the way to the Alpilles. The property sits on 0.8 acres of constructible land, offering terrific potential for expansion and development.

Inside, the rooms are bathed in natural light, with a simple, open plan layout and cathedral pine ceilings. The whole property displays a rare harmony for a house of this age. The gîte with its own gated access, the independent artist studio and the additional suite with a separate entrance offer multiple possibilities: seasonal rentals, hosting friends or family, or accommodation for a live-in helper. The bedrooms, spacious and airy, each have their own bathroom or shower room, ensuring optimal comfort.

The main house, mostly on one level, is organised around a large, welcoming space with a wood stove, combining a gorgeous sitting room, dining area, kitchen, office, and library. This level also includes two bedrooms, one featuring an ensuite bathroom. The suite, consisting of a bedroom with shower and a private terrace on the lower level, is accessible from both inside and outside.

The fully independent gîte has its own entrance via a second gate to the property. This comprises: sitting room; kitchen; bedroom; shower room; WC; private dining terrace.

Amenities include: mains water and drainage; automatic watering system; exterior lighting; windows with double glazing; air conditioning in the sitting room and main bedroom; fibre-optic internet; artist studio with exposed stone walls and large bay windows; technical room with central oil heating; garden shed, wood storage.

A rare opportunity to own an authentic yet effortlessly elegant home in one of the most prized settings in the Luberon, within walking distance of all local restaurants, cafés, bars and restaurants - the very definition of Provençal refinement.
summary: Charming former Bergerie in an unrivalled location in Gordes.

title: V3027 MENERBES
body:
Located in the heart of Ménerbes, one of the most desirable villages in the Luberon, this fully renovated house combines authentic character with modern comfort and offers a mix of contemporary finishes and natural materials. Set at the top of the village, the property enjoys spectacular panoramic views and a peaceful setting, all while being just steps from a great selection of restaurants, cafés, shops, and local vineyards. A historic village house, entirely remodeled to offer a luxurious standard of modern living.

The ground floor comprises: characterful vaulted entrance hall; two beautiful caves carved into the rock, offering a unique atmosphere - currently used as a sitting room and a game room; luxurious hammam; lovely library; loo; utility room; technical room.

The first floor is composed of: principal suite with a private bathroom and terrace; two bedrooms, each with its own en suite shower room and charming private terrace; loo.

The second floor accommodates: bright kitchen with a fireplace, opening onto a dining room, a spacious living room, and a TV room – creating a stunning ensemble, extended by a vast panoramic terrace; loo.

The third floor comprises two elegant bedrooms and an office, bathed in light thanks to large windows opening onto the view, beneath a beautiful high ceiling.

Outside, several terraces offer exceptional views over the Luberon, the Monts de Vaucluse, Mont Ventoux, the citadel of Ménerbes, and the Cévennes. 
This space is ideal for al fresco dining thanks to easy access to the kitchen.

Below, the 5m x 2m swimming pool – a rare asset in the heart of the village – blends seamlessly into the landscape, highlighted by porcelain stoneware tiling. 

Amenities include: electric heating and underfloor heating on the ground floor; double glazing; mains drainage; mains water; fibre optic internet; electric shutter for the pool.

Perfectly located, the house offers several bedrooms with independent access, creating a beautiful ensemble ideal for hosting guests. With its high-quality renovations, great volumes, prime location, and breathtaking views, it provides fabulous living, in the centre of the village of Ménerbes.
summary: Alluring village house with pool and spectacular views.

title: V3022 MAUBEC
body:
Nestled at the foot of the Luberon, this magnificent 18th-century magnanerie offers an exceptional living space of 600 m², harmoniously combining the charm of the past with modern comfort. Located on the edge of a village, it guarantees perfect tranquility without being isolated. A majestic cypress-lined driveway leads to the property, announcing the unique character of this exceptional place.

Main Residence  
This property exudes remarkable authenticity with its French ceilings, exposed wooden beams, and period stonework, giving each room a unique character.

Ground Floor: A large entrance hall, a vast living/dining room of 80 m² featuring a monumental fireplace, a bright kitchen opening onto a terrace for outdoor dining, a utility room, a laundry room, a gym/games room, and a wine cellar.

South Wing: A spacious 50 m² independent suite with an en-suite bathroom, benefiting from direct access to the gardens and inner courtyard.

West Wing: An entrance hall, two storage rooms, an orangery, and a charming attic space comprising a bedroom and an en-suite bathroom, ideal for children with its reduced ceiling height.

First Floor: A sumptuous 65 m² master suite with an adjoining bathroom/shower and dressing room, as well as three additional bedrooms and two shower rooms.

Outdoors  
The Mediterranean-style landscaped gardens offer an enchanting setting with mature trees, dry stone walls, and a charming inner courtyard. The 11x6 m swimming pool, framed by authentic stone walls, has recently been renovated with a high-quality liner and features a salt treatment system and automatic pH control for easy management. Shaded terraces invite relaxation or outdoor dining.

Amenities and Features  
- Two covered carports  
- A storage area for garden tools  
- Two wells and an authentic stone fountain  
- Fiber optic, automated gate, outdoor lighting with motion detectors

Comfort & Technical Aspects  
- Hybrid heating with thermal exchanger & gas boiler  
- Reversible air conditioning in the master suite  
- Ceiling fans in three bedrooms  
- Four fireplaces, including a large Castellas fireplace with heat recovery  
- Double glazing in main rooms  

Location  
This exceptional property is just a few minutes’ walk from the village, offering easy access to local amenities while benefiting from a peaceful and privileged setting. Combining Provençal charm, elegance, and modern comfort, this rare home is a unique opportunity in the heart of the Luberon.
summary: Elegant 18th Century Provençal Estate with Breathtaking Views of the Luberon.

title: V2759 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
Set in the heart of the picturesque Luberon village of Cabrières-d’Avignon, this impressive 18th century property offers the unique opportunity to own an established restaurant and bed & breakfast. Benefitting from a rich heritage and a privileged location, the property offers a wealth of character and has been the subject of a superb renovation project that has instilled elegance and grandeur throughout.

Restaurant

The entrance hall flows through to an elegant Bistrot-style dining room featuring an ornate bar, natural oak parquet, decorative panelling and a refreshingly contemporary palette - creating an exceptional dining experience for guests. The 61 sqm dining room has 32 covers and is air-conditioned. The restaurant comprises well-equipped professional kitchens, a cold storeroom and guest toilets. 

A covered dining terrace serves as an extension of the dining hall, with oversized opening to create a seamless transition from interior to exterior. The covered terrace offers an additional 12 covers. A superb courtyard dining area lies just beyond, adorned with wrought-iron pergolas grown with climbing plants to provide shade and an intimate setting for guests. The courtyard is equipped with a bar and offers a total of 44 covers.

Accommodation

The main building comprises, on the first floor: beautifully proportioned suite with a private terrace and an adjoining shower room; two grand suites, each with an adjoining shower room and toilet. 

The second floor is composed of: spacious suite with a private sitting room and terrace, and a bathroom fitted with a shower; family suite comprising two adjoining double bedrooms, with magnificent Luberon views, and an adjoining shower room. All the bedrooms are air-conditioned.

An independently accessed part of the property offers an additional four suites, each with an adjoining modern shower room. The property also enjoys an independent studio comprising a sitting room, a kitchen, a double bedroom and a contemporary shower room.

Located in the heart of the stunningly beautiful Luberon valley, the authentic village of Cabrières-d’Avignon is set amongst manicured vineyards and close to the ever-desirable villages of Gordes, Ménerbes, Goult, Roussillon and l’Isle-sur-la-Sorgue. A unique investment opportunity in superb part of Provence.
summary: Restaurant with rooms in the heart of the Luberon.

title: V3020 GORDES
body:
This single-storey stone property, offering extraordinary, breathtaking views of the Luberon, is located in a charming setting just minutes from the world-renowned village of Gordes. Completely renovated in 2005, it combines modern convenience with Provençal character.

The home consists of two wings. The first wing comprises: a sumptuous 50 m2 living/dining room with an elegant stone fireplace, and doors opening out to the terrace; bespoke kitchen fitted with brand-new appliances and granite work surfaces; two bedrooms with ensuite bathrooms; utility room; guest WC.

A handsome library and study area lead down a few steps to the second wing which comprises: additional sitting room; two bedrooms with ensuite bathrooms.

For wine enthusiasts, the basement houses a smart 12m2 wine cellar, lined with wrought iron shelving to house hundreds of bottles of wine as well as the olive oil produced by the property’s own olive trees.

The property is accessed through automatic gates, leading to a spacious parking area. The impeccably maintained grounds on over two acres of land are equally impressive, with a 40 m2 double garage, an equipment room and storeroom, and a pool house. 75 olive trees and a borie (dry-stone shepherd’s hut) complete the Provençal idyll. A 33m covered terrace runs the length of the house, providing plenty of shade for enjoying the long warm days outside. The 11m x 5m salt-water pool enjoys the same superb views as the house, making it a perfect spot for relaxation, complemented by the summer kitchen. The property’s magnificent sunsets are the jewel in its crown. 

Amenities include: fully-equipped kitchen; underfloor heating; fireplace; mains water; double glazing; alarm system; basement with wine cellar.

This property enjoys an exceptional location, providing easy access to the heart of the village via a walking path leading directly from the property. Gordes was recently awarded the accolade of one of the most beautiful villages in the world. Whether you're seeking a family home, a luxurious holiday retreat, or an excellent rental investment, this outstanding contemporary property offers it all.
summary: Gordes stone property with Luberon views, olive grove and pool.

title: V2972 GORDES
body:
This contemporary stone property offers breathtaking panoramic views of the Luberon and is conveniently located within walking distance of the world-renowned village of Gordes.

On the ground floor, the home opens with a grand 30m² entrance hall, boasting cathedral ceilings and an impressive floor-to-ceiling window over 4.5 meters tall. The vast sitting room seamlessly connects to the terrace, where you can take in the spectacular vistas. The exceptional bespoke kitchen is fitted with top-of-the-range integrated appliances and complemented by a fully equipped back kitchen, making it ideal for entertaining. The dining room enjoys direct access to the terrace and gardens, while a guest WC adds to the convenience.

Also on the ground floor is a generous 40m² master suite, complete with two separate dressing rooms, direct access to a private terrace, and a spacious bathroom.

An elegant staircase leads to the first floor, where two bedrooms are accompanied by a family bathroom and a separate WC. The second bedroom features a south-facing balcony, offering fabulous views over the stunning landscape.

The property is accessed through automatic gates, leading to a spacious parking area. The grounds are equally impressive, with a garage measuring over 40m², a workshop, and a pool house. The 12x6 meter swimming pool enjoys the same superb views as the house, making it a perfect spot for relaxation.

Features & Equipment
- Bubendorff electric shutters
- Underfloor heating
- Wood burner
- Town water and mains drainage
- Aluminium double glazing
- Alarm system

This property enjoys an exceptional location, providing easy access to the heart of Gordes, recently awarded the accolade of one of the most beautiful villages in the world. Whether you're seeking a family home, a luxurious holiday retreat, or an excellent rental investment, this outstanding contemporary property offers it all.
summary: Authentic stone property with contemporary interior and breathtaking views.

title: V2964 SAIGNON
body:
Nestled on over 12 acres of beautifully landscaped grounds, this 18th-century farmhouse has been the subject of a masterful renovation, subtly blending traditional Provençal charm and modern conveniences. Superb views of the surrounding lavender fields, private woodland, rolling fields and dramatic valley landscapes can be enjoyed throughout. The property comprises a handsome stone farmhouse, an 'orangery' guest house, an independent guest suite and a 140m2 garage.

The accommodation, on the ground floor, comprises: entrance hall; majestic 56m2 sitting room, with double height ceilings, exposed stone walls and an oversized window providing the perfect viewpoint over the Luberon valley below; perfectly chic kitchen, equipped with a Lacanche stove, opening onto the dining room. 

The garden level of the farmhouse is composed of: master suite with walk-in dressing room, bathroom, and adjoining loo; utility room; guest loo.
 
All of these spaces benefit from direct access to the garden and the courtyard, offering the choice of a variety of dining and seating terraces. The property has been renovated with the utmost taste, superb contemporary panache, and excellent choice of natural materials.

The first floor accommodates two additional suites, each with its own private shower room.

The 'orangery' guest house offers complete privacy and independence for guests, and accommodates: open-plan kitchen and sitting room, drenched in natural light by oversized wrought-iron French doors; spacious bedroom with an en suite shower room. The kitchen features an authentic, and fully functional bread (or pizza) oven.

The farmhouse and the 'orangery' stand around a lovely central courtyard, adorned with a stone fountain. Wonderfully landscaped gardens, grounds and private woodland extend in every direction, ensuring privacy and complete quietude. A heated swimming pool, 11m x 5m with a submerged cover and large terraced area, blends seamlessly into the environment, offering the perfect spot to relax and take in the surrounding scenery. The property also boasts a large 140m2 garage.

Amenities include: underfloor heating and cooling; air conditioning in the bedrooms; mains water; water softener; automatic watering; double glazing; alarm; fibre optic internet; septic tank that conforms to current regulations.

With its bright spaces, sumptuous décor, beautifully landscaped gardens, and breathtaking views, this exceptional property redefines Provençal living, rich in character and brimming with style.
summary: Gorgeously renovated 18th-century farmhouse, with 12 acres of grounds.

title: V3049 GOULT
body:
Located just a few steps from the vibrant heart of Goult – with its shops, cafés, bars and restaurants – this gorgeous 17th-century village house (dated 1699) boasts an imposing stone façade and particularly refined and timeless décor. With sweeping views across the Luberon valley and towards the Monts de Vaucluse, beautifully landscaped gardens, and remarkable privacy despite its central location, the property offers an exceptional setting in one of the region’s most sought-after villages.

The ground floor is composed of: entrance hall; elegant sitting room centred on a handsome stone fireplace; spacious and bright kitchen featuring bespoke Fabre cabinetry and an adjoining dining area. The living spaces open onto a charming terrace overlooking the garden and its stone fountain – ideal for outdoor dining and entertaining. The kitchen also opens out to an east-facing terrace, adorned with sculpted boxwood and white rose bushes, with steps descending to the swimming pool. An additional raised terrace, accessed directly from the kitchen, commands far-reaching views of the valley below.

The upper floors comprise: beautiful principal suite with spacious double bedroom, walk-in wardrobe, and bathroom fitted with a freestanding bath and walk-in shower (with Fabre cabinets); second suite (currently used as a sitting room) with adjoining office space and private shower room; third suite with cosy TV lounge and adjoining shower room.

The lower level offers: vaulted utility room (with access to the parking area); food cellar; charming vaulted wine cellar and tasting room.

The gardens extend over 840m² (0.2 acres) and are divided into distinct, beautifully landscaped spaces. A lush, lawned garden to the north is adorned with an ornate stone fountain and bordered by traditional dry-stone walls. This space benefits from lovely views of the village château and is complemented by a shaded dining terrace beneath a vine-draped pergola. Stone steps lead to a raised terrace offering an utterly staggering panorama of the Luberon valley, shaded by a tall hackberry tree. The swimming pool – a striking bassin-style pool built seamlessly into the rock – enjoys a tranquil setting and blends wonderfully with the landscape.

Amenities include: air-conditioning throughout; double glazing; mains water and drainage; fibre-optic internet; automatic watering system. The property enjoys private parking fitted with a carport.

This property exudes innate charm and character, with natural materials, generous volumes, and fantastic views throughout. A wonderfully private and elegant Luberon retreat, nestled in one of the most prized villages that the valley has to offer.
summary: Elegant 17th-century village house with breathtaking views in the heart of Goult.

title: V3060 ROUSSILLON
body:
In a bucolic setting on the edge of a peaceful hamlet just a few kilometres from the sought-after village of Roussillon, this superb stone bastide embodies all the authentic charm of the Luberon. Offering a breathtaking panorama over Gordes, Joucas and the gentle hills of the Luberon, the property enjoys an exceptionally beautiful environment where the tranquillity of nature blends seamlessly with the magic of Provençal landscapes. Surrounded by a magnificent landscaped plot covering more than an acre, the property stands out with its handsome historic façade, generous volumes, and warm, elegant atmosphere. The whole exudes a timeless quality while offering excellent modern comfort.

The ground floor comprises: a spacious open-plan living area with kitchen and dining room; a bright sitting room with fireplace opening onto a panoramic terrace with stunning views; a utility room; and guest WC.

On the first floor: two double bedrooms; an office (or small additional bedroom); a bathroom with cast-iron bathtub and shower; separate WC; and a large billiards room with independent access.

The second floor includes: three further double bedrooms, a single bedroom, and a shower room with WC.

Outside, a beautifully landscaped and flower-filled garden wraps around the house, enhanced by multiple terraces, a pétanque court, a garden shed, and a lovely 12m x 6m heated swimming pool with an integrated roller cover. Bordered by mature trees and natural hedges, the garden offers both sunny and shaded corners to fully enjoy the Provençal way of life — all while taking in superb views of the surrounding rolling countryside.

The property also includes a charming independent studio, ideal for use as a home office, guest accommodation or creative space. A wine cellar is located just below.

Amenities include: reversible air conditioning; carport; alarm system; automatic irrigation; mains water and water from the Canal de Provence; fibre-optic internet.

The house has recently undergone a careful and high-quality renovation.

This exceptional property combines historic character, quality features, and an enchanting setting. It will appeal equally to families seeking a primary or secondary residence and to investors looking for a property with strong seasonal rental potential.
summary: Superb stone bastide with heated pool and breathtaking views.

title: V2970 TAILLADES
body:
This wonderfully chic 18th-century farmhouse has been meticulously restored to the highest standard, offering an excellent balance of innate charm and modern luxury. Set amidst beautifully landscaped gardens and grounds, the property enjoys a breathtaking backdrop of the Luberon mountains.

Designed for modern living and entertaining, the ground floor features a spacious open-plan sitting and dining area with two wood-burning stoves, flowing seamlessly into the bespoke Fabre kitchen. The living spaces open directly onto covered terraces and the gardens, perfectly suited to indoor-outdoor living. The ground floor also includes: second sitting room, adorned with elegant wrought-iron doors; lovely covered terrace ideal for leisurely breakfasts; well-appointed utility room; access to the wine cellar. The entire ground floor benefits from underfloor heating and cooling, and air conditioning.

Adjoining the main house through a large office space is a fully air-conditioned gym and workshop with shower and separate WC, ensuring both comfort and practicality.

The first floor comprises a luxurious principal suite with a sleek en suite bathroom; two spacious double bedrooms; large family bathroom; separate WC; dressing room. All bedrooms are air conditioned.

The property also includes a fully self-contained guest house, ideal for accommodating friends or generating rental income. This annex features an open-plan kitchen and living area opening onto a private terrace, and two air-conditioned bedrooms, each with its own en suite shower room.

The outdoor areas are as carefully designed as the interiors. The south-facing dining terrace, shaded by a pergola draped in wisteria, offers an idyllic setting for outdoor dining. Nearby, a covered terrace with a summer kitchen and built-in barbecue provides the perfect spot for outdoor entertaining. The property also features a tennis court with excellent views and a heated free-form swimming pool with water features.

The estate’s extensive grounds include olive groves with more than 450 trees, a carp lake, and a pétanque court. The gardens are watered by  a private well and canal water, ensuring lush greenery throughout the year.

Following a recent and significant renovation, the property is equipped with every modern amenity: underfloor heating and cooling; new roof and insulation; double-glazed aluminium doors and windows; air conditioning; fibre-optic internet. The house and grounds are fully alarmed, fenced, and equipped with automatic gates and a videophone.

Ideally situated at the gateway to the Luberon, the property is within easy reach of the picturesque town of L’Isle-sur-la-Sorgue and the charming villages of Gordes, Oppède-le-Vieux, and Goult. Whether you are looking for a comfortable and spacious family home  or opulent second home, this exceptional property offers an unrivalled Provençal lifestyle in one of southern France’s most sought-after settings.
summary: Superbly renovated farmhouse with tennis court, guest house and Luberon views.

title: V3029 GORDES
body:
This stunning property enjoys a privileged position, just a pleasant 10-minute stroll from the historic centre of Gordes. The construction is of the highest quality, carried out by carefully selected local artisans with meticulous attention to detail. Modern comfort is seamlessly blended with reclaimed materials, creating an idyllic setting perfectly suited to contemporary living.
A newly installed heat exchanger powers the underfloor heating and cooling system, with additional air conditioning in the bedrooms—ensuring efficient and consistent climate control throughout the property.

A spacious entrance hall leads into the impressive 100 m² open-plan area, which flows effortlessly towards the sun-drenched pool terrace, the inviting covered outdoor living space, or the tranquil olive grove. This expansive area includes a kitchen, dining area, and sitting room with traditional open-fireplace, while the library/games room is adorned with a striking high vaulted ceiling, adding an extra layer of charm. The ground floor also features a spacious ensuite bedroom, which boasts independent access to the south-facing terrace, offering both privacy and practicality with easy access to the gardens and grounds.

The first floor offers two additional suites and a well-appointed office, all featuring generous proportions and elegant décor that reflects the refined character of the property.

The timeless natural stone Dordogne floors, reclaimed wooden beams, and elegant French ceilings are just a few of the exquisite features that contribute to the exceptional atmosphere of this outstanding property.
summary: Elegant Stone Property with Swimming Pool and Olive Grove.

title: V2569 OPPEDE
body:
Nestled in the heart of the Luberon countryside and surrounded by vineyards, this superb hamlet house provides lovely views, a serene garden and a recently remodelled interior that has instilled elegance and panache throughout. The property is located just several kilometres from the desirable villages of Oppède and Ménerbes.

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: entrance hall with guest loo; beautiful sitting room with large arched French doors that open into the courtyard; adjoining dining room, flooded with light by French windows; sleek modern kitchen with ceramic worktops and a breakfast table and larder, with wrought-iron French doors granting access to the outdoor dining terrace; secondary sitting room currently used as a music room, adorned with an ornate fireplace; authentic wine cellar.
