An additional entrance hall allows two of the bedrooms to be accessed independently from the main house.

The first-floor master suite is composed of two large adjoining bedrooms, with one currently serving as an office/sitting room, a modern shower room with loo and laundry facilities and walk-in cupboard. This fabulous suite is air-conditioned and enjoys pretty Luberon views. The first floor is also comprised of: sitting room; double bedroom with shower room and loo; air-conditioned mezzanine bedroom with private shower room and loo.

The second floor is composed of: double bedroom with a shower room, bath, and loo; family suite offering two adjoining double bedrooms complete with a shower room and loo. All the second-floor bedrooms are air-conditioned. 

The house is positioned around a central courtyard. A manicured garden beyond accommodates a 10m x 5m swimming pool with a surrounding stone paved terrace and lush lawn. A stunning view of the Luberon mountain and surrounding vineyards can be enjoyed from the garden and pool and complete privacy is ensured by mature foliage and a magnificent Cedar of Lebanon. An annexe in the garden has been fitted with a summer kitchen with an adjoining covered terrace. Additional amenities include a 1-car garage, two separate annexes providing additional storage, a loo, and an outdoor shower.

The meticulous and chic renovation project has breathed new life in to the property whilst retaining the abundance of innate character that this authentic Provençal farmhouse has to offer.
summary: Elegant Luberon property with stunning views.

title: V3114 GORDES
body:
Just a few minutes by car from the centre of the renowned village of Gordes, this contemporary property offers an exceptional lifestyle with its generous volumes, high-end amenities and refined décor. Both elegant and comfortable, this is a sophisticated house, remarkable for the natural light that pours through it and the high quality of its building materials. The spectacular views from the bedrooms and the one-of-a-kind terrace, as well as the careful choice of the finishes and furnishings, will entice any buyer seeking a well-designed contemporary property.

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: impressive living area (sitting room with adjacent dining room), bathed in light from the generous French windows; mezzanine with impressive high ceilings giving a fabulous sense of space. The stone floor and neutral tones are warmly accented with contemporary colours. A modern kitchen with spacious utility room, and a separate bedroom suite with independent laundry room complete this floor.

The first floor is composed of: generously proportioned principal bedroom with en suite bathroom and private terrace – affording stunning panoramic views – and two dressing rooms; mezzanine office overlooking the living area; two further bedrooms, one of which has a terrace; family bathroom; separate WC.

The beautifully laid-out garden has been designed with relaxation and conviviality in mind. The heated 11m x 3.5m pool has a wide stone surround. A covered terrace extends the interior living space to enjoy indoor/outdoor living year-round; a summer kitchen and outdoor shower room complete the picture. Thanks to the under-floor heating already installed, this terrace could be closed-in and converted to become an additional room.

Amenities include: heating with heat pump; thermodynamic water heater; aluminium window and door frames; water softener; alarm; town water and automatic watering system using well water; fibre optic internet. The property also has a large carport and garage (heating system installed here) with storage for garden tools.

Nestled in an unspoiled, peaceful location, this contemporary house presents a rare opportunity to enjoy an elegant yet smooth-running lifestyle. Absolutely turnkey, it is perfect for family life and welcoming guests to share the joys of modern living in the Luberon.
summary: Contemporary stone house with pool and fabulous terraces in Gordes.

title: V3079 GOULT
body:
Set amongst picturesque oak woodland and gorgeous natural scenery, this tastefully remodelled two-acre property is located in the heart of the Golden Triangle, close to the sought-after village of Goult. Spacious and cleverly re-imagined for modern living, the property is composed of a large main house and an independently accessed gite for guests. With its sun-drenched living area and oversized picture windows offering far-reaching views, this property enjoys absolute privacy, comfort and style – a fantastic Luberon retreat.

The ground floor is composed of: spacious sitting room with double-height ceilings, exposed beams and a fireplace, with sliding doors opening out onto the terrace and offering unobstructed Luberon views; large contemporary kitchen with island unit, Brazilian granite countertops, and views as far as the eye can see. This floor further comprises: office (which could serve as a bedroom); principal suite bedroom with built-in cupboards and French windows opening onto the terrace; bathroom with bathtub and rainfall shower; guest WC.

The first floor comprises: two double bedrooms, one of which is fitted with built-in cupboards; family bathroom with shower and double vanity; WC.

Set below the main accommodation, the gite is composed of: generous living space incorporating a kitchen with a La Cornue gas range, a sitting area arranged around the fireplace, and a dining area; double bedroom with arched French windows leading out to the lower terrace; shower room with washing machine; separate WC; wine cellar; technical room.

Set in nearly two acres of landscaped grounds, the property offers a typical Provencal dry garden, home to a wide variety of native flowering plants, shrubs, trees and herbs, and surrounded by mature woodland. Meandering paths lead through the gardens, with a series of shaded seating areas and dining terraces offering spots to relax, unwind and enjoy the peaceful surroundings. At the heart of the garden lies a 10m x 5m salt-water swimming pool, framed by a wide stone terrace with plenty of space for sun loungers.

The property also benefits from an air-conditioned workshop (ideal for creative use, or as an office for remote working), as well as a large garage.

Amenities include: heat pump central heating; air conditioning in the living space; photovoltaic solar panels; mains water; Canal de Provence water (with contract) for the garden; double glazing; electric gates with intercom; fibre optic internet; spacious garage with specialised socket for electric car charging and a carport for additional parking.

Nestled in the heart of the Luberon, this property combines the authentic charm of Provence with all the comforts of modern living. It would be perfect as a comfortable family home, a peaceful holiday retreat, or a lucrative rental investment. Ideally situated just minutes from Goult, Gordes, and the most picturesque villages of the Golden Triangle, this is a rare opportunity.
summary: Wonderfully private stone property with superb views in the countryside of Goult.

title: V3046 ST SATURNIN LES APT
body:
Perched above the village of Saint-Saturnin-lès-Apt, in the heart of unspoilt oak woodland, this contemporary property enjoys spectacular, panoramic views over the village, the Alpilles and the Mourre Nègre. Every element of this property has been thoughtfully conceived to complement its exceptional location. The house also offers superb volumes, bathed in light, where the elegance of contemporary style blends perfectly with the Provencal environment.

The single-storey property: spacious and bright living space combining kitchen, dining room and sitting room in a seamless flow, enhanced by large bay windows opening onto the terrace with stunning views; principal suite with walk-in shower room, WC, dressing room and laundry room; two additional bedrooms - one with en suite bathroom, the other with adjoining shower room and WC; fourth bedroom, currently used as an office; guest WC; utility room; large garage; cellar.

Outdoors, the Mediterranean garden, generously planted with local species - lavender, olive trees and typical garrigue flora - blends naturally into the surrounding unspoilt and profoundly authentic Provençal landscape. The main terrace, equipped with an electric awning, overlooks a breathtaking view. An 11m x 5m tiled swimming pool blends elegantly into the landscape, while at the rear of the house, a more intimate courtyard space would be perfect for a vegetable garden.

Amenities include: double-flow ventilation with heating and cooling function - heat pump; triple glazing; water softener; alarm; septic tank - conform to regulation; fibre optic internet; electrical charging station. Thanks to the careful design of its openings (windows and shutters) and its optimized insulation, the house comes as close as possible to meeting passive house standards.

Just a stone's throw from the village, accessible via a charming walking path , this property combines fabulous natural surroundings, meticulous finishings, quality features and spectacular views. A house where every detail has been carefully considered to honour the beauty of its setting.
summary: Exceptional property with panoramic views, in the heart of the Provençal garrigue.

title: V3078 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
Located in the very heart of the picturesque village of Cabrières-d’Avignon, in the Luberon, this attractive 18th-century property offers a wealth of character and traditional Provençal charm. Behind its handsome stone façade lies a property of generous scale, offering bright, well-proportioned rooms, several private terraces and a large courtyard. Formerly used for commercial purposes, it now presents an exceptional opportunity to create a spacious, comfortable and wonderfully authentic  village home. Though some reconfiguration and upgrades will be required, the potential is outstanding, and houses of this size, proportion and stature are rarely available in the village.

The ground floor is composed of: elegant drawing room with decorative mouldings and beautiful oak parquet flooring that brings warmth to this space; living space lined with wrought-iron French windows opening to the courtyard - an ideal future kitchen; professional kitchen with adjoining cold room; guest WC. The large volumes, and flexible layout ensure that the property would be well suited as a family home, a large Luberon retreat, or a lucrative seasonal rental investment.

The first floor provides three generous suites, each with its own shower room and WC - one also benefits from a lovely private roof terrace.

The second floor offers two further suites. The first comprises a large bedroom with a private sitting area, a roof terrace, and a bathroom with bathtub and shower. The second, a duplex, includes a bedroom and shower room, with an internal staircase rising to a study (or private salon) set beneath wide windows that frame incredible views of the Luberon valley.

The courtyard affords a generous outdoor living area, currently fitted with pergolas draped with vines, a summer kitchen and a fountain. The space could accommodate a swimming pool or bassin - an inviting and quiet setting.

Works and imagination would be required to needed to unleash the property’s full potential, but the combination of gorgeous original features, excellent ceiling heights and a prime position in the heart of a sought-after Luberon village ensures that this property will stand out. Cabrières-d’Avignon is an authentic village surrounded by vineyards and protected landscapes, moments from Gordes, Ménerbes, Goult, Roussillon and L’Isle-sur-la-Sorgue - one of Provence’s most desirable locations.

Please note: the photos shown are virtual staging proposals intended to help visualise the property’s potential. Please contact us for further information.
summary: Village house with terrific potential, with courtyard garden, rooftop terraces and fantastic volumes.

title: V3113 VENASQUE
body:
Facing the cliffs of Saint-Pierre and on the edge of the village of Venasque, this ultra-modern stone property offers a true haven of peace and relaxation, enhanced by panoramic south-west views, expansive terraces with a heated swimming pool, and a beautifully landscaped Japanese-inspired garden. The house is accessed via a charming footbridge leading to a partially covered wooden terrace, ideal for hosting or relaxing in the shade, with the pool and a centennial olive tree as a striking focal point.

Set on a landscaped plot of 3,794 m², the property offers approximately 200 m² of living space arranged over three levels, thoughtfully designed to maximize light, views, and privacy.

The ground floor features: fully equipped kitchen; adjoining pantry; sitting room opening onto balcony that captures uninterrupted views over the surrounding countryside; WC. Large sliding bay windows allow natural light to flood the interior and frame the scenery throughout the day.

The upper floor includes: principal bedroom suite accessed via striking iron and glass staircase with built-in wardrobe and private balcony overlooking the cliffs of Saint-Pierre; spacious bathroom fitted with double sinks and generous walk-in shower. 

The garden level comprises: large bedroom suite with direct access to private terrace whose bathroom includes bathtub, walk-in shower and double sinks; two additional bedrooms with en suite bathrooms and shared access to separate terrace; laundry room; utility room; extensive linen storage room.

The exterior spaces are carefully maintained and designed with a subtle Japanese influence, enhanced by clean lines, terraces at varying levels, and mature oak trees. The 9m x 4.5m heated swimming pool integrates perfectly into the setting, offering both privacy and open views.

Amenities include: double-glazed windows; reversible air-conditioning throughout; two hot water heaters; automatic irrigation; mains water; Starlink internet; electric gate.

Located in the countryside of Venasque, yet within a 15-minute walk of the village, this contemporary stone home combines architectural elegance, modern amenities, and a rare natural setting in one of Provence’s most beautiful villages. Its elevated position, thoughtful layout, and seamless connection between interior and exterior spaces make it an ideal primary residence or refined second home.
summary: Contemporary stone house with panoramic views, pool, and terraces in the Venasque countryside.

title: V3105 PERNES LES FONTAINES
body:
Ideally located at the gateway to both Mont Ventoux and the Luberon, this spacious modern property enjoys easy access to the medieval town of Pernes-les-Fontaines, within walking distances of its renowned restaurants, shops, and wide range of amenities. Offering all modern comforts and sleek contemporary finishes, the property also benefits from a gorgeous garden with exotic plantings and traditional pine woodland, and a terrific variety of outdoor living areas. The accommodation comprises a spacious main house with an independent guest wing, together with a separate three-bedroom gîte – ensuring strong potential for seasonal rental income.

The main house opens onto a vast open-plan space combining sitting room, dining area, and sleek contemporary kitchen. Large picture windows overlook the garden, and wide terraces adorned with a pergola draped in jasmine provide a wonderful setting for outdoor dining. Four spacious bedroom suites, arranged on either side of the living space, each with a private terrace and adjoining bathroom, offer an excellent level of comfort and style.

The west wing of the property, accessible via the outdoor walkway, faces the garden and the 12m x 4.5m swimming pool. It comprises a covered terrace with a fantastic living area for dining and relaxing in the shade, a kitchen and bar, as well as two adjoining suites with particularly generous volumes.

Located to the rear of the main house, the property's gîte benefits from a separate gated entrance and complete independence for guests or staff. On the ground floor, the gîte comprises: private terrace; entrance hall; living space composed of a sitting room and dining room; and a kitchen. A bedroom with ensuite bathroom and separate WC completes this floor. The first floor comprises: a large terrace; two additional bedrooms; and a bathroom with WC.

The carefully landscaped garden blends local pine trees with large exotic wooden planters, jasmine, pomegranate, and olive trees, offering a varied outdoor setting with poolside areas, lawn, and pétanque court.

Amenities include: reversible air conditioning; two electric gates; double glazing; mains and canal water supply; automatic irrigation system; electric vehicle charging point; parking; Starlink internet; laundry room; and storage areas.

This exceptional property harmoniously combines comfort and functionality in a stunning natural setting, with most of the accommodation arranged on a single level. Its layout with several independent spaces, numerous bedrooms with private terraces, and extensive facilities – from the pool house to the summer kitchen – make it ideal for seasonal rentals, large families, or any buyer seeking generous living space.
summary: Contemporary villa property with lovely wooded surroundings, within walking distance of Pernes-les-Fontaines.

title: V3132 TAILLADES
body:
Ideally situated on the edge of the Luberon village of Taillades, this traditional farmhouse mas offers lovely authentic features, bright living spaces and lush gardens.

The farmhouse sits at the centre of the plot, surrounded by mature trees and landscaped grounds. The ground floor comprises: spacious sitting room with handsome stone fireplace, exposed stone walls and original beams; large dining room; secondary dining area with wide arched doors; generous kitchen equipped with a Lacanche cooker, opening onto the exterior through beautiful wrought-iron French doors, creating a seamless transition between the interior and the garden; two double bedrooms, each fitted with an en suite shower room. The ground floor also accommodates: utility room; storage room/cellar; fitness room; guest WC.

The first floor comprises four additional bedrooms, all with en suite shower rooms, including two bedrooms with independent access to the garden, offering excellent flexibility.

The property also benefits from an independent suite, located in the garden, ideally positioned to accommodate guests.

The pool area provides a particularly inviting setting in which to relax and enjoy the Provençal climate, thoughtfully arranged with a series of stone terraces. A large covered terrace hosts a pizza oven and summer kitchen, while a shaded gazebo overlooks the tiled and heated swimming pool measuring 12m x 6m.

Amenities include: underfloor heating and cooling via heat pump on the ground floor; reversible air conditioning throughout; garage; mains water; Canal de Provence water; private borehole.

This character mas offers a rare opportunity to enjoy a preserved natural environment while remaining within immediate proximity of the centre of the village of Taillades. Just minutes from the perched villages of the Luberon, L’Isle-sur-la-Sorgue, Avignon airport and the TGV station, it represents an ideal home, whether as a family home or an elegant Provençal retreat.
summary: Stone farmhouse located on the edge of the Luberon village of Taillades.

title: V3101 ROUSSILLON
body:
Close to Roussillon, one of Luberon's most sought-after villages, this spacious property enjoys magnificent unspoiled views of the surrounding countryside in a completely private location. It was designed for ultimate comfort and convenience with a nod to modern features, such as the smartphone-linked security system and solar panels, and traditional finishes, such as the terracotta tiled roof, stone pillars, and travertine floor tiles.

The ground floor comprises: entryway with mirrored storage closets, whose facing windows frame the stunning view outside; relaxation nook with bar and soothing water feature; open-plan sitting-room with magnificent oversized windows reaching to the double-height ceiling, allowing the light to pour in; double-sided fireplace with insert, shared with dining area; fully-equipped kitchen, complete with high-end appliances, whose generous island invites informal entertaining with family and friends; adjacent utility and laundry rooms; guest WC. This living area has multiple access points via sliding doors to the outdoor terrace.

The east wing of the ground floor accommodates: principal suite with lovely views from the French windows, ensuite dressing room, vast ensuite bathroom with corner tub, shower, WC and double vanity. It further comprises: TV and games room; two bedrooms with Jack and Jill shower room featuring double vanity and WC.

An elegant stone staircase leads to the first floor, composed of: guest bedroom opening onto wrap-around balcony; bathroom with tub; separate WC; generous-sized study filling the entire west wing on this floor, with windows on three sides. Both rooms enjoy ample storage space. The guest bedroom and study are connected via the mezzanine, and share the balcony.

The house sits on two acres of fully fenced-in land, of which the eastern side is planted with oaks and other native trees. The land is constructible - perfect for adding a guest cottage, for example. A sweeping driveway lined with cypresses leads you to the main entrance of the house, with ample parking, an outdoor car charging point, three-car garage and additional carport.

The garden is designed for relaxing and fully enjoying Provencal life with its Petanque court, 10m x 5m heated pool, shaded terrace for outdoor dining, and fully-equipped glassed-in summer kitchen with cathedral-style frame. Its adjoining terrace, graced with a jacuzzi, is protected with a bioclimatic pergola. A garden shed, wood store, basement, and wine cellar complete the picture.

There are numerous areas for soaking up the sun, either around the pool or in the pretty garden, whose impeccable lawn is planted with oleanders, palms and olive trees. Beyond the hedged perimeter, a gorgeous verdant vista unfolds towards farmland, rolling hills and Roussillon's iconic ochre cliffs.

Amenities include: underfloor heating and cooling throughout; double glazing; electric blinds; sophisticated solar panels system with batteries for storing excess electricity; mains drains and water; two thermodynamic water heaters; water softener; Canal de Provence water for garden (automatic sprinklers and drip system); alarm; security cameras; electric front gates with visiophone; electric garage door; fibre internet.

This beautifully-designed house is move-in ready, and would make a wonderful family home in the heart of the Luberon. Within easy reach by car of the larger towns of l'Isle-sur-la-Sorgue and Apt, and only an hour from Avignon TGV station and Marseille airport, it is perfectly situated for visiting the area's picturesque perched villages and attractions, making it also ideal as a second home with excellent rental potential if desired.
summary: Light-filled contemporary villa with pool and stunning views in Roussillon.

title: V3076 MENERBES
body:
This superb villa nestles in 1.7 acres of landscaped gardens and grounds. A cypress-lined driveway leads to the property, which combines elegant living spaces with modern comforts. 

The ground floor features a bright living area surrounded by large French windows, bathing the space in light and opening onto a terrace overlooking the Luberon mountains; a well-equipped open-plan kitchen; a master suite with bathtub and walk-in shower; and a guest wc.

The garden level comprises three generous double bedroom suites, each with an adjoining shower room; a utility room; a technical room; and additional storage. Comfort is ensured with underfloor heating on the ground floor and ducted air conditioning in all bedrooms.

The gardens include a heated 8m x 4m swimming pool; a variety of flora including tall cedars, centenary olive trees, and cypresses; and automatic drip irrigation supplied by a deep well that also feeds the pool. The property is fully fenced and accessed via electric gates, with covered parking for three vehicles.

Modern installations include ducted air conditioning, underfloor heating, wood-burning stove, water softener, alarm system, garden and exterior lighting, automatic irrigation, smoke detectors, shutters, pool cover, electric gates, and fibre-optic internet connection.

This contemporary villa makes an exceptional private retreat or an attractive rental investment, offering a prime location, refined interiors, and landscaped gardens with a heated pool in complete privacy. The picturesque village of Ménerbes lies less than a kilometre away, with its choice of restaurants, cafés, bars, and shops.
summary: Elegant villa within walking distance of Ménerbes

title: V3069 OPPEDE
body:
Located in a gorgeous rural setting, with landscaped gardens and unobstructed views of Oppède-le-Vieux and the surrounding Luberon valley, this mid-century bastide-style property combines character, lovely volumes, abundant natural light, and complete privacy. Benefitting from a picturesque Mediterranean garden, a saltwater swimming pool and a self-contained gîte, this 210 m² property offers an ideal retreat in the heart of the Luberon, just a short drive from Coustellet and its shops and weekly market. The villages of Oppède and Maubec are accessible on foot.

The ground floor comprises: large entrance hall with staircase leading up to the first floor and picture windows framing the magnificent valley views; south-facing living space incorporating a sitting room and dining area, complete with fireplace and tall French doors opening onto the dining terrace; kitchen fitted with Fabre units and an adjoining larder/utility room with steps leading down to the cellar. The ground floor also accommodates a self-contained gîte, featuring a double bedroom with wood-burning stove, a kitchen and a shower room. The gîte benefits from its own separate entrance and a covered terrace.

The first floor is composed of: principal suite with an adjoining shower room, double vanity and WC; two further double bedrooms (currently used as an office and an additional sitting room); linen cupboard.

The 3.5-acre grounds have been beautifully landscaped with a great variety of indigenous plants and mature trees, creating a tranquil setting of woodland and Mediterranean plantings. An authentic cabanon ruin adds Provençal charm. A 14.5 m × 3.5 m saltwater swimming pool, fitted with a submerged cover, enjoys a lovely view of the medieval village of Oppède-le-Vieux — which is particularly beautiful when illuminated at night — as well as a far-reaching view of Mont Ventoux. Additional outbuildings include a large atelier with newly installed double-glazed doors, and a tool shed. The surrounding land is protected farmland and natural woodland, ensuring the peace and quiet of the property.

Amenities include: underfloor heating; double glazing (aluminium); fibre-optic internet; alarm system; mains water; automatic garden watering system. The roof has been entirely replaced. The property can be extended if desired.

With its stunning natural setting, mid-century architecture and excellent potential for seasonal rental income, this property offers a lovely Provençal retreat in the Golden Triangle of the Luberon valley.
summary: Rural bastide-style property with salt-water swimming pool and incredible views.

title: V3077 BONNIEUX
body:
Located in the heart of the Luberon valley, this striking Provençal Bastide is surrounded by rolling hills and picturesque woodland yet lies within walking distance of all local amenities. The property enjoys bright living areas, landscaped gardens, superb views of the surrounding valley, and a wonderfully tranquil setting.

Upon entry you are greeted by a grand foyer with double-height ceilings and a traditional staircase adorned with wrought-iron balustrades – complete with a guest WC. The ground floor enjoys panoramic views throughout and comprises: open-plan dining and sitting room with a charming stone fireplace; bright, fully equipped kitchen which opens onto a breakfast terrace for morning sun and boasts an oversized picture window overlooking the valley below; cosy second sitting room with access to a covered terrace; luxurious ground-floor master suite with a contemporary shower room and private living area.

The first floor is composed of: spacious double bedroom suite with adjoining office/sitting area and private bathroom; three further generous double bedrooms, sharing a modern shower room; large linen cupboard already plumbed for an additional bathroom if desired. 

Below, the garden level offers additional accommodation for guests, extended family, or rental income. This floor comprises: lovely office space; living room with kitchen; double bedroom (currently used as a gym) with adjoining shower room; workshop; technical room housing the gas-fired boiler; direct access to the double garage.

The bastide is set within beautifully landscaped gardens, designed for both privacy and year-round enjoyment. Mature trees and established hedges provide utter privacy, while a 12m x 6m swimming pool, complete with an electric safety cover, is set above the bastide, surrounded by a large terrace. A spacious pool house and covered terrace, equipped with a summer kitchen and pizza oven, offers the perfect setting for outdoor dining and entertaining. The pool house is fitted with roller shutters. From the pool area, you can admire both the bastide’s charming façade and the panoramic views across the Luberon valley. The grounds also feature a mature olive grove (producing approximately 25L of olive oil), majestic century-old oak and cedar trees, and a lovely variety of flowering plants, including lavender and oleanders.

Amenities include: gas-fired central heating; mains water; private water source (well); fibre-optic internet; double garage with electric doors; electric gates; automatic watering system; alarm and security cameras.
This exceptional bastide offers the perfect blend of Provençal charm, modern comfort, and breathtaking natural surroundings. Whether as a primary residence, a bucolic holiday retreat, or a lucrative Bed & Breakfast business, the property promises a relaxed, refined lifestyle in one of Provence’s most sought-after settings.

With its spacious interiors, superb outdoor living spaces, and panoramic views, this home is ready to welcome its next chapter.
summary: Elegant provençal bastide in the heart of the Luberon with panoramic views.

title: V3124 TAILLADES
body:
This elegant Provençal farmhouse, with origins dating back to the early 19th century, has been carefully restored, preserving its authentic character while offering generous volumes and modern comfort. Set in the countryside of Les Taillades, this Luberon property enjoys a peaceful rural setting within easy reach of village life, amenities, and the Luberon mountains.

Offering approximately 360m2 of living space and nearly 470m2 of total usable area, the house is arranged to allow both a natural sense of flow and a high degree of independence between living areas, making it ideally suited to family life, hosting guests, or a hospitality project. 

The main entrance opens into a large and welcoming hall with original stone staircase and guest WC, leading to a charming sitting room with fireplace where period features have been carefully preserved. The primary kitchen is complemented by a substantial pantry and utility area housing the boiler room, providing excellent practicality for everyday living or entertaining.

Upstairs, a spacious landing currently used as a games or TV room leads to a comfortable and flexible sleeping arrangement. This floor comprises: principal suite with dressing area and large ensuite bathroom with walk-in shower; two additional suites with adjoining shower rooms; two double bedrooms sharing a shower room; bedroom currently used as dressing room; large attic space. 

A second kitchen and dining room, accessible both independently from the exterior and internally via a secondary staircase, creates a fully autonomous living space, ideal for hosting family or guests in complete privacy or for rental use. Additional ground-floor spaces include a laundry room and cellar. 

The property sits within an enclosed and beautifully maintained garden of approximately .37 acres. A large shaded terrace extends from the house, ideal for outdoor dining, overlooking the heated 11m x 3m swimming pool set within lawned gardens planted with olive trees. The outdoor areas also include an outdoor shower, chicken coop, discreetly positioned pool technical room, WC and enclosed vegetable garden.

Several outbuildings add further value and versatility to the property, including: large garage of approximately 40m2, air-conditioned bureau of 40m2 with independent access and WC, which could easily be converted into a guest studio or small gîte; multiple workshops and storage spaces. Parking is available for several vehicles, with a carport completing the exterior amenities.

Amenities include: double glazing; heated swimming pool; oil-fired central heating; reversible air conditioning in all bedrooms; fiber-optic internet; mains water; private well; automatic irrigation; jacuzzi; electric gate; videophone; electric vehicle charging point; CO₂ water softener.

Ideally located in a calm and natural environment while remaining close to shops, cafés, and restaurants, this character-filled farmhouse offers a rare opportunity to enjoy an authentic yet highly adaptable home in the Luberon.
summary: Sublime Provençal farmhouse sheltered by a landscaped, walled garden at the foothills of the Luberon.

title: V3107 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
This spacious property, consisting of a main house and separate gîte, enjoys a superbly bucolic setting, away from nearby neighbours, within walking distance of the popular village of Cabrières-d’Avignon. Set in the heart of the Luberon’s prized Golden Triangle, this south-facing house opens out to a fabulous patio overlooking the wooded garden. Adjacent to the house is an atelier with running water and electricity.

The ground floor of the main house comprises: lovely light-filled sitting/dining area (56m2) with polished cement floor, exposed wooden beams and two handsome French windows with wrought-iron frames leading out to the patio. A fireplace (with insert) surrounded by wall-to-ceiling bookshelves graces the far end of the sitting room. Adjacent to the living area: office or TV room with built-in cupboards; modern fitted kitchen with stainless steel cabinetry, Zimbabwe granite countertops and high-top breakfast bar; back kitchen/laundry room with water heater and second fridge. 

The east wing offers: principal bedroom with dressing room and ensuite bathroom (bathtub, shower, and vanity all in marble surround, and WC); separate guest WC. 

The west wing consists of two further bedrooms, each with ensuite shower room. Gorgeous solid wood doors, some paned to allow extra light through, are fitted throughout the house, including the bathrooms and cupboards, and are a remarkable feature.

The gîte comprises: sitting room and Provence-themed bedroom on the ground floor; mezzanine floor with shower room (with extra washing-machine) and further bedroom.

The garden is fully secluded, enclosed by walls and fragrant eleagnus hedges. It is planted with native species including green and white oaks, oleanders, olives and lavender, and remains faithful to its Provençal nature. Behind the kitchen is a herb garden, shaded outdoor dining area, plancha and woodstack. The impressive front patio, whose Virginia creeper-covered pergola provides shade for outdoor eating and relaxation, greets you as you arrive at the front door. From here, steps and pathways lead you towards the swimming pool, secured by a recently-installed electric cover. With a stone bench here, a fountain there, grassy areas and leafy hideaways, the garden lends itself superbly to family life, with plentiful places for playing and relaxing (including a wooden playhouse).

Amenities include: ducted A/C throughout the main house; electric radiators in the gîte; double glazing with security glass; mains water; automatic watering system; electric gates with brand-new motor; ample parking on the property.

This spacious and beautifully presented home with its gîte, providing independent additional accommodation, would be ideal either as a family home, a Luberon retreat, or a profitable rental investment. It enjoys peace and quiet, yet is well-situated for visiting the valley’s renowned perched villages, and a convenient hour away by car from Avignon TGV and Marseille airport.
summary: Chic single-storey house with separate gîte, pool and garden.

title: V2895 SAUMANE DE VAUCLUSE
body:
This contemporary stone property, located at the entrance of the Luberon valley, has been recently renovated and benefits from a sumptuous garden, excellent volumes, and high quality materials. The property is composed of a spacious 160m2 house and an adjoining 40m2 garage.

This single-storey property is composed of: bright and spacious open-concept sitting room with a fantastic adjoining kitchen, complete with a large central island and high-end appliances; utility room with ample storage space; cosy home cinema with an adjoining bathroom (this could serve as a fourth bedroom if desired); two spacious double bedrooms that share a bathroom; lavish master suite with an elegant dressing room, and a lovely ensuite bathroom (fitted with a bathtub and a walk-in shower).  

The gardens provide a remarkable setting, shaded by tall pine trees and planted with a fantastic variety of indigenous and exotic flora. A driveway lined with shrubs and aromatic plants leads up to the house. The property enjoys a particularly impressive swimming pool (14m x 4.5m), complete with a large built-in Jacuzzi and a summer kitchen - providing the perfect spot for relaxing and entertaining. 

Amenities include: reversible air conditioning throughout; double glazing; fibre optic internet; videophone; electric gates; alarm system; mains water; water softener; automatic watering system; garage; parking. 

Thanks to its high-quality materials, many amenities, pretty setting, and large open spaces, this lovely stone property epitomises modern luxury.
summary: Freshly remodelled contemporary property with landscaped garden.

title: V3068 LAGNES
body:
This lovely property is a ten minute walk from the village of Lagnes, a lively year-round traditional Luberon village with everything to offer, including: bars and restaurants, a bakery, a hairdresser’s, a pharmacy and doctor’s office. Set in lovely grounds against a breathtaking backdrop of the Vaucluse mountains, the house’s views are unspoilt, whether through the generous French windows or from the terrace and poolside. This house was designed to let the natural sunlight bathe its bright décor and very spacious rooms, and to enjoy life indoors and outdoors, year-round.

The house’s interior is chic, yet a whimsical ode to colour, dedicated to entertaining and relaxing in style. 

The ground floor comprises: attractive entrance hall leading to three adjoining living rooms, one featuring a cosy wood-burning stove, another serving as a TV room; spacious combined kitchen and dining room with exterior doors (39m2); laundry room and storage space which could serve as an additional bedroom or office. A fabulous glass ceilinged sunroom (31m2), flooded with natural light, invites you to relax in any season, whilst a large reception room (90 m2), boasting bar, kitchen and stage, creates a warm and friendly atmosphere, completing this elegant ensemble.

Also on the ground floor: master bedroom with walk-in closet, sink and toilet, and shower/hammam. A second bedroom also features its own shower room with WC, and sink. Switch this and add doors out to pool area framing a superb view.

The first floor accommodates: generous principal suite with walk-in closet, bathroom with tub and double sink. Two other bedrooms with ensuite shower rooms complete this floor, giving complete privacy to each family member.

Outside, the garden extends over more than an acre and presents a choice of areas to find shade or sun to enjoy the clement south of France weather all year round. The heated mosaic-tiled pool, 12m x 5 m, is flanked by a shaded pergola and a tiled surround with plenty of room for sun loungers and an outdoor table for al fresco dining.

Amenities include: reversible air conditioning throughout; double glazing; mains water and Canal de Provence water for the garden; automatic watering system; fibre internet; visiophone; ample private parking.

This unique house ticks all the boxes for buyers seeking a turnkey property in close proximity to the lively market town of L’Isle-sur-la-Sogue, the airport and Avignon TGV station, yet secluded enough to enjoy entertaining family and friends in complete privacy. Equally suited to being a sizeable family home, a second residence, or a lucrative rental in the heart of the Luberon, this gem is not to be missed!
summary: Authentic property with heated pool and gorgeous views; walk to village.

title: V3058 GORDES
body:
This lovely stone property is located a few minutes by car from the centre of the renowned village of Gordes, in a bucolic setting surrounded by trees and fields. The views towards the Luberon and the Alpilles are simply stunning, all to be enjoyed from the terrace, the lavender-scented garden, or the swimming pool. Close to the other iconic Luberon villages of Roussillon, Lacoste, Bonnieux and Ménerbes, this well-maintained property with its typical Provençal garden is a perfect base for exploring the area, and then relaxing over a glass of rosé contemplating the sunset after a day of sight-seeing.

The ground floor is composed of: open-plan sitting and dining area with fireplace, lined with French windows letting the sunlight stream in. The windows lead out to a spacious terrace, shaded with a retractible awning. The light and airy fully-equipped kitchen (including washing-machine) with sit-around island has practical direct access to the parking area. The ground floor also comprises: master bedroom with lovely views from the window and ensuite bathroom with double sink and WC; two spacious bedrooms looking out towards ‘la Colline St Jacques’ and the Alpilles mountain range; family bathroom; TV nook or play area; fourth bedroom.

Downstairs to the garden level: fifth bedroom with ensuite shower room; adjoining living room with large French windows leading out to the terrace.

The garden, which covers nearly two and a half acres, and slopes gently down from the property, is home to an impressive olive grove producing over 100 litres of olive oil. Oleanders and other native plants grace the impeccably maintained grounds, and a stone pathway flanked by fragrant lavender leads you to the saltwater pool, where there is ample room for family and friends to sunbathe on loungers before taking a dip. Around the house, areas are designed for al fresco relaxing and dining in the shade (or in the sun on a bright winter day) – either on the upper or lower terrace, next to the kitchen, or under the canopy of an ancient olive tree.

Amenities include: ducted reversible A/C ground floor; radiators and portable A/C unit on the garden level; all-waters septic tank meeting current regulatory standards; mains water (possibility to be hooked up to the Canal de Provence); ADSL internet; alarm; automatic watering system. Ample parking space. There is a vast crawl space at almost standing height under the house providing plentiful storage and a wine cellar. Garden shed.

This unmissable property is move-in ready. It would serve as a delightful Luberon retreat (less than an hour from Avignon TGV and Marseille airport) or as an investment property for attractive seasonal rental returns.
summary: Stone house with breathtaking views and olive groves.

title: V2928 GORDES
body:
This 19th century property, a former 'Magnanerie' (a silkworm farm), has retained all the charm and authenticity of its era, enhanced by subtle renovations that complement its original features. Located in the heart of a picturesque landscape, it offers stunning views of the Luberon Valley and exudes character.

The ground floor comprises: spacious sitting and dining room, bathed in light; adjacent kitchen; laundry room; large larder; guest loo. The terracotta floors beautifully complement the Provençal ceilings and exposed beams, creating a timelessly elegant atmosphere.

The first floor features two double bedrooms that share a bathroom. 

The second floor accommodates a spacious master suite, comprising a large double bedroom, a second bedroom (that could serve as an office or a dressing room), and a shower room. 

The property also accommodates an independent guest house with two double bedrooms, each with an en suite bathroom.

Outside, the garden extends over 2.3 acres, offering complete privacy. The house opens onto a superb courtyard, adorned with vines and a large covered terrace - creating a haven of serenity. At the edge of the courtyard, beside a majestic century-old olive tree, a 10m by 5m swimming pool stretches out, surrounded by a sun-drenched terrace. This outdoor living space offers utterly enchanting views of the Luberon Valley and the Alpilles mountain rage are revealed in all their splendor. The property also features two perfectly preserved, quintessentially Provencal bories.

Amenities include: electric heating; water from a private well and mains water; mains drainage; ample parking; carport. The property also benefits from numerous storage spaces and tool sheds.

With its generous volumes, lush garden, and spectacular views, this property, close to the shops and restaurants of Gordes, is a true testament of a relaxed Luberon lifestyle.
summary: 19th century farmhouse with perfectly preserved Provencal features.

title: V2930 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
This elegant bastide-style property enjoys a privileged location within walking distance of the popular village of Cabrières-d’Avignon, offering both convenience and a wonderful sense of privacy. The living spaces have been tastefully and carefully remodelled, whilst the south-facing garden has been entirely landscaped, featuring a gorgeous new swimming pool. Far-reaching views of the Luberon mountains can be enjoyed throughout the property.

The ground floor comprises: impressive open-plan living space, including a large sitting room with a stylish suspended fireplace, a generous dining area, and a newly fitted kitchen with peninsula and high-end appliances; double bedroom with adjoining shower room; guest WC; and cloakroom. A further double bedroom with ensuite shower room is accessed independently and opens directly onto the pool area.

The first floor offers: luxurious principal suite with cathedral ceilings, a Juliette balcony overlooking the Luberon, an ensuite bathroom (with walk-in shower and WC), and large fitted cupboards; fourth double bedroom with ensuite shower room and WC; utility room. Both upstairs bedrooms are air-conditioned.

The garden has been thoughtfully landscaped, featuring a variety of native trees and flowering species, and bordered by hedging and fencing to ensure complete privacy. A recently installed 12m x 3,5m heated lap pool with travertine surrounds and submerged cover sits at the heart of the garden, surrounded by lush lawns. Terraces and shaded seating areas flow from the house, encouraging outdoor living throughout the seasons. Despite its position on the edge of the village, the gardens are entirely private and peaceful.

Amenities include: underfloor central heating; air-conditioning in the first-floor bedrooms; wood-framed double glazing; mains water; fibre-optic internet; electric gates; alarm system; well water ; automatic watering system; extensive exterior lighting.

A spacious double garage with electric door and an additional carport provide covered parking for several vehicles. The property is fully enclosed.

This spacious and beautifully presented home offers a rare combination of comfort, privacy and proximity to one of the most picturesque villages in the Luberon.
summary: Elegant bastide-style property with landscaped garden and Luberon views – on the edge of the village.

title: V2674 L'ISLE-SUR-LA-SORGUE
body:
This elegant manor-style property benefits from gorgeous original features, excellent volumes and a wonderfully private one-acre garden. Extensive renovation works have been carried out to modernise it, with great care taken to maintain and preserve the innate grandeur of this traditional Provençal Bastide.

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: entrance hall; newly installed dining kitchen with marble worktops and a wood-burning stove; sitting room with ornate stone fireplace and traditional Provençal ceilings; lovely library/music room; formal dining room; utility room; impressive 'orangerie' spaces (72 sq.m and 35 sq.m) with authentic terracotta tiling and oversized wrought-iron French doors opening onto the garden - recently redecorated and refreshed, these offer fantastic versatility, whether as additional living rooms, creative studios, or for potential professional use (yoga classes, seminars, reception rooms, etc.).

The first floor comprises: spacious master suite complete with bathroom and dressing area (and a Juliette-style balcony overlooking the garden, flooding the room with natural light); double bedroom with ensuite bathroom; three further double bedrooms; two guest bathrooms. Beautiful decorative cement tiles flow throughout the first floor.

The garden is entirely hedged and fenced for privacy. A large terrace runs along the front of the house, shaded by two centenary traditional plane trees. The large 11m x 5m elegant swimming-pool is heated (by a newly installed heat pump) and surrounded by a wide terrace and a large lawned area. A carport for two vehicles is located to the rear of the property, along with access to the vast (173 sq.m) garage.

The property has been renovated and refurbished with high quality materials. The renovation includes: roof entirely replaced and insulated; newly fitted kitchen; heated swimming-pool and surrounding terrace; installation of bespoke, wood-framed and double-glazed, French windows and doors throughout; newly installed septic tank; automatic watering system; and the installation of reversible air conditioning throughout the house, ensuring year-round comfort.

The property is very well-located close to the desirable market town of l’Isle-sur-la-Sorgue, famous for its antiques and restaurants, cultural life and less than 30 minutes from the Avignon TGV station.

The information about the risks to which this property is exposed is available on the Géorisques website: http://www.georisques.gouv.fr
summary: Renovated Bastide property, with heated pool and private gardens, close to l'Isle-sur-la-Sorgue.

title: V2999 L'ISLE-SUR-LA-SORGUE
body:
This exceptional riverside property enjoys a truly rare privilege: a private island on the crystal-clear Sorgue, complete with a natural inlet ideal for a small boat, canoe or paddleboard. Immersed in lush greenery and bordered by one of France’s most magical natural springs, this is a sanctuary of tranquillity and nature — yet less than 2 km from the heart of L’Isle-sur-la-Sorgue, just a short stroll or cycle from its vibrant cafés, Michelin-starred restaurants and world-famous antique markets.

Fed by the largest natural spring in France (and the fifth largest in the world), the Sorgue’s waters are naturally filtered through rock and emerge just 7 km upstream — always clear, clean and rich in wildlife. The river is known for its stable temperature of 13°C year-round, meaning it never freezes; in winter, steam rises from the surface, and even in the cooler months, swimming remains possible.

The house offers generous living spaces with abundant natural light thanks to dual-aspect windows. The ground floor includes a spacious living area with fireplace and dining space; an open, fully-equipped kitchen with Zimbabwe granite countertops; a recently built conservatory; an additional sitting room with elegant French wrought-iron doors; a utility room; two bedrooms; a bathroom; a shower room and WC.

Upstairs, there are three further bedrooms, a bathroom, and a useful utility or dressing area.

The grounds are beautifully divided between the private riverside garden and the main front garden. A wooden bridge leads to the property’s very own island — a serene place to read, swim, kayak or simply watch the light dance on the water, with views toward the fields and Mont Ventoux. A charming garden studio offers private guest accommodation, an office or an artist’s retreat.

To the front of the house, safely separated and enclosed away from the river, is the pool area and children’s play space. The pool terrace enjoys sun throughout the day and is complemented by a large veranda, pool house and outdoor shower. Beyond, olive trees punctuate the garden, and a private driveway lined with vines provides ample parking.

Additional features include: underfloor heating; air conditioning; electric shutters throughout; alarm system; electric gates with intercom; private water source; heated submerged pool cover; mains water and mains drainage.

A truly rare opportunity to own a riverside haven with its own private island — combining wild Provençal beauty, complete privacy and direct river access with the ease and pleasure of being moments from L’Isle-sur-la-Sorgue’s bustling centre.
summary: Rare riverside haven with private island in L’Isle-sur-la-Sorgue

title: V3054 ROBION
body:
Within walking distance of the lively Luberon village of Robion, this striking bastide has been thoughtfully renovated and redesigned. Offering generous living spaces and vast reception rooms, the property exudes character and charm, ensuring terrific flexibility for hosting guests and strong business potential. Arranged around a central walled garden, the property comprises a gorgeous main house (the bastide), several independent suites, a gîte, and large reception rooms – perfect for seminars, artistic or yoga retreats, or accommodating guests on a large scale.

Main House (the bastide)
The ground floor is composed of: kitchen with dining area; 51sqm sitting room featuring a second dining area and a gorgeous old well; wine cellar and larder.

The first floor comprises: two spacious suites, each benefitting from a private shower room; office space; two additional bedrooms sharing a Jack-and-Jill bathroom and WC.

The second floor accommodates a generous principal suite, complete with its own bathroom (with bath and walk-in shower) and a large dressing room. Lovely views of the Luberon mountains can be enjoyed from this suite. An independent wing of the property (still on the second floor) offers two further bedrooms with shared bathroom and WC.

Guest suites
Three independent suites, each with a separate entrance and great privacy, ensure flexibility and comfort for guests:

– The first includes a sitting room, bedroom, bathroom with bathtub, shower and WC, and a private terrace.
– The second comprises a bedroom with en suite bathroom and WC.
– The third offers a bedroom with its own bathroom and WC.

Gîte
The gîte features a kitchen, dining room, sitting room, WC, two bedrooms and a shower room – ideal for guests or extended stays.

Reception rooms
A recently converted space (over 80sqm) provides the perfect spot for seminars or entertaining on a larger scale. This versatile area is equipped with a kitchen, storage room and WC. A second space, with gorgeous original features and high cathedral ceilings, is currently used for serving breakfast and meals to B&B guests. Guests are also provided with a separate fully equipped kitchen, and a laundry room.

The outdoor spaces are equally inviting, with generous terraces, a bright glass-covered veranda, a sauna and a jacuzzi. The 8m x 4m bassin-style swimming pool, heated and secured with a submerged cover, is separated from the bastide by colourful oleanders and fragrant jasmine.

A vast garage completes the property, with a large workshop area, ample parking for cars (2 - 3 cars) – with potential for additional conversion.

Amenities include: gas-fired central heating (mains gas); air conditioning in the bedrooms; double glazing; water softener; mains water and a private well; fibre-optic internet; electric gates with videophone; electric garage door.

Located less than a kilometre from the heart of the village of Robion, this property holds strong rental and business potential, with heaps of possibilities to explore. A superb village property that combines timeless Provençal charm, an array of modern comforts, generous volumes, and the convenience of village life.
summary: Striking bastide property with excellent rental and business potential.

title: V3003 VILLARS
body:
This exceptional 18-century stone farmhouse rests serenely in the mountains above the charming Luberon village of Villars, providing a haven of peace in an unspoiled rural setting.  A family home for many years, the property has been lovingly and respectfully renovated, with a particular regard for maintaining its innate character and rich heritage, whilst creating intimate indoor spaces for the family.  The choice of natural building materials as well as the considered planting of drought-resistant plants reflect the great care taken to respect the environment.  The clear views of distant villages, and the unpolluted night sky, enhance the property’s unspoilt beauty.

The accommodation, on the ground floor, comprises: entrance hall with its original bread oven, which once fed the village’s entire working population; spacious dining kitchen with a masonry stove; utility room; large cellar; sitting room with cathedral ceiling, generous south-facing windows allowing the winter sun to pour in, and a stove to add to the warmth in winter.

On the first floor: partially laid with exotic dark fraké wood flooring; three bedrooms (the one over the living room has a glassed-in partition to allow in the light from below; family bathroom; two further bedrooms; shower room.

The house’s insulation is almost entirely made up of hemp – roof, walls, and even the floors in some rooms.  Hemp was chosen for its ecological properties and thermal performance which gives the walls a special warmth.  
 
Annexed to the house, with independent access, is an apartment with a generous living space, a bedroom and a shower room.  It enjoys natural light from all four sides of the building and gorgeous views to the south. With its own garden, terraces, and parking area, this apartment offers an entirely separate living space from the main house.  

The front garden is  made up of plants that don’t require watering – chosen in collaboration with the renowned ‘dry gardener’ James Basson, based in Grasse. The stone walls create a micro-climate and an ideal habitat for a diverse fauna.  White and evergreen oaks weave a dappled canopy beneath which one can enjoy an al fresco lunch or some bird-watching.  In the shade of the centennial evergreen oaks in front of the house there is always a welcome breeze coming up from the valley. As dusk settles, the garden is bathed in a golden light.

The stone walls and steps created from locally sourced stone from the valley reflect the deep history of the place.  Set on the slope of the hill the gardens are on several levels.  This adds to the magic of the environment and the restanques (terraced areas) provide many varied opportunities for outdoor living areas, such as the ‘hanging garden’, the parking areas, the vegetable garden (whose soil quality has been improved over the years to create a fertile potager), and olive grove of approximately 20 trees yielding 50 – 100 kg of olives a year.

Amenities include: a wood-burning boiler; fibre optic internet; mains water; rain water collection (150m3); private well; automatic watering system in the potager; outdoor lighting on the terrace, a septic tank and electric fencing.  Additional features include ample parking; extensive storage below the property and an adjacent boiler-room.

This unique property seamlessly weaves together modern comfort with the enduring spirit of an authentic Provençal farmhouse, offering a peaceful retreat in an idyllic corner of the Luberon.  The proximity to Apt, for local supermarkets, and its renowned Saturday outdoor market, as well as Saint-Saturnin-lès-Apt and Villars (home to terrific restaurants, run by innovative young restaurateurs, such as Le Saint Hubert, Le Bar des Amis, and La Fontaine) and the Villars Golf Course (with restaurant and upcoming hotel-spa) adds to the desirability of the location.

Information on the risks to which this property is exposed is available on the Géorisques website: http://www.georisques.gouv.fr
summary: Renovated rural farmhouse in idyllic countryside with peace and views.

title: V3102 GORDES
body:
Set just a short walk from the historic village of Gordes, with its many restaurants, cafés, and boutiques, this beautiful stone villa perfectly blends Provençal charm with modern comfort. The property has undergone a complete renovation, carried out with exceptional attention to detail and high-quality materials. The result is a contemporary yet character-filled home that offers light-filled interiors, generous proportions, and a landscaped garden ensuring privacy while remaining close to village life.

The entrance opens into a spacious open-plan living area with high ceilings, exposed beams and arched windows that flood the space with natural light. The bespoke kitchen – crafted with ceramic worktops and natural wood cabinetry – flows seamlessly into a spacious dining and sitting area opening directly onto a large, partially covered terrace, ideal for outdoor dining and entertaining.

The ground floor hosts two generous bedroom suites, each with its own ensuite shower room and WC. A utility room and additional WC complete this level.

The first floor accommodates a third suite, with independent access, offering ample built-in storage, a private shower room and WC – ideal for guests or seasonal rentals.

Outside, the landscaped south-west-facing garden features multiple terraces, dry gardens, and a rich variety of native plants and trees. Stone steps lead down to the 9m x 5m swimming pool, framed by a terrace that invites you to relax under the Provençal sun. The property also includes a large tool shed and ample private parking within the garden.

Amenities include reversible air conditioning throughout; mains water and drainage; automatic garden watering system; fibre-optic internet; aluminium-framed double glazing; and automatic gates with intercom.

This is a rare opportunity to own a completely renovated home that combines authenticity, comfort and understated elegance – perfect as a permanent residence, a second home or a highly sought-after seasonal rental in one of the most desirable villages of the Luberon.
summary: Beautifully renovated stone house within walking distance of Gordes.

title: V2683 MENERBES
body:
Located just several kilometres from the legendary village of Ménerbes and Lacoste, this beautiful property benefits from a superb setting, unobstructed Luberon views and an abundance of character. Features include a garage, independent stone ‘gîte’ and a lavish swimming pool area.

The accommodation, on the ground floor, comprises: bespoke ‘Fabre’ dining kitchen with granite countertops and an island unit, with French doors leading out to a south-facing terrace shaded by a stunning Lady Banks’ rose; sitting room with an open stone fireplace; south-facing master bedroom with adjoining shower room; guest loo; utility room/larder; technical room housing the boiler. French doors grant access to the swimming pool area and a terracotta-tiled roofed dining terrace.

The first floor is composed of: lovely double bedroom suite with an adjoining shower room, loo, and dressing room; two spacious double bedrooms; guest bathroom and loo. All the first floor bedrooms enjoy particularly impressive views of the Luberon valley.

An independent ‘gîte’, located just beyond the swimming pool area, comprises a spacious double bedroom, kitchenette and a shower room. The ‘gîte’ benefits from a private terrace shaded by a mulberry tree.

The property’s gardens offer a bucolic setting overlooking the valley below. The swimming pool (10m x 4m – equipped with a submerged cover) is adorned by a vast terraced area and a well-equipped summer kitchen.

This quintessentially ‘Provençal’ retreat would serve as a warm and welcoming family home, idyllic Luberon getaway, or a lucrative seasonal rental investment – in the heart of the Luberon’s ever-desirable ‘Golden Triangle’.
summary: Beautiful Lacoste farmhouse with pool and fantastic views.

title: V2994 LE BARROUX
body:
Perched on the foothills of Mont Ventoux, this stone property enjoys spectacular panoramic views and a wonderful natural setting. Surrounded by lush greenery and private woodland, it offers breathtaking scenery and complete privacy. The property is located just a 10-minute walk from the popular and lively village of Le Barroux, which is home to several restaurants, a Bistrot, a grocer, and a café.

The ground floor is composed of: bright and spacious 60 m² living area, comprising a kitchen, dining room, and welcoming sitting room; two double bedrooms, each with their own en suite bathroom and loo; large office - enjoying direct access to a Jack-and-Jill bathroom; utility room; larder. 

The first floor comprises a bright master suite, with an adjoining shower room and dressing room. 

An independent guest house accommodates a bedroom, bathroom, and storage space, ideal for hosting family and fiends, or creating a private atelier or workshop.

Outdoors, a welcoming terrace extends across the front of the house. Below, layered terraces are planted with centuries-old olive trees and a terrific variety of fruit trees. The heated infinity pool offers breathtaking vistas over the valley, enhanced by a spacious surrounding terrace. Behind the property, a private woodland has been thoughtfully landscaped and includes a hidden viewpoint. Here, a secluded bench invites you to relax and take in the stunning natural scenery.

With its great volumes, bright interior spaces, and utterly stunning views, this property offers a perfect, idyllic and tranquil environment. The picturesque village of Le Barroux lies on the doorstep of the legendary Mont Ventoux, drawing cyclists from all over the world.
summary: Lovely stone property with spectacular views.

title: V2871 L'ISLE-SUR-LA-SORGUE
body:
This attractive property is located on the edge of the bustling market town of L'Isle-sur-la-Sorgue, renowned for its weekly antique market and terrific variety of restaurants, cafés, and bars. The property is composed of a beautifully proportioned manor house, two spacious gîtes, and a lovely private garden with a lavish swimming pool.

The ground floor comprises: entrance hall; spacious sitting-dining room adorned with exquisite decorative cement tiles; well-equipped kitchen; adjoining utility room; second sitting room; large bedroom/office (currently used as a laundry room); guest w.c.; garage.

The first floor accommodates: three lovely double bedroom suites each with an adjoining bathroom; two double, each with adjoining bathroom; guest w.c.

A separate annex located in a quiet corner of the garden offers an open-concept loft style living space comprising a kitchenette, dining area, bedroom and shower room. This gîte benefits from ample natural light through large French doors.

The second gîte features: spacious double bedroom; bathroom; large kitchen/sitting room.

The garden provides a serene setting, with a shaded terrace under tall trees, perfect for relaxation and outdoor entertaining. The garden is complemented by a superb 10.5m x 5m tiled swimming pool, ideal for enjoying the sunny Provençal climate.

Amenities include: fibre optic internet; mains water; mains drainage; automatic watering system; newly installed wood-framed double glazing; gas-fired central heating; large workshop for storing garden tools and furniture; private parking.

This property is well-suited as a main residence, a holiday home, or a bed and breakfast with a great degree of flexibility. The property offers an excellent blend of comfort and convenience in a sought-after location, within walking distance of the many local shops and restaurants. Its spacious, light-filled rooms and private garden make it an excellent choice for those seeking a quality living environment in L'Isle-sur-la-Sorgue.
summary: L'Isle-sur-la-Sorgue manor house with large private garden, within walking distance of local shops and restaurants.

title: V2846 GORDES
body:
This magnificent property, located in one of the most beautiful villages in the world, offers a uniquely exquisite and tranquil setting. The property features bright and airy volumes, fantastic views of Gordes, and a prime location.

The entrance reveals a welcoming open-plan living space that harmoniously combines a large kitchen (with adjoining pantry), a cosy sitting room fitted with a wood-burning stove and a generously-sized dining area. This living space is bathed in natural light, featuring oversized French doors that lead out onto sunny dining terraces. The ground floor further comprises: four spacious bedrooms; bathroom with a shower and a bath; home office; shower room; two w.c.

On the first floor, an additional bedroom overlooking the garden below provides a particularly peaceful setting.

The grounds span 1.87 acres (7,600 m²) and have two gated entrances, to the north and to the west. The carefully landscaped gardens feature a splendid lavender field, a 6m x 11m swimming pool and two south-facing terraces. An annexe or garage could be constructed on the land if desired. A large cellar offers valuable storage space for garden tools and furniture.

Amenities include: electric heating; mains water; canal water; automatic watering system; exterior lighting; double glazing; fibre.

This property offers a unique opportunity to live in the heart of Provence, a highly sought-after region. Its ideal location, generous volumes and exceptional views make this property a first-rate choice for anyone seeking a lifestyle in a captivating environment.
summary: Spacious property with a stunning view of Gordes.

title: V2927 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
This stylish and spacious stone house enjoys stunning volumes and great views, and sits on natural grounds, primarily planted with olive trees, cedars, and other mature trees and flowering species. The property lies within walking distance of the highly sought-after village of Cabrières-d'Avignon.

The accommodation on the ground floor comprises: large entrance hall with guest w.c. and a beautiful curved stone staircase; spacious and bright sitting room with a fireplace and French doors opening onto the south-facing terrace, which leads down to the garden and offers pretty views of the Luberon mountain range; dining room with garden access; large kitchen; adjoining laundry room; ground floor bedroom with ensuite bathroom; second double bedroom with ensuite bathroom.

The first floor is composed of: beautifully-proportioned open-plan room with exposed beams, used as an art workshop (with the potential to transform into an additional bedroom with bathroom); master bedroom with an ensuite bathroom.

Amenities include: large garage; outbuilding for garden tools and storage; double glazing; underfloor heating and cooling on the ground floor; renowned local stone floors in the main ground floor rooms; mains water; mains drainage; thermodynamic boiler; electric gates; large private parking area.

The easily maintained garden, with its stunning olive grove and lovely views, is fully enclosed and offers complete privacy. A swimming pool could be installed if desired.

The village and local shops are within walking distance of the property, while larger amenities and the popular farmer’s market in Coustellet are just a short drive away. With its privileged location, stunning views, generous spaces, and high-quality modern amenities, this property would make an ideal luxurious Luberon retreat, a comfortable family home, or a lucrative seasonal rental investment.
summary: Elegant stone property with large garden, on the edge of the village.

title: V2938 LORIOL DU COMTAT
body:
Just minutes from the heart of the charming village of Loriol-du-Comtat, this property was completely renovated in 2015 with exceptional attention to detail and impeccable taste. The property comprises a spacious and well-appointed main house, an independent gîte, an additional guest suite, and a superb contemporary artist’s atelier (or private guest house) on the grounds. Offering generous volumes throughout, it is set within a beautifully landscaped garden of approximately 0.77 acres providing complete privacy.

In the main house, on the ground floor: PEZ kitchen with quartz countertops and Lacanche gas range leading on to a  dining area; adjoining sitting room with fireplace; principal suite with dressing room, shower room, WC, study, and private sitting room; utility room. 

Upstairs, a second principal suite features its own shower room, WC, and a spacious private terrace with gorgeous views. There is also a storage area that could be converted into a child’s bedroom.

The guest annexe includes: family suite with two double bedrooms sharing a shower room and WC; double bedroom with en-suite shower room; summer kitchen with pantry; bike room.

An independent studio bathed in natural light thanks to large French windows, offering an inspiring workspace for artists, a yoga room, or a fabulous office. It could also serve as a fully self-contained guest house and currently includes a living area, a kitchenette, and a terrace.

Outdoors, the fully enclosed grounds feature a 12m x 5m heated swimming pool with submerged cover, a pool house, a pétanque court, and a rich variety of Mediterranean planting, including mulberry trees, flowering laurels, cherry trees and palm trees. 

Amenities include: oil-fired central heating; reversible air conditioning; double glazing; ADSL internet; mains water and an 80-metre borehole; electric gates; cellar; mains drainage.

This beautifully renovated home stands out for its refined finishes and use of high-quality materials. With its spacious interiors, private and superbly landscaped grounds, and potential to build and develop, it is a rare find. Whether as a main house, a luxurious holiday home, or a property with strong seasonal rental returns, it offers a wealth of possibilities — a unique opportunity in the heart of the Vaucluse.
summary: Beautifully renovated property with gîte, guest suites & pool.

title: V2880 GORDES
body:
Perfectly positioned on the edge of a charming hamlet in Gordes, this attractive house is set in an exclusive and tranquil environment. The property offers spacious interiors and sits on a large 1.9-acre plot, planted with centenary oaks and pine trees, including an extremely desirable 3,000 m² of constructible land (located in zone UC of the planning code).

The ground floor is composed of: kitchen that opens onto the dining room; grand, cathedral-style, sitting room with a fireplace; three double bedrooms (one with a mezzanine); two bathrooms; separate WC; garage.

The first floor comprises: two additional bedrooms; shower room; guest WC.

Key amenities include: electric heating; traditional fireplace; mains water; private well. The property is fenced and partially surrounded by handsome drystone walls. The gently sloping grounds are home to a 12m x 6m heated swimming pool, multiple terraces, and a stunning traditional 'borie'. Oriented to the southwest, it boasts beautiful views of the Luberon.

This property is ideally suited for year-round residence, as a superbly-located Luberon retreat, or for use as a seasonal rental. Additionally, the option to detach a portion of the constructible land presents an exciting opportunity for development in a coveted area.
summary: 182m² property with swimming pool and stunning plot of constructible land.

title: V3094 GORDES
body:
Ideally positioned in the very heart of the Luberon’s most desirable hilltop village, this property of character stands out for its authenticity and impressive rental potential. Combining commercial visibility and residential comfort, it reprensents a unique opportunity for investors. 

The property offers 262 m2 spread out on five floors, including five independent units, four currently used for commercial purposes and one as a residence, guaranteeing excellent potential for rental income. 

The ground floor hosts spacious commercial unit benefitting form an independent access presently trading as a clothing boutique. This unit makes the most of a fantastic visibility thanks to its privileged location on a busy street within one of the regions most renowned tourist villages. 

A second entrance leads to the main staircase allowing access to the upper floors which are slightly more residential.  
On the first floor : light-filled sitting room with open kitchen area, office or bedroom, shower room with WC. 
The second floor: residential apartment including a kitchenette opening on to a generous sitting/dining room with firplace; spacious double bedroom, bathroom with WC. Ideal for long-term of holiday rentals. 
These floors benefit from magnificent panoramic views across the valley, the château de Gordes and the surrounding village scenery. 

The lower levels, each with independent access, also offer excellent commercial possibilities:
Upper ground floor: 17 m2 unit with kitchenette, shower room and WC.
Lower ground floor: two adjoining rooms with a WC, featuring vaulted exposed stone ceilings.

Combining period charm, an exceptional location, a flexible layout and outstanding views, this property represents a rare opportunity in the Luberon. Ideal for a long-term investment, a mixed-use project or a rental investment, it will appeal to buyers looking for a property of character and strong potential in the heart of one of France’s most beautiful villages.
summary: Elegant historic property combining charm and profitability in Gordes.

title: V3089 MENERBES
body:
This charming stone hideaway boasts an excellent location in the highly sought-after Ménerbes countryside, just a short distance from local bars, restaurants, cafés, and shops.

Recently renovated with care, it blends modern touches with traditional character and offers an authentic, comfortable retreat with charming interiors, good volumes and a beautifully landscaped garden. The property showcases breathtaking and unobstructed views of the Luberon.

The accommodation, on the ground floor, comprises: entrance hall; open-plan living space and an elegant kitchen, generous dining area, and a cosy sitting room with impressive wooden beams; utility room; master bedroom with adjoining bathroom and double aspect windows granting stunning views; double bedroom; guest shower room and WC. The dining room opens out onto an expansive terrace, adorned with a pergola draped in grape vines, overlooking the valley below.
