The kitchen leads out to a covered terrace, featuring authentic parefeuille flooring and large windows offering beautiful views of the garden.

The first floor consists of two double bedrooms and a modern shower room. The property also features an independent studio on the lower floor with great potential for renovation and decorative works.

Amenities include: mains water; automatic watering system; exterior lighting; fibre-optic internet; wood-framed double glazing. The roof has recently been inspected and partially redone.

The garden is an absolute triumph: it features beautiful stone walls and stone-paved paths lined with lavender. The pièce de résistance is the 12 m x 5 m swimming pool equipped with a submerged cover, walled and planted to ensure complete privacy. Olive trees on one side set the scene, while a drystone wall topped with lavender and roses adds fragrant scents and vibrant colour. Landscaping has been carefully planned to create a sense of space and light throughout the property.

Offering panoramic Luberon views and tranquil surroundings, this property provides an idyllic Provençal experience within easy reach of Ménerbes.
summary: Hideaway with great panoramic view of the Luberon, in the heart of Ménerbes' countryside.

title: V3016 MENERBES
body:
In the very heart of Ménerbes, one of the Luberon’s most desirable villages, this stylish 18th-century stone house enjoys a privileged position just a few steps from the local restaurants, cafés, and shops. Brimming with character and authenticity, and expertly remodelled, the property offers generous volumes, chic décor, and a rare 120 m² rooftop garden commanding outstanding 280-degree views over the village, the Citadelle, Mont Ventoux, and the rolling Luberon valley. Both the house and the private garden face south, basking in Provençal sunshine all year round. 

The ground floor comprises: entrance through a charming central courtyard lined with oversized wrought-iron orangery windows; sitting room laid with cobblestone flooring; spacious office (currently serving as a bedroom); gorgeously unique guest suite featuring vaulted ceilings, stone accent walls, and an adjoining shower room; wine cellar; floating Oppède-stone staircase leading up to the first floor.

The first floor accommodates: mezzanine area flooded with natural light; elegant principal suite with an adjoining bathroom and walk-in shower.

The second floor is composed of: beautiful bespoke ‘Fabre’ kitchen opening into the sitting room; sitting room boasting high ceilings, an ornamental 'pigeonnier', traditional parfeuille tiles, a stone fireplace, and ample space for dining. Terrific views of the Luberon mountains can be enjoyed from the upper floors.

The expansive rooftop terrace and garden form an exceptional outdoor living space, perfectly private and large enough for outdoor dining and entertaining, with unrivalled sunrise-to-sunset views over the village rooftops and surrounding countryside. Perched high above the village below, the garden enjoys a private section of oak woodland - an enchanting setting!

Meticulous restoration has combined high-quality materials with master craftsmanship, preserving the property’s authentic character while delivering a particularly high level of modern comfort.

Amenities include: central heating; mains water plus private well; security system; fibre-optic internet; modern wood-framed double glazing.

With its awe-inspiring rooftop garden, refined interiors, superb views, and doorstep access to the vibrant village of Ménerbes, this property offers a unique village retreat in the Golden Triangle of the Luberon valley.
summary: Ménerbes village house with rooftop garden and unparalleled views.

title: V2991 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
Located in a peaceful setting and just a five-minute walk from a charming Provençal village, this property enjoys stunning views of the Luberon and vineyards bathed in golden hues.

The ground floor is composed of: spacious living area with a beautiful Fabre kitchen, dining room, and sitting room, all of which open onto the outdoor terraces; laundry room; guest loo.

The first floor comprises: master suite with bathroom en suite; three additional bedrooms, each with en suite shower rooms; loo.

Steps away from the main house, a delightful annexe accommodates a large office with a mezzanine, offering a flexible working space or an artists atelier. 

The gardens enjoy a magnificent, partially covered terrace, ideal for year-round outdoor gatherings, as well as a 12m x 4m swimming pool equipped with a Diffazur self-cleaning Diffaclean system. At the rear of the house, the garden opens onto a constructible plot of land - providing the potential to create additional space, expand the property or add a garage.

Amenities include: underfloor heating and cooling via a heat pump system; air conditioning; double glazing; fibre optic internet; electric gates; automatic watering system; mains water ; mains drainage; pool house; large storage space; carport.

With its beautiful gardens, constructible land, and generous living spaces, this property strikes a perfect balance between modern comforts and authenticity, seamlessly blending indoor and outdoor living.
summary: Lovely property with views and a constructible plot of land.

title: V3067 SAIGNON
body:
Nestled on a hillside just below the medieval village of Saignon - one of the Luberon's most beautiful perched villages - this superbly restored stone house offers an ideal balance of tranquility and accessibility. The setting is exceptional: the property enjoys sweeping views across the Luberon countryside, with the charm of village life just moments away. Saignon's café, bakery and restaurants are within easy reach, while the market town of Apt, with its renowned Saturday market and many amenities, is just 10 minutes by car. This is authentic Provence, where peaceful rural living meets the convenience of nearby amenities. The house sits at the heart of over two acres of beautifully landscaped grounds, commanding stunning panoramic views of rolling hills and the quintessential Provençal countryside.

The property has been thoughtfully restored, successfully balancing original character with contemporary comfort. Traditional elements - terracotta floors, exposed stone walls, and wood-burning fireplaces - have been carefully preserved, while modern amenities and tasteful decor throughout create a home of genuine quality and charm.

The main house comprises: light-filled open-plan sitting and dining room, laid with traditional terracotta tiles and arranged around a central wood-burning stove. The adjoining fully equipped kitchen features sleek cabinetry, a peninsula counter, and high-quality appliances. Both spaces open onto a vine-covered terrace framing sweeping countryside views. A few steps lead down to a stylish bathroom, a separate WC, and a spacious double bedroom with extensive built-in wardrobes. From the bedroom, a floating stone staircase leads up to a private rooftop terrace – ideal for a peaceful morning coffee or afternoon glass of rosé. 

The upper level of the house includes: guest suite with its own shower room and WC, providing complete independence for visitors. Below, on the garden level, an independent gîte offers an additional bedroom, kitchenette, shower room and storage – perfect for hosting family or generating rental income.

An elegant cypress-lined driveway leads up to the property, providing an impressive sense of arrival. The gardens extend across more than two acres of gently terraced grounds, with mature lawns, established lavender plants, and beautiful trees including oak, walnut and cedar. A productive olive grove adds authentic Provençal character and yields a modest annual harvest. The heated swimming pool enjoys an elevated position with exceptional sun exposure throughout the day and panoramic views to the south and northwest. A traditional sauna is positioned behind the house, while multiple terrace areas - including the vine-covered terrace and private rooftop space - offer varied outdoor living options to suit different times of day.

Amenities include: reversible air-conditioning throughout; wrought-iron double glazing with security glass; mains water; Canal de Provence for the garden; 2,500L rainwater collection tank; fibre-optic internet; electric gates and fencing; alarm system with cameras; garden sheds. The roof has recently been replaced.

This charming property represents a rare opportunity to acquire a tastefully renovated Provençal home in a truly outstanding location, combining complete privacy with village proximity and authentic character with modern comfort - whether as a primary residence, holiday retreat, or rental investment.
summary: Charming stone house in idyllic rural location with beautiful views.

title: V2661 GOULT
body:
Ideally located in the heart of the sought-after village of Goult, this elegant stone property combines authenticity, refinement and modern comfort. Offering generous proportions and panoramic views across the Luberon valley, it enjoys a privileged setting just a short stroll from the village cafés, restaurants and shops.

The ground floor is arranged around a spacious and light-filled open-plan living area, comprising: a bespoke Schmidt kitchen with granite worktops and large central island; a generous dining area; a welcoming sitting room. Large sliding doors recess fully into the walls, extending the living spaces onto a south-facing terrace and a north-facing veranda. This layout creates a seamless flow between indoors and outdoors, while making the most of the superb views of the Luberon. Both terraces are fitted with electric retractable awnings, and the veranda is air-conditioned.

The first floor offers: two large double bedrooms; a shower room; and a guest bathroom.

The second floor is entirely devoted to a luxurious principal suite comprising: a private sitting room; a large double bedroom; a dressing room; a shower room; and a separate WC. A Juliet balcony enjoys breathtaking views over the Luberon valley, while a charming oculus window in the shower room beautifully frames the village church.

An elegant staircase with wrought-iron balustrades harmoniously links the ground floor, first floor and second floor.

The lower level includes: a superb vaulted wine cellar, fully restored; a large, well-equipped laundry room; guest WC; cloakroom; technical room; and a spacious garage with motorised door and suspended storage. 

Features include: underfloor heating via heat pump; double-glazed windows; Bourgogne stone flooring; fibre-optic internet; an alarm system.

Renovated in 2011 with meticulous attention to detail, this timeless village property offers exceptional comfort and style in the very heart of the Luberon – ideal as a permanent home or prestigious pied-à-terre.

Information on the risks to which this property is exposed is available on the Géorisques website: www.georisques.gouv.fr
summary: Elegant village house with exceptional views in the heart of Goult

title: V2707 GORDES
body:
Nestled in the oak woodlands above the village of Gordes, this lovely property benefits from pretty views, an abundance of space and 2.7 acres of private grounds. 

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: large open concept sitting-dining room (44 sqm) with a pellet-burning stove and patio doors granting access to the large south-facing terrace; adjoining kitchen; master bedroom with shower room and loo en suite; covered terrace with a wood-burning stove; utility room; guest loo; small larder.

The first floor is composed of a generous sitting room / office space, three spacious double bedrooms and a shower room.

The property boasts an independent gîte that consists of a fully equipped kitchen with an adjoining sitting room, bedroom, modern shower room, guest loo and a private terrace with access to the swimming pool.

The east wing of the property accommodates : double bedroom suite, recently remodelled to grant a high standard of living - enjoying large patio windows, a contemporary shower room, separate loo, private terrace and lovely views of the surrounding countryside ; spacious additional gîte with bathroom, loo, kitchen and adjoining terrace.

The carefully tended to grounds provide vibrant colours and a tremendous sense of intimacy. The garden is home to numerous centenary oaks, olive and cypress trees, and a large variety of roses and indigenous shrubs. Stone steps lead down to the swimming pool (10m x 5m), which is adorned with a large, terraced area. The property enjoys immediate access to some of the best walking, hiking and cycling paths that the Luberon has to offer.

The property would serve as an idyllic Luberon retreat, a spacious and comfortable family home or a rental investment with an array of possibilities.
summary: Spacious Luberon property in a superb rural setting.

title: V3074 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
Just a short walk from the charming heart of Cabrières-d’Avignon, this property offers a rare combination: a peaceful, natural setting within walking distance of village amenities — bakery, restaurant, and grocery store. A true everyday luxury. 

Set within a landscaped garden with panoramic views of the Luberon, the house enjoys its own private olive grove, a high-quality of construction, and bright, well-proportioned living spaces.

The ground floor includes: spacious living area with wood-burning stove and French doors opening to the outdoors; custom Fabre kitchen with adjoining covered terrace; master suite with built-in wardrobes and ensuite bathroom (with both shower and bathtub); large utility room; generous garage offering ample storage space.

The first floor features three charming bedrooms that share a family shower room. Each of the upstairs rooms enjoys particularly lovely views over the surrounding countryside and the Luberon hills.

Outdoors, the landscaped garden offers stunning views of the Luberon mountains, a covered dining terrace, and an 8m x 4m swimming pool with paved terraces and a second covered seating area — ideal for escaping the hot summer sun. Beyond, the mature olive grove produces over 10 litres of its very own olive oil each year.

Amenities include: underfloor heating and cooling via heat pump (ground and first floors); double glazing with wooden frames; fantastic insulation (Trilatte roof panels); mains drainage; mains water; fully enclosed plot thanks to stone walls.

A rare opportunity combining all the most sought-after features in the Luberon. Whether you're searching for a main residence, a holiday home, or a long-term investment, this house ticks all the boxes — and is sure to appeal to lovers of peace, nature, and Provençal authenticity.
summary: Charming Property with Pool, Panoramic Views & Olive Grove — A Quiet Retreat Near the Heart of the Village.

title: V2682 GORDES
body:
This enchanting stone property is nestled in a preserved and idyllic part of Gordes’ countryside. Tremendous views of the surrounding landscape and the imposing Luberon mountains can be enjoyed from the house. The property benefits from a lovely walled garden and a ‘bassin’ style swimming pool.

The accommodation comprises: small foyer; kitchen with breakfast table; sitting room with stone fireplace; master bedroom with shower room en suite; guest loo. French doors in the kitchen and sitting room lead out to the south facing dining terrace, grown with a wisteria. Lovely stone steps lead up to the first floor.

The first floor is composed of: office; double bedroom; guest shower room; rooftop terrace with a remarkable view of the Luberon mountains.

The property also includes an independently accessed gîte: entrance hall/office space; sitting room with a stone fireplace and an adjoining kitchen; bright double bedroom with terracotta tiling and a private first-floor terrace overlooking the surrounding olive orchards; guest shower room and loo; technical room.

The property enjoys two large, vaulted rooms on the garden level, an office, and a storage room, as well as a covered terrace (27 sqm, 38 sqm and 31 sqm respectively).

The innate charm of this wonderfully traditional stone property has been preserved with great care, with dressed stone staircases, original stone flagstone flooring, exposed beams, and colourful terracotta tiling.

The lovely walled garden ensures utter intimacy and a superbly lush setting. The ‘bassin’ style swimming pool is adorned with a stone terrace and surrounded by a verdant lawned area. The garden is populated by centenary olive trees, cypress trees, oleanders, and an assortment of shrubs. Multiple parking spaces lie to the rear, shaded by a majestic hackberry tree.

A truly authentic stone farmhouse, in a stunning setting.
summary: Gorgeous 18th century property with manicured garden.

title: V2905 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
On the edge of the Luberon village of Cabrières-d'Avignon, this spacious property enjoys a rather remarkable natural setting. The property has been extended by the current owners, meticulously renovated and embellished by elegant and tasteful décor (the most recent renovation works were completed in 2023).

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: large entrance hall with an adjoining loo and cloakroom;  40 m² sitting/dining room, flooded with light thanks to large French doors; kitchen with an adjoining utility room and larder, which could conceivably be combined to extend the kitchen; sitting room/home office wit an adjoining storage area, that could easily be converted into a vast master suite.

The first floor comprises four double bedrooms and two bathrooms. Beautiful views of the Luberon can be enjoyed from the upstairs bedrooms and the roofed terrace.

The ground floor rooms open onto a large terrace overlooking 1840m2 of beautifully landscaped gardens, shaded by evergreen oaks. The garden features a 12m x 4m swimming pool, as well as a large outbuilding of over 30m2 that serves as a pool house and garage, but could be converted to create an independent gîte or workshop.

Amenities include: heat pump heating installed in November 2023, with radiators throughout; fireplace; wood framed double-glazing; alarm system; mains drainage; mains water; connexion available by fibre optic to internet. The property is entirely fenced, with automatic gates and an interphone.

With an excellent location, within walking distance of Cabrières-d'Avignon, beautiful volumes and a picturesque wooded garden, this property could serve as a beautiful Luberon retreat (with attractive returns as a seasonal rental). An abundance of modern features guarantee a high standard of living throughout the year.
summary: Contemporary villa in immaculate condition within walking distance of Cabrières-d'Avignon.

title: V3064 LAGNES
body:
A recent build in the traditional style by local craftsmen, using materials sourced from the area (such as Gordes and Ménerbes stone), this property is utterly adorable, tucked away in a quiet corner of Lagnes yet within walking distance of the village centre. Lagnes is a lively year-round traditional Luberon village with everything to offer, including: bars and restaurants, a bakery, a hairdresser’s, a pharmacy and doctor’s office. The views towards the Alpilles, Luberon and Ventoux from the garden are gorgeous. 

The house’s location is ideal for enjoying all that the Luberon has to offer: exploring the area’s famed perched villages, or spending a day in the bustling nearby town of L’Isle-sur-la-Sorgue, with its boutiques, restaurants, antique stores and twice-weekly open-air markets. 

The ground floor is composed of: light-filled open-plan sitting and dining area with electric fireplace, lined with French windows leading to a large shaded terrace. A practical breakfast bar separates the room from the charming kitchen nook. Fully equipped (including a wine fridge) it has exposed stone walls, a typical Provençal ceiling, and a wrought-iron framed window to the entrance hall, letting in more light. A door leads out to a further terrace for outdoor dining. The ground floor also comprises an office, laundry and storage room, and guest WC.

The first floor comprises: main bedroom with dressing room (plans exist to transform this into an ensuite shower room). Two further bedrooms each with fitted wardrobes; family bathroom with double sink, tub and shower; separate WC. The stairs leading to the first floor are made of Ménerbes stone, with risers set with attractive contrasting tiles.

The garden, which covers half an acre, is planted with mature specimens of native species such as olives, oaks, figs, oleanders, agapanthus and hydrangeas. It slopes gently down from the property, towards the secluded pool area with its beckoning summer kitchen equipped with a sink, fridge and grill. Whether you want to relax with friends on the shaded terrace, enjoy a meal al fresco, or sun yourself by the saltwater pool (9.5m x 4m), you will relish the privacy and the peace and quiet.

Amenities include: reversible A/C units with heat pump; gas-fired central heating; electric fireplace; mains water and drainage; fibre internet; alarm and security cameras; electric gates; automatic watering system using Canal de Provence water. Ample parking and carport for 2 cars with shed. Crawl space. Summer kitchen. Pétanque court.

A home to be lived in and loved through every season — ready to move into, and brimming with charm. It would serve as a delightful Luberon retreat (less than an hour from Avignon TGV and Marseille airport) or as an investment property for attractive seasonal rental returns.
summary: Pretty house with lovely views and saltwater pool – walking distance to village.

title: V2971 ST MARTIN DE CASTILLON
body:
Set in the scenic Luberon hills, this beautifully renovated 18th-century farmhouse blends authentic Provençal charm with modern comforts. South-facing and enjoying a privileged location in a tranquil rural setting, it is surrounded by over an acre of immaculately landscaped gardens. Carefully restored using gorgeous natural materials, the property exudes traditional character and Provençal allure.

The accommodation on the ground floor comprises: entrance hall with a striking wrought-iron staircase leading to a cosy library and office; spacious artist’s atelier (which could be used as a bedroom) ; open-plan living space composed of a sitting room and a large dining area, adorned with two stone fireplaces; second, smaller sitting room/tv room; impressive, fully equipped professional-style kitchen, complemented by a Lacanche gas cooker and a large cold room/pantry; utility room; beautiful summer kitchen overlooking the swimming pool, with a dining area and open fireplace, perfect for creating a convivial atmosphere by the pool; guest shower room and WC.

The first floor comprises: master bedroom with en suite bathroom, fitted with bathtub and walk-in shower; second bedroom suite with adjoining bathroom and private rooftop terrace; separate WC.

The second floor is composed of: double bedroom with adjoining shower room and access to a second roof terrace; separate WC; children’s dormitory offering various possibilities.

The lush gardens offer numerous enchanting spots in which to relax and take in the surrounding countryside. Superb views of the Luberon valley below can be enjoyed throughout. The 10m x 5m swimming pool is surrounded by a bucolic walled garden, framed by luxuriant vegetation for complete privacy.

A delightful feature of the property is its carefully crafted wooden treehouse, complete with electricity, perched at the top of a magnificent oak tree, designed by a renowned local artisan. The gravel driveway to the house offers ample parking, in addition to the property's large garage.

Amenities include: professional kitchen with rôtissoire and Lacanche stove; underfloor heating; air conditioning in all rooms except the main living area, which remains naturally temperate; wood-framed double glazing; mains water; internet; security system.

For nature lovers, the surrounding area offers fantastic hiking opportunities, just several kilometres from the nearby Luberon village, home to a café, restaurant, and a small supermarket selling local produce. The property is within easy reach of the lively market town of Apt, the heart of the Luberon, renowned for its popular Saturday market. This region, with its beautiful perched villages and breathtaking views, offers endless opportunities for exploration.
summary: Superbly renovated farmhouse, with swimming pool and views.

title: V2874 MAUBEC
body:
This delightful bastide-style property, set on the edge of the peaceful Luberon village of Maubec, exudes a serene charm combined with modern comfort. The property, enjoying a quiet residential setting, benefits from a south-facing orientation, a wonderfully intimate landscaped garden and superbly chic décor.

The ground floor is composed of: gorgeous dining room with vaulted ceilings, flowing through to the sitting room; sun-drenched sitting room adorned with a wood burning stove; bespoke kitchen with French doors leading to a quaint dining terrace; utility room. The ground floor also comprises a lovely master bedroom with an en-suite, 'his and hers', bathroom and separate shower room, and generous dressing room space.

A graceful staircase takes you up to the first floor. The accommodation upstairs comprises: three double bedrooms; large bathrooms; WC.

The property offers an independent annex, composed of a double bedroom, sitting room area and private shower room.

The house is perched on a quarter-acre plot, promising al fresco delight with a stunning wisteria-draped pergola and a 10m x 5m pool, complete with wrap-around terrace for sunbathing. A covered terrace extends to the south of the dining room.

Amenities include: reversible air conditioning throughout; fibre-optic internet; double-glazing, and wooden frames adding an element of traditional aesthetics; electric gates. The property offers ample parking with a carport.

The property, superbly furnished, is poised to be an exquisite holiday home or attractive rental asset, located conveniently within walking distance to the village, known for its lively atmosphere and numerous amenities.

Nestled at the edge of the tranquil Maubec, this bastide invites its new owners to indulge in the harmony of Provence's historical elegance and today’s conveniences.
summary: Bastide-style property with stunning garden.

title: V2782 MOLLEGES
body:
This lovely property, located in the village of Mollégès, has been thoroughly and thoughtfully renovated, seamlessly integrating traditional Provençal architectural features and a wide range of modern comforts. The property is adorned with gorgeous natural materials and timelessly elegant décor.

The accommodation on the ground floor comprises: kitchen; utility room; bright and spacious sitting room with a beautiful 18th century stone fireplace and exposed wooden beams; guest loo.

The first floor is composed of: three lovely double bedrooms, each with a bathroom en suite, adorned with decorative glazed terracotta tiling and ornate fittings.

The property also features an independent guest house. The ground floor accommodates an open-plan kitchen flowing through to the sitting room. A handsome Napoléon III staircase leads to the first floor, composed of two double bedrooms sharing a bathroom and a loo. A large arched window in the bedroom grants a view on to the local bell tower.

The large walled garden is complemented by a summer kitchen and a terrace shaded by a Pergola, providing the perfect spot for outdoor dining and entertaining. A stone-clad plunge pool, 3m x 2m, and an outdoor shower complete this picturesque setting.

Amenities include: underfloor heating and cooling throughout the ground floor; reversible air conditioning in the bedrooms; mains drainage; double glazing; mains water; electric gates; videophone; garden lighting; fibre optic internet.

Thanks to the well-conceived layout, lofty volumes, exquisite décor and host of modern amenities, this property ensures an exceptional standard of living - in the heart of the Alpilles. The village's shops and restaurants are just a few steps away.
summary: Beautifully renovated village property in the heart of the Alpilles.

title: V3090 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
This charming early eighteenth-century stone property enjoys a peaceful setting in the heart of the elegant village of Cabrières-d’Avignon. It counts the village castle as its most prestigious neighbour. Only a few minutes’ walk to the grocer’s, the baker’s, and the bistro, the property is set within old stone walls, affording complete privacy. The house offers modern conveniences (bathrooms and A/C in every bedroom), whilst showcasing lovely authentic features in each room: exposed wooden beams, stone interior walls, or original floor tiles.

The ground floor includes two bedroom suites, each accessed independently from the garden. Suite 1 consists of: spacious 27m2 bedroom with fitted cupboards; ensuite shower room; separate WC. Suite 2 consists of: bedroom with ensuite bathroom with bathtub and adjacent WC. Also on this floor: laundry room; separate WC; access to small outdoor terrace.

The first floor, accessed via old stone steps leading up from the garden, features: rustic-style equipped kitchen/dining /sitting room with white-washed ceiling beams, stone walls, and attractive fireplace with stone surround; mezzanine for storage; views of the garden and castle from the window. Also on this floor: principal bedroom with magnificent high ceiling, ensuite bathroom with bathtub, separate WC; bedroom with ensuite shower room. 

Outdoors, the walled garden with its mature trees, oleanders, vines, and other flowering plants is delightfully spacious for a village property, providing various areas for relaxing and enjoying the sunny Provençal weather, either on the deck of the 5m x 3m heated pool, its lawn, or under the shade of the outdoor kitchen. Stately mulberry trees provide a natural canopy in the heat of the day, and the eye is drawn to original features such as the abreuvoir (drinking trough) and well. Discreet outdoor lighting ensures that the garden can be enjoyed into the evening for apéritifs and dinner under the stars.

Amenities include: gas-fired heating and reversible A/C in all the bedrooms; fireplace; wrought-iron window frames on the garden floor; mains drainage; mains water; fibre-optic internet; alarm; automatic watering system; parking for two cars within the property, secured by gates. 

This is a rare opportunity to own a turnkey centuries-old property in the historic heart of Cabrières-d’Avignon. The house ticks all the boxes for lovers of peace and authenticity, yet it is only a few minutes’ drive from the renowned villages of Gordes, Roussillon and Ménerbes. Just an hour from Marseille airport and Avignon TGV, it is ideal as either a main residence, a holiday home, or a rental investment.
summary: 18th century village house with pool, walled garden and view of the castle.

title: V3036 TAILLADES
body:
Located on the edge of the charming village of Les Taillades, in the heart of the Luberon, this property of approximately 200 sqm perfectly balances authenticity with modern comfort.

From the moment you step inside, the unique character of the home is revealed through a succession of generously proportioned rooms. The main living area, bathed in natural light, showcases exposed beams and stone walls, creating a warm, refined, and timeless atmosphere.
Adjacent to the living room, a fully equipped professional kitchen meets the highest standards and is complemented by a discreet and practical utility room.
A second living room, featuring original cement tile flooring, has been transformed into a library and offers a more intimate space, ideal for reading or quiet moments of relaxation.  This space can easily be adapted to suit your needs and desires. A hallway flows harmoniously through the ground floor, which also includes a guest toilet.

Upstairs, the 31 sqm master suite enjoys its own private bathroom and benefits from independent access via a staircase leading directly to the main living space. Two additional inviting bedrooms complete this level, along with a dressing room that could easily be converted into a second bathroom, depending on the needs of future owners.

In addition, a 15 sqm air-conditioned guest annex offers a bedroom with en-suite shower and toilet - perfect for hosting family or friends with complete independence. A bright and functional 15 sqm workshop, along with a covered carport, further enhance the outdoor spaces.

The garden, a true haven of greenery, is arranged around a stunning lap pool measuring 13 meters in length and 3 meters in width. Surrounded by majestic century-old plane trees and around forty olive trees, the grounds invite relaxation and contemplation in every season.

Amenities include an automated gate, video intercom, fiber-optic internet, mains water, a well, and automatic irrigation.

Combining peace and proximity to local amenities, this property embodies a discreet and authentic lifestyle in a privileged setting. Whether as a primary residence or a holiday home, it is an ideal place to create lasting memories.

Information on the risks to which this property is exposed is available on the Géorisques website: http://www.georisques.gouv.fr
summary: Authentic Provençal farmhouse with garden, pool and views of the Luberon.

title: V2842 GORDES
body:
In an exclusive and extremely peaceful setting, this house is located within the commune of the world-famous village of Gordes. It has the advantage of a large plot of naturally wooded land (nearly four acres). The house is in need of renovation and modernisation but offers great potential and a terrific one-acre plot of constructible land.

It is predominantly on the ground floor and is made up of: spacious entrance hall; kitchen; laundry-room; sitting-room with chimney; three bedrooms; bathroom; separate w.c; large salon or atelier with mezzanine; second bathroom.

The first floor comprises: spacious landing; one bedroom; considerable attic space with mansard roof.

Amenities include: oil-fired central heating; mains water plus two wells; garage; stone outbuilding; ancient borie with adjoining stone hut (features on the cadastral map).

The property is partially enclosed by stone walls typical of the region and is mostly planted with natural oaks and some pines. This beautiful and predominantly flat south-west facing plot of land offers a lovely view towards Lacoste and the Luberon hills.

The property would serve as a lovely family home, with a wonderful garden, but needs some work. If desired, it is also an extremely interesting project for development of a constructible plot in such a prestigious environnement. The latter is a highly sought-after and valuable asset.
summary: Gordes - villa with exceptional constructible plot of land.

title: V2924 MURS
body:
This charming property, dating back to the Age of Enlightenment, is sure to capture your attention. Located in a historic village, not far from Gordes, in the heart of the Luberon, this exquisite house boasts 230 sqm of meticulously restored living space.

Combining modern amenities with old-world charm, this home exudes a unique appeal. Situated in a village known for its shops and artisans, this delightful property offers an attractive south-facing stone facade and an inviting garden overlooking the picturesque Luberon valley and mountains.

The accommodation, on the garden level, comprises: spacious sitting/dining room with a wood-burning stove; fully equipped 'Fabre' kitchen that blends rustic charm with modern convenience, perfect for enjoying convivial moments. 

The first floor is composed of: three bright double bedrooms; dressing room that can be converted into a bedroom; contemporary bathroom; office area. 

The ground floor accommodates: third bedroom with an en suite shower room; sitting room. This area has an independent entrance and can also serve as a gîte. A magnificent vaulted cellar, a utility room, and a guest toilet complete this level.

Nestled on the southern side of this hilltop village, this authentic property is surrounded by lush greenery, ensuring a wonderfully bucolic setting. Located in the heart of the national park, the village is also a paradise for hikers and cyclists. An opportunity not to be missed.
summary: Stone village property with Luberon views.

title: V3033 SAIGNON
body:
Located in the heart of the charming and authentic village of Saignon, this spacious and beautiful village house enjoys a peaceful setting. Shops, bars, and restaurants are within walking distance, and the lively center of Apt, with its famous market, is just 5 minutes away.

The property has recently been extensively renovated, retaining authentic features such as the terracotta tiles, fireplace, Provençal ceilings and wooden beams to create a warm atmosphere.

The roof terrace offers panoramic views of the Luberon, with magical sunsets in the evening. A private, sunny and sheltered south-west facing garden with a 4m x 7m swimming pool is unique for a village house. A vaulted terrace provides shade and shelter on hot summer days. 

With over 70 m² of cellar space, including a wine cellar accessible from the house, there is plenty of storage space. Several cellars are located at street level, allowing easy storage of bicycles.

The property is accessible by car year-round for dropping off and picking up directly at the door. There is ample parking less than 300 meters away.

The ground floor consists of: a sunny bedroom with an adjoining shower room; separate entrance on the ground floor leading to an apartment with a comfortable sitting area, a fully equipped kitchen, a guest toilet and a spacious bedroom with a shower room and a romantic private balcony.

The ground floor provides access to the vaulted terrace and garden and also includes a technical room and access to the wine cellar.

The first floor houses a large living space with a living room, a dining room with a fireplace, and an open kitchen. The large windows in the dining area offer breathtaking views of the Luberon. The sitting room, both spacious and intimate, opens onto the large terrace, also featuring floor-to-ceiling windows to maximize natural light and take full advantage of the view. 

This partially covered terrace faces southwest to enjoy the sun all day, all year round. With an outdoor barbecue and magnificent sunsets, it's the perfect place to enjoy Provençal evenings with friends and family.

On the second floor is the master bedroom with en-suite shower room, where you can retreat in complete privacy and once again enjoy the panoramic view.

Recently installed technical equipment includes: oil-fired condensing heating and hot water boiler; air conditioning with a heat pump in the living room and ground-floor apartment; double glazing with wooden joinery adding a traditional aesthetic; fibre internet; and large storage spaces spread across four cellars.

The ground floor appartement with a private entrance is ideal for seasonal rental.

This fantastic property is ideal for those seeking the liveliness of one of the most charming villages of the Luberon, but also peace and quiet with panoramic views in their own home.
summary: Spacious village property with garden and pool in Saignon.

title: V2859 MODENE
body:
Ideally located between the villages of Crillon-le-Brave and Caromb, in a picturesque setting, this superb 180m² villa offers particularly impressive views of Mont Ventoux and the surrounding vineyards and historical perched villages.

The accommodation, on the ground floor, comprises: entrance hall leading through to a large sitting room with a dining area and a fireplace; sleek contemporary kitchen; sitting room, lined with floor-to-sliding glass doors, overlooking the garden and offering an incredible view of the surrounding scenery; master suite with adjoining shower room and loo; utility room; shower room; guest loo.

The first floor is composed of: office; large double bedroom; two further double bedrooms; shower room; loo.

The house is surrounded by 2400m² of beautiful grounds, planted with mature trees and complimented by a tiled 10m x 5m swimming pool. The garden has a watering system fed by a private water source, a Pétanque court, automatic gates, a garage and a workshop.

The local shops are located less than 2 km away, and the TGV train station is only a 30 minutes drive from the property.

This superbly maintained villa property is ideal for year-round living, but could also be used as a lavish second home or a rental investment, offering a remarkable location, beautiful gardens, excellent volumes and incredible views.
summary: Close to Bedoin, beautiful villa with garden, swimming pool and sumptuous views.

title: V3056 SAIGNON
body:
This exceptional property, with Saignon’s iconic landmark, Le Rocher, as its backdrop, offers you a delightful get-away with gorgeous panoramic views including Mont Ventoux and the Luberon and Lure mountains. Within walking distance of the heart of the village, with its pretty square, boulangerie and restaurants, this fully detached house is perfectly positioned for enjoying peace and quiet after exploring the Luberon’s famed perched villages, hiking the Colorado Provençal or other local trails, or spending the morning sampling the sights and tastes of Provence, a short drive away, at Apt’s sprawling Saturday market.

The ground floor is composed of: living and dining room with elegant high ceilings and exposed beams, lined with over-sized windows and doors to let in the sunlight and enjoy the sumptuous views; working fireplace with stone surround; office; fully-equipped kitchen; laundry space and mezzanine storage area. The ground floor also comprises a spacious master bedroom with French windows opening out onto a terrace with views towards Caseneuve; a second bedroom; a large bathroom with tub and shower; shower room.

At the top of the stairs is a third bedroom with a Velux window allowing sunlight to pour in; ensuite shower room with WC.

Outside you will find a treasure chest of history. In days of yore, just in front of where the house stands now, was a threshing floor where villagers brought their wheat.  It is thought that the stone fixed in the front terrace was used to grind the grain. The garden, planted with multiple varieties of shrubs, flowers and trees, is more than a third of an acre in size.  It is thoughtfully arranged to provide several spots for enjoying the views, relaxing, dining, sunbathing or keeping cool in the shade.  The 10m x 3.5m pool is heated, and fitted with an electric cover.  Old stone paths known as callades dating back to the seventeenth century lead around the house – some visible at the far side of the house, others buried.  These may have led to the windmill that stood where the house now is.  At the back of the house is a stone jas or shelter for sheep and goats.  

Amenities include: underfloor heating and cooling powered by heat pump; two portable A/C units; mains water and septic tank; Orange broadband; ring alarm; automatic watering system. A garage, parking space for three cars, wine cellar, tool shed and heating control shed complete the picture.

Fully renovated with modern conveniences, this property is unmissable!  On a clear day, you can see as far as the Alpes and always enjoy spectacular sunsets in all seasons from one of the many terraces.  It lends itself perfectly to being either a comfortable family or second home, or a rental investment.
summary: Village house with pool and stunning panoramic views.

title: V2974 ST PANTALEON
body:
Located in a charming countryside setting, a ten minute drive from the world-famous villages of Gordes and Goult, this 18th century Provençal farmhouse exudes timeless elegance, combined with high-quality renovation works. The property lies within a pretty garden, surrounded by stone walls, with views towards the Luberon mountains.

The village of St Pantaléon remains lively year-round; most villagers are full-time residents. Cultural life in the village is rich and varied, and its own café/restaurant remains open throughout the seasons. The starting point for several marked trails, St Pantaléon is particularly attractive for hikers.

Main House:
The ground floor comprises: lovely kitchen with flagstones and exposed wooden beams, equipped with a Lacanche induction range; independent bedroom with ensuite bathroom.

The first floor accommodates: bright and spacious sitting room, adorned with whitewashed ceiling beams and an inviting stone fireplace, opening onto a veranda equipped with electric shutters – perfect for enjoying the views; large bedroom; office; bathroom.

Gîtes:
Steps away from the main house are two charming independent gîtes, the larger of which has been recently redecorated, ideal for hosting guests or generating an attractive rental income.

The first gîte is composed of a sitting room, a bedroom, and a modern shower room, while the second enjoys a fully equipped kitchen and a beautiful open-plan living space with its own bedroom.

The garden offers a peaceful setting, embellished by multiple fruit trees including persimmon and walnut, along with a Japanese pagoda, all providing shade and a lovely array of colours. The property is complemented with a 9m x 4m swimming pool. 

Amenities include: air conditioning throughout; electric heating; automatic watering system; electric gates; fibre optic internet; mains water and water from a private well; septic tank conforming to current regulations; gorgeous vaulted wine cellar; storage shed.

With its generous volumes, lush garden, and independent gîtes, this old farmhouse offers authenticity and a peaceful lifestyle, benefiting from both a beautiful living environment and appealing rental potential. It would be equally suited to being a second home, or a delightful family home, since buses to local schools depart from the village. Just a few minutes’ drive away are bus stops for Avignon TGV station and Cavaillon, with its rail link to Marseille Airport.
summary: Beautiful 18th century stone farmhouse close to Gordes, with two independent gîtes.

title: V3084 GORDES
body:
This superbly authentic 19th-century hamlet house, built in 1836, is nestled in a quiet street in the heart of a sought-after hamlet in the commune of Gordes. Combining traditional Provençal character with modern comfort, the property offers an excellent sense of privacy, combined with wonderfully chic and spacious interiors. The house enjoys a delightful walled garden with various terraces and a lovely swimming pool area, making it a perfect main home or easy-to-maintain Luberon retreat.

The ground floor comprises: inviting entrance hall opening on one side to the sun-drenched sitting room, complete with fireplace and arched wrought-iron French doors leading to the courtyard, and on the other side to a spacious contemporary kitchen. Fully renovated with quartz worktops and sleek white cabinetry, the kitchen comfortably accommodates a dining table for hosting dinners.

The first floor comprises: elegant principal suite complete with an adjoining bathroom with bathtub, shower, and, WC; second double bedroom with lovely terracotta floor tiling (currently used as an artist's workshop); shower room with WC and laundry facilities.

The second floor accommodates a gorgeous third bedroom with en-suite shower room and air conditioning, as well as access to an insulated attic (currently used as storage / dressing room). Pretty Luberon views can be enjoyed from this bedroom.

The outdoor spaces are particularly picturesque: a gravelled courtyard, adorned with potted hydrangeas, oleanders, and ferns, offers multiple areas for entertaining. A wrought-iron staircase leads to the upper terrace, where the swimming pool and surrounding terrace provide an idyllic setting for sunbathing and relaxation. Partially sheltered by a traditionally tiled roof, the pool area enjoys sunlight until late afternoon in the summer months.

Amenities include: oil-fired central heating; reversible air conditioning on the second floor; mains water; well water for the garden; fibre-optic internet; wrought-iron and PVC double-glazing; secure access through a large gate allowing for on-site parking, in addition to public parking nearby.

This delightful property offers an exceptional blend of history and modern comfort, with authentic Provençal features such as terracotta floors, exposed beams, and traditional ceilings preserved alongside elegant renovations. Whether as a year-round home or a second home, this house is ideally located in the heart of the Luberon, with privacy, charm, and character in abundance.
summary: Tastefully remodelled 19th century village house with walled garden and pool.

title: V3096 GORDES
body:
Set on the edge of the world-renowned village of Gordes - just a short walk from its cobblestone streets, lively cafés, excellent restaurants and boutiques - this charming 18th-century stone house offers an exceptional blend of authenticity, comfort and potential. South-facing and full of character, it captures the essence of Provençal living and offers the most breathtaking view of the village of Gordes and the surrounding Luberon valley. The property includes a 425 m² constructible plot of land facing the village with an unrivalled view.

The ground floor comprises: kitchen; sitting room; shower room with utility facilities. The ground floor opens out onto a terrace that overlooks Gordes and the Luberon valley - an ideal spot for morning coffee or an evening glass of rosé.

The first floor accommodates two bedrooms, one of which enjoys a private balcony offering an incredible panorama of the surrounding countryside.

The house sits on a rare constructible plot of land (approximately 425 m²), providing the option to expand the existing property or add features such as a swimming pool, guesthouse or garage.

Amenities include: mains water and drainage; reversible air conditioning; electric hot water heater; water softener; fibre internet.

This property is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity, with exceptional development potential - offering charm, authenticity and one of the most beautiful views in the Luberon, all within walking distance of one of France's most beautiful villages.
summary: Stone house with breathtaking views of Gordes and incredible development potential.

title: V2923 L'ISLE-SUR-LA-SORGUE
body:
This exceptional 160 sqm duplex apartment is located in the heart of L’Isle-sur-la-Sorgue, just steps away from local shops and restaurants. Recently renovated, with superb taste and great modern amenities, it enjoys fabulous views and beautifully proportioned living spaces. 

The first floor accommodates: magnificent and bright living space, with Versailles parquet flooring and a gas fireplace; 8 sqm soundproof office; bathroom; dressing room; guest loo; copper staircase leading up to a gorgeous fully-equipped kitchen with an adjoining south-facing terrace - the terrace offers breathtaking panoramic views of the Luberon countryside as well as the surrounding rooftops; utility room; additional room, that could be used as a workshop or an office.  

A bright staircase leads up to the first floor, bathed in natural light thanks to its glass roof. This floor is composed of : sumptuous master bedroom offering 360-degree views on the rooftops of the 'Venice of Provence' and mountain landscapes; two double bedrooms; shower room. 

Additional amenities include: underfloor heating; reversible air conditioning; mains drainage; mains water; fibre optic internet. 

Thanks to its prime location, the quality of its renovation, great volumes and high end materials, this apartment is unrivalled in its décor, ensures an exceptional standard of modern living. An opportunity not to be missed!
summary: Exceptional apartment with breathtaking views and a lovely terrace, in the heart of L’Isle-sur-la-Sorgue.

title: V2568 TAILLADES
body:
This impressive property offers an open-concept floor plan with spacious and airy volumes, and stunningly landscaped, utterly private grounds. The garden accommodates a luxuriously large swimming pool and a beautiful pond shaded by a mature willow tree. Offering a solid foundation, and full of character, this house requires refreshing and modernisation to create a truly exceptional, personalised home. The 1.5-acre plot is constructible and thus represents an interesting investment opportunity for developers.

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: large entrance hall; open plan kitchen/dining room with large island unit; formal dining room; sitting room arranged around the fireplace; TV room; office or bedroom; entrance hall for rear door leading out to the covered terrace; utility room; guest loo. The ground floor also provides additional, and independently accessed, accommodation comprising two double bedrooms, a kitchenette, and a bathroom with loo. The ground floor is air-conditioned.

The first floor is composed of: master suite with large walk-in wardrobe and a shower room with loo; additional suite with adjoining shower room and loo benefitting from access to a private balcony overlooking the property’s pond; double bedroom; guest bathroom with shower; guest loo.

The second floor comprises: large double bedroom; child’s bedroom; guest loo; attic storage.

The property also benefits from a 2-car garage fitted an electric door and inspection pit.

Outdoor living space is provided by a large west facing covered terrace with a decorative stone pillars. The property also enjoys terraces to the south and east sides, with decorative balustrades, for enjoying the sun at different points of the day. The unusually verdant 1.5-acre garden is entirely hedged, granting complete privacy throughout. The property benefits from a private well that feeds the garden.

Amenities include: reversible A/C; electric radiators; double glazing; mains, Canal de Provence and borehole water source; septic tank conforming to regulations; fibre optic internet; electric gate and garage; automatic watering system. 

The property sits on the western edge of the Luberon with views of the famous mountain and an intimate but not isolated spot, close to all amenities. Beautiful cycling and walking paths lie on the property’s doorstep. This light and elegant property is welcoming for families and children.
summary: Spacious villa property with swimming pool,  1.504 acres of land, of which 0.457 acres is constructible.

title: V3059 BONNIEUX
body:
Beautifully renovated, this 18th-century village house enjoys a prime location in the heart of Bonnieux, nestled in the renowned Golden Triangle. Facing due south, it offers breathtaking panoramic views from the garden.

Full of charm and character, the property comprises an independent 50 m² studio with an open-plan living space that includes a kitchen and dining area, a guest WC, and a shower room — perfect for welcoming guests or generating rental income. The main house features a spacious kitchen and dining room that open onto a south-facing balcony with an authentic wrought iron railing. This level also includes a guest WC and shower room, and leads to a cosy living room with a vaulted ceiling and a stunning exposed natural stone wall.

Upstairs, there are two large double bedrooms, a third smaller bedroom, and a family shower room.

Outside, the terraced garden is a true haven of peace with a 3.5 x 3.5 metre plunge pool, sunny and shaded spots for relaxing, a solarium with spectacular views, and a remarkable wine cellar carved directly into the rock.

The renovation has been carried out using high-quality materials and finishes, including air conditioning throughout, brand new electrical and plumbing systems, polished concrete floors, fibre-optic internet connection, and double-glazed wrought iron windows in some areas. The house also boasts beautiful exposed beams, vaulted ceilings, and stone arches dating back to the 17th century, along with exposed natural stone walls that elegantly reflect the charm of a bygone era.

This exceptional property would make an ideal pied-à-terre in the world-famous hilltop village of Bonnieux, right in the heart of the Golden Triangle, with excellent rental potential if desired.
summary: Charming 18th Century Village House in the Heart of Bonnieux.

title: V3106 VILLARS
body:
A short walking distance from the centre of Villars, much prized by locals for its excellent restaurants, this charming property delights the eye with its traditional stone facade and wooden shutters, topped with an authentic dovecote. Inside, its generous, light-filled living spaces showcase lovingly preserved features, including the vaulted ceiling and stone floor on the garden level, original solid wood doors, Provencal ceilings, exposed stone and wooden beams. The unexpectedly spacious and truly stunning principal suite on the second floor harmoniously unites these latter elements.

The garden floor comprises: fully-equipped eat-in kitchen; scullery with wine fridge; technical room. A few steps lead up to a spacious double bedroom with ensuite shower room and WC; adjoining walk-in closet.

The first floor comprises to the east, a spacious living/dining area with bar and fireplace; adjacent balcony, accessible to the outside via stone steps. A staircase at the end of the room leads to: guest bedroom with WC and vanity. The other side of this floor comprises: office with floor-length bookshelves; guest bedroom; shower room with double vanity and washing machine; separate WC.

On the second floor, the gorgeous principal suite features: impressive sitting room with cathedral ceiling and large picture window, adorned with original wooden shutters, looking out towards the neighbouring village of Saint-Saturnin-les-Apt and beyond to the Vaucluse mountains; spacious bedroom with traditional Provencal ceiling, exposed stone walls, polished wood floors and roomy closet; generous walk-in closet; bathroom with tub, shower, double vanity and WC. A cosy library nook built into the dovecote greets you at the top of the stairs.

The walled garden provides an intimate setting designed for enjoying outdoor living year-round. The generous canopy of the Mulberry tree provides shade during the hotter months for al fresco dining; around the pool there is plentiful space to soak up the sun. The garden is easy-to-maintain with a combination of gravel ground cover and stone paving, flowering shrubs and potted plants.

Amenities include: oil-fired central heating; double glazing throughout; wood-burning fireplace; water softener; mains drains and water; automatic watering system in place; outdoor lighting; fibre internet; closed garage for one car; further parking within and outside of the property.

Move-in ready, this lovely house will captivate its new owners with its authentic Provencal features, generous-sized bedrooms and living area, and magnificent principal 'dovecote' suite on the top floor. The views of the sweeping countryside, taking in lavender fields and vines, are unforgettable. Within easy reach by car of Apt, with its shops, services, and renowned Saturday market, and half an hour from the famed perched villages of the Luberon, this property would be ideal either as a family home or as a second home, with excellent rental potential if desired.
summary: 18th century stone house with walled garden and pool in picturesque Villars.

title: V3063 MURS
body:
A few kilometres from the sought-after village of Gordes, right in the heart of the Luberon, this beautifully restored stone farmhouse perfectly balances authentic Provençal charm with modern elegance. Nestled within an inviting walled garden for complete privacy, the property also boasts a swimming pool – ideal for relaxed afternoons in the sun. The property is located in a peaceful hamlet just minutes away from the picturesque village of Murs, with its emblematic 12th-century fortified castle. Perched at an altitude of nearly 500 metres, the village enjoys cooler summers and a tranquil, natural setting surrounded by oak forests and lavender fields.

The ground floor is composed of: separate sitting room; open-plan dining, living and kitchen space. This chic light-filled area has soft green walls to complement the smart white kitchen cabinetry and pale polished concrete floors, and enhance the warmth of the bricks behind the Laconche range. Adjacent, the spacious sitting room featuring a handsome stone fireplace and exposed white-washed beams, with French windows leading out to the garden. The ground floor also comprises a laundry room, storage space and cloakroom with WC.

The first floor comprises: master bedroom with ensuite shower room and fitted closets; second double bedroom suite with adjoining bathroom; third bedroom; family bathroom; WC; office. Eye-catching coloured tiles in the bathrooms combined with the muted Provençal hues of the décor add to the overall visual attractiveness.

The intimate walled garden is absolutely private – offering shaded spots for al fresco dining as well as places to soak up the sun. Surrounded by greenery from the vines climbing the walls, the grassy nooks, trees, shrubs and flowers, the pool area is lovely and easily accessed from the house.

Amenities include: A/C on the ground floor; electric radiators; mains water and drainage as well as a private well; fibre optic internet. Parking available inside the walls.

This unmissable property has been tastefully updated, and offers a delightful Luberon retreat with timeless appeal and modern convenience in equal measure. It would, furthermore, serve as an investment property for attractive seasonal rental returns.
summary: Pretty stone farmhouse with walled garden and pool.

title: V3099 RUSTREL
body:
Combining traditional features with modern convenience, this lovely 19th century village house sits in the very centre of Rustrel, a bustling village known for its iconic "Colorado Provençal" ochre cliffs. With its restaurants, boulangerie, and grocery store, Rustrel lends itself to comfortable year-round living. Nearby lies the larger town of Apt, renowned for its vibrant Saturday market and wide range of shops and services.

Full of charm and character, and showcasing many authentic features, such as the kitchen's original tiled floor and the stunning Provençal ceiling in the two sitting rooms, the property's tasteful renovation was completed in 2023, using quality materials.

The ground floor comprises: light-filled sitting/dining room with an eye-catching exposed natural stone wall and new windows overlooking the courtyard; dine-in kitchen with sleek cabinetry and new appliances; utility/laundry room; shower room with WC; cosy second sitting room with wheelchair access from the outdoor parking space; access to vaulted cellar.

The first floor is composed of: three spacious bedrooms, one of which has mezzanine storage, each one with ensuite shower-room and WC.

On the top floor: shower-room with WC; ample space well-lit by Velux windows to create two further bedrooms.

Outside, the fully-enclosed courtyard is accessible via the sitting room and kitchen, offering complete privacy for al fresco dining under the shade of a pergola, or a refreshing splash in the plunge pool. The surrounds for the windows and entryways add elegance to the house's original exposed stone façade.

Amenities include: mains drains and water; private parking space; free street parking. Included in the renovation: roof; all electrics and plumbing; polished travertine floors; reversible air conditioning throughout; double-glazed wrought iron window and door frames; fibre internet.

This gem would make an ideal pied-à-terre in a beautiful part of the Luberon, within easy reach by car of the picturesque perched villages of the Golden Triangle and excellent restaurants in nearby Saint-Saturnin-lès-Apt, Villars and Caseneuve. It also has excellent rental potential if desired.
summary: Gorgeous renovated 19th century village house in the heart of Rustrel.

title: V2778 ST DIDIER
body:
Located in a quiet residential area outside of the village of Saint-Didier, this handsome bastide-style property boasts a large open-concept floor plan, a great garden area and a lavishly sized swimming pool. The popular Provençal market village of Saint Didier is located just a short drive from the property’s doorstep.

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: entrance hall with a stone-clad staircase leading up to the first floor; well-equipped kitchen with a large island unit/breakfast bar and sleek Zimbabwe granite worktops; utility room granting access to the carport; adjoining formal dining area; sitting room arranged around a fireplace insert; guest loo. The ground floor also accommodates a beautiful master suite comprising a spacious double bedroom with access to the garden, a shower room with a walk-in shower and double vanity unit, a dressing room, a home office, and a loo. All the living spaces benefit from large French windows that open out onto a generous dining terrace overlooking the garden and the swimming pool. 

The first floor is composed of: three double bedrooms; guest bathroom with a walk-in shower; dressing room; guest loo.

The 0.33-acre garden is home to a terrific 10m x 8m swimming pool, surrounded by a lush lawned area. The kitchen leads out onto an impressive roofed dining terrace fitted with a summer kitchen and a stone barbecue. The garden is entirely fenced and hedged.

Amenities include: underfloor heating and cooling throughout; air-conditioning in the bedrooms; automatic gates; town water; mains drainage; canal water; automatic watering. The property has a large two-car carport, a tool storage room and a technical room.

This attractive and well-conceived property is ideally suited as a well-located family home or spacious Provençal retreat – close to all of the shops and restaurants that Saint-Didier has to offer!
summary: Contemporary bastide with lovely swimming pool.

title: V3043 BONNIEUX
body:
Located on a peaceful cobbled street above the centre of the sought-after Luberon village of Bonnieux (home to boutiques, art galleries, bars, restaurants and a bustling weekly market), this thirteenth century property has been respectfully restored by its present owners to honour its long history. Safekeeping its simplicity, the renovations have been devoted to the preservation of many of the remarkable original features that make it so exceptional. The back of the house is built directly into the rock with a vaulted stone ‘troglodyte’. The exposed stone, centuries-old beams, and hardwood floors with lovely patina, tell a story of steady craftsmanship, using local and natural materials, that has stood the test of time. This is a place of comfort and peace.

The ground floor accommodates: entrance hall with deep cupboards for storage (antique wooden doors); kitchen with Lacanche range and porcelain sink; steps leading down to sun-filled living/dining room with a charming wood-burning stove gracing the stone chimney; double bedroom with ensuite shower room and WC. Adjacent to the hallway: workshop with sink, and cellar built into the stone.

On the first floor via a wooden staircase leading up from the entry way: 18m2 bedroom with fitted closets and antique clawfoot bathtub, and breathtaking views of the Cedar Forest from the window; second bedroom with a tryptic of windows overlooking the valley; family shower room with WC. Doors to the upstairs rooms are partially glazed, allowing the sunlight to stream through. The flooring on this level is all wood.

Renovated over four years, the house offers a soothing palette of earth colours to enhance the sense of space and calm. Attention to detail, down to the vintage style light switch plates and taps, and antique doors, ensures complete harmony in the décor. Original features such as the exposed stone walls, Provençal ceilings, preserved tiled or flagstone floors, provide character and charm.

French windows open out into the walled garden. The terrace, all in stone, surrounded by trees, shrubs, and potted plants, provides shaded areas to enjoy a meal al fresco looking across the valley over the rooftops, or relax and unwind. Protected by a tall stone wall, this space ensures complete privacy and intimacy.

Amenities include: electric radiators; double glazing; bespoke wooden and wrought-iron window frames and doors, using traditional methods; fibre optic internet; mains water; mains drainage. The house has been thoroughly renovated with part of the roof recently replaced and insulated, and newly installed plumbing and electricity. Free public parking close-by.

The renovation reflects a deep respect for the house’s history and soul, as if time stood still. Turnkey ready, it offers a seamless blend of modern comforts with old world authenticity in an historic Luberon village. Just an hour from Avignon TGV and Marseille airport, this is a perfect pied-à-terre for exploring the Luberon or relaxing in the sanctuary of the peaceful interior, or outdoors on the shaded patio. It would make an exceptional year-round home, being in the heart of a bustling village with proximity to four Michelin starred restaurants.
summary: Centuries-old hilltop home in the heart of the village.

title: V2906 GORDES
body:
Located in one of Gordes' hamlets, this spacious 19th-century house has benefited from a complete remodel, combining elegance and traditional Provençal charm.

This authentic stone house is composed of: large and sun-drenched sitting room with a fireplace, opening onto the terrace and courtyard garden; adjoining fully-equipped kitchen opening out onto the terrace; utility/laundry room; cloakroom; home office; magnificent vaulted cellar; guest loo.

A staircase leads up to the first floor, that accommodates: master suite with a splendid view of the Luberon and a private dressing room and a shower room; two further double bedrooms; shower room. These three bedrooms are bathed in natural light and offer great ceiling height.

The south-facing property offers an utterly charming courtyard garden, adorned with a fountain. This courtyard features a roofed dining terrace and an additional seating area shaded by a pergola.  A walled garden enclosed by stone walls offers an additional space for relaxation, complete with a heated pool.

Amenities include: heat pump central heating; air conditioning in living areas; mains water; double glazing; mains drainage; fibre optic internet.

This hamlet house has been tastefully renovated, with terrific innate character, and enjoys a refined and minimalist décor. Located on the desirable commune of Gordes, in the heart of the Luberon's Golden Triangle.
summary: Elegant hamlet house with courtyard, pool, lovely walled garden and Luberon view.

title: V2854 GORDES
body:
Located close to the sought after village of Gordes, this charming stone-clad single-storey villa is surrounded by a lovely landscaped garden with a swimming-pool and a large pool-house furnished for summer living.

The accommodation comprises: large living space with high ceilings, composed of an open plan kitchen, a dining room and a generous sitting room area; master bedroom with ensuite shower room; three double bedrooms with adjoining shower rooms; two WC's; utility room. 

The intimate, well-maintained garden boasts: heated swimming-pool (8m x 4m); pool house; large terrace for al fresco dining; boules pitch. The house also comprises two independent garages and several parking spaces.

Amenities include: reversible air-conditioning; double glazing; fibre optic internet; automatic watering system; mains water; septic tank (conform to regulations); electric gates.

This high quality provencal property offers a peaceful retreat as a main residence, second home or rental investment. Its unique setting and high-quality décor make it an extremely enchanting place to live, promising attractive rental returns.
summary: Contemporary villa located in Gordes.

title: V3066 L'ISLE-SUR-LA-SORGUE
body:
In an unbeatable location for utter peace and quiet, this well-maintained contemporary property is just over five minutes’ drive to the centre of bustling L’Isle-sur-la-Sorgue, famed for its boutiques, restaurants, antique stores and twice-weekly open-air markets.

The ground floor is composed of: entrance hall with closet; open-plan sitting room and dining area with fireplace, opening out to a superb light-filled, air-conditioned fitted kitchen featuring a fan-assisted oven, induction plates and quartz countertops. An ideal spot for gathering family and friends around the sizeable island, the kitchen is south-facing and overlooks the pool, with huge sliding doors leading to the tiled terrace shaded by a motorised bioclimatic style pergola. The ground floor also comprises: two bedrooms with fitted closets; family bath and second WC; office (or bedroom); combined laundry room and back kitchen; guest WC.
 
Adjacent to the main house is an independent studio comprising a bedroom and ensuite shower room. 

The garden, which covers over an acre, is grassed over and planted with mature specimens of native species such as olives and oaks. The 5m x 10m pool is flanked with travertine stone – a beckoning spot to sunbathe or take a dip.  Perfect for keeping small children safe, it is completely secured by a wrought-iron fence and gate. Whether you want to enjoy a meal al fresco, take a nap under a tree, or splash in the pool, this garden has something for everyone.

Amenities include: ducted reversible air conditioning; double-glazing with insect screens in bedrooms and living room; wood-burning fireplace with insert; mains water; septic tank conforming to current regulations; 60m borehole; fibre internet; electric gates; automatic watering system using borehole water. Insulated and tiled garage with electric door; 3-car carport and additional driveway parking space. Garden shed and borie. Crawl space.
  
This home is move-in ready, and full of possibilities for transforming the living space or adding a bedroom. It would serve as a delightful family home, a Luberon retreat (less than an hour from Avignon TGV and Marseille airport) or as an investment property for attractive seasonal rental returns.
summary: Single-storey stone house with large garden and pool.

title: V3091 VENASQUE
body:
Situated on the edge of the desirable village of Venasque, just a short stroll from restaurants, shops, and a bakery, this exceptional property combines authentic Provençal character with modern comforts and timeless elegance. With spacious interiors, lovingly preserved historical details, and a large private garden, it offers both charm and convenience in one of the region's most sought-after settings.

The ground floor comprises: welcoming garden room with exposed beams, working fireplace, and stone floors revealing the original rock foundation; sitting room; dining room; fully-equipped kitchen, cleverly converted from the original wine cellar, complete with a stone countertop cut from a single slab.

The first floor houses: grand salon with ornate wood fireplace, original crown molding, and terracotta tile flooring throughout; three comfortable light-filled bedrooms with impeccable period wallpaper; bathroom with original tiles; separate WC. A spiral stone staircase with wrought iron railing is an architectural highlight of this level.

The enclosed garden is planted with native trees and flowers and includes: generous dining terrace shaded by a pergola; greenhouse/potting shed; swimming pool with complete privacy and open views. The land across the road is part of the property, ensuring protection from any vis-à-vis.

Amenities include: fibre internet; mains water and drainage; oil-fired central heating with radiators; two water heaters; electric gate; window screens; electric shutters in garden room and kitchen; new roof; private parking for several cars.

This property stands out for its authenticity, proportionate spaces, and sun-filled rooms, making it as welcoming as it is elegant. A rare opportunity to own a true Provençal home, perfect as a primary residence, holiday retreat, or rental investment in one of the Luberon’s most picturesque villages.
summary: Elegant home with preserved Provençal character on the edge of Venasque.

title: V2932 VENASQUE
body:
Located within walking distance of the centre of the picturesque village of Venasque, one of France's 100 most beautiful villages, this lovely property offers breathtaking views of the Dentelles de Montmirail and the village remparts, and a wonderfully private garden. Venasque is an easy car ride away from Mont Ventoux.

The accommodation on the ground floor comprises: airy open living space which leads into a dining area, opening onto a splendid terrace with spectacular panoramic views; kitchen; double bedroom with en suite bathroom and loo; guest loo; utility room. 

The first floor accommodates three double bedrooms that share a bathroom. Here, there is plenty of scope for reconfiguring the space.  

The exterior exudes Provencal charm. The fantastic wooded garden of trees and low maintenance shrubs features an 8m x 4m swimming pool with an adjoining covered terrace, ideal for relaxing in the shade. A second terrace, draped with wisteria, runs along the front of the house providing a further shaded outdoor dining area. 

The property also features a pool pump room, a large storage room, a garage and a car port.
 
Amenities include: underfloor heating (ground floor) and electric radiators (first floor); double glazing; mains water; water softener; mains drainage; Fibre internet; fully fenced.  

Thanks to its superb location, adorable pool area and magnificent views, this property offers an idyllic setting, just a few steps away from all the local shops and restaurants that Venasque has to offer.
summary: Charming property with pool and stunning views; walking distance to village.

title: V3126 CHATEAURENARD
body:
Ideally located in a peaceful location in the very heart of Châteaurenard town centre, this fully renovated town house offers exceptional volumes, a spacious garage and multiple possibilities for use, combining comfortable living with strong rental potential.

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: large 50 m²  garage; independent single-storey studio apartment (67 m²) composed of living room, bedroom, bathroom, WC; direct access to a private enclosed garden.

The first floor is composed of: spacious 60 m²  living room flooded with natural light thanks to large picture windows, with the possibility to install the kitchen of your choice; separate pantry; principal suite with bedroom, bathroom, separate WC; second bedroom which may be used as a dressing room.

The second floor comprises: two additional bedrooms; bathroom; separate WC; versatile room suitable for a TV lounge, library, office or gym; insulated attic providing useful storage space.

Outdoor spaces include a private enclosed garden of 50 m²  on the ground floor as well as a generous south-facing terrace of 36 m²  on the first floor with a reinforced structure allowing the installation of a jacuzzi or small plunge pool.

Amenities include: double glazing; reversible air-conditioning; fibre-optic internet possible; mains water; mains drainage; new roof; new electrical and plumbing installations; 50 sqm garage (rare for a town centre).
