A rare opportunity in Châteaurenard, offering generous living space, excellent flexibility and an easy town-centre lifestyle within walking distance of shops and amenities.


Information on the risks to which this property is exposed is available on the géorisques website www.georisques.gouv.fr.
summary: Distinctive town house with independent studio, garden, terrace and garage.

title: V3123 TAILLADES
body:
Situated at the edge of the village of Taillades, this charming stone house, formerly a "bergerie", is located in a quiet residential area. Behind its handsome carriage gates lies a completely private walled garden with an inviting swimming pool area, and separate atelier. The house has been lovingly rebuilt by the current owner, preserving many stunning original Provençal features. It offers both charm and convenience, close to the bustling town of L’Isle-sur-la-Sorgue with its rail link to Marseille airport and proximity to Avignon TGV station.  

The ground floor comprises: fully-equipped Provençal-style kitchen/dining area; adjoining sitting room with the gorgeous original stone staircase, double-height ceilings and attractive French windows leading out to the pool area; cosy fireplace nook; double bedroom with access to a small terrace; shower room and separate WC with storage. This floor’s warmly-coloured terracotta floor tiles, exposed wooden beams, Provençal ceilings and stone arches are a visual reminder of the house’s rich history - including an ancient well serving now as a decorative indoor feature!

The first floor is composed of: principal suite comprising a spacious bedroom; generous bathroom decorated with pretty blue and white tiles; dressing room lined with fitted closets. A third bedroom with views over the Luberon, and adjacent sitting area, are accessible via stairs leading up from the main part of the sitting room.

The second floor accommodates: 43m2 standing-height attic with skylight, offering potential for a home office or fourth bedroom. 

The enclosed garden is planted with elegant cypresses, palm trees, hydrangeas, potted oleanders and other local species. An inviting stone terrace in front of the sitting room provides the perfect spot for outdoor eating or enjoying a glass of rosé at sunset. The saltwater pool is surrounded by a tidy lawn providing space for play and relaxation. At the end of the garden, stunning Moroccan folding doors reveal the summer kitchen. This space would work work equally well as an artist’s atelier or additional outdoor dining area. 

Amenities include: fibre internet; mains water and drainage and canal de Provence water for the garden; automatic watering system; electric radiators; double glazing and bespoke aluminum window frames.

This pretty property is move-in ready, offering privacy and comfort in a one-of-a-kind house. This is a great opportunity to own a true Provençal home, perfect as a primary residence, holiday retreat, or rental investment for those wanting quick access from the TGV station and airport, as well as proximity to the splendours of the Luberon.
summary: Authentic 18th century village house with walled garden and pool.

title: V3050 LACOSTE
body:
Nestled at the edge of the picturesque hilltop village of Lacoste, in the heart of the Luberon's sought-after Golden Triangle, this charming 17th-century stone cottage sits on a 1.62-acre plot enhanced by a swimming pool. Ideally located, the property offers a peaceful setting within a short distance of the village's shops and amenities.

The property is composed of two separate buildings connected by a terrace and balcony, allowing for great flexibility in the layout.

The main house, arranged over two levels, offers: sitting room with a gorgeous old stone archway, a fireplace and French doors granting direct access to the outdoors; adjoining dining room; kitchen with an additional dining area; a cosy TV room; a shower room with WC; and a study.

The first floor is composed of: three bedrooms; bathroom; WC.

In a separate wing, easily accessible via the connecting terrace, an en-suite bedroom benefits from its own private entrance and a kitchenette - ideal for hosting guests or family in complete privacy. This part of the house is located above a 28 m² garage, offering generous storage space or the possibility of housing a classic or collector’s vehicle.

Outside, the natural, shaded garden, dotted with pine trees, invites you to relax to the soothing sound of cicadas. The 12m x 6m swimming pool and pétanque court sit harmoniously within this quintessentially Provençal setting.

Amenities: electric heating; wood-burning stove; single glazing; mains water; custom-made fly screens.

Some refreshing and renovation work will allow the full potential of this charming property to be revealed - a true haven of peace in Provence.
summary: 17th-century stone cottage, with swimming pool, in the heart of the Luberon.

title: V3002 TAILLADES
body:
This impressive property offers an open-concept floor plan with spacious and airy volumes, and stunningly landscaped, utterly private grounds. The garden accommodates a luxuriously large swimming pool and a beautiful pond shaded by a mature willow tree. Offering a solid foundation, and full of character, this house requires refreshing and modernisation to create a truly exceptional, personalised home. 

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: large entrance hall; open plan kitchen/dining room with large island unit; formal dining room; sitting room arranged around the fireplace; TV room; office or bedroom; entrance hall for rear door leading out to the covered terrace; utility room; guest loo. The ground floor also provides additional, and independently accessed, accommodation comprising two double bedrooms, a kitchenette, and a bathroom with loo. The ground floor is air-conditioned.

The first floor is composed of: master suite with large walk-in wardrobe and a shower room with loo; additional suite with adjoining shower room and loo benefitting from access to a private balcony overlooking the property’s pond; double bedroom; guest bathroom with shower; guest loo.

The second floor comprises: large double bedroom; child’s bedroom; guest loo; attic storage.

The property also benefits from a 2-car garage fitted an electric door and inspection pit.

Outdoor living space is provided by a large west facing covered terrace with a decorative stone pillars. The property also enjoys terraces to the south and east sides, with decorative balustrades, for enjoying the sun at different points of the day. The unusually verdant garden is entirely hedged, granting complete privacy throughout. The property benefits from a private well that feeds the garden.

Amenities include: reversible A/C; electric radiators; double glazing; mains, Canal de Provence and borehole water source; septic tank conforming to regulations; fibre optic internet; electric gate and garage; automatic watering system. 

The property sits on the western edge of the Luberon with views of the famous mountain and an intimate but not isolated spot, close to all amenities. Beautiful cycling and walking paths lie on the property’s doorstep. This light and elegant property is welcoming for families and children.
summary: Spacious villa property with swimming pool.

title: V3040 BONNIEUX
body:
This elegant property is located in the heart of the Bonnieux valley, overlooking the picturesque villages of Bonnieux and Lacoste. It is the ideal home for couples who are seeking a hazard free pied-à-terre in the Luberon. The property is surrounded by one hectare of land offering an idyllic setting with olive trees, lavender, a vegetable garden and vineyards. 

The property comprises off : a generous living area with terrace doors to maximize the views of the valley. The open plan kitchen with high-tech appliances has direct access to the garden. The spacious bedroom with ample cupboard space is serene and offers views of Lacoste. 
A modern bathroom with walk-in shower, a large sink, washing machine and toilet is generous and chic. 

The second room is currently used as a dressing, but could also be an office or a guest room with space for a double bed. 

The garden with its many terraces’ bathes in sunlight throughout the day and has picture perfect views from every corner. A large 8x4 pool enhances the holiday joys, as does the barbeque area located under the old pine trees. Part of the terrain consists of vineyards, which are maintained by a local wine maker. You will obviously get your fair share of the wine. 

Amenities include : A/C throughout the property ; thermodynamic water heater ; double glazing ; mosquito screens ; fibre internet ; large storage space ; ample parking space and solar panels on the roof ensure neglectable energy bills. 

The property was built in 2021 with a 10 years warranty for all construction and amenities and is very easy to maintain. The smart layout, high (cathedral) ceilings, large windows and efficient use of square meters provide a generous sense of space throughout the property.

This chic, yet practical property is the perfect holiday spot for those who want to enjoy a carefree Luberon lifestyle. It has all the sought-after villages of the area nearby and embodies the true Provencal dream. With ample chambres d’hôtes in proximity for your guests, you can keep this little gem just for yourself.
summary: Elegant villa in the Bonnieux valley.

title: V2816 VENASQUE
body:
In the heart of the desirable village of Venasque - listed among the most beautiful villages in France - this charming 284 m² house offers utterly superb views of the surrounding countryside and Mont Ventoux. The property benefits from a courtyard, several terraces, and a lovely garden with far-reaching views, providing a variety of outdoor spaces to enjoy throughout the seasons.

Currently arranged as two independent dwellings, the property offers flexibility of use and could easily be reconfigured as a single family house if desired.

The first house comprises: entrance hall leading to a vast open-plan living space, with an adjoining kitchen and dining area, complete with a fireplace; two double bedrooms, each with an ensuite bathroom and incredible views of the surrounding landscape.

The second house, located on the garden level, is accessed via the courtyard or by an external staircase. This portion of the property includes: generous sitting room carved into the rock; open-plan kitchen; two bedrooms; shared bathroom; laundry room. A workshop and a wine cellar complete the accommodation.

This bright and characterful property offers many original features and a great deal of charm. With a few refreshing works, this house could become both a superb pied-à-terre and a sound investment. It would make a superb year-round residence, second home, or seasonal rental investment. The shops and restaurants of the village centre are within walking distance, and Avignon TGV station can be reached in just 40 minutes.
summary: Authentic stone village house with large walled garden and incredible views.

title: V3035 MALEMORT DU COMTAT
body:
This contemporary property offers generous living space, a large heated swimming pool, and breathtaking views of Mont Ventoux and the surrounding countryside. Multiple terraces encircle the house, providing perfect spots for al fresco dining, relaxing in the sun, or simply enjoying the landscape in every season.

The main level comprises: spacious open-plan kitchen and bright dining area, which flows seamlessly into a bright living room with exposed beams and an open fireplace; two bedrooms share a bathroom and WC; utility room; guest WC. 

The first floor accommodates a gorgeous principal bedroom with its own bathroom with bathtub and separate shower, along with access to a private terrace from which you can enjoy superb views on the Mont Ventoux and surrounding countryside. 

The lower level is composed of: large games room, which could easily be converted into a generous principal suite, office or studio space; boiler room; extensive storage; garage.

A standout feature of the home, the 12m x 5m heated swimming pool is surrounded by terraced gardens and a lovely pool house with indoor shower and WC - ideal for summer entertaining or quiet afternoons in the sun.

Amenities include: oil-fired central heating; wood-framed double glazing; mains water. 

Carefully renovated with attention to detail, the house is presented in excellent condition and ready to move into. Set in the picturesque hills near the village of Venasque, it’s just a short drive from Carpentras and around an hour from the Avignon TGV station. Equally suited to year-round living or as a holiday home.
summary: Contemporary property with magnificent view of Mont Ventoux and heated pool.

title: V3047 MENERBES
body:
This historic property, with unobstructed south-facing views of the Luberon, enjoys a coveted spot on a quaint cobblestone street, just steps away from the highest point of Ménerbes, one of the much-prized perched villages in the renowned Golden Triangle. A former convent, the property’s neighbours are the imposing clocktower and similar centuries-old buildings, gorgeous examples of the noble and ornate stonework of medieval architecture. The house is freshly redecorated, yet particular attention has been paid to preserving the authenticity of the property, such as for the lovely floor in the sitting room.

The property comprises on the ground floor: spacious entrance hall leading to the authentic stairwell; buanderie and cave. 

On the first floor: sitting room of calming aesthetic simplicity, as befits a former convent, with its graceful arches, old double wooden doors, stone fireplace and tall windows looking out to the mountains; kitchen (with access to its own 20m2 terrace) fitted with wooden cabinets and granite countertops and equipped with a fridge, dishwasher, cooktop, oven and microwave; guest WC.

On the second floor: spacious master bedroom with its decorative fireplace and plentiful cupboards; bathroom with tub, shower, sink and WC; office space (could serve as a bedroom) with access to upper terrace.  

Up a small flight of stairs is a further bedroom with shower and terrace, offering endless possibilities for customisation. Enjoy views over to Le Mourre Nègre – the highest point of the Luberon!

Amenities include: electric heating; fireplace; ADSL internet; mains water; mains drainage. 

This is a unique property which has been lovingly maintained and renovated over the years, whilst retaining many of its original features including traditional tiles, doors and the fireplace. With three separate terraces and gorgeous views, this house, with abundant Provençal charm, is a must-have for lovers of French village life, and, of course, fans of Peter Mayle’s ‘A Year in Provence’.
summary: Ménerbes village: 16th century convent with splendid views of the Luberon.

title: V3034 LAGNES
body:
Located in the heart of the charming village of Lagnes, just a stone’s throw from local shops and amenities, this property offers the perfect blend of authenticity and convenience in a highly sought-after setting. With natural light streaming throughout it, the house enjoys a bright, sun-filled atmosphere all day long.

The ground floor accommodates: an entrance hall lined with elegant glass French doors; a welcoming dining room; a fully renovated kitchen fitted with quality materials and high-end finishes; and a guest WC.

The first floor comprises: a cosy sitting room currently used as a TV lounge; a more spacious second sitting room featuring a beautiful fireplace and opening onto a balcony – ideal for enjoying the village atmosphere. This level also includes an independent studio with bedroom, bathroom, WC, kitchenette and dining area. The studio benefits from its own separate entrance, offering flexibility for guests or rental potential.

The second floor offers: two charming bedrooms sharing a bathroom with loo, along with a dressing room and a study, which could easily be converted into an additional bedroom, if desired.

Throughout, exposed beams and traditional Provençal ceilings highlight the character of the house.

Outside, a private inner courtyard provides a peaceful and intimate setting, ideal for outdoor dining.

Amenities include: oil-fired central heating; double glazing; fibre optic internet; mains water; mains drainage.The house also enjoys a cellar and a private parking space - a rare asset for a village house.

With its character, lovely renovations, and delightful outdoor space, this property offers comfortable and convenient living, in this sough-after Luberon village.
summary: Charming village house, in the heart of Lagnes.

title: V3095 GOULT
body:
Perched at the top of the sought-after village of Goult, just steps from the historic windmill, this beautifully renovated stone studio offers a rare combination of authentic Provençal charm, refined materials, and breathtaking views over the Luberon valley. Goult is one of the most desirable villages in the region, known for its vibrant atmosphere and multiple amenities - including a bakery, small grocery store, cheese shop, butcher's shop, boutiques, and restaurants - all within walking distance of the property. 

The house was the subject of a complete renovation, completed in 2024, using only the highest-quality materials. Egyptian stone floors, Portuguese marble kitchen countertops with vintage Italian stone sink and unlaquered deVol tap, and Chabaud beams and floorboards blend seamlessly with Portes Antiques doors and carefully chosen finishes, creating a home that feels both character-filled and contemporary. 

The lower level comprises a kitchen designed with both practicality and elegance in mind, alongside a charming bathroom featuring a classic clawfoot tub. Upstairs, a lofted bedroom with integrated closet space makes clever use of its open layout and natural light, offering comfort while maintaining the studio's cozy charm. 

One of the property's rarest features is its private 150m² garden - a peaceful haven with a stone fountain, lush plantings, and panoramic valley views. Whether enjoying a morning coffee, an evening apéritif, or a quiet afternoon under the Provençal sun, this outdoor space makes the home truly special. 

Amenities include: reversible air-conditioning; electric hot water heater; mains water and drainage; double-glazed windows; automatic watering and drip irrigation in the garden; fiber internet. 

Perfect as a romantic pied-à-terre, an idyllic holiday home, or a charming gîte, this stone retreat captures the very essence of village living in Provence - where history, lifestyle, and craftsmanship meet in a setting of rare beauty.
summary: Renovated stone studio with private garden and panoramic views in the heart of Goult.

title: V2899 MENERBES
body:
This exquisite 18th-century farmhouse stands out as a distinctive property, located just a few kilometres from the legendary Luberon village of Ménerbes. The property not only enjoys an unrivalled location, gorgeous interior volumes, and timelessly elegant décor, but also features 5.6 acres of impeccably maintained grounds that encompass the farmhouse. A truly extraordinary property in one of France’s most picturesque regions, it offers unparalleled privacy and splendid views of the surrounding countryside.

The accommodation, on the ground floor, comprises: entrance hall with stone staircase; cloakroom; outstanding open-concept kitchen fitted with La Cornue appliances, with a large dining area, perfect for entertaining family and guests; south-facing sitting room with a handsome dressed-stone fireplace; utility and technical room; bright breakfast room with oversized wrought-iron French doors leading out to the east and west courtyards; ground floor master suite with en suite bathroom and patio doors to the courtyard.

The first floor accommodates: double bedroom suite with en suite bathroom; impressive second master bedroom with large dressing room area; large bathroom with bathtub and walk-in shower; spacious double bedroom.

As you approach the property, an impressive driveway lined with stately cypress trees and lavender provides a terrific sense of arrival.  A picturesque east-facing courtyard, adorned with elegant wrought-iron doors, provides a serene spot to relax while overlooking the beautiful landscaped grounds. An additional courtyard to the west of the farmhouse provides an intimate setting for outdoor dining and entertaining. Stone steps from the courtyards lead up to the traditional bassin-style salt-water swimming pool (measuring 15m x 6m and equipped with an automatic cover).

The property also boasts a meticulously maintained tennis court, complete with overhead floodlights. The surrounding grounds are a testament to careful landscaping, featuring lawned areas accented by centenary olive trees, manicured shrubs, and aromatic herbs. The grounds are also home to carefully tended vines, further enhancing the beauty and effortless Provençal appeal of this remarkable property.

Amenities include: air-conditioned wine cellar; underfloor heating/cooling; air-conditioning in the bedrooms; water softener; fibre optic internet; mains water; Canal de Provence water; automatic watering system with sprinklers; outdoor lighting; Petanque court; sophisticated alarm system; central vacuum. The garden is entirely fenced and has electric gates.

With a seamless blend of historical character and modern luxury, this Luberon farmhouse epitomises refined living, in a peaceful countryside location, but only 5 minutes from arguably the most desirable village of the Luberon's Golden Triangle.
summary: Beautifully renovated Luberon farmhouse.

title: V2973 ROUSSILLON
body:
This lavish 18th-century stone farmhouse property lies in the heart of the Luberon valley, close to the desirable perched villages of Roussillon, Goult, and Gordes. Offering a prime rural location, gorgeous volumes, and state-of-the-art modern amenities, the property is surrounded by more than 14 acres of landscaped grounds, including private olive groves, vineyards, and immaculate woodland. A stunning blend of Provençal character and contemporary elegance, and complimented by unrivalled craftsmanship, it provides complete privacy and breathtaking views of the rolling Luberon countryside.

The accommodation, on the ground floor, comprises: formal entrance hall leading to the dining room and a superbly crafted bespoke kitchen, equipped with an Ilve induction cooker, open fireplace, and adjoining utility room; summer room lined with wrought-iron French doors opening out and providing unbroken panoramic views; double-height sitting room with dressed-stone fireplace, Versailles parquet flooring, and oversized arched windows that fill the space with natural light; wrought-iron staircase leading to the mezzanine and stone steps descending to the vaulted wine cellar; orangery with charming terracotta tiles and mezzanine, leading to the pigeonnier fitted with a shower room and WC; small guest bedroom. The ground floor boasts handsome stone flooring, complemented by a warm and thoughtfully curated colour palette.

The first floor accommodates: master suite with an adjoining shower room featuring decorative cement tiling, along with a private office that opens onto a balcony overlooking the gardens and Luberon valley below; two further spacious double bedroom suites, each benefitting from an adjoining shower room. Every bedroom is air-conditioned and finished with oak wood parquet flooring, elegant wallpapers, and contemporary colour schemes, showcasing exceptional attention to detail and craftsmanship.

As you arrive, a stately cypress-lined driveway provides an exceptional sense of arrival. The south-facing courtyard terrace is shaded by a magnificent plane tree and opens onto a manicured lawn dotted with mature olive trees, extending out to meet beautifully maintained grapevines. Terraces surround the farmhouse, embellished by dry-stone walls, climbing rosemary, and tall cypress trees. The grounds feature a superb tiled, heated swimming pool measuring 20m x 5m, equipped with an automatic submerged cover and set against the backdrop of vineyards and the Luberon mountains. Over 300 olive trees, yielding close to one ton of olives annually, and private vineyards encompass the property, ensuring the utmost privacy and intimacy.

Amenities include: geothermal underfloor heating and cooling throughout the property; air-conditioning in the bedrooms; recently installed solar panels; water softener; fibre optic internet; mains water and Canal de Provence; private well with an automatic watering system; extensive outdoor lighting; sophisticated security and alarm system; septic tank conform to regulations; fully enclosed garden with electric gates. Additional features include a quadruple carport with storage for garden equipment, as well as a utility room and technical space housing the heating system.

This property seamlessly blends timeless Provençal charm with modern luxury, offering an idyllic retreat in one of the most prized parts of the South of France - the famed Luberon valley.
summary: Lavish Luberon estate, set on over 14 acres of land.

title: V2643 BONNIEUX
body:
This magnificent bastide is set in an exceptional location with incredible open views to the surrounding countryside. A smart driveway lined with olive trees leads to this beautiful 19th century property. Surrounded by vineyards and in the heart of the Luberon countryside, the house is located only a few minutes by bicycle from the highly desirable village of Bonnieux.

Two sunny terraces welcome visitors to this exquisitely decorated home and its landscaped grounds, which include 35 olive trees, a magnificent rose garden and a generously proportioned 15 metre heated swimming pool with adjacent dining terrace and barbecue.

The comfortable and generous living space on the ground floor, comprises : a sitting-room with fireplace and two large windows; a light-filled informal television room with four sets of French doors all leading into the garden or onto paved terraces; an entrance hall with guest cloakroom; a stunning, made-to-measure kitchen with large open-plan dining area and floor-to-ceiling sliding doors leading onto a shaded outdoor dining terrace; a pantry/laundry also with access to the terraces.

On the upper floors the accommodation extends to : on the first floor, a sunny landing; two spacious double bedrooms, each with their own shower-room; the second floor offers two further generous bedrooms and a well-appointed bathroom with separate shower.

In addition to the main house : a stone outbuilding provides a prettily decorated bedroom and shower-room. Meticulously designed and maintained, the property’s garden and grounds benefit from access to a private water source and automatic irrigation system. There is ample parking for numerous cars and a separate stone garage provides useful storage space or parking for a small vehicle. 

Other ameniteis include : electric entrance gates; mains water; electified fencing around the perimeter of the property; a discreetly situated rainwater storage tank with pump which feeds the watering system.  

This lovely bastide has been renovated the with great care and style to create an impressively comfortable and attractive property with plentiful entertaining space, inside and out. Whether as a full-time residence, a second home or as a rental investment, the incredible open views, wonderful accommodation and proximity to Bonnieux make this a highly desirable property.
summary: Elegant Bastide, breathtaking views and large heated pool.

title: V2792 BONNIEUX
body:
This exquisite 18th century bastide, located close to the Luberon village of Bonnieux, enjoys striking panoramic views, tremendous innate character and meticulously landscaped grounds. The property has been masterfully renovated with the highest quality natural materials, and finished to an incredible standard.

The accommodation on the ground floor comprises: particularly grand 'foyer'; well-equipped kitchen and dining-room; office / library; charming drawing-room with large authentic stone fire-place; guest loo. Breath-taking views of the valley below can be enjoyed throughout.

The first floor is composed of: stunning master suite with an adjoining bathroom, dressing room and loo; lovely suite with a large adjoining bathroom and loo; double bedroom suite with an adjoining shower room and loo. The suites are adorned by tall French windows that drench the interior with natural light, authentic terracotta tiles, and ornate marble fireplaces. The shower rooms and bathrooms feature wrought-iron bathtubs or walk-in showers, moroccan Zélige tiling and the highest quality Catchpole and Rye fittings, lavatories, and basins.

The second floor accommodates a fourth suite with an adjoining shower room and loo. 

The creative concept of the gorgeously landscaped garden captures the elegance and beauty as it unfolds before you with its different levels, each of which has a unique interest. A variety of secluded spots allow for contemplation and admiration of the outstanding scenery and spectacular sunsets. The heated swimming-pool (12m x 4m) has been beautifully incorporated into the landscape, embellished by a flagstone terrace and encompassed by lush lawns and centuries-old olive trees. A spacious dining terrace runs along the front of the Bastide, setting the scene with manicured plantations that immediately conjure up the poetic quality of this tremendously unique property.

A large original vaulted wine cellar, a pool house with a summer kitchen and loo, secure parking, and a garage complete the property.

Amenities include: underfloor heating and cooling (fed by a newly-installed heat-pump); fibre optic internet; electric gates; sophisticated alarm system; automatic watering system; town water; water softener.

An exclusive Luberon retreat with an unrivalled natural setting, spectacular Luberon views and an exquisitely renovated interior. Located close to the sought-after perched villages of Bonnieux, Lacoste and Goult.
summary: Bonnieux - Beautiful Bastide, terraced garden with magnificent  views

title: V2922 GORDES
body:
An enchanting tree-lined driveway leads you to this exquisite stone property,  surrounded by over 1.5 hectares of grounds, the epitome of Provençal charm and elegance. 

This property offers approximately 360m² of luxurious living space with underfloor heating and cooling throughout.

The upper ground floor features: grand entrance hall complete with a cloakroom and wc, setting the tone for the volume and elegance that pervades the entire home; expansive and light filled sitting room with authentic stone fireplace, seamlessly opening onto the terrace; TV room, ideal for unwinding ; spacious, extremely well-equipped kitchen/diner that flows to the covered summer dining area, with the breathtaking views of the Luberon; vast utility room with direct access to the triple garage, offering convenience and ample storage.

Lower Ground Floor includes: a magnificent master suite featuring an elegant, bespoke dressing room, a spacious bathroom, and a private study; three other generously sized ensuite bedrooms, each with impressive volume and ceiling height (3 of the bedrooms have private access to the terrace and gardens beyond) an additional utility room and a gym complete this floor.

Guest Annexe
The charming guest house comprises: a lovely sitting room with an open-plan kitchen/diner; comfortable bedroom, modern bathroom and a separate wc.

Outdoor Features
The 15 x 6 m swimming pool is a true delight, framed by dry stone walls and surrounded by indigenous plants and trees. It features an automatic cover and is encircled by a wooden decking. For added comfort, there is a changing room, shower, and WC.

The expansive 1.5-hectares of  grounds include beautifully landscaped gardens around the house and various areas that are both wooded and open.
A dedicated petanque area with unbroken views of the famous cliffs of Roussillon and Lioux is perfect for leisurely afternoons.

This sublime property is a unique opportunity to experience the luxurious and serene Provençal lifestyle. It enjoys enchanting grounds, elegant living spaces, unparalleled views and all this just a 10 minutes walk from the the world famous village of Gordes.

For more information on the risks to which this property is exposed, please visit the Géorisques website: www.georisques.gouv.fr.
summary: Spacious, authentic stone property with stunning views and swimming pool

title: V2649 L'ISLE-SUR-LA-SORGUE
body:
The Domaine is ideally located between L'Isle sur la Sorgue and the Luberon valley. The property is accessed by an elegant driveway lined with cyprus trees and lavender.  The wrought iron gates open to reveal the heart of the fabulous views of the Luberon and the Monts de Vaucluse beyond.

The grounds include 350 olive trees, landscaped gardens, a stunning natural stone heated swimming pool 14m x 6m and a dedicated well-being area.

The 200 year old mulberry tree offers shade throughout the summer months and bears witness to the age of the farm.
A pathway leads from the fountain to the traditional and quintessential 'boules' area.

The renovation has created an exquisite blend of authentic and contemporary design that successfully combines comfortable modern living with traditional architecture and materials. 

The main houses comprises , on the ground floor: a veranda which offers 65m2 of open plan living space with views of the Monts de Vaucluse; spacious dining room with fireplace; professionally equipped kitchen; guest wc; spacious double bedroom with ensuite bathroom opening onto the interior courtyard .
The first floor comprises: 2 double bedrooms enjoying the same contemporary style  with ensuite bathrooms.

A private terrace under the plane tree brings us to a 50m2 suite that includes sitting room , bedroom and bathroom with views of the Monts de Vaucluse and the interior courtyard. 
Connected to the main property but also with independent access the 5th bedroom with ensuite bathroom has an intimate private terrace.

 There is also the possibility to further optimise the atelier if further space is required.

The area 'well-being ' has a particularly peaceful setting, perfect for enjoying the facilities that include:
Massage room 
Sauna (Harvia)
Jacuzzi 
plunge pool 
Outdoor gym
Shower & wc

With it's high quality renovation and attention to detail this sumptuous Domaine would make an ideal family residence or a business venture.
summary: 18th century Stone farmhouse set in 2 hectares of landscaped gardens

title: V2486 GORDES
body:
Surrounded by vineyards and set on over three acres of olive orchards, this early 18th century farmhouse enjoys stunning views, utter tranquillity, and living spaces steeped in Provençal character.  

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: impressive foyer with tall stone archways; sitting room with ornate stone fireplace; second sitting room; dining room; contemporary Fabre kitchen with island unit; utility room; guest loo; large storage room with adjoining wine cellar; boiler room; additional storage room. French windows adorn the south-facing sitting and dining rooms, granting access to a large terrace and the garden beyond.

The first floor is composed of: master suite with adjoining bathroom complete with double vanity and shower; equally spacious double bedroom with adjoining shower room; double bedroom; double bedroom with overhead mezzanine; single bedroom; hallway with fitted cupboards; guest shower room. A family suite on this floor enjoys a spacious double bedroom, additional bedroom or sitting room, kitchenette, and shower room. This suite benefits from an independent access and a private terrace shaded by a mature hackberry tree. Both the master and the family suite have been fitted with air-conditioning units.

The second floor comprises a hallway with storage, study, double bedroom and a shower room.

This impressive and truly authentic stone farmhouse is embellished by century-old stone arches, vaulted ceilings, terracotta flooring, Provençal ceilings and beautiful decorative hardwood doors. The abundance of character that flows throughout the house is complemented by a modern central heating system, sleek kitchen, and a modern alarm system, to ensure easy living, as a primary residence or a second home.

A sprawling stone-slabbed terrace extends from the house to the south and wraps round to the west. Mulberry and hackberry trees, and a pergola provide shade to the various seating and dining areas, with meticulously trimmed shrubs setting boundaries between each space. A path leads to the swimming pool area just beyond. The 10m x 5m swimming pool is adorned with a generous travertine terrace and enjoys beautiful views of the Luberon to the south and of vineyards to the west.

The grounds are home to a garage with and adjoining storage room, a technical room located next to the property’s well (housing the automatic watering system and system for the electric fence), and the pump and filter room for the swimming pool.
summary: Superbly authentic farmhouse with unrivalled views

title: V2572 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
Nestled in the serene oak woodland that surrounds the sought-after village of Cabrières-d’Avignon, this unique Luberon property has been meticulously re-imagined with organic materials and a timelessly elegant décor. The property is complemented by intimate and manicured grounds, magnificent views, and a heated swimming pool.

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: foyer; bespoke kitchen with central island unit and a Provençal ceiling; impressive dining room with French doors leading out to the patio and the garden beyond; spacious sitting room with ornate stone fireplace; double bedroom; guest shower room and loo; additional bedroom or office; well-equipped utility room/larder. Natural stone flooring, stone archways and high ceilings impart an air of stateliness to the living spaces, enhanced by the abundance of natural light that floods in through the French windows. 

The first floor is composed of: spectacular master suite lined with French windows, benefitting from a lavishly spacious bathroom with a shower and loo; additional bedroom suite with shower room and loo; double bedroom; guest shower room and loo. Stunning views of the Luberon can be enjoyed from all these first-floor bedrooms. Natural pine flooring flows throughout. The first floor is entirely air-conditioned.

The property enjoys 0.76 acres of private woodland and well-maintained gardens. The house sits centred on the plot. A terracotta tiled terrace adorned with a pergola extends out from the kitchen, providing the perfect spot for intimate gatherings or family dinners. An additional seating area shaded by truffle oaks provides a remarkably idyllic setting and a welcome escape from the hot summer sun. A 10m x 5m heated swimming pool completes the property and is surrounded by a large travertine terrace. The pool is equipped with an automatic safety cover.

Features include a gas-fired central heating system, air-conditioning in the first-floor bedrooms, an alarm system, automatic gates, and an intercom. A carport and additional parking can be found to the rear of the property. The plot is entirely fenced.

This exclusive property shines through its authentic and intricate features, open flow yet clear definition of spaces, and particularly stellar location. The local boulangerie, butcher’s and grocers are only a short walk from the property’s doorstep.
summary: Prestigious stone villa with impressive Luberon views

title: V2860 ST SATURNIN LES APT
body:
This beautiful property is located in a dominant position overlooking the Luberon valley, just a short distance from the lively village of Saint-Saturnin-lès-Apt. The property enjoys a wonderfully peaceful setting and is encompassed by a manicured landscaped garden. Enriched with timeless Provençal character, the interior incorporates contemporary amenities of a high standard.

The ground floor comprises: large well-equipped kitchen with adjoining dining area; cosy sitting room with a handsome stone fireplace; master bedroom with an en-suite bathroom; large utility room with built-in cupboards.

The lower level accommodates a billiard room, a large wine cellar and ample storage space.

The first floor is composed of: three large double bedrooms, each with an en-suite shower room.

A charming annexe in the garden completes the property, featuring a large double bedroom, lined with oversized wrought-iron windows, and an adjoining bathroom.

Amenities include: geothermal central heating; mains water; septic tank; water-softener; electric fence; automatic gates.

The property offers a tremendous amount of character and gorgeous architectural details (decorative cement tiles, tommettes, waxed concrete, and wonderful antique door cupboards in every room). These features underscore the property's excellent condition and refined taste.

The two-and-a-half-acre garden, unfolds elegantly before the house. These grounds feature a 12m x 4m swimming pool (equipped with a submerged cover) surrounded by a lush lawn and shaded by tall pine trees. The property also enjoys a large roofed terrace overlooking the garden and the Luberon valley.

The property lies just a kilometre from the desirable village of Saint-Saturnin-lès-Apt, home to a great number of shops, cafés and restaurants (amongst many other amenities). It also enjoys proximity to the vibrant market in the regional town of Apt.
summary: Saint-Saturnin-lès Apt - wonderfully authentic property with Luberon views

title: V2868 OPPEDE
body:
Nestled in the heart of the splendid Provençal countryside, this Mas and its annex are set across nearly two acres of immaculately maintained grounds. The property’s traditional Provençal décor and stunning setting deliver an unparalleled level of charm - in a privileged part of the Luberon's Golden Triangle.

Main house:
The ground floor comprises: spacious and elegant sitting room adorned with a stone fireplace; dining room with Provençal ceilings; kitchen; beautiful vaulted wine cellar. 

The first floor is composed of: two double bedrooms; bathroom; loo; lovely master bedroom with an en-suite bathroom. 

Annex:
The ground floor accommodates: cosy drawing room opening onto a charming courtyard; utility room. 

The first floor is composed of a bright sitting room with an adjoining Bistro-style kitchen, and offers picturesque views of the surrounding countryside.

The second floor enjoys two double bedrooms, a bathroom and a loo. 

The serene gardens are home to an impressive variety of magnificent cedar, oak, and pine trees, manicured shrubs, and an abundance of indigenous flowering plants. A beautiful swimming pool, 12m x 5m, features a pool house and a summer kitchen, wrapped with gorgeous wisteria vines. A superb interior courtyard, embellished by centuries-old stone arches and tall wrought-iron gates, offers the perfect spot for entertaining family and friends on a grand scale.
 
Amenities include: electric heating in the main house, gas heating in the annex; mains and well water; water softener; septic tank; fully fenced garden; automatic watering system, drip irrigation; ADSL internet; electric gate; videophone. 

In this idyllic setting, with picture-perfect Luberon views, this property encapsulates the beauty of Provence in all of its glory.
summary: Picturesque Provençal farmhouse with Luberon views and sumptuous gardens

title: V2598 LA ROQUE SUR PERNES
body:
Perched upon the Vaucluse mountains, this stunning rural retreat benefits from unrivalled views, an elegant and refined décor, and an abundance of character. Remodelled to an exceptional standard, an array of modern features ensures that the property, and its remarkable environment, can be enjoyed in the utmost comfort.

A gated stone archway grants access to the house and gardens, opening to unveil the property and the spectacular views that stretch out to the horizon.

The accommodation comprises: large sitting/dining room with stone fireplace; bespoke Fabre kitchen with granite worktops; large double bedroom (currently serving as a second sitting room); guest shower room and loo. A floating stone staircase leads up to the first floor.

The first floor is composed of: vast, lavish master suite with an adjoining contemporary bathroom, shower, loo and dressing room; two further double bedrooms; guest shower room and loo. Large windows throughout drench the interior in natural light and grant superb views.

A large basement comprises: utility room; large storage room; boiler room; large wine cellar.

The property’s generous 7-acre grounds and gardens have been thoughtfully re-imagined by the current owners, landscaped with care and purpose. The house and garden sit elevated upon the grounds, with terraces planted with mature trees stepping down to meet the forest below. A stone slabbed terrace encompasses the house, providing a series of remarkable viewpoints from which to take in the surrounding landscape - ensuring the spectacular panorama can be enjoyed from sunrise to sunset. With the surrounding pine forests, the renowned Palais des Papes in the distance, and even a view of Mont Ventoux, this could well be the most astounding view the region has to offer.

A stone path, adorned on each side with manicured shrubs, leads down to the swimming pool area. Enjoying privacy from the house itself, the 12m x 4m heated swimming pool benefits from a natural stone wrap-around terrace. The terrace is partially roofed to allow for pool-side entertaining and dining. A quaint chapel-style outbuilding sits next to the pool area, tastefully refurbished and could be used as guest accommodation or a rather unique home office.

To the rear of the property lies the parking area, two large garages and an independent workshop/tool storage shed.

Further amenities include: heated swimming pool; fibre-optic internet; mains water; oil-fired central heating.

This uniquely stunning property has been meticulously renovated and superbly decorated whilst adapted for a fine level of modern living. The property lies nestled between the highly desirable Luberon valley and the majestic Mont Ventoux and its renowned vineyard appellations.
summary: Exquisite rural property with breath-taking views

title: V2776 VENASQUE
body:
Close to the picturesque villages of Méthamis and Blauvac, this magnificent property boasts both charm and grandeur. With its traditional 18th-century architecture, this attractive farmhouse effortlessly combines rustic character with modern comfort.

The accommodation on the ground floor comprises: bespoke kitchen, with granite worktops, Lacanche cooker and authentic bread oven, leading out to a dining and breakfast terrace; dining room; larder; adjacent sitting room with open fireplace; office or second sitting room; double bedroom with an adjoining shower room and w.c.

The first floor comprises: beautiful master suite complete with an adjoining bathroom with freestanding bathtub, walk-in shower and spacious fitted cupboards; second suite with an adjoining shower room; three further double bedrooms; guest bathroom; guest w.c.; dressing room.

The garden level accomodates: sitting room; games room; utility room; wine cellar; billiard room; garage; Pétanque court.

Large French windows and doors adorn the house, ensuring natural light floods throughout. The stunning dining terrace overlooks the garden below and offers the perfect spot from which to enjoy wonderful views of the surrounding countryside, and stunning sunsets. The terrace is shaded by a wrought-iron pergola covered with white-flowering wisteria. The swimming-pool (12m x 6m) is sheltered from the main house and is surrounded by a large terraced area. Landscaped gardens encompass the property, featuring established flower beds and traditional Provençal plants; mature olive trees, mulberries, lavender, rosemary, and a variety of fruit trees.

Amenities include: automatic watering system; mains water; central heating throughout. The roof has been recently replaced and a new septic tank installed.

A timeless retreat in the heart of the Provencal countryside offering total privacy, stunning views, elegant living spaces and manicured grounds.
summary: Magnificent 18th century stone property in stunning and peaceful environment near Venasque.

title: V2819 GORDES
body:
This attractive stone property is located above the village of Gordes and benefits from one of the most spectacular views that the region has to offer. The uniquely remarkable view extends across the Luberon mountain range and over to the famed Mont Saint Victoire, near Aix-en-Provence, in the far distance.

The ground floor is composed of: large entrance hall; kitchen with a breakfast table and French windows leading out to the dining terrace; spacious sitting room with a lovely traditional stone fireplace.

A graceful staircase leads up to the first floor. The accommodation on the first floor comprises: master suite (35 sqm) with an adjoining shower room; three double bedrooms; bathroom; guest loo. All the first floor rooms enjoy particularly impressive views and are drenched in natural light. 

The house sits on 0.8-acres of natural terraced grounds and enjoys a tiled swimming-pool (7m x 3.5m) and a large open pool house.

Amenities include: modern central-heating system (fed primarily by a heat-pump); fibre optic internet; double-glazing; wine cellar; mains water; recently installed electric gates. The property benefits from a large garage and a roofed workshop area.

The house is in very good condition but needs some refreshing. The property would serve as a magnificent holiday house or rental property with an exceptional view on the edge of one of the world's most renowned villages. Gordes, with its rich history, shops, many restaurants and cultural events throughout the year lies within walking distance.
summary: Attractive stone property with sensational views

title: V2826 VAISON LA ROMAINE
body:
Ideally located, at the foot of the Mont Ventoux and close to the medieval towns of Vaison-la-Romaine, Rasteau and Séguret, this renowned winery, with a superbly equipped cellar, enjoys an exceptional environment.

Spanning 45 acres, the certified organic vineyard, covers 32 acres (including 12 acres of leased land) of AOP Côtes-du-Rhône, AOP Côtes-du-Rhône village and AOP Ventoux. The vineyard is planted with Grenache noir, Syrah, Marsellan, Cinsault (reds), and Viognier, Grenache blanc and Clairette (whites). These meticulously tended-to vines produce a selection of structured, round and refreshing wines. The rest of the land is planted with around a hundred olive trees producing oil, and a private forest.

The estate boasts a modern winery, of around 360 m², with a capacity of over 300 hl. It incorporates the latest technology to ensure an autonomous and high-quality vinification process. An adjoining cellar and a large storage shed complete this winery.
In addition, a high-powered photovoltaic system, a Canadian well and a borehole guarantee that the estate is self-sufficient.

The property offers a charming stone farmhouse with a warm, authentic feel, measuring around 120 m² (with planning permission for a 120 m² extension). The farmhouse enjoys a lovely walled garden with a swimming-pool overlooking the vineyards.

The accommodation comprises : spacious kitchen ; sitting room ; office ; two double bedrooms ; two bathrooms ; laundry room. 

This property represents a unique opportunity for those seeking to invest and enjoy a peaceful lifestyle in the heart of Provence.

Semi-Confidential sale. Please contact us to obtain more information, the virtual viewing and a video of the property.
summary: Organic winery with a superb cellar and charming stone farmhouse.

title: V2984 PERNES LES FONTAINES
body:
On the edge of the lively Provençal market town of Pernes-les-Fontaines, with its charming shops and restaurants, this exceptional property seamlessly combines contemporary design with a refined and subtle palette. Crafted and conceived with meticulous care, it stands out for its impeccable quality and exquisite attention to detail.

The ground floor opens onto a bright entrance hall, leading to a vast main living space. The sleek modern kitchen, dining room, and sitting room are bathed in natural light thanks to oversized windows and panoramic sliding doors, providing a seamless transition to the outdoor terraces. The luxurious master suite includes a dressing room and an adjoining shower room. The ground floor further comprises three additional suites, each featuring their own private bathroom, with a freestanding bathtub and Italian-style shower (with one of these suites benefiting from a private dressing room). A guest WC and laundry room complete this level. 

Upstairs, a fifth suite with an adjoining shower room offers additional spacebar family or guests

Outdoors, the landscaped garden, facing south and west, offers a stunning natural setting, with lush vegetation ensuring utter privacy. The heated 12m x 5m pool, accessible via a cypress-lined path, is accompanied by a pool house, equipped with a kitchen, living space, and shower room - all lined with large bay windows. The meticulously maintained garden is adorned with a variety of trees and plants, including cypresses, century-old olive trees, cordylines, and perfectly pruned shrubs.

Modern amenities include: reversible air conditioning throughout; aluminium-framed double glazing; electric shutters; mains water; newly installed septic tank; electric gates; automatic watering; high-speed Starlink internet; ample parking; large basement.

Fully enclosed with automatic gates, this stylish contemporary property, with its enchanting garden and high-end features, embodies luxury, privacy and tranquility in Provence.
summary: Superb contemporary property with gorgeous gardens.

title: V2378 OPPEDE
body:
Set amongst its own vineyards, this quintessential ‘mas’ has 6 bedrooms and 5 bathrooms, a luxurious swimming pool, and beautiful views of the Luberon mountain and surrounding countryside.

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: fabulous entrance hall/reception room with floor to ceiling windows looking on to the south-facing terrace; drawing room with stone fireplace; smart dining kitchen with central island and granite worktops; breakfast room; utility room; guest wc; study; boiler room; wine cellar.

Upstairs: spacious TV room, study, or sitting room; 6 double bedrooms, 4 of which have smart en suite bathrooms; family bathroom. With beautifully renovated stonework, travertine flooring, natural materials throughout and underfloor heating, this house shouts quality and style.

Outside, the freeform pool measures 73m², and views are of the Luberon to the south and Mont Ventoux to the north. There is garaging for 3 cars, and a workshop and technical room. With its own vineyard, olive grove, fruit trees, lavender field, and lovely terraces for enjoying the weather at different times of the day and in all seasons, the garden is a delight!

With a pretty Provencal village within walking distance, and fabulous walking and cycling countryside all around, this is a beautiful property in a perfect location.
summary: An exceptional example of a Provencal farmhouse, tastefully renovated to a high standard.

title: V2677 BOULBON
body:
Originally built in 1850, this stunning property has been carefully and elegantly renovated. 

Not only does the property enjoy panoramic views of the surrounding countryside but it is also located just opposite the 11th century fortress in all its splendour!

The property offers approximately 320m2 of living space, 6 bedrooms, 6 bathrooms (all with individual thermo-dynamic water heaters) and air-conditioning throughout.

The ground floor comprises: entrance hall; 40m2 sitting room; dinning room; fully equipped kitchen and utility room.

The first floor comprises: 5 bedrooms with ensuite bathrooms.
One of the bedrooms also has its own garden and access to a private terrace with breathtaking views!

An exceptionally well-equipped apartment is connected to the property but also has private access and a spacious terrace that overlooks the village.
The apartment comprises: 30 m2 open-plan kitchen/dining room opening onto the terrace; bedroom with ensuite bathroom.

The gardens are an absolute delight and include a 'bassin' style heated swimming pool, covered terrace, discreet parking under a fabulous wisteria and even a shaded grassy area for the hot summer months.

The village of Boulbon is particularly lively throughout the year and its shops include restaurants, boutiques, bakeries and a café.

Distance to :
Avignon  17 km
Les Baux-de-Provence  25 km
Saint Rémy-de-Provence  22 km

Equipment :
Heat pump. for the property and the pool
Automatic watering system
Traditional open fireplace
Wine cellar, with Roman remains!
New roof  & insulation
Pellet burner

This divine property is sure to appeal to the most discerning buyer!
summary: Beautiful 19th century, south facing stone property with swimming pool

title: V2546 MAUBEC
body:
This fabulous two-storey villa property offers beautiful volumes, a south-facing terrace, a private garden and an infinity pool with Luberon views. This recent build is located less than a kilometre from the center of the village of Maubec.

The 145m2 ground floor consists of an open concept living space, a master suite, an additional bedroom (currently used as an office) and a guest loo. The voluminous living space offers a sleek fully equipped kitchen fitted with a central island dining table, a back kitchen, and a spacious sitting room. The ground-floor master suite accommodates a beautiful double bedroom, a dressing room, and a private bathroom fitted with a bath, shower, and double vanity unit – French windows from the master suite provide access to the property’s garden.

A hallway on the first floor gives way to three double bedrooms, two of which enjoy private shower rooms. An additional guest loo serves the first floor.

A covered terrace in the garden offers a generous shaded outdoor space with breathtaking Luberon views. A 11m x 3.4m tiled infinity swimming pool lies just beyond. In-keeping with the contemporary nature of the property, this south facing ‘lap pool’ offers the perfect spot to unwind and take in the views in utter privacy.
 
The garden is equipped with an automatic watering system fed by a private well. The sprawling garage and utility space (100 m2) are located out-of-sight, in the basement, and are accessed through the back kitchen. The land offers ample space for additional parking and is equipped with automatic gates and a videophone.

The property is equipped with a centralised air conditioning and a sophisticated smart home system allowing full control of the electric shutters, the outdoor lighting and locking/unlocking of the front door.

This particularly well-conceived property seamlessly combines elegance, comfort, and convenience. The property lies within walking distance of Maubec’s boulangerie, butcher and grocer.
summary: Stunning contemporary property with infinity pool and Luberon views

title: V3042 ST SATURNIN LES APT
body:
Just a stone’s throw from the village of Saint-Saturnin-lès-Apt, this beautifully located property enjoys a peaceful and picturesque setting. Tastefully designed throughout, it seamlessly blends authentic Provençal character with modern comforts, offering a gorgeous and thoughtfully curated living spaces.  

The first floor comprises: bright sitting room and dining room with high ceilings, opening onto an exquisite terrace and bathed in natural light; spacious, elegant Fabre kitchen, and breakfast table that flows through to the dining area; beautiful bedroom - with gorgeous hardwood oak flooring and double aspect windows - with its private bathroom, WC and charming balcony; additional bedroom with bathroom and WC en suite.
Every room has been carefully considered, with meticulous attention to detail, creating harmonious and magnificent interiors. 

The garden level is composed of: bedroom with adjoining bathroom and WC with tomette flooring; lovely double bedroom - currently used as an office; laundry room.
This level is enhanced by exposed wooden beams and terracotta floor tiles, adding warmth and character to the spaces.  

Outside, the landscaped gardens offer a natural, immaculately kept setting: olive trees, oaks, vines and Mediterranean plants make up a peaceful environment. A superb terrace runs alongside the house, revealing a magnificent view of the Luberon valley, the Mourre Nègre and the village church - with stone accent walls and fabulous views, it offers an incredible space for dining and entertaining. The property also enjoys a 12m x 4m heated swimming pool, as well as a lovely shaded terrace adorned with stone arches, from which you can also admire the view.

Amenities include: air conditioning in the upstairs bedrooms; electric heating; double glazing; water softener; automatic watering system; mains water; electric gates.

With its great sense of privacy, perfectly landscaped gardens, meticulously designed interiors and prime location on the edge of the lively village of Saint-Saturnin-lès-Apt – with the renowned Le Saint-Hubert restaurant and local shops – this property offers a superb setting for everyday living.

It is a place where comfort, style and authenticity come together effortlessly.
summary: Fabulous property with remarkable gardens and stunning views, in Saint-Saturnin-lès-Apt.

title: V2915 FONTAINE DE VAUCLUSE
body:
This stunning 1920s art-deco property encapsulates the grandeur of a bygone era. Built in 1928 at great expense by the wealthy French papermaker Andre Navarre, this striking property offers 465 sqm of living space sat on 3.7 acres of beautiful parkland.

A large hall greets you at the entrance and leads into the ballroom-sized ‘Great room’ that occupies the lion’s share of the ground floor. High ceilings complimented by large arched French windows ensure an airy feel and an abundance of natural light throughout. Conceived for entertaining guests, this wonderful space comprises a sun-drenched formal dining area, breakfast table and casual seating arranged around the fireplace.

Additionally, on the ground floor: large kitchen with French windows out to south facing terrace and additional dining table; cloakroom; utility room; large larder. A “caretaker’s gite” on the ground floor provides a self-contained living space for family and guests with an independent entrance. This is composed of a kitchen / diner, bathroom and double bedroom.

The first floor is composed of three suites. The master suite comprises a 36 sqm bedroom with marble fireplace and parquet floors, an airy study with its own south-west facing balcony, bathroom, and dressing room. The second suite features a 22 sqm bedroom adorned with two lovely marble fireplaces and a shower room en suite. Both these suites have large French windows leading out onto a romantic balcony overlooking the Monts de Vaucluse. A further double bedroom with shower room en suite is on this floor.

The second floor is comprised of: two generous double bedrooms; shower room; large artist’s studio that could be converted into a further bedroom; attic storage room.
There is a full basement underneath the property housing the oil-fired central heating system, UV water purifier for the spring water, and water softener. There is also a large cold room and four more rooms, used for storage and as workshops. The property has water from the canal de Provence for the garden, and a private spring providing crystal clear drinking water that is also used to fill the swimming pool. 

A plane tree lined driveway leads up through the parkland to the property. A modern 12 m x 4 m swimming pool sits comfortably below the property and is surrounded by a wonderful lawn, fruit tree orchard and sculptural pines. Large terraces, verandas and balconies adorn every façade of the house, providing copious outdoor sitting and dining areas that can be enjoyed from sunrise to sunset.

Although some refreshing is required to restore this building to its former glory, the layout and proportions of this unique property will guarantee a fantastic result. Ideally situated just 5 minutes from L'Isle-sur-la-Sorgue, Saumane Golf course and the Petit Palais farmers’ market.
summary: Turn-of-the-century manor house set in 1.5 hectares of parkland.

title: V2879 SAIGNON
body:
On the edge of Apt and Saignon, this former manor house, dating from 1790, has been completely restored and offers a remarkable place to live. It's easy to imagine that all the reception rooms make this a magical place for entertaining family and friends, with over four hundred square meters of living space.

Upon entry, you are greeted by vast entrance hall leading through to three reception rooms and a beautiful, fully-equipped contemporary kitchen. The high ceilings, natural light, and superb volumes give this manor house a terrific sense of authenticity, enhanced by terracotta or cement tile floors, decorative fireplaces, and grand Provencal-style staircases.

Two staircases lead to the first and second floors; a beautiful central staircase and a rear staircase. The first floor is composed of four bedrooms, each with an en-suite bathroom or shower room. 

The second floor accommodates four bedrooms and three shower rooms. 

The lower, garden-level, is composed of: garage; wine cellar; laundry room; boiler room with oil-fired central heating; bike room.

The 17 acres of landscaped grounds offer vast terraces, gorgeous water features fed by a natural spring, and an impressive 20m x 7m swimming pool (with a submerged cover and adjoining pool house). The whole property is beautifully wooded and boasts a particularly spectacular driveway lined with cypress trees.

The property is located just a few minutes from the bustling market town of Apt, with its shops and famous Provencal market, yet enjoys lovely views over the surrounding hills and gardens and retains all the charm of its privacy.
summary: Renovated 18th century bastide with 17 acres of grounds

title: V2374 GOULT
body:
A beautiful cypress tree and lavender lined driveway leads to this lovely 384 m2 stone mas, surrounded by 2 acres of landscaped grounds. The property benefits from a quiet position in the heart of the unspoiled Goult countryside.

The living accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: large entrance hall; double-height sitting room with stone fireplace; dining room with wood burning stove; dining kitchen with Lacanche range; master bedroom with modern bathroom en suite and stone staircase leading to the adjoining dressing room. French windows from the sitting room, dining room and kitchen lead out to the south-facing terrace that runs the length of the building. 

The property’s amenities / service rooms on the ground floor include: pantry / wine cellar; storage room currently used as a wine cellar; utility room with in-built storage; technical room; workshop; double garage with overhead mezzanine for storage; garden/pool technical room. 

The first floor is composed of: double bedroom with bathroom en suite; mezzanine study/library looking down on to the sitting room; double bedroom; shower room; separate wc; double bedroom with bathroom en suite; double bedroom with shower room and wc en suite. Panoramic views of the surrounding landscape can be enjoyed from the first-floor roof terrace which lies adjacent to the latter bedroom suites.

The grounds have been designed with outdoor entertaining in mind. A vast terrace skirts the southern length of the property and a roofed auvent terrace offers a large, shaded sitting / dining area for the hotter summer months. The 72 m2 swimming pool also benefits from a southern exposure. A further double garage sits at the entrance of the property, by the gates, and is currently used to store garden equipment. The property is entirely surrounded by vineyards and lavender fields guaranteeing pretty seasonal colours and an unrivalled sense of privacy. The grounds are home to a number of indigenous roses, plane and pine trees, as well as purple-leaf plum and a handful of beautiful old cedar trees.

Whilst this property requires some refreshing to bring it up to date, this authentic stone mas, with its idyllic location would provide an exceptional family home or luxury chambre d’hôtes once tailored to the needs and particular taste of its new owners.
summary: Handsome 384 m2 stone farmhouse in the picturesque Goult countryside.

title: V2502 VENASQUE
body:
This absolutely stunning property is elegant in its simplistic design. The entire south facing wall is made up of floor to ceiling sliding doors, allowing an uninterrupted view of the gardens and countryside beyond. 

The living accommodation comprises: an incredible 95m2 living space with industrial style polished concrete floors; fully equipped ultra modern kitchen; utility room; main bedroom with ensuite bathroom and dressing room; interior courtyard; 
2 double bedroom with ensuite bathrooms; 2 bedrooms with shared bathroom; office area; guest wc. All the rooms have direct access to the landscaped gardens and terrace and the entire property is equipped with internal air conditioning. 

The gardens includes numerous different terrace areas to enjoy the garden at anytime of day.

The fabulous "Bali stone" pool (11m x 3,5m) is surrounded by an easy to maintain Japanese lawn. 

The property is located in the heights of the famous mediaeval village of Venasque. The village is listed amongst the most beautiful in France and has a selection of restaurants, cafés, shops and a regular outdoor market. 

Location:
20 minutes drive to Gordes
35 minutes drive to Avignon
50 minutes to the peak of Mont Ventoux!

A particularly rare property that has been thoughtfully planned, beautifully decorated and is sure to capture your heart!
summary: Luxurious contemporary property situated in an Idyllic setting.

title: V2504 ROBION
body:
As soon as you walk through the door you immediately get a feel for exactly what this Luberon property has to offer: beautiful, exposed stone walls, terracotta and flagstone flooring, lovely mountain views and a fantastic feeling of space and warmth, drenched with natural light throughout.

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: large open-plan sitting / dining room with gorgeous stone fireplace and French windows lining the south side; lovely Fabre kitchen with breakfast table; guest loo; south-facing family suite composed of a double bedroom, single bedroom or study, bathroom and loo. There is also a utility room on the ground floor, a wine cellar, and a vast two-door garage with overhead mezzanine for storage. 

The first floor comprises: south-facing double bedroom with shower room en suite; double bedroom with shower room en suite and access to the first-floor terrace; spacious south-facing double bedroom sharing the first-floor terrace.

The beautiful Luberon mountain views to the south can be enjoyed from both the ground and the first floor, the swimming pool, and the grounds of the property.

The recent and tasteful remodel included: underfloor heating on the ground floor with a 2017 Bosch oil-fired boiler; Daikin air-conditioning; modern double glazing and new French windows; Fabre kitchen with its Lacanche range; complete re-roofing; heated swimming pool with an automatic cover. The property is gated, alarmed and has fibre optic internet.

The wonderfully landscaped garden has been entirely hedged with conifers, ensuring utter privacy throughout. To the south, the fantastic 12m x 6m tiled and heated swimming pool is complimented by a wrap-around flag-stoned terrace and adjoining covered dining area with a fully equipped summer kitchen. A wisteria-covered pergola extends out with relaxed seating underneath, creating the perfect spot to sit and enjoy the property and its surroundings in all their splendour. Centenary plane trees, a fruit orchard, olive, pine and cypress trees complete this wonderfully authentic stone farmhouse.
summary: Beautifully renovated stone farmhouse set on 3.5 acres of land

title: V2921 GOULT
body:
This enchanting provençal property in Goult is surrounded by beautifully landscaped gardens with spectacular views over the surrounding countryside, and sits just a few minutes' walk from the heart of the famous village.

The modern interior retains authentic charm, with exposed wooden beams and natural stone features. Living spaces are bathed in light with large windows, framing picturesque views.

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: bright, bespoke and timeless Fabre kitchen, opening onto the dining room and leading easily onto the terrace for al fresco dining; beautiful sitting room with carefully chosen colours; cloakroom; double bedroom with en suite bathroom, echoing the refined décor of the entire property.

The first floor accommodates: master suite with Juliette balcony overlooking the Luberon and bathroom with island bath and walk-in shower; further double bedroom with en suite bathroom. 

A vast stone terrace borders the 10m x 5m heated swimming pool, and is fully equipped with an outdoor kitchen and covered dining area, ideal for entertaining. The property is also home to grape vines, producing table grapes and tended by the local farmer.

Amenities include: underfloor heating and cooling; reversible air conditioning (first floor); wood burning stove; double glazing; mains and canal water; automatic watering; fibre optic internet; electric gates; videophone.

This sublime stone residence offers a haven of peace with incomparable views, in the heart of Provence.
summary: Renovated stone house with pool and views, walk to Goult

title: V2795 MENERBES
body:
Located within walking distance of the legendary village of Ménerbes, in a superbly tranquil setting, this beautiful villa property benefits from well-maintained grounds, terrific views and a superbly elegant décor.

The ground floor comprises: bright living-space composed of a sitting room and a formal dining area; well-equipped open-concept kitchen; master suite featuring a bathroom fitted with a bathtub and a walk-in shower; guest loo. Large French windows line the living spaces and open onto a terrace overlooking the Luberon mountain and the surrounding countryside.

The garden level is composed of: three generously-sized double bedroom suites, each boasting an adjoining shower room; utility room and an adjoining technical room and storage space.

There is underfloor heating throughout the ground floor and all the bedrooms are air-conditioned.

The 1.7 acres of grounds encompass the house, ensuring complete privacy. The landscaped garden offers an 8m x 4m heated swimming pool and is home to a superb variety of flora, with tall cedars, centenary olives, cypresses and manicured shrubs. The garden has automatic watering (fed by a private water source), is fenced, and has electric gates. There is covered parking for three cars. 

This superb Luberon property would serve as a lavish Luberon retreat or rental investment property - offering an unrivalled location, beautiful gardens, lovely volumes and an array of modern comforts. The ever-desirable perched village of Ménerbes lies less than a kilometre away, home to a variety of restaurants, cafés, bars and shops.
summary: Lovely property close to the village of Ménerbes, with garden and views

title: V2344 LAGNES
body:
This magnificent Provencal "mas" enjoys a dominant position on the edge of this popular village. The property has has been entirely renovated whilst respecting the original features and architecture.

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: fitted dining kitchen; utility room; superb dining room with vaulted ceiling; vast sitting room with impressive open fireplace; wine cellar; laundry room; separate wc. 

Upstairs, there are six double bedrooms, all with en suite bathrooms and views of the garden; a further double bedroom; family bathroom; separate wc; eighth bedroom, presently used as a study.

All ground floor rooms open onto the beautiful terrace and landscaped gardens which are an absolute delight. The pretty swimming pool has great views and plenty of space for sunbathing or simply relaxing in the idyllic surroundings. An olive grove sits behind the main house and is embellished by traditional dry stone walls. 

A few minutes walk brings you to the very heart of the village and the lively café bar, restaurant and other commerce. This property would make an outstanding chambre d'hôte or family home in a rare and privileged position.
summary: Authentic 17th century village farmhouse with swimming pool and views.

title: V2207 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
This magnificent property comprises: entrance hall with ancient stone flagstone floor and fireplace; living room with fireplace, old beams & stone features, with doors opening out to the courtyard terrace; spacious well-equipped farmhouse kitchen with mezzanine study area above. Flowing out from the kitchen is a large sunny terrace with panoramic views over the Luberon and valley. There are 5 stylish and spacious bedrooms, each with their own bathrooms.

The house offers a choice of areas for dining and for sitting with an apéro at the end of the day. Along the front of the house is a Wisteria-covered pergola providing shade for a long dining table, perfect for large family meals 'al fresco'. The sun-drenched swimming pool enjoys the same expansive views as from the house and the land around is planted with cherry, apricot, peach and olive trees, as well as Muscat vines.

Homes of this style and quality with extraordinary views are rare, so do not delay your visit to this one!
summary: Beautiful fully renovated farmhouse with typical Provençal courtyard, period features, country views and a large pool, set on 5 acres.

title: V2813 GORDES
body:
This beautiful contemporary property, located in a bucolic setting, offers remarkable interior volumes and a large landscaped garden. Lovely views of the Luberon mountains and surrounding countryside can be enjoyed throughout the property. An array of modern amenities has been integrated, ensuring a high standard of living in an extremely peaceful part of the Provençal countryside.

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: vast 76m² living area featuring a lovely kitchen and a sitting room with a wood-burning stove, adorned with large French doors that lead out to the garden and the dining terrace; adjoining dining room; TV room (or office space); five spacious suites, each with a double bedroom and an adjoining bathroom; three guest loos; family bathroom.

The accommodation on the garden level is composed of: double bedroom with bathroom en suite and independent access; utility room; large office; wine cellar; games room; technical room. There is also an 81m² garage with an automatic door, a large storage area, and a multipurpose space offering great flexibility.

The fully enclosed garden features a lavish 12m x 4m swimming pool, a pétanque court, and a large covered dining terrace, all offering panoramic views. The swimming pool, equipped with an integrated rolling cover, grants the perfect spot to enjoy the serenity of the property and the stunning Luberon views. The land is planted with centuries-old olive trees and truffle oaks, ensuring a particularly verdant setting.
