Amenities include: underfloor heating and cooling (heat pump); ground-coupled heat exchanger; double glazing; electric gates; fibre optic internet; garden lighting.

This wonderfully located contemporary property would be perfectly suited as a rather luxurious Luberon retreat, or a seasonal rental investment opportunity with lucrative returns.
summary: Spacious stone property with beautiful views and excellent volumes.

title: V2743 L'ISLE-SUR-LA-SORGUE
body:
This picturesque Provençal farmhouse has been masterfully re-imagined and renovated to the highest standard by an architect, seamlessly incorporating contemporary sophistication and traditional charm. The superb use of natural materials and a warm palette has instilled a timeless sense of elegance throughout. The property enjoys complete intimacy, lovely volumes and a stunning indoor swimming pool, and is located close to the desirable market town of l’Isle-sur-la-Sorgue. 

The entrance hall gives way to unveil a gorgeous sitting room with oversized windows that grant views that stretch out across the surrounding countryside. The sitting room is fitted with a pellet-burning stove and leads through to the adjoining dining room.  The sleek kitchen, with natural wood accents, is adorned with an island unit and vast sliding doors that open out onto the covered dining terrace. Hand-laid herringbone ‘zellige’ tiles flow seamlessly throughout the ground floor, complemented by warm tones to create wonderfully inviting living spaces. French windows provide access to the various dining terraces and ensure a particularly bright and airy feel.

A stunning 8m x 2.5m indoor swimming pool lies on the ground floor (heated and equipped with a sophisticated dehumidification system). Arched French windows drench this 41 sqm space with natural light and grant lovely views of the surrounding countryside. The swimming pool enjoys an adjoining shower room and toilet.

The ground floor is further composed of: rear kitchen; spacious home office; utility room. 

The first floor accommodates a beautiful master suite comprising a spacious double bedroom and a bathroom en suite with a freestanding bathtub, a shower, and a toilet. The first floor is also composed of: double bedroom with a shower room and toilet en suite; two further double bedrooms; guest bathroom with a shower; guest toilet. Oak floorboards adorn the first floor room.

The farmhouse sits centred on 3.6 acres of land, with a lovely pine and cypress tree-lined driveway leading up to the property. A stone paved terrace runs along the front of the house and is shaded by a pergola grown with a lady banks rose. A dozen mature olive trees produce, on average, 20 litres of olive oil per year. A carport grants sheltered parking for cars, with additional parking spaces hidden to the rear of the property.

Amenities include: oil-fired central heating; air-conditioning in the living spaces; town water; canal water; water from a private ‘forage’; double glazing throughout; alarm system; electric gates; septic tank (newly installed and conform to norms).

An outstanding stone farmhouse property, renovated with panache and embellished with exquisite décor.
summary: Impeccably renovated authentic Provençal farmhouse

title: V2055 LAGNES
body:
Formerly a farmhouse, this authentic stone property now finds itself near the centre of this popular Provencal village on the edge of the Luberon. It has been renovated with great attention to detail, creating well-appointed light and spacious rooms. 

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: entrance hall; vast (85m2) open-plan living/dining area with original stone fireplace, three double doors to the terrace and Shaker-style kitchen; breakfast bar, granite worktops and travertine floor; 2 double bedrooms, both with smart bathrooms; utility room. 
Up the original stone steps to: second reception room used as a study and sitting room; 2 large double bedrooms, both with en suite bathrooms; 2 further double bedrooms; family bathroom. 

Outside, the garden is very well organised, with a large terraced area for al fresco dining and aperitifs, shaded by a beautiful old plane tree, and perfectly-proportioned 8m x 4m heated swimming pool; summer kitchen; garden store.

The grounds are entered via large metal gates, and there are car parking areas both inside and outside. This property has been really well updated for modern living and boasts oil-fired central heating, air-conditioning, double glazing throughout and automatic garden watering system drawn from the well.

This is a beautiful stone house, rich in Provencal character but very comfortable and easy to maintain. It is perfectly located in a peaceful village, yet less than 10 minutes drive to the lively market town of L'Isle-sur-la-Sorgue
summary: Beautifully renovated 18th century stone mas in the heart of the village.

title: V2597 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
Nestled up in the oak woodland that surrounds the sought-after village of Cabrières-d’Avignon, this impressive late-century villa property enjoys grand proportions complemented by private landscaped grounds. Lovely views of the Luberon mountain can be enjoyed throughout the property.

The accommodation comprises, on the ground-floor: spacious entrance hall with an adjoining cloakroom and guest loo; double-height living room incorporating a formal dining area and a sitting room; kitchen; master bedroom with a bathroom en suite; further double bedroom suite with an adjoining shower room; technical room; two garages.

The first floor is composed of: suite with an adjoining shower room and loo; suite with an adjoining shower room; two further double bedrooms; guest shower room; guest loo; large, covered terrace with a beautiful view of the surrounding countryside and the Luberon mountain.

The acre of grounds have been landscaped by the current owners, planted with mature oak and cedar trees and a variety of indigenous shrubs. The driveway winds through the trees up to the house. A large stone-paved terrace runs along the front of the property, shaded by a mature pine tree, granting the perfect spot for entertaining family and guests. Stone steps lead down to the 13m x 4m tiled swimming pool. The pool house outbuilding comprises a summer kitchen, covered terrace, guest shower and loo and an additional room, that could be used as guest accommodation.

The property benefits from gas-fired central heating, fibre optic internet, electric gates, and an alarm system. The roof has been recently replaced and the grounds are entirely walled/fenced.

This superbly located villa lies within walking distance of the Luberon village of Cabrières-d’Avignon and benefits from great views and an abundance of space.
summary: Impressive villa property within walking distance of Cabrières-d'Avignon

title: V2577 LE BEAUCET
body:
Privately set behind gates and a long driveway, this stunning 12-acre property enjoys a calm and peaceful environment and unparalleled views of Mont Ventoux, the Monts de Vaucluse, and the valley below. This picturesque stone farmhouse has been entirely re-imagined to ensure an excellent standard of modern living in one of the most bucolic settings the region has to offer.   
                                                                                                                                                               
The accommodation, on the garden level comprises: sleek dining kitchen; open-concept sitting room with oversized windows and a wood burner; home office; guest WC. French doors throughout ensure seamless indoor-outdoor flow and an abundance of natural sunlight.

The ground floor comprises: entrance hall with guest WC; two spacious double bedroom suites, each with great views and a private shower room; large utility room with an abundance of storage space; authentic wine cellar. The property’s garage lies on this floor.

The upper floor accommodates a third double bedroom with a shower room en suite.

The property is adorned with an expansive roofed terrace that extends out from the kitchen. This terrace is fitted with ceiling fans and built-in seating to guarantee a tremendous outdoor living space with truly spectacular views. Stylish timber decking surrounds the 9m x 4m swimming pool. A charming courtyard, series of raised terraces, and a firepit area provide additional entertaining spaces. An olive grove and Petanque court lie just beyond the pool area, surrounded by indigenous flora and herbs, and the property's oak woodland.

Additional amenities include: fibre optic internet; double glazed wrought-iron windows; underfloor heating throughout; UV water filtration system; several outbuildings. Two reservoirs (totalling close to 70.000L) provide storage for water with additional tanks for rainwater collection. A private water source supplies the house and the garden. Furniture and the sophisticated smart home management system can be purchased with the property.

Traditional charm meets contemporary flair in this impressive rural retreat, conceived for living and entertaining in a uniquely stunning setting. A vast variety of hiking, trail running, mountain biking and cycling paths and tracks lie on the doorstep, with perched villages, vineyards, and gorgeous scenery in every direction. The house is conveniently located close to the villages of Venasque and Saint-Didier, home to a boulangerie, several restaurants and the famed weekly farmer's market. 

The perfect Provencal hideaway for nature lovers!
summary: Impressive rural 12-acre property with spectacular Ventoux panorama

title: V2749 ROUSSILLON
body:
Nestled in the hills of Roussillon’s countryside, this gorgeous property benefits from a stunning rural setting, hidden behind wrought-iron gates and a beautiful driveway bordered by olive trees. The house sits on 4.4 acres of private grounds and features a lovely swimming pool area and unrivalled panoramic views of the Luberon valley.

An antique hardwood door opens into an elegant foyer to provide a fabulous sense of entry. The sitting room lies just beyond, boasting beautiful volumes, authentic terracotta tiling, and traditional Provençal ceilings. A grand fireplace and an ‘œil de boeuf’ embellish the room, whilst arched French windows drench every inch of the space in natural light. The spacious dining area leads to a bright and well-equipped modern kitchen with doors granting access to a terrace.

The ground floor further comprises a double bedroom with a bathroom with toilet en suite, utility room, and a guest toilet.

The first floor accommodates a generous master suite, complete with a large balcony overlooking the swimming pool and terraces below. This master suite features an ornate stone fireplace, a contemporary shower room equipped with a walk-in shower and a double vanity unit, a toilet, and a dressing room. Prepare to enjoy a spectacular view of Roussillon and the Luberon valley.

The west wing of the house comprises a generously sized double bedroom, a bathroom/wet room, a toilet, and a sitting room area adorned with a majestic fireplace dating back to 1806.

A beautiful 12m x 6m salt water pool (tiled and with an electric cover) is surrounded by a large terrace, accompanied by a covered terrace. From the sitting room, walk out to the large shaded dining terrace, which offers the perfect space to entertain family and friends whilst enjoying the spectacular scenery. A timelessly elegant stone balustrade borders the terrace and the swimming pool area. Stone steps take you down to the olive groves and fig trees. A picturesque archway leads from the pool round to the parking area, the garage with automatic door, and a double carport. A small outbuilding provides storage space for bicycles and garden tools. Wooden shutters, double glazed windows and substantial walls ensure the interior of the house remains cool throughout the summer.

This quintessentially Provençal property enjoys a superb cadre and would serve as a luxurious Luberon retreat or a comfortable year-round home for a discerning buyer. This property is located less than 2 kilometres from the ever-desirable village of Roussillon. A superb location for those looking to explore the Luberon.
summary: Rural Roussillon property with terrific views

title: V2633 ST SATURNIN LES APT
body:
Located just a short walk from the lively village of Saint-Saturnin-les-Apt, this traditional farmhouse benefits from a private 1.5 acre plot, generous and airy interior volumes and authentic character. The property lies on the south facing flanks of the Monts de Vaucluse, granting superb views on to the Luberon valley below.

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: large dining kitchen that flows through to the sitting room; spacious sitting room with oversized windows providing unobstructed valley views; relaxed seating arranged around an open fireplace, and an adjoining dining area; utility room; guest loo. 

The first floor is composed of: double bedroom suite with an adjoining shower room and loo; two further double bedrooms (one currently used as a spacious home office); guest bathroom; guest loo. 

The second floor accommodates an impressive master suite with a private bathroom and dressing room en suite. The master suite enjoys particularly lovely views.

The property also features an independent gîte, complete with a sitting room/kitchenette, double bedroom, shower room and loo. The gîte has proven, and attractive, seasonal rental potential.

The 1.5-acre garden afford a terrific sense of privacy, despite the proximity to the village. The grounds offer a large swimming pool (10m x 5m - although this requires some work) and a superb terrace which offers an exceptional view of the garden and the surrounding countryside. There is covered parking for two cars and ample space to the rear of the property to park. A south-facing outbuilding is currently used to store garden furniture and equipment - the outbuilding has an adjoining covered terrace. The property also has an additional tool/bike storage room.

Amenities include: gas-fired central heating; Fibre-optic internet; mains water; newly installed septic tank; automatic watering system.

This charming farmhouse with lovely innate character is ideally located, for those looking for a country home, within walking distance of the lively and authentic village of Saint-Saturnin-les-Apt.
summary: Spacious farmhouse with great views, within walking distance of the village

title: V2872 GORDES
body:
This elegant contemporary villa is nestled in the countryside with sweeping views across the iconic village of Gordes. Crafted from high quality materials, the property boasts spacious interiors with great natural light and an unrivalled location in the heart of the Luberon valley.

The main house comprises: entrance hall; sleek contemporary kitchen featuring a central island unit and black granite worktops, flowing through to an adjacent dining area; open-plan living space with a fireplace insert; three generously sized bedrooms; large shower room; private office which could be used as an additional bedroom.

An annex, with its own entrance, is composed of: living space fitted with a kitchenette; spacious double bedroom; shower room.

The property is set in 0.7-acres of natural gardens, shaded by towering pines. The stunning swimming pool (10m x 5m) offers privacy, enclosed by stone walls and greenery, and features a pool house with a shower room and a summer kitchen - ideal for outdoor entertaining. A vast covered dining terrace overlooks the garden, creating an additional living space during the long summer months.

The property is equipped with high-end amenities: air-conditioning throughout; radiators fed by an air-source heat pump; wine cellar; mains drainage; aluminium-framed double-glazing; electric shutters; automatic watering system; electric gates; visiophone; ample private parking, and a covered pergola for three cars.

This chic single-storey property is ideally suited as a luxurious Luberon retreat, a spacious family home, or a profitable seasonal rental. It is ideally situated in the Luberon’s Golden Triangle, close to the sought-after villages of Goult, Ménerbes, and Gordes - perfect for exploring the immensely popular and picturesque region of the Luberon.
summary: Contemporary stone property with swimming pool and stunning view of Gordes

title: V2612 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
Idyllically located in the heart of Cabrières-d’Avignon, this stunning stone property benefits from easy access to the village shops and restaurant and grants complete privacy and a high standard of modern living. This recent construction has been completed with high quality authentic materials, guaranteeing both charm and a ease of living, with underfloor heating, double glazing and a fully automated pool.

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: open plan kitchen/dining room; large adjoining sitting room with an open fireplace; master suite with access to the terrace, including a dressing room, double bedroom and a bathroom en suite; utility room; further double bedroom or office.

The first floor comprises:  a spacious double bedroom with en suite bathroom; a further double bedroom; a single bedroom leading out to the large south facing balcony; a separate bathroom.

The well-maintained and large private garden offers a choice of seating areas – two south facing terraces accessed through the oversized French windows in the sitting room, a shaded courtyard to the rear of the house, and a veranda looking on to the swimming pool (9m x 4m). Pergolas adorn these terraces, providing shade during the hot summer months. The property also benefits from a detached two-car garage with additional space to be used as a workshop – additional parking lies just in front. Privacy in the garden is ensured by the tall stone walls surrounding as well as cypress and olive trees.

This high calibre village house lies nestled in the centre of the sought-after village of Cabrières-d’Avignon, known for both its rustic charm and amenities, with the local bakery, butcher, bar restaurant and grocery shop within a few minutes walking distance of this property. A lovely airy and bright property with excellent summer rental prospects to cater for the most discerning buyer.
summary: Superb Cabrières-d'Avignon property with views and landscaped garden

title: V2764 L'ISLE-SUR-LA-SORGUE
body:
This picturesque 19th century farmhouse, perched above the desirable market town of l’Isle-sur-la-Sorgue, enjoys exceptional panoramic views of the Luberon and Alpilles mountains. Recent renovation works have brought the property up to standard and ensure a high standard of modern living.

The accommodation on the ground floor comprises: bright sitting room with patio doors leading out to the garden; dining room; charming secondary sitting room with a dressed stone fireplace; recently renovated kitchen; utility room; guest toilet. Warm tones and natural sunlight ensure that these living spaces feel airy and welcoming.

The first floor accommodates: master bedroom with a bathroom en suite; two further double bedrooms, both air-conditioned and benefiting from a shower room en suite; two offices.

The property also boasts a gîte outbuilding offering an additional 51m2 of living space. The gîte is entirely independent from the main house and comprises two bedrooms, a sitting room, a kitchen, and a fenced garden - ideal for seasonal rentals or accommodating guests.

The house sits centred on an utterly private 1.45-acre plot, shaded by gorgeous centenary plane trees. The house enjoys a superb south-facing dining terrace looking out over the panoramic views that stretch out to the horizon. A large covered terrace is located just beyond, fitted with a summer kitchen and a barbecue area, with ample space for outdoor dining and entertaining. Just steps away, the 12m x 6m swimming pool offers a picturesque spot to relax throughout the summer and enjoy the garden and the views.

Amenities include: central heating fed by a heat pump; thermodynamic water boiler; solar panels producing electricity for domestic use; air conditioning in the gîte and the upstairs bedrooms; newly installed septic tank; mains water; double glazing; automatic gates.

This superb farmhouse property enjoys utter privacy, intimacy and tranquillity, yet is located just a short drive from the many shops and restaurants that l’Isle-sur-la-Sorgue has to offer. Perfectly suited as a spacious family home, idyllic Provençal retreat or seasonal rental property with attractive returns.
summary: Superb 19th century farmhouse with exceptional views

title: V2626 MALAUCENE
body:
Located on the foothills of the iconic Mont Ventoux, this handsome contemporary property enjoys an unspoilt rural setting and sweeping views of the surrounding scenery.

A terrific living space with oversized windows and a cathedral ceiling greets you upon entry. This living space offers an equipped kitchen with island unit, a dining area and relaxed seating. The vast windows drench the interior in natural light and open to grant access to the large dining terrace that skirts the length of the building. Utterly unobstructed views of the surrounding Ventoux countryside can be enjoyed throughout. The living room flows through to a spacious TV room, fitted with large French windows with electric shutters. A guest loo and utility room are located on the ground floor. These living spaces are air-conditioned.

The ground floor is also composed of: double bedroom suite with adjoining shower room; three further double bedrooms; bathroom; shower room with loo; guest loo. An independently accessed wing (to the east) offers an additional suite, complete with a modern shower room, sitting room, and mezzanine bedroom space. The east wing is air-conditioned.

The first floor accommodates an impressive master suite (45m2) comprising a lovely double bedroom, large dressing room, shower room with an Italian shower and a gorgeous vintage double vanity unit. This suite benefits from an ornate wrought-iron balcony and a private rooftop terrace that grants a particularly impressive view of the surrounding landscape. An additional room (that could serve as a home office), and separate loo are located on this floor. The master suite is air-conditioned.

The 0.88-acre garden has been planted with mature olive trees and landscaped with outdoor entertaining in mind. Steps lead down from the main terrace to the swimming pool. The 12m x 4m swimming pool is adorned with a wrap-around terrace and benefits from privacy from the main house, ensuring an exceptional cadre.

Amenities include: lovely bespoke wood-framed windows and doors; authentic reclaimed shutters; air-conditioning; alarm system; modern pellet burner; tasteful modern bathrooms; mains water and a private source.

A unique contemporary property in a marvellous environment.
summary: Superbly positioned contemporary property

title: V2873 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
This well-conceived contemporary property, located on the edge of the village of Cabrières-d'Avignon, enjoys excellent volumes and a beautifully landscaped garden.

The ground floor comprises: large main room with a harmonious kitchen, elegant sitting room and spacious dining area; utility room; guest loo; double bedroom with bathroom en suite and loo; large study that could be converted into an additional bedroom; double garage with electric doors.

A handsome stone staircase leads up to the first floor, composed of: double bedroom; bathroom; WC; two double bedrooms with a jack-and-jill bathroom. 

Outside, an enchanting garden offers a superb sense of privacy, landscaped with purpose and care. A terrace, draped in wisteria, runs along the front of the house, while a covered area invites you to relax and shelter from the Provençal sun. The lush, carefully landscaped grounds boast a sumptuous 10 m x 5 m swimming pool, providing an idyllic setting. 

Amenities include: underfloor heating and cooling (fed by a heat pump); thermodynamic water heater; fireplace; mains water; mains drainage; automatic watering system; ample parking; electric gates; videophone; fibre optic internet.

This property, bathed in natural light and encompassed by lovely grounds, is ideally located within walking distance of the popular Luberon village of Cabrières-d'Avignon. Built in 2015, the property features high quality materials and modern fittings, guaranteeing the highest level of modern comfort. With its generous volumes, light-filled rooms and undeniable charm, it is the epitome of luxury and elegance.
summary: Luxurious contemporary property on the edge of the village of Cabrières-d'Avignon

title: V2710 VENASQUE
body:
This cleverly conceived villa property masterfully blends the charm of an authentic “mas” with the comfort of contemporary living, all within walking distance of the renowned village of Venasque. The owners have thoughtfully incorporated traditional features such as 60 cm thick stone walls, high ceilings, and several outbuildings, while also ensuring modern amenities throughout.

The main terraces face southwest, providing stunning sunset views that can be enjoyed from both the living and dining areas during summer. Thanks to protection from northern winds, it’s often possible to dine outdoors even in winter. The views are completely unobstructed, and the swimming pool is fully sheltered, offering a superbly private setting.

The main house accommodates an impressive 76 sqm living space. A modern kitchen lies on one end, featuring a large island unit, granite work-tops and a gas range. The living spaces feel particularly cosy during the winter months, with central heating and a magnificent open fireplace ensuring the desired level of warmth and comfort. The kitchen opens onto a formal dining area and an inviting sitting room. Oversized arched French windows drench the interior with natural light, opening to reveal the property’s main dining terrace. 

The master suite boasts a large double bedroom, a dressing room, a bathroom with a walk-in shower and a freestanding bathtub, and an office space. The master suite is air-conditioned. The east wing of the property comprises a spacious double bedroom complete with a shower room and WC en suite. 

The main house further comprises: guest bedroom with an adjoining shower room and WC; large home office that could serve as an additional bedroom; utility room; pantry; guest WC.

Bucolic gardens encompass the house, landscaped with purpose and populated with a fantastic variety of indigenous trees and plants. The  dining terrace is adorned with a pergola and offers the perfect spot to entertain family and friends. Steps lead down from the terrace, through the manicured woodland, to grant access to the swimming pool area. The 10m x 5m tiled swimming pool is equipped with an automatic cover. A pool house outbuilding provides additional accommodation, independent from the main house, and comprises a double bedroom with an adjoining kitchenette, a shower room and a technical room housing the swimming pool pump system. 

A driveway winds through the oak-woodland and leads to the barn at the bottom of the property that currently serves as an ‘atelier’, with an adjoining shed providing storage space for garden tools and equipment. A double garage offers secure parking and additional storage space. 

Amenities include: oil-fired central heating; automatic watering system; town water; double glazing; automatic gates; solar panels. The property is entirely fenced.

Located in a peaceful residential area, the villa offers an unparalleled sense of tranquility - within walking distance of the village and just a short drive from the historic town of Pernes-les-Fontaines, where all essential services can be found. Conceived for living and entertaining in a beautiful setting, this property would be ideally suited as a lavish Provençal retreat or a particularly comfortable family home.
summary: Villa with gardens and swimming pool, on the edge of the village of Venasque

title: V2998 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
On the edge of the charming village of Cabrières-d’Avignon, within walking distance of local shops, this elegant Bastide-style property enjoys a great location, overlooking the Luberon valley. South-facing, this handsome property lies centred on a generous 0.42-acre plot. 

The ground floor comprises: bright and airy living area where an open-plan kitchen and dining room blend seamlessly; sitting room enhanced by a Provençal ceiling and an inset fireplace; master suite composed of a spacious walk-in wardrobe and a luxurious bathroom with both a bathtub and a shower; utility room; guest loo.

The first floor enjoys: four bedrooms, one of which is converted into an office, offering stunning views of the Luberon valley; two additional shower rooms; separate loo.

Adjoining the main house is a versatile extension, fully equipped with water and electricity connections, offering numerous possibilities of conversion, such as an office or an independent accommodation for guests. 

The Mediterranean garden, adorned with olive trees and a majestic plane tree, features a heated infinity pool with freeform curves (10m x 5m) and a spacious partially covered terrace, perfect for enjoying summer evenings or finding shade during the hot summer months.

Amenities include: underfloor heating on the ground floor; reversible air-conditioning on both floors; electric radiators on the first floor; double glazing; alarm system; automatic watering system; fibre optic internet; electric gates; videophone; mains water and a private borehole; mains drainage; wine cellar; storage room; private parking; carport. 

With its idyllic location at the entrance of the village, its generous spaces volumes, magnificent views of the Luberon, and thoughtfully designed layout, this property perfectly combines tranquillity with the convenience of easy access to the beautiful villages of Gordes, Fontaine-de-Vaucluse, Robion and Saumane-de-Vaucluse.
summary: Elegant villa with lovely views of the Luberon valley

title: V2636 LE BARROUX
body:
Located in a dominant position, close to the charming village of Le Barroux, this exceptional stone house has benefited from a complete and beautiful renovation with high quality materials.

The property consists of two independent and private dwellings as well as two garages.
The main house offers approximately 240 m² of living space and the gîte provides an additional 35 m². The house sits on a generous 1.4-acre plot of landscaped gardens.

The accommodation on the ground floor comprises: bright living room with a suspended fireplace; large and well-equipped kitchen; utility room; dining room with a fireplace. Thanks to the large sliding windows in these rooms, you can enjoy the terrific views of the landscaped garden and the infinity pool throughout the day. The patio windows in the living room and kitchen grant access to exterior terraces. The kitchen terrace benefits from a retractable awning/pergola and electric shutters.

The first floor is composed of: three bedrooms; bathroom; guest loo. One of these bedrooms, the master suite, comprises large fitted cupboards as well as a bathroom, including a bathtub, a double shower and a loo.

To complete this ensemble, the lower floor accommodates a gym, a jacuzzi, a sauna, as well as a bicycle room - with access to the garage and the garden.

The gîte provides independent living, with a sitting room / kitchen and a shower room. The large patio windows provide access to a large terrace, and to the landscaped garden and the private swimming pool that lie beyond.

The property's infinity pool and gardens (just steps away from the outdoor jacuzzi) provide an impressive viewpoint from which to enjoy the surrounding landscape, as well as the tremendous panoramic view, which is particularly spectacular at sunset. 

Meticulously renovated and decorated to a fantastic standard, this property stands out like no other.
summary: Stone property with outstanding views

title: V2162 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
Positioned in the heart of a picturesque lively village, this lovely property comprises a main house plus a small separate dwelling.

The accommodation comprises: main house, ground floor: vaulted living room with stone fireplace & dining area; library/small sitting room; kitchen with fireplace; utility; boiler room; beautiful provencal staircase. First floor: master bedroom with ensuite bathroom & dressing room; bedroom with shower room; terrace. Top floor: bedroom with mezzanine & shower room.

Attached to the main house is a wing, comprising: sitting room; kitchen; large terrace; 2 bedrooms, both with en suites.

The separate building comprises, ground floor: 2 rooms of 20m2 each, used as studies, and upstairs: a living area with mezzanine and bedroom with ensuite.
summary: Beautiful, fully renovated 18th C. stone village house with vaulted cellar, gorgeous garden and pool.

title: V2599 L'ISLE-SUR-LA-SORGUE
body:
Set in a particularly peaceful part of Saint Antoine, a desirable location above the town of L’Isle-sur-la-Sorgue, this spacious property offers beautiful interior volumes encompassed by gorgeous grounds.

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: large sitting room lined with French windows and fitted with a stone fireplace; adjoining TV room; spacious kitchen with dining table; ‘garden room’ with oversized wrought-iron windows; double bedroom suite with a shower room, loo and access to a private terrace; further
double bedroom with shower; guest loo; particularly spacious home office; utility room; small larder.

The interior is embellished by traditional Provençal ceilings, exposed beams, and terracotta flooring. Large French windows complement the elegant décor and flood the interior with natural light.

The first floor is composed of: impressively proportioned master bedroom with a bathroom and loo en suite; further double bedroom; guest shower room; guest loo. Pretty views of the garden and the surrounding countryside can be enjoyed throughout.

The house lies centred on its acre of serene park-like grounds, hidden behind wrought-iron gates and a cypress-lined drive. French windows from the kitchen and sitting room open directly onto a large south-facing dining terrace, shaded by a pergola grown with wisteria. Just beyond this terrace lies the 11m x 5m swimming pool. Hedged to provide privacy from the house, the pool is adorned by a paved surround, a covered terrace, and an outbuilding housing the swimming pool pump and storage for garden tools. Water from a private borehole feeds the garden and the property’s small pond.

Additional features include: double glazing throughout; reversible air-conditioning in the kitchen; large carport; water softener. The property is hedged, fenced and secured by automatic gates.

This beautiful and well-located property benefits from an idyllic setting, yet only a very short drive from the sought-after market town of L’Isle-sur-la-Sorgue.
summary: Beautiful bastide property close to the desirable town of L'Isle sur la Sorgue

title: V2762 ROUSSILLON
body:
Located within walking distance of the sought-after Luberon village of Roussillon, this large property enjoys an open-concept layout, great volumes, and a gorgeous landscaped garden complete with a swimming pool. Famous for its picturesque scenery and impressive ochre mines, the lively village of Roussillon is home to a bakery, grocers’ and a large number of restaurants, cafés, and bars.

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: entrance hall with fitted cupboards and an adjoining guest toilet; large 39 sqm sitting room, adorned with a wood-burning stove, flowing through to the kitchen-dining room (42 sqm); spacious double bedroom suite (currently used as an office) with an adjoining shower room and toilet; utility room; boiler room.

The first floor is composed of: lovely master suite comprising a double bedroom with a balcony overlooking the Luberon valley, a private sitting room (or home office), and an adjoining bathroom with a bathtub, double vanity unit, walk-in shower and a toilet; two further double bedroom suites, each with an adjoining shower room and toilet; sitting room providing access to the rooftop terrace.

The beautiful landscaped gardens provide a splendid and bucolic setting and offer a variety of shaded and covered terraces from which to enjoy the hot summer days and evenings. The sitting and dining rooms open out onto a large dining terrace with impressive views of the grounds and the Luberon mountains. The kitchen leads out to an intimate walled garden embellished by a wrought-iron pergola and a fig tree. The swimming pool (12m x 5m) is complete with a wrap-around terraced area. The garden is home to a terrific variety of indigenous plants and trees, with centenary olive trees, cypresses, palms, oleanders, white oaks, and towering pines. The property has a paved driveway, a carport and electric gates

Amenities include: double glazing; oil-fired central heating; air-conditioning in the master bedroom; town water; sophisticated alarm system; automatic watering; pétanque court; water softener.

This spacious Roussillon property enjoys a privileged location close to the village, stunning views, great volumes, and a contemporary layout – these features ensure that the property would serve as a lavish Luberon retreat, a comfortable family home or an interesting seasonal rental investment.
summary: Villa with superb views, located on the edge of the village.

title: V2520 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
Nestled in a quiet and private spot amongst the oak trees, but within walking distance of the sought-after village of Cabrieres d’Avignon, this type of property is rare to market. The interior is light-filled and well-conceived, and the views are stunning. 

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: open-plan living area with fitted kitchen, dining area, and large comfortable sitting room, all south-facing and with patio doors leading to the terrace; master bedroom; en suite bathroom with twin sinks, shower and bath; study; utility room; access to the garage.

The first floor comprises: 2 double bedrooms, both with breathtaking views of the Luberon valley and mountain beyond, and each with en suite bathroom; separate wc.

The property is accessed by electric gates with video entry leading to an attractive drive that meanders its way to the house. The garden, of over an acre, is beautifully landscaped and maintained, with Pétanque court and planted with Provençal shrubs and trees fed by an automatic watering system.  The swimming pool measures 9m by 4m, is heated, and has an electric rolling cover for security, heat retention and ease of maintenance.

The property boasts a garage, double glazing  and mosquito netting throughout, underfloor heating, security alarm, and mains water and drainage. It is also possible to extend the property, or to construct an additional separate building if required. 

This beautifully-situated property has enormous potential as a family home, holiday house or seasonal rental, and has scope for further development.
summary: Elegant villa with pool, view and constructible land

title: V2540 GORDES
body:
The property, built in 1876, has been renovated to a very high standard and enjoys a privileged position on the edge of the hamlet. This authentic property is surrounded by a well planned an easy to maintain walled garden to ensure absolute privacy.

On the ground floor: spacious entrance hall leading to the 60m2 open plan sitting /dining room with direct access to the gardens;  kitchen with decorative fireplace; utility room; separate wc.

Upstairs: double bedroom with ensuite bathroom; 2nd double bedroom; 3rd bedroom presently used as a tv room; family bathroom; separate wc.

The second floor comprises: master bedroom, with a view of Gordes, ensuite bathroom; dressing room; spacious library/reading room.

The gardens have an automatic watering system fed by a 4 independent wells. The garden and grounds include a stone 'cabanon' that could be used as a pool house if desired, off road parking for 2 cars, covered dining area and a dozen different fruit trees!

This property with original timber beams, french ceilings and stone floors is bound to capture your heart!
summary: Elegant 19th century property with pretty garden and swimming pool

title: V2639 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
This stone house, extended and renovated in the 90s, offers exceptional potential on the edge of the Luberon village of Cabrières-d'Avignon. The local grocer, boulangerie and butcher all lie just a short walk from the property's doorstep. The house sits on an extremely generous, and partly constructible, 0.57-acre plot.

The living comprises, on the ground floor: entrance hall; large open-concept sitting/dining room that flows through to the kitchen; master suite with an adjoining shower room and private loo; utility room; guest shower room and loo. The sitting/dining room benefits from a south facing terrace adorned with a pergola.

The first floor is composed of: second living space with an adjoining kitchenette; second double bedroom suite with oversized windows granting outstanding views, and an adjoining bathroom fitted with a large walk-in shower; further suite with an adjoining shower room and loo;  large room that could be used as an additional bedroom or a great home office.

The property is sold with an outbuilding, formerly used as a workshop, offers an area of approximately 50 m2 and could serve for personal or professional uses.

The partially constructible plot of land accommodates a large outbuilding (approximately 95m2) as well as many fruit trees. An electric gate provides a second access to the property and secure parking. Naturally, a swimming pool could be installed if desired and further outbuildings (e.g. a gîte) could be constructed.

The house is offers oil-fired central heating and reversible air conditioning. Many remnants of the property's historic origins remain well preserved, maintaining the Provençal charm and appeal of the house.

This property benefits from an exceptional location just steps away from the heart of the village, with terrific Luberon views and endless potential.

title: V2755 L'ISLE-SUR-LA-SORGUE
body:
Located in a superbly quiet setting, this traditional stone farmhouse offers 1.2-acres of gardens, well-proportioned living spaces, innate character and a fantastic array of modern amenities. The property is located close to the sought-after market town of l’Isle-sur-la-Sorgue and the lively Luberon village of Lagnes in the foothills of the Monts de Vaucluse.

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: entrance hall; 61 sqm sitting room with a wood-burning stove, an exposed stone wall and French windows leading out to the garden; large dining kitchen; secondary sitting room; utility room; pantry; guest toilet.

The first floor accommodates a beautiful master suite that consists of a 40 sqm double bedroom, large fitted wardrobes, and a shower room with a large walk-in shower and a toilet. This suite features authentic ‘parefeuille’ floor tiling, exposed stonework, cathedral ceilings and an ‘oeil de boeuf’.

The first floor further comprises: double bedroom suite with an adjoining shower room and toilet; three double bedrooms; guest bathroom; guest shower room; guest toilet.

The lush green garden enjoys a particularly impressive swimming pool area complete with a natural rock water feature and an adjoining plunge pool. The swimming pool (15m x 6m) is tiled and surrounded by a large terraced area. The adjoining pool house grants the perfect spot to relax and enjoy the hot summer months, offering a large roofed dining terrace, a particularly well-equipped summer kitchen, a loo, and a pool pump room. A large terrace runs along the front of the house, shaded by a centenary plane tree and pergolas grown with climbing roses.

The property is entirely fenced and has electric gates, a private water source (60m depth) and an automatic watering system.

A large barn area (~50 sqm), to the west of the house, adjacent to the kitchen, could serve as a garage or carport. There is also a large workshop with ample space to store garden tools and equipment.

Amenities include: newly installed heat pump providing central heating and hot water; solar panels generating electricity for domestic use; double glazing; wood burner; air-conditioning in the master suite and in the main sitting room; alarm system and safe.

A beautiful and thoroughly charming stone farmhouse that would serve as a wonderful Provençal country retreat or a spacious family home.

Les informations sur les risques auxquels ce bien est exposé sont disponibles sur le site Géorisques : http://www.georisques.gouv.fr
summary: L'Isle-sur-la-Sorgue stone farmhouse with pool and land.

title: V2386 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
This imposing yet elegant property dating back to the beginning of the 17th century has retained many original period features and has fabulous views of the Luberon and the church of Saint Vincent consecrated in 1587.

The living accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: stately entrance hall with stone stairwell; sitting /dining measuring 55m2, with open fireplace; equipped kitchen; utility room; separate wc; games room, with original vaulted ceiling, measuring 60m2; authentic vaulted wine cellars.,

The first floor comprises: spacious landing with south facing balcony; 4 double bedrooms, one of which has a private terrace, all with ensuite bathrooms ; 2 further double bedrooms; family bathroom.

The loft space, presently used for storage measures 145m2 and could be easily transformed into further bedrooms, bathrooms or office space if desired.

The stone walled garden has: pool area; summer kitchen and dining area; carport for 2 vehicles; a  stone cabannon built in 1788 for the production and storage of wine, well established garden with a pretty fountain and various shaded seating areas amongst the olive trees.

A sumptuous property that has high ceilings, tall windows and is steeped in character! The potential volume of the building allows for many possible projects.
summary: South facing 17th century vicarage with swimming pool in the heart of the village

title: V2701 ROUSSILLON
body:
Contemporary meets traditional in this fantastic Luberon property. This newly remodelled stone cottage, with olive tree-lined driveway, sits on 1.9 acres of landscaped countryside with a beautiful swimming pool and pool house building.

The accommodation on the ground floor comprises: contemporary fully equipped kitchen with dining island and wonderful views of the countryside; open-plan sitting / dining room; two double bedroom; office; WC; bathroom. The sitting room is lined with French windows to the north and patio doors to the south that can be fully opened to create a seamless indoor-outdoor transitional space, and the perfect spot to sit and enjoy the unspoiled panoramic scenery. One further double bedroom and a bathroom lie on the first floor.

The pool house outbuilding has potential as a fabulous bedroom suite with adjoining shower room or a wonderful home office. To the rear, this outbuilding also offers a valuable one-car garage, and additional roofed space to accommodate garden equipment (or an additional car) and space for wood storage. 

The 1.9-acre garden features a 10 m x 5 m swimming pool with wrap-around terrace, a barbeque and outdoor dining area, and a variety of covered terraces to enjoy the scenery and the sun in absolute privacy. The property has ample parking to the front with an additional driveway and parking to the rear.

The complete renovation and remodel have brought this authentic 18th century stone farmhouse into the 21st century with taste and style. Double glazing features throughout, with underfloor heating overlaid with travertine, air-conditioning, granite worktops in the kitchen, and a fabulous exterior designed with outdoor entertaining in mind. The result is a beautiful blend of modern and rustic, and a house that complements its stunning surroundings perfectly.

The property is conveniently located within walking distance of the village of Roussillon, which hosts numerous restaurants, bars, various grocers’ and a boulangerie.
summary: Beautiful stone house in a serene part of the Roussillon countryside

title: V2766 GORDES
body:
Nestled in the heart of the Gordes countryside, this superbly conceived single storey property offers an exceptional standard of modern living, a refined décor, tremendous attention to detail and a wonderfully manicured garden. The interior comprises bright and airy living spaces, drenched with natural light by oversized French windows. Natural materials blend seamlessly with soft tones to create a welcoming and serene atmosphere.

The pièce de resistance is undoubtably the open concept living room, lined with French windows that flow out to the swimming pool area and the serene garden that extends beyond. The gorgeous bespoke, 'Fabre', kitchen is fitted with a large island and accompanied by a generous formal dining area. On the far end, the sitting room is arranged around a dressed stone fireplace. This spacious and elegant space features authentic Provençal ceilings. There is a pantry, a large garage (with an automatic door) and a guest toilet.

The property’s master suite comprises a spacious double bedroom (20.6 m2), a private shower room with a toilet and large fitted cupboards. Two further suites lie on the opposite end of the house and each feature a lovely shower room, fitted cupboards and a toilet.

The 0.5-acre garden has been superbly landscaped and grants complete privacy and a serene setting. The 12m x 4m swimming pool (tiled, heated and fully automated) is fitted with a submerged cover. The swimming pool is adorned by a large covered terrace, to relax and enjoy the scenery in utter tranquillity. Thyme lawns and lavender plants surround the pool, shaded by centenary olive trees and mature white oaks. The garden is entirely fenced and the property has electric gates.

Amenities include: ducted air-conditioning throughout; thermodynamic water boiler; mains drainage; mains water; fibre optic internet; sophisticated alarm system; automatic watering. There is a technical room, a storage room and a stone tool shed in the garden.

A superb modern property, completed in 2022, crafted to a terrific standard with natural materials and the highest quality fittings. The property would serve as a particularly lavish Luberon retreat with attractive seasonal rental returns.
summary: Exquisite stone property in the heart the Luberon

title: V2418 L'ISLE-SUR-LA-SORGUE
body:
A fabulous property located just a few minutes from the famous market town of L'Isle sur La Sorgue and all its colourful cafes, restaurants and shops!

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: large living room 50m2 with stone fireplace, fully equipped kitchen; laundry room; study; family bathroom; separate wc; double bedroom; TV room (could be used as a 5th bedroom if necessary); interior access to the garage.

The first floor includes: 3 double bedrooms, each with ensuite bathroom, one with private terrace. All rooms are spacious with high ceilings and have been beautifully renovated and decorated.

The gardens have been superbly landscaped and planted, they offer many different possibilities to enjoy the sun or welcome shade during the long summer months!

The expansive stone-tiled terrace is accessed from all the south facing rooms and and is an absolute delight! This exterior dining area enjoys a pretty view  of the gardens and swimming pool (10m x 5m with automatic cover and "swim against the current" function)

The property has a brand new heat pump as well as air conditioning, central heating, electric gates, automatic irrigation system (connected to the canal) and alarm.

A perfect family or holiday home investment for the most demanding buyer!
summary: Elegant, south facing property, beautifully renovated in a privileged position.

title: V2714 BEDOIN
body:
Provence, Vaucluse, south Ventoux. 
In absolute peace and quiet, not isolated and within walking distance to the village, this property comprises a single-storey villa and its annex offering sumptuous, unobstructed views over the countryside, Mont Ventoux and the village of Crillon le Brave.

The main house is bright and comfortable, with a large fully-equipped dining kitchen opening onto the terrace shaded by a bioclimatic pergola, a rear kitchen and a storeroom; a living room with high ceilings and a fireplace; the night area features a master suite with its own bathroom and separate toilet, two other bedrooms sharing a bathroom; a laundry room or storage room completes the property.

The annex of approximately 50 m² is located near the Desjoyaux 5 m x 10 m swimming pool. It comprises a sitting room, a fitted kitchen, a bedroom and a shower room with wc.
The garden, beautifully laid out and subtly planted with trees, overlooks the hills, the organic vineyards, the very pretty village of Crillon le Brave and the giant of Provence, Mont Ventoux.

Wonderful location and environment, high-quality materials and features characterise this superb property. Ideal as a main or second home, or as a luxury holiday rental.
summary: Superb villa and annex for 200m² of living space with swimming pool and panoramic views

title: V3021 GOULT
body:
Just a short walk from the ever-desirable village of Goult, this elegant contemporary villa offers the perfect blend of modern comfort and serene countryside living. Boasting outstanding Luberon views, a private garden, swimming pool, and multiple terraces, this property is the ideal retreat.

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: open plan kitchen and sitting room flooded with light and fitted with a cozy pellet-burning stove; master bedroom with adjoining shower room and WC. The kitchen benefits from direct access to the dining terrace that enjoys jaw-dropping views of the surrounding Luberon countryside. The open plan living space is also air-conditioned. A practical laundry room and access to the garage complete the ground floor. 

The first floor comprises: large double bedroom with adjoining office space that could be converted into a bathroom; large double bedroom with the possibility to split to create two separate bedrooms; guest shower room; guest WC. 

The garden is thoughtfully designed, with two terraced areas, ideal for outdoor dining and relaxation. The 7m x 3.5m swimming pool is fully secured with a gate, ensuring peace of mind. Mature trees surround the property, enhancing privacy and creating a lush setting. A garage offers ample storage space, and the property is completely enclosed with an automatic gate for added security.

This beautiful property offers the best of both worlds - great privacy while being just a short walk from Goult's local restaurants, bars, cafés, boulangerie, butcher, and grocery store. Enjoy complete tranquility without sacrificing convenience. With its stylish décor, incredible location, and generous outdoor space, this villa is the perfect Luberon getaway, a comfortable family home, or a potential rental investment.
summary: Contemporary villa with breathtaking views, on the edge of Goult.

title: V2580 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
Located in the heart of the sought-after village of Cabrières-d’Avignon, this 18th century stone property enjoys generous living spaces, a large walled garden, and an abundance of innate architectural character. The property is filled with natural light from a host of French windows, which is further amplified by high ceilings and the elegant décor that flows throughout.

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: beautifully proportioned sitting room with fireplace; Provençal kitchen; ‘Petit salon’ or home office; double bedroom with vanity; guest loo.

The first floor is composed of: master bedroom with Juliette balcony; further double bedroom; large bathroom with shower and loo; home office; shower room with loo.

The second floor accommodates a double bedroom that benefits from a private sitting room area.

Hidden behind the property’s walls, the south-facing garden offers a generously sized outdoor living space adorned with a swimming pool and large paved terraces. A roofed terrace with direct access to the kitchen provides an escape from the sun. The recently installed 8m x 4m heated swimming pool has been a tremendous addition to this outdoor space and ensures that all comforts are catered for within the property’s walls.

This meticulously maintained stone house has been thoughtfully updated over the years with care paid to the preservation of its gorgeous authentic features. Provencal ceilings, hexagonal terracotta tiling, hardwood doors and stonework guarantee an unrivalled level of charm throughout. The layout ensures that the property is ideally suited for entertaining guests, comfortable year-round living, and relaxing holiday retreats.

The roof has been entirely replaced and insulated, and a discreet central air-conditioning system installed throughout the first and second floors. The renovated attic space offers generous storage space with easy access from the first floor. The property also has oil-fired central heating.

A beautiful Luberon property, just a short walk from the local boulangerie, Bistrot, grocer’s and butcher’s.

title: V3086 MENERBES
body:
Located in a peaceful setting just minutes from the desirable village of Ménerbes, this 18th-century stone house captures the very essence of Provençal charm. Steeped in history and character, the property combines authentic architectural details with modern comforts, creating a home that feels both timeless and welcoming.

Inside, original features such as Provençal ceilings, exposed beams, and stone elements have been lovingly preserved, while thoughtful renovations with high-quality materials bring warmth and modern convenience.

The ground level comprises: welcoming kitchen with fireplace, stone sink, and grand skylight; adjoining dining area with direct access to stone wine cellar; cozy sitting room with working fireplace and original stone water trough - all set upon elegant Bourgogne stone floors. A WC, shower room with Zellige tiling, and utility/laundry room complete this level.

The first floor houses: small room that may serve as an office or child's bedroom; spacious principal bedroom with access to an adjoining room, ideal as a dressing area or office; additional bedroom; bathroom with a classic clawfoot tub, adding a touch of elegance. Beautiful oak wood floors are laid throughout the entire upper floor. 

An independent air-conditioned 26m² stone outbuilding offers further potential, ready to be transformed into a guest house, artist's studio, or cozy gîte.

Outside, a private inner stone courtyard shaded by a pergola provides a relaxing outdoor living space, with a 250-year-old staircase standing as a reminder of the property's remarkable history. A beautifully landscaped walled garden offers privacy as well as views of the surrounding cliffs and includes: heated bassin-style pool; outdoor shower; greenhouse; stone outbuilding for storing firewood or garden equipment.

Amenities include: reversible air conditioning; electric hot water heater; mains and canal water; double-glazed oak windows; fibre internet; automatic garden irrigation; sheltered parking for two cars.

This property is exceptional for its authenticity, privacy, and prime location near one of the Luberon's most celebrated villages. Combining historic charm with modern convenience, it presents a rare opportunity to own a true Provençal retreat - whether as a permanent residence, pied-à-terre, or character-filled rental investment.
summary: Charming 18th-century stone house near Ménerbes.

title: V3012 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
On the edge of the village of Cabrières-d'Avignon, this property blends seamlessly into its surroundings, combining traditional architecture with amazing views of the Luberon.

The ground floor comprises: spacious living area with great volumes, bathed in natural light, featuring an open-plan kitchen that flows into the dining room and sitting room; additional sitting room, enhanced by oak flooring, adding warmth and character to the space; utility room; loo; large garage.

On the garden level: bedroom, enjoying direct access to the outside; large and lovely wine cellar.

The first floor accomodates: two elegant bedrooms sharing a beautifully renovated shower room with a walk-in shower and gorgeous Zellige tiling; master bedroom with an en suite shower room; separate loo.

The garden features a covered terrace, providing an ideal space for summer dining. A path lined with terraced walls leads to a shaded area, perfect for the warmer days. The chlorine pool, measuring 8m x 4m, fits perfectly into this beautiful setting.

Amenities include: underfloor heating; double glazing; automatic watering system; electric gates; mains water; mains drainage; fibre optic internet.

Thanks to its prime location, stunning views, spacious interiors,  character and private garden, this property offers a peaceful living environment or excellent potential for rental investment, all in the heart of Provence.
summary: Elegant property with stunning views, on the edge of the village of Cabrières-d'Avignon

title: V2977 L'ISLE-SUR-LA-SORGUE
body:
This stunning property epitomizes luxury and elegance. Extensively renovated, the home and its beautifully manicured gardens have been transformed into a serene oasis of tranquility and style.

The heart of the home is a spacious 65m² sitting and dining room, opening onto a generous terrace with south-facing views. The sitting room has a impressive contemporary fireplace for the winter months.The sleek, bespoke kitchen is outfitted with top-of-the-line appliances, perfect for those with a discerning eye for detail. The ground floor also includes a luxurious master suite, a large utility and technical room, an office, a separate WC, and ample built-in storage for maximum convenience.

Upstairs, the first floor offers two spacious bedrooms, a family bathroom, a balcony, and a separate WC.

The independent gîte mirrors the elegant design of the main house, featuring a comfortable bedroom, a shower room, and a separate WC, making it ideal for rental opportunities or hosting guests.

The meticulously landscaped gardens are a sight to behold, with palm trees, decorative shrubs, and a low-maintenance Japanese lawn. The 10x4 meter heated pool, complete with an automatic cover and a fountain, offers a stunning focal point. The outdoor living space is enhanced by a summer kitchen and dining area shaded by two mulberry plane trees, perfect for al fresco dining. A built-in Jacuzzi and seating area provide the ideal vantage point for enjoying dazzling sunsets.

Equipment includes
- Brand new solar panels, generating revenue and covering all electrical consumption
- Double garage with electric doors (48m²)
- Visiophone and alarm system
- Connection to canal water for garden irrigation
- PAC air conditioning throughout the property and gîte
- High-quality aluminum double glazing 
- Petanque court

This exceptional home is the perfect blend of modern luxury and natural beauty, offering a lifestyle of unparalleled comfort in a highly desirable location.
summary: Stunning, spacious villa with separate gîte and swimming pool.

title: V2453 OPPEDE
body:
This magnificent hamlet property in Oppède, dated back to 1784, radiates comfort, quality, character. The 300 m2 of stylishly renovated living space would be ideally suited for a fabulous family home or luxury bed & breakfast. Particular attention was paid to the preservation of the original architecture and overall charm during the renovation and the result reflects this – a lovely property with a modern interior oozing with charm.

The accommodation includes, on the ground floor: fully equipped stainless-steel kitchen; sitting room with a large open fireplace and small office space; utility room / wine cellar; master bedroom (30 m2) with French windows opening out onto the interior courtyard; bathroom; pantry. A lovely winding Provençal staircase takes you up to the first and second floors. 

First floor; three double bedrooms, one with an adjoining dressing room; storage room; two bathrooms with double vanities; further bedroom (30 m2). 

On the second floor; two spacious double bedrooms (29.5 m2 and 22 m2) giving views over the vineyards; dressing room; bathroom. 

The interior courtyard, newly re-laid with authentic limestone slabs and adorned with a mulberry tree and wisteria provides access through to the workshop (30 m2) and its mezzanine (20 m2), a large independent reception room / summer dining room, affectionately named the “Salle des Fêtes” (30 m2), the kitchen and the master bedroom. Needless to say, the property is ideally laid out to accommodate friends and family throughout the year. The house also has a recently installed swimming pool with stone walls, lavender and, olive trees surrounding it - a subtle reminder that you are in the heart of the Luberon. There is equally ample outdoor parking and a pétanque court to the rear of the house. 

The renovation has been meticulously carried out to completion. Smooth limestone tiles cover the kitchen and “Salle des Fêtes”. The renovation equally included structural work to bring the property into the 21st century, with modern double-glazing, roof insulation, sealing and treatment of the beams, a brand new oil-fired central heating system, and revised plumbing and electrics. Hidden in-built storage units located throughout keep the house feeling clean and spacious. 

An authentic, but modernised character property in a peaceful and privileged Luberon location.

Neighboring constructible land can be purchased with the property – see ref V2448.
summary: Meticulously renovated Mas dated 1784 in Oppède.

title: V2503 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
This stylish stone property enjoys a spacious and tastefully decorated interior, a landscaped garden, and a beautiful infinity edge swimming pool.

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: sitting room with wood burning stove; mezzanine bedroom with a private dressing room below; guest shower room and loo; four further double bedrooms, each fitted with a modern bathroom en suite. All the bedrooms and living spaces are air-conditioned.

A corridor lined with floor-to-ceiling windows leads to the open-plan kitchen / sitting room. This fantastic 48 sqm space offers a fully equipped kitchen complete with an island unit and a breakfast bar, a dining area, and a sitting area. A large arched French widow floods this space with light and provides access to the property’s covered terrace and swimming pool.

The large, covered terrace extends out from the house and wraps around the 10m x 5m swimming pool. This fabulous outdoor entertaining space is complemented by the pool’s infinity edge, a wrought-iron gazebo, exterior lighting, and a built-in barbecue. The property is walled and gated, featuring ample parking to the rear as well as a storage room for the garden equipment. The swimming pool pump and equipment is housed in a basement below the main terrace.

The property is located just a short drive from the sought-after villages of Gordes and Cabrières-d’Avignon. The convenient single-storey layout, lovely yet easy to maintain garden, and great location in the heart of Luberon guarantee a fabulous holiday home or interesting rental investment.
summary: Contemporary single-storey stone property with swimming pool

title: V2483 APT
body:
This beautiful 18th century stone farmhouse offers an abundance of charm with over 7 hectares of private countryside and woodland.

The ground floor accommodation comprises: bright sitting room with fireplace; kitchen with breakfast table; dining room; study; shower room; TV room; lovely authentic wine cellar with vaulted ceiling; utility / storage room; large workshop; technical room. There are an additional three rooms to the rear with an independent entrance - currently used as an office, utility and reception room - but would provide a self-contained living space to accommodate family or guests.

The first-floor accommodation is composed of: hallway; three double bedrooms with bathrooms en suite; large sitting room with kitchen and French windows leading out on to the terrace. A spacious attic room could provide an additional bedroom.

The garden offers a variety of terraced areas for dining, sitting and relaxing in absolute privacy. The front garden is adorned with a lovely stone carp pond fed by the property’s spring water with a selection of mulberry trees providing much-needed shade. The first-floor terrace offers the ideal outdoor dining area, embellished by a pergola and climbing roses, and conveniently positioned next to the first-floor kitchen – ensuring the Rosé will never be far from reach!

The property features an excellent central heating system, using solar panels backed up by a 2016 Bosch oil-fired boiler (with brand new hot water cylinder). An AEG water softener has also been newly installed. The property is fully alarmed and has fibre internet.   

Although it has a lovely rural feel, this property is ideally situated just 5 minutes from the lively town of Apt, which offers a large variety of restaurants, shops, bars, boulangeries, and a weekly farmers’ market. This lovely authentic farmhouse has a lot to offer and would make a fabulous family house or charming chambre d’hôtes. The location, authenticity, beautiful terraces and stunning plot of land are sure to captivate your attention.
summary: Idyllic farmhouse in the heart of the Luberon countryside

title: V2767 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
Nestled in a bucolic part of the sought-after village of Cabrières-d'Avignon, this spacious south facing house is surrounded by beautiful olive trees. The 0.87 acres of wooded grounds accommodate a heated swimming-pool (11m x 4m, equipped with an automatic cover) and a comfortable gîte outbuilding. 

The ground floor is composed of: entrance hall; large and bright 50 m2 living space comprising a dining room and a sitting room with a fireplace; well-equipped open concept kitchen with a breakfast table; library or music-room; guest WC; master bedroom with adjoining bathroom. The property also benefits from a spacious painting studio with beautiful wrought-iron French windows, and a technical room.

The first floor comprises two bedrooms and a bathroom.

The gîte has an independent access and offers: double bedroom; guest bathroom; spacious sitting room complete with a kitchenette; private terrace.

Amenities include: oil-fired central heating (De Dietrich); air-conditioning in the two upstairs bedrooms, the studio, and the gite; fibre-optic internet; double glazing; automatic watering; private water source; automatic gates.

The highly desirable village of Cabrières-d’Avignon, and its shops and Bistrot, lies within walking distance. This lovely property would serve as a fantastic family home, a rental investment, or a lovely holiday home close to all amenities.
summary: Property with excellent views within walking distance of Cabrières-d'Avignon

title: V2531 ROUSSILLON
body:
This spacious south-facing villa offers a well-conceived floorplan that optimises space and light, a wonderfully landscaped garden, and a private swimming pool area. The property lies within walking distance of the village of Roussillon.

The ground floor comprises: small foyer; large kitchen with breakfast table and French windows leading out on to the covered terrace; utility room; south-facing dining room; sitting room with fireplace; double bedroom currently used as a home office; shower room with guest loo. Terracotta tiles flow throughout the ground floor and out to the terraces, creating a seamless indoor-outdoor transition.

The first floor is composed of: south-facing master bedroom with shower room en suite; south-facing double bedroom with bathroom en suite. Both these first-floor bedrooms benefit from utterly unobstructed views of the Luberon mountain.

The carefully landscaped garden ensures that absolute privacy can be enjoyed throughout the property. A series of tiled terraces lead down from the house to the swimming pool area, with drystone walls and sculpted shrubs delineating each space. Just below, the freeform swimming pool sits wrapped around a mature olive tree, with climbing rosemary plants, shrubs and colourful oleanders providing shelter and privacy. Totalling over 200m2, these terraces serve as a welcome extension of the living space during the hot months, with a large pergola and the covered terrace providing shaded seating and dining options. Exterior lighting ensures this space is as delightful night as it is day. 

A small outbuilding houses the swimming pool pump and equipment, and a garage offers secure parking with a workshop and storage space behind.

Thanks to the well-thought-out landscaping, mature vegetation and the house’s tastefully simplistic design and layout, the property blends seamlessly into its surrounds and guarantees the perfect Provencal hideaway.
summary: Handsome villa with landscaped gardens

title: V2893 ROUSSILLON
body:
A charming country home, full of Provençal character, offering beautiful open views of the surrounding countryside and the Luberon hills beyond. Located in a pretty hamlet close to the village of Roussillon, this 4-bedroom property has been carefully renovated and extended and has been well maintained, both inside and out. The house benefits from two dining terraces, offering convivial entertaining space accessed from both the kitchen and an impressive light-filled living and dining room with double height ceiling. A 10m swimming pool, facing south and east, sits in a partially enclosed garden of around 3000m2 which has been partly planted with olive trees.

On the ground floor the accommodation extends to: an entrance hall; a spacious and light open plan dining-sitting room with vaulted ceiling, providing superb volume, and a handsome fireplace; two sets of glazed double doors lead from the sitting room onto a paved dining area and a raised terrace planted with olive trees. Off the entrance hall is a storage cupboard; a pantry/laundry; and a guest WC.

The first floor comprises: a short staircase leading to a mezzanine level with a bright master bedroom suite with shower-room; a double bedroom; and separate WC. 

The second floor accommodates: two good sized double bedrooms, one with a decorative, exposed stone wall; and a bathroom. 

The exterior of the property includes: two paved dining terraces; a well-maintained mature garden with trees, shrubs, a variety of flowering plants and space for a vegetable garden; an olive grove; a swimming pool of 10m x 3.5m; a stone out-building for garden storage and pool equipment; and a gated parking space. The open views to the countryside and the Luberon hills can be enjoyed from the garden and pool area.

Technical information: mains water; mains drainage; automatic watering system; alarm system; electric heating; double-glazing; fibre optic internet connection.
summary: Charming country property with lovely Luberon views

title: V2553 ST SATURNIN LES APT
body:
This superb contemporary property seamlessly combines the charm of a traditional Provencal farmhouse with the sought-after ease of modern living. Complemented by a bright and spacious floor-plan, a fantastic garden and even grape vines, this property is ideally suited as a fabulous Luberon holiday home or a particularly comfortable family house.

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: master suite; fully equipped kitchen with falcon induction range; spacious adjoining living room arranged around the fireplace; utility room / rear kitchen; single bedroom currently used as a study; guest loo. The beautiful ground floor master suite accommodates a large double bedroom, a sleek dressing room and an adjoining bathroom with shower and loo. Large French windows lining the property grant immediate access to the south facing terrace and flood the ground floor with natural light. 

The first floor is composed of: double bedroom with an adjoining shower room and dressing room; further double bedroom with an adjoining shower room; small sitting room or home office; guest loo. Pretty Luberon views can be enjoyed from the first floor.

The high-quality of the property’s construction has seamlessly instilled charm and character throughout. Exposed wooden beams, natural stone flooring, and reclaimed features adorn the interior, with stone surrounds, traditional Provencal roofing, and stone cladding along the façade. The property is fitted with double glazing, underfloor heating/cooling, and a water softener.

The house sits on a 0.68-acre plot, partially planted with grape vines to the east. The remainder of the grounds are walled, creating a fantastic sense of privacy. The south-facing garden accommodates a large stone-slabbed terrace that runs the length of the property, with the 8m x 4m heated swimming pool just beyond. A lovely, roofed veranda provides relaxed seating with the barbecue and summer kitchen area just behind. A small stone-clad outbuilding houses the swimming pool pump and system.

This fantastic property provides an excellent standard of modern living in the heart of the sought-after Luberon valley.
summary: Splendid bastide-style property with swimming pool and grape vines

title: V2380 SAIGNON
body:
This Luberon countryside property offers fantastic views, complete privacy and a beautiful garden accommodating a heated swimming pool. Natural stone flooring, exposed wooden beams and a tasteful decor have instilled character into the property whilst underfloor heating, modern bathrooms and double glazing guarantee a high standard of modern living. The property lies within walking distance of the picturesque village of Saignon.

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: entrance hall; spacious and sun-drenched sitting room adorned with large French windows and a stone fireplace; dining room; open-concept kitchen with a Lacanche range; pantry; utility room; guest loo. The ground floor master suite provides a spacious air-conditioned double bedroom complete with an adjoining bathroom. All rooms on the ground floor are south facing and have their own access to the terrace area and the garden beyond. Beautiful views of the village of Saignon and the surrounding countryside can be enjoyed throughout. 

The first floor comprises: two further double bedrooms, both with stunning views; guest bathroom; separate loo.

The garden has been beautifully landscaped, fenced, and hedged to grant complete privacy. Indigenous shrubs, fruit trees and olive tress ensure an ease of maintenance whilst providing much-needed shade from the heat. A large slabbed terrace skirts the front of the property and is adorned with a pergola whilst an additional roofed breakfast terrace offers an escape from the heat during the day. The garden also accommodates a heated 8m x 4m swimming pool complete with an adjoining pool house. The pool house is fully equipped with a WC, heated shower and a summer kitchen.

The property also includes a garage and an atelier/workshop. Both open and covered south facing terraces offer magnificent views of the village, surrounding lavender fields and cherry orchards.
