Within walking distance to the popular village of Saignon with bakery, post office and restaurants, this property would make a fantastic family home, holiday house or excellent rental investment.
summary: Elegant south facing villa with gorgeous views

title: V2481 LAGNES
body:
This tastefully renovated stone mas delivers character, privacy, and stunning proportions, conveniently located on the edge of the historic village of Lagnes. 

Once a vast barn, this unique space has been fabulously transformed into an open concept ‘great room’, providing a terrific space optimized for entertaining family and guests. This room incorporates a fully equipped kitchen, large dining table and relaxed seating arranged around the fireplace. Large French windows lining this space open out onto the terrace and swimming pool. The accommodation on the ground floor also comprises: two double bedrooms; modern shower room; utility / technical room.

The first floor is comprised of two family suites, each providing a spacious self-contained living space. The first suite is composed of: large open-plan kitchen / sitting room with fireplace; shower room; overhead mezzanine with a double bed. The second suite comprises: open-plan living area with fully equipped kitchenette and a lovely fireplace; two double bedrooms; shower room. There is also a storage / technical room on the first floor.

The property boasts a gorgeous walled swimming pool area, complete with a shaded terrace, outbuilding housing the pump and pool equipment, and an assortment of olive trees, oleander and rosemary plants – all wonderfully kempt. An additional terrace provides a sunny dining area with a gravelled section below with parking for up to 6 cars. The property is fully walled, has electric gates and an intercom.

This property represents a great balance between authenticity and modern living. 19th century farmhouses aren’t synonymous with bright and large volumes – which is what makes this property uniquely special. Provençal ceilings, exposed beams, French windows and beautiful stonework retained throughout add character to this historic property. Ideally located less than 10 minutes from Isle-sur-la-Sorgue, Lagnes also offers a bakery, bar, pharmacy, restaurants and a doctor.
summary: Stylish stone village house with garden and swimming pool.

title: V2467 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
This recently renovated village house offers an abundance of character and space in the centre of the sought-after village of Cabrières-d’Avignon. An outbuilding with unique development potential is also included in the sale. 

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: entrance hall; wine cellar; bright dining room with large windows; sitting room with fireplace; cloakroom; fitted dining kitchen. French windows in the sitting and dining rooms open out into the courtyard.

The first floor is composed of: two spacious double bedrooms; Jack and Jill bathroom; WC; further bedroom with shower en suite.

The second floor comprises: large bedroom, study, or studio, with wall-to-wall window revealing a very pretty view of the village;  spacious double bedroom; bathroom; terrace with view over the village and Château of Cabrières; summer kitchen to chill the rosé, or it could be adjoined to the bedroom to form a family suite. 

The south and west facing courtyard offers a generous outdoor space for sitting, dining or sunbathing, with a covered terrace to hide from the hot Provençal sunshine. The courtyard could accommodate a small swimming pool whilst retaining a terrace and shaded dining area.

A separate 65 sqm stone outbuilding, currently used as a garage, is also included in the sale. Planning permission can be obtained to transform this into a separate two-story dwelling – an increasingly rare investment opportunity in the heart of the village.

This lively and convenient Luberon village offers a boulangerie, butcher, grocer, restaurant and Bistro all just minutes from the property. Whether you’re looking for a low-maintenance Luberon getaway, spacious family house, or an investment opportunity with untapped potential – you’re sure to be charmed by this lovely property.
summary: 18th century village property with garden and views

title: V2925 LE THOR
body:
This delightful 18th century convent, just steps away from the local shops and restaurants, combines charm and authenticity. With its grandiose architecture and beautifully proportioned spaces, it is a small piece of paradise in the heart of the village.

The interior enjoys large windows, drenching the living spaces with natural light, as well as gorgeous decorative ciment tiles and stunning ceiling height. 

The ground floor comprises: spacious hallway leading through to the drawing room; double bedroom with en suite shower room and WC; kitchen opening onto the sitting room and dining room, opening out into the walled garden; workshop; laundry room; storage area.

The first floor is composed of: kitchen; dining and sitting room with an open concept, double-sided fireplace and tall French doors flowing out to the terrace; additional drawing room; three double bedrooms; two shower rooms with WC.

The house could therefore be split into two fully independent living spaces. 

The garden, surrounded by a manicured lawn and shaded by a mature olive tree, features a lovely terrace and a swimming pool -  the property is enclosed by a historic fortified wall. 

Amenities include: gas central heating; air conditioning in all bedrooms; mains water; automatic watering system; fibre optic internet; mains drainage. 

With its excellent volumes, great character and modern amenities, this house offers absolute peace in the heart of the village.
summary: Charming and authentic 18th century convent, in the heart of the village

title: V2638 L'ISLE-SUR-LA-SORGUE
body:
Set above the market town of l’Isle-sur-la-Sorgue, this spacious property offers a fantastic blend of authenticity and contemporary flair. The house lies centered on its 0.75-acre plot of landscaped woodland and benefits from airy interior volumes and an elegant yet inviting décor.

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: 52m2 sitting room with an insert fireplace and two large French windows granting access to a large dining terrace; modern kitchen with an adjoining dining space and French doors leading out to a roofed terrace; secondary sitting room arranged around a fireplace; utility room; guest loo.

The first floor is composed of: large double bedroom with dressing room space; second double bedroom; third bedroom currently used as an office; guest bathroom with a walk-in shower, double vanity, and loo.

The property also offers an independently accessed space that currently accommodates a guest suite. This space is air-conditioned and is composed of a double bedroom, a shower room and a loo. An oversized patio window grants access to a private terrace.

All the living spaces and bedrooms are south-facing and enjoy pretty views of the garden and the surrounding woodland.

The property’s grounds grant complete privacy and a particularly bucolic setting. Set away from the house lies a 6.5m x 1.5m ‘bassin’ style swimming pool, complete with a surrounding deck. The grounds are adorned by a series of manicured pine trees, towering cypress trees and centenary olive trees. A shrub-lined path leads up to the front door, creating a fantastic sense of arrival. A small outbuilding in the garden is used to store garden tools and furniture. The property has electric gates and benefits from a natural spring.

This superb property has been lovingly maintained by the current owners and grants an ease and high standard of living in a remarkable woodland setting.

Please contact us for the virtual viewing.
summary: Spacious l’Isle-sur-la-Sorgue property with landscaped garden

title: V2529 CAROMB
body:
Located just a short drive from the closest village, this charming property, comprising a main building and two independently accessed gîtes, is nestled in an idyllic and verdant setting.

A large arched gate opens to provide access to the property's 100 m² walled courtyard. This wonderfully distinctive Spanish Hacienda style layout offers the perfect spot to unwind, and relax in utter privacy. 

The main house comprises 150 m² of living space, consisting of: large 70 m² sitting room complete with a fireplace and access to the terrace; open-plan kitchen with access to the terrace; three bedrooms, one of which with access to the terrace; bathroom; guest loo; utility room. 

The larger gîte (80 m²) is composed of: open-plan kitchen-sitting room; bathroom; first-floor bedroom with a shower room en suite; two bedrooms; balcony offering a pretty view on the landscaped garden. This gîte has an independent entrance but can be accessed through the main house. 

Detached from the main house is the second gîte (40 m²) composed of: kitchen/sitting room; bedroom; shower room with loo.

The grounds are made up of 2.5 acres of bucolic parkland and landscaped gardens, complete with a 8m x 4m swimming pool, a garage and a carport for 2 additional vehicles.

The property is conveniently located in close proximity to the village, which offers various shops, grocers, cafés, restaurants, hairdressers, boulangeries, doctors, a nursery and and a primary school. The privileged location allows you to live in the countryside, while being close to the village as well as the Carpentras train station (12 minutes), the Avignon TGV train station (35 minutes) and Marseille and Nîmes airports (1 hour).
summary: Property near the Dentelles de Montmirail

title: V2306 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
South facing, partly stone property recently renovated with taste.

Fabulous property with breathtaking panoramic views of the Luberon, with an idyllic location on the edge of the village, ensuring absolute calm yet minutes from the village centre. Within the property and adjacent to the current sitting room there is 70m2 that could be easily converted if required. This would create over 200m2 of living space! 

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: entrance hall; fully equipped modern kitchen; good-sized sitting room; dining room; utility room and separate wc. All of the south facing rooms open onto the dominant terrace with its stunning views.

The first floor comprises: 2 bedrooms with ensuite bathrooms; separate wc; double bedroom and family bathroom. 

The garden has been beautifully landscaped and planted with pretty shrubs and trees. There is a pretty pool house and separate garage.

This property would make an amazing holiday, or family home, nestled in the very heart of the "golden triangle" with direct access to incredible woodland trails and gorgeous countryside! A coup de coeur guaranteed!
summary: South facing, partly stone property recently renovated with taste.

title: V2864 GOULT
body:
This spacious south-facing villa offers a well-conceived floor-plan that optimises space and light, a pretty landscaped garden, and a private swimming pool area. The property lies within walking distance of the ever-desirable Luberon village of Goult.

The ground floor comprises: large living space accommodating a sitting room, a dining area and a sleek, bespoke 'Fabre' kitchen; utility room; office or double bedroom; guest WC; ground floor gîte comprising a kitchenette, double bedroom and a shower room with walk-in shower. Large sliding doors line the living space, creating a seamless indoor-outdoor transition, and open to reveal a lovely covered dining terrace.

The first floor is composed of: elegant sitting room with an ornate stone fireplace, and an adjoining home office with a view of Mont Ventoux; south-facing master bedroom with contemporary ensuite bathroom (complete with a luxurious walk-in shower); further double bedroom; shower room; guest WC.

The property enjoys a terrific sense of privacy, despite being located just a short walk from the popular village of Goult. A large south-facing terrace runs along the front of the house, shaded by a pergola, offering the perfect spot for outdoor dining and entertaining. The swimming pool is set slightly away from the house, and is surrounded by a large terrace and complimented by a roofed seating area. Evening apéritifs can be enjoyed from a second, west facing, dining terrace.

The garden is planted with a fantastic variety of indigenous trees and plants - with mature olive trees, grape vines, wisteria plants, fig trees, tall pines, colourful oleanders and even a private bamboo forest! The garden is entirely fenced and hedged. The property also has electric gates and a large carport.

A warm and welcoming property, thoughtfully renovated and complimented with tasteful décor – on the edge of the desirable Luberon village of Goult, with its many restaurants, café, boulangerie, shops and grocers.
summary: Handsome villa property on the edge of the village of Goult

title: V2388 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
This charming property enjoys a privileged position on the edge of the village yet only a few minutes walk to all commerce.

The living accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: a light filled living area measuring  100m² including; open-plan, fully equipped kitchen leading to dining area and sitting room with superb contemporary open fireplace; 2 bedrooms both with en suite bathrooms and private terraces; guest wc; utility room.

Upstairs the accommodation comprises: spacious double bedroom with beautiful views of Luberon; ensuite bathroom; guest wc; double bedroom with ensuite bathroom.

Features of the property include: underfloor heating throughout the main property; videophone electric gates; fully automatic watering system; 25m² south facing terrace; well established landscaped gardens; ample parking with possibility for garage if required.

The particularly calm environment and open plan design of this attractive will surely capture the heart of the most discerning buyer!
summary: South facing traditionally built village house with beautiful garden and pool

title: V2461 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: entrance hall with built-in storage cupboards and stairs leading to the first floor; fully equipped open plan kitchen-dining room; sitting room with vaulted ceilings and pretty stone fireplace; WC.

On the first floor: second sitting room / study; spacious double bedroom with charming stone fireplace and large French window that opens onto the balcony (south-west facing); further double bedroom; bathroom; separate WC.

The second floor comprises: spacious master bedroom with shower room en suite and phenomenal Luberon views; independent WC; airing cupboard; double bedroom.

An arched gate provides access to the courtyard, and guarantees absolute privacy within the property despite its central location within the village and proximity to the bakery, bistro, butcher, and grocer. The easy-to-maintain flag-stoned courtyard boasts a 5m by 3m plunge pool with a charming fountain. The property also includes a small outbuilding with pool pump room and two technical rooms / workshops. A tiled roof covers part of the courtyard and provides a shaded seating area for hot summer days. The Provençal sun can be optimally enjoyed from the first-floor balcony.

Benefitting from a recent renovation, the house is ready to accommodate new owners and is sold fully furnished. The renovation included: double glazing with a combination of wood and wrought iron windows; modern bathrooms / shower rooms; plunge pool; courtyard restoration. The house is equipped with air conditioning on the ground floor and in the master suite.

This property would make a superb Luberon getaway and promises an exceptional rental potential due to its prime location within Cabrières-d’Avignon.
summary: Lovely authentic stone house with small pool in the heart of the village of Cabrières-d'Avignon

title: V2730 LAFARE
body:
Exclusive.

Provence, Vaucluse, in the heart of the Dentelles de Montmirail, very close to Beaumes de Venise and in superb surroundings!
Maison Victoire offers for sale this adorable house of 145m² living space, set in 1.5 hectares of land bordered by a river and with an abundant spring. 
The living comprises, on the ground floor: a fitted kitchen; a lounge/dining room with bay window and fireplace; a TV lounge; a bedroom with its shower room/wc and separate entrance; a utility room; a wc; 2 storage rooms and a cellar.
On the 1st floor, a first staircase leads to a landing leading to 2 bedrooms with large wardrobes, an office, and the bathroom/shower room with toilet. The second staircase leads to a bedroom with shower room/toilets, separate entrance and terrace. A garage completes the property.
Outside, there is a pleasure garden with pool area, a large meadow ideal for a horse, a vegetable garden and numerous olive and fruit trees. 
The village is within walking distance and all shops and schools are a 5-minute drive away.
It's a real postcard, a superb place, ideal for year-round living, second home or seasonal rentals.
summary: Rural villa property in stunning natural setting

title: V2667 ST SATURNIN LES APT
body:
Located on the edge of a pretty hamlet in the Luberon, this quintessentially Provençal 'Bastide' (Manor House) is steeped in traditional charm and enjoys generously proportioned living spaces and stunning views of the surrounding countryside. With a dominant location within the hamlet, the Bastide benefits from a south-facing garden, large plot of land, a pretty courtyard and a large heated swimming pool.

The ground floor of the Bastide comprises: entrance hall; air-conditioned Bistro-style dining kitchen; sitting room with wood burning stove and office area; guest loo.

The first floor offers four spacious double bedrooms and two shower rooms. An air conditioning unit at the top of the stairs serves the first floor.

This 2.4 acre property is entirely surrounded by vineyards and fruit tree orchards, providing a bucolic setting and panoramic views of the surrounding countryside. The 12m x 4.5m heated swimming pool lies to the south of the house and enjoys a breathtaking view that can be enjoyed in complete privacy. The property has a well and is connected to the town water supply (with an option of connecting to the Canal de Provence). The main access to the house is through a charming courtyard with a stone fountain and planted with a mulberry tree, roses and lavender.

A large barn can also be purchased (not comprised in the listing price) - this barn offers an enclosed surface area of roughly 180m2, to be renovated. Please contact us for more details.

A beautiful, charming and spacious property set in a terrific rural location.
summary: Beautiful bastide with land, swimming pool and superb views

title: V2888 SAUMANE DE VAUCLUSE
body:
Located in the heart of the sought after village of Saumane de Vaucluse, close to L'Isle-sur-la-Sorgue and Gordes, this adorable 161 m² house with garden, terrace and swimming pool offers magnificent views of the surrounding countryside. The property, previously occupied by various artists, exudes authenticity and charm.

The ground floor comprises: lovely sun-drenched sitting room with fireplace; large kitchen; dining area; bedroom; bathroom with w.c.

The first floor accommodates: three bedrooms; bathroom; possibility of creating a bathroom for each bedroom.

The garden level comprises: magnificent vaulted room opening onto a "soleillan"; large covered terrace with summer kitchen; technical room/workshop; utility room with w.c.;  large cellar.

The garden has been remarkably well landscaped, with various shaded terraces providing a welcome escape from the hot Provençal heat. The garden features a terrace with vine-covered pergola, a lovely variety of trees, and a 10m x 3m swimming pool fitted with a submerged electric cover.

The property includes an outbuilding with a garage (a rare asset in a village), a large storage space and an additional room( approx. 30 m² / 323 sq ft).

This haven of peace, light and comfort has a tremendous amount of authentic character, and with some minor refreshing, it would serve as an ideal for a permanent residence, a terrific second home or a holiday rental property.
summary: Spacious village house with views, garden, swimming pool and garage.

title: V2533 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
Located in the sought-after village of Cabrières-d’Avignon, this elegant late 19th-century property offers generous interior volumes, a large walled garden, and a garage, all less than a minute’s walk from the village's boulangerie, butcher and grocer.

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: sitting-dining room with fireplace; adjoining kitchen; utility room with guest loo; 42m² workshop that could serve as an extension of the ground-floor living space. Two small terraces to the rear of the house can be accessed from the kitchen and the workshop.

The first floor is composed of: 50m² master bedroom with adjoining shower room and south-facing private roof terrace; south-facing double bedroom; single bedroom; guest bathroom with loo; study.

The second floor accommodates a modern, self-contained suite with superb Luberon views. On one side of this space lies a sitting room, fitted with a wood-burning stove and a contemporary kitchen area. A stylish shower room creates a boundary between the sitting room and the double bedroom. Authentic terracotta floor tiles, exposed beams and high ceilings complement the contemporary décor and layout.

The property and the garden are concealed behind stone walls and a large gated archway. Once inside, you are greeted by a spacious covered terrace, with the garden and swimming pool just beyond. A 30m² double garage offers secure parking with ample room to spare for storage of any garden furniture and equipment. A small workshop, pool house, and additional covered terrace complete the garden. The 6m x 4m swimming pool is equipped with a ‘swim against the current function’, however it should be noted that it requires re-tiling or fitting with a liner. 

With a great indoor/outdoor balance, simple layout, and an abundance of character throughout, this property would make a fantastic family home or and easy-to-maintain getaway in the heart of the Luberon valley.
summary: 19th century village house with walled garden and swimming pool

title: V2606 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
Located just a short walk from the sought-after village of Cabrières-d’Avignon lies this handsome contemporary villa, complete with a lovely garden, swimming pool and large terraces. Pretty views of the Luberon countryside and the neighboring villages can be enjoyed throughout the property.

 
The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: open plan dining-sitting room flooded with light by three large French windows and adorned with an intricate Art Nouveau wood-burning stove; master bedroom with adjoining shower room and dressing room; sleek kitchen lined with oversized wrought-iron French windows; large utility room; guest loo. The kitchen benefits from direct access to a large covered terrace and enjoys lovely views of the surrounding Luberon countryside. The open plan living space is air-conditioned.

 
The first floor comprises: large double bedroom with an adjoining office space; two further double bedrooms; guest shower room; guest loo. Beautiful views of the Luberon and the nearby villages of Gordes and Bonnieux can be enjoyed from these first-floor bedrooms.
 
The large and well-conceived garden accommodates a large terraced area, partially shaded by a Pergola. The 8m x 4m swimming pool lies just beyond. Mature olive trees, truffle oak, apricot and cherry trees populate the garden, providing shelter from the sun and a terrific sense of privacy. There is also also a garage and large carport, and the property is entirely fenced and has automatic gates.
 
This lovely modern property is conveniently located within just a short walk from Cabrières-d’Avignon’s boulangerie, butchers and grocers. Complete tranquility is granted, despite the property’s close proximity to village life. The elegant décor, stellar location, lovely views and fantastic outdoor space ensure that this property would serve as a superb Luberon getaway, comfortable family home or interesting rental investment.
summary: Charming villa within walking distance of the village centre

title: V2624 GORDES
body:
Located close to the village of Gordes, this stone property enjoys an abundance of innate character, a tasteful décor and generous living spaces.

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: sitting room with handsome stone fireplace; glass-roofed veranda with a large dining table; kitchen.

The first floor is composed of: master bedroom with adjoining shower room and loo; double bedroom with a ‘Juliette’ balcony. Pretty views of the village of Gordes and of the Luberon mountain can be enjoyed from the first-floor bedrooms.

The lower floor comprises; double bedroom suite with adjoining shower room and loo; small room that could serve as a utility room or a wine cellar; garage equipped with an electric door.

The property benefits from a pretty 100m2 private garden, shaded by a mature olive tree, cypress trees and a mulberry tree. A small shed provides storage for the garden tools and furniture. A small swimming pool could be installed if desired.

The property would be suitable as an easy-to-maintain pied-à-terre with great rental potential. The house has been wonderfully renovated with particular care paid to the preservation of all the lovely original features. Located in the heart of the ‘Golden Triangle’, the Luberon’s sought-after perched villages and picturesque vineyards are all just a short drive from the property.
summary: Charming Gordes hamlet property with garden

title: V2446 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
Positioned in the heart of Cabrières d'Avignon are these two separate but side-by-side village houses each with separate entries, offering generous space for family and friends, as well as the opportunity to rent one or both for investment income.

House 1: The living accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: entry hall; open plan kitchen/dining room; laundry/storage room; small under-house cellar.
On the half level: bathroom.
First floor comprises: double bedroom; smaller bedroom currently used as a dressing room.
Second floor comprises: large bedroom currently used as a sitting room.

House 2: The living accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: sitting room with fireplace; open plan kitchen/dining room with direct access to the street.
First floor comprises: double bedroom with shower & basin plus stair-access to the sitting room; bathroom with bath; twin bedroom.
Top floor comprises: large bedroom.

A large ancient timber portal provides access to the courtyard which separates the two houses and offers parking for one or even two small cars. The tiled plunge pool is 4m x 3m with a depth of 1.5m.

An exceptional opportunity to acquire two magnificently-renovated village houses each with independent entry in the heart of a very charming stone-built village close to Gordes and L'Isle-sur-la-Sorgue.
summary: Two 19th century Village houses with central courtyard and plunge pool

title: V2713 ROUSSILLON
body:
Located on the edge of the perched Luberon village of Roussillon, this attractive property comprises a single-storey house and an adjacent stone guest house. The property offers excellent privacy, generous interior volumes, and a wealth of authentic character. Uninterrupted views of the Luberon valley can be enjoyed throughout. The layout is ideal for accommodating family and friends, with privacy for all. The independent guest house ('gîte') also offers strong rental potential, without the need for owners to share living space. The entire property has been renovated to a high standard, with quality natural materials, bespoke fittings, and modern comforts throughout.

French doors open from the main terrace into the main living space, ensuring excellent natural light and a seamless transition from indoors and outdoors - ideal for entertaining or simply enjoying the panoramic views and colourful mediterranean sunsets.

The main house features a spacious open-plan layout that includes: large dining area; sitting room with a handsome reclaimed stone fireplace and bespoke fitted library; contemporary kitchen; guest WC. French doors throughout provide access to the south-facing dining terrace, while there is a second, covered, breakfast terrace to the rear. Exposed beams, travertine floor tiles, and neutral tones ensure bright airy living spaces.

The master bedroom lies just beyond the living area, offering floor-to-ceiling oak wardrobes, two oversized French doors opening onto the terrace, and an ensuite shower room with WC. This suite enjoys a particularly lovely view of Roussillon’s iconic ochre cliffs and the Luberon valley.

The adjacent gîte benefits from its own entrance, both from the main terrace and the parking area. It is arranged as a fully independent guest house, with a kitchen, sitting room (or third bedroom), and shower room with WC on the main level, and two additional bedrooms with ensuite shower rooms on the upper levels. The configuration comfortably accommodates four to six guests.

The large main terrace overlooks the valley below. A centenary olive tree and wrought-iron pergolas add structure to the space and shade during the long summer months. Steps from the breakfast terrace lead to a small upper terrace with particularly impressive views of the rooftops and surrounding countryside. The property also includes two remarkable wine cellars: one set against the ochre rockface, and another, older cellar carved directly into the stone beneath the house.

The property boasts a large garage (17 m²), additional private parking, and automatic gates.

Amenities include: wood-framed double glazing; mains water; mains drainage; reversible air conditioning; alarm system.

This is a cleverly re-imagined village house in one of the Luberon’s most iconic villages. With superb views, generous living spaces, and excellent outdoor areas, it is ideally located just a short stroll from Roussillon’s restaurants, cafés, shops and boulangerie.
summary: Spacious village property with stunning views.

title: V2488 GOULT
body:
Perched on the edge of the centre of the picturesque village of Goult, this conveniently located property features a private garden complete with a swimming pool and fantastic views.

The large open-concept ground floor is composed of: fully-equipped American kitchen with Zimbabwe granite worktops and a wine cellar; sitting area with sofas around a built-in fireplace; dining area with drinks bar. South and east facing French windows lead out into the garden creating a fabulous space that blurs the boundaries between interior and exterior. There is also an independent WC on the ground floor.

The first floor comprises: two bedrooms with shower rooms en suite; master bedroom with bathroom en suite and south-facing balcony with the same exceptional view; independent WC; garage with electric door and laundry area.

The cleverly landscaped garden offers a variety of outdoor areas to entertain friends and family. The entirely south-facing garden offers a 5 x 3 swimming pool, outbuilding used as a workshop, additional small outbuilding with WC, fantastic barbecue area with traditional pizza oven, and a large, covered terrace for outdoor dining. Two beautiful oaks, honey suckle, jasmins and an olive tree guarantee complete privacy and much needed shade during the long summer months. There is also a small vegetable garden and large gravelled area to enjoy the game of Petanque from your own home. 

The property’s perched position ensures unobstructed, jaw-dropping valley views enhanced by the recent garden makeover. The serene garden combined with a stylish interior and stone’s throw distance from one of the most prized Luberon villages promise a fabulous and wonderfully private Provençal getaway. The village of Goult offers a wide variety of restaurants and bars - a boulangerie, grocers, butchers and famed weekly farmer’s market - all right on this property’s doorstep.
summary: Village house in Goult with stunning views

title: V2775 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
This well-conceived contemporary property is located just a short walk from the desirable village of Cabrières-d’Avignon and enjoys a large landscaped garden, a lovely swimming pool area and a great variety of outdoor living spaces. A chic contemporary décor and pretty views of the Luberon countryside complete this property.

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: open concept sitting-dining room with a wood-burning stove, drenched with natural light by five large French windows; sleek contemporary kitchen with a peninsula and quartz worktops; gorgeous master bedroom with a large bathroom fitted with a bathtub, a walk-in shower and a toilet; two further double bedrooms (one currently used as an artist’s ‘atelier’); guest shower room with a toilet. Two lovely covered terraces are accessed from the kitchen and the sitting room and enjoy views of the Luberon mountains.

The house also features a well-equipped utility room/rear kitchen and a technical room. 

The 0.47-acre garden has been landscaped with care and enjoys a lovely 9m x 4.5m swimming pool complete with surrounding terraced area. A pool house outbuilding accommodates a covered terrace and a technical room (housing the pool pump and filtration system). The property is entirely fenced and has automatic gates and parking to the rear.

Modern amenities include: geothermal underfloor heating/cooling; double glazing throughout; mains water and mains drainage; fibre optic internet; alarm system. 

This stylish property would be ideally suited as an easy-to-maintain Luberon retreat with excellent rental potential. The picturesque village of Cabrières-d’Avignon, with its bakery, butchers, grocers and restaurant, lies within a short walk of the property’s front door.
summary: Spacious modern property within walking distance of Cabrières-d'Avignon

title: V2627 L'ISLE-SUR-LA-SORGUE
body:
Located in the heart of the bustling market town of l’Isle-sur-la-Sorgue, this spacious apartment boasts an impressive open-concept layout, a great rooftop terrace and an industrial chic décor with a touch of contemporary flair.

The entrance hall opens to unveil a sweeping living space, comprising a sleek modern kitchen, formal dining area and generous relaxed seating arranged around the fireplace insert. French windows and overhead Velux windows (equipped with electric shutters) flood this space with natural light. The well-equipped kitchen features an island unit and breakfast bar.

The ground floor is also composed of: master bedroom with a walk-in dressing room en suite; further double bedroom; shower room with lavish Italian shower; guest loo.

Finally, a floating staircase in the living room grants access to a mezzanine bedroom suite, complete with an adjoining home office, shower room and loo. 

Amenities include: air-conditioning throughout; Velux windows with electric shutters; fibre-optic internet. The apartment benefits from a communal garden and a private storage space. The rental contract for a parking space can be transferred to the new owners if desired.

The apartment enjoys a lovely rooftop terrace, fitted with a Jacuzzi with a view of the Vaucluse mountains. A retractable awning ensures shade during the long summer months.

A uniquely chic property with great potential for seasonal rental investment, a convenient pied-à-terre, or a small family home.
summary: Stylish contemporary l’Isle-sur-la-Sorgue apartment with rooftop terrace and Jacuzzi

title: V2408 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
Set in 1,2 hectares of lush parkland on the edge of the famous village of Cabrières d’Avignon, this property is well situated.

With an open plan design and a beach house theme, the interior of the property makes for a refreshing change. The exterior has a modern feel and includes a smart, contemporary 'venetian' style sun canopy for the expansive decking.

The living accommodation comprises: sitting room that flows through to the open plan, fully equipped kitchen with adjacent dining area; 3 bedrooms; family bathroom; separate wc. All of the ground floor rooms open onto the south facing terrace and it's fabulous views of the Luberon.

Set apart from the main house is the independent gîte that has a bedroom, bathroom and it's own private terrace. 

The elegant swimming pool (10m x 5 heated) is separated from the gardens by a traditional stone wall that includes some welcome shade for the gym area.  

The grounds include an olive grove and even a pretty stone "cabanon" presently used to house the pool equipment. There is also a double garage and plenty of parking.

This property would make a great home or holiday residence and the separate gîte is a real plus!
summary: South facing, light filled property with unobstructed views of the Luberon.

title: V2716 LE BARROUX
body:
In the heart of peace and quiet, authentic and beautifully restored property with 180 m² of living space, a pleasant shaded courtyard and a garage.
The property comprises on the garden level: stunning 21 m² vaulted room; covered terrace; garage; 3 cellars totaling 50 m².

The magnificent outside staircase leads to a terrace and the entrance door which open onto: dining room with its magnificent stone floor tiles and fireplace; sitting room with a wood stove; new superbly integrated kitchen; utility area; loo; bedroom with an adjoining shower room and loo.
The upstairs accommodates: bedroom with its own shower room and loo; bedroom (to be completed); study area; shower room; separate loo; bedroom.

A property with modern comforts and a Zen feel, which has retained its old-world charm and superb materials.
summary: Lovely village house with charming exterior and garage

title: V2310 CABRIERES D'AVIGNON
body:
The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: 50m2 sitting room with cathedral ceiling and French windows opening onto the manicured garden and covered terrace; fully equipped kitchen; bedroom with ensuite bathroom; separate wc; generous garage/utility room.

On the first floor: bright mezzanine/office overlooking the sitting room; 2 bedrooms, one opening onto the balcony and both with ensuite bathrooms; separate wc.

Attached to the main house but with an independent entrance is a guest wing comprising 2 bedrooms and a bathroom. 

The property has a low maintenance, well maintained garden fenced on all sides. 

It's rare to find a property in this price bracket with 5 bedrooms and 4 bathrooms in such a privileged position. Only minutes from the centre of this lively village and its various commerce, including bakers, butchers, and restaurant. 

This property is sure to create the famous "coup de coeur"
summary: South facing villa in an exquisite position with views of the Luberon.

title: V2986 LE THOR
body:
This attractive modern house with three bedrooms and an office, sits in a secure and peaceful residential area on the edge of Le Thor, close to the popular and sought-after town of Isle-sur-la-Sorgue. The property boasts a beautiful vine-covered terrace overlooking the easily maintained garden and swimming pool, with a further terrace to the east.

The accommodation on the ground floor comprises: well-equipped contemporary kitchen opening onto a large living space with an integrated dining area and sitting room, complete with fireplace; laundry room including a pantry; office; separate w.c.

The first floor is composed of; master bedroom with shower room en suite; large open-style dressing room; two further bedrooms; family bathroom with both bath and walk-in shower, with separate w.c.

The 0.25-acre south-facing garden unfolds in front of the house with its recently built 7m x 3.5m swimming pool (2023) equipped with an electric cover. The property is not isolated but entirely hedged thus sufficiently private with parking space just outside the gate (and within).

Amenities include: double glazing throughout; mains water and drainage; private parking spaces; two newly installed water boilers, one on each floor; electric heating; water softener; bore-hole for outside watering; smoke detector; outside lighting on the terrace; ADSL internet; possibility to connect to fibre internet; PH regulator for the pool; garage.

This charming and well-built family home, decorated with taste, benefits from all the local schools and amenities, within easy reach of the stunning papal city of Avignon, and the international TGV station. The tranquil town of Le Thor is located on the edge of the well-known and busier town of Isle-sur-la Sorgue, famous for it's antique shops and Sunday market,  well-placed for exploring the many attractions that the region offers.
summary: 'Mas' with garden and pool

title: V2478 RUSTREL
body:
This detached village house has been carefully restored and features a charming interior surrounded by a beautifully tended garden. The house’s abundance of character combined with its calm position on the edge of this lively Luberon village assures it would make an idyllic get-away with a great rental yield.

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: dining room with French windows leading onto the front garden; kitchen; sitting room with French windows out onto the terrace; bathroom.

On the first floor we have the master bedroom with bathroom en suite and a further bedroom.

Particular care was paid during the renovation to retain and expose the original features, all whilst updating the house with much-needed modern amenities. Provençal ceilings, authentic stonework, traditional terracotta tiles and beautiful French windows follow throughout adding character to this delightful property.

The garden offers a fabulous sense of space and privacy, with various intimate areas for sitting, dining and sun-bathing, populated with indigenous figs, mulberries, cherries, oleanders and centenary olives. There is 9.4 m x 4.5 m swimming pool and pool house (currently used as a covered summer bedroom with shower room en suite). The property also has private parking for up to two cars. 

This picturesque Provençal cottage offers all the convenience of a village house yet with an unusually generous garden and swimming pool. Rustrel’s bakery, grocers, Auberge, and Bistrot all lie within minutes of the property’s front door.
summary: Charming stone property in the village of Rustrel

title: V2673 VENASQUE
body:
Authentic and charming property located in the heart of Venasque, classified as one of the most beautiful villages in France. 
This house currently consists of a main house and a cottage, but it is very easy to combine them into a single entity. 

The main house

The ground floor comprises: entrance hall; workshop opening onto the courtyard; cellar; boiler room. 
The first floor consists of : kitchen open onto the dining room; two bedrooms; bathroom with loo. 
The second floor offers: master suite with bedroom and bathroom; shower and loo; magnificent living room bathed in light with access to the panoramic terrace. 

The cottage

The ground floor comprises: dining kitchen; bathroom with loo; bedroom opening onto the interior courtyard. 
The first floor holds a second bedroom and the second floor: living room (or extra bedroom) with access to its own panoramic terrace. 

This charming property is ideal for year-round living, as a second home or for seasonal rental. All shops are within walking distance (bakery, grocery store, restaurants, cafes). Gordes is 20 minutes away and it takes 40 minutes to get to Avignon TGV.
summary: Village house with courtyard and panoramic terraces

title: V2441 SARRIANS
body:
This authentic 1900’s Bastide, located in a quiet and idyllic part of the Vaucluse countryside, boasts pretty gardens planted with indigenous shrubs and trees, and a south-facing terrace from which to enjoy it. Many of the original features were retained during the renovation that contribute to the charm of this elegant property.

The accommodation comprises, on the ground floor: entrance hall with stone fireplace; kitchen/dining room; sitting room; utility room. 

The first floor comprises: master suite, including dressing room or study, double bedroom and en suite bathroom; a 2nd double bedroom with en suite bathroom.

The second floor comprises: double bedroom with en suite bathroom; a further 3 rooms with potential for 2 bedrooms and a bathroom (plumbing in place).

The property had been well-maintained, has recent oil-fired central heating, and forage water for watering as well as domestic use. There is a good-sized garage with wc, garden store and workshop.

The garden is split into three main areas. The main garden, beautifully kept, is entirely fenced and hedged in, providing a tremendous sense of tranquility and privacy. Beyond this, two fields with a large stable that could accommodate horses or be used to store garden equipment. 

Whilst this property would be ideal for equestrian use, it would equally make an excellent family home or investment as a bed and breakfast. A lovely authentic rural property.
summary: Renovated, early 19th century farmhouse surrounded by landscaped gardens.

title: V3028 MENERBES
body:
At the epicenter of Ménerbes, this charming stone home seamlessly blends authentic character with contemporary sophistication. Situated in one of the Luberon's most vibrant villages, renowned for its dynamic community and rich cultural offerings, this rare, move-in ready residence with 80 m2 interior space total is bathed in natural light and boasts expansive views. Thoughtfully updated to meet modern needs, updated with impeccable taste the home invites you to enjoy the very best of village life: arts, gastronomy, nature, light, and a strong sense of community right at your doorstep.

The ground floor features an open-concept kitchen and living area, complemented by a guest WC. Sunlight pours through large windows, illuminating every detail of this thoughtfully designed space.
A bespoke staircase leads to the second floor, where the master bedroom and a second bedroom (currently used as an office) enjoy stunning valley views. A bathroom with a shower serves this level, and across from the master, French doors open to a small garden area, the perfect spot for a quiet coffee or reading session.

The expansive top floor is a bright and versatile with skylights, additional French doors, and a second private bathroom with a shower. A discreet closet houses a washer and eventual dryer. Currently used as a bedroom, this floor offers endless possibilities for customization.

Every detail in this home has been thoughtfully curated—terracotta tiles, wooden doors with wrought iron hardware, and large double-glazed windows create a harmonious atmosphere throughout, connecting each room with seamless elegance. This sophisticated village property offers far more than meets the eye.
summary: Charming stone house in the heart of the village

title: V2566 VIOLES
body:
This charming Provençal farmhouse, surrounded by vineyards, is located close to renowned villages of Vacqueyras, Gigondas and Beaumes de Venise. The property enjoys a wonderfully peaceful setting, with lovely views of the legendary Dentelles de Montmirail.

The accommodation on the ground floor comprises: entrance hall; bright sitting room with access to the garden; large fitted kitchen; utility room; larder; guest WC. A staircase in the entrance hall leads up to the first floor.

The accommodation on the first floor is composed of: master suite with adjoining bathroom and dressing room; two further double bedrooms, both with an en suite bathroom.

An adjoining barn could be converted into an impressive open concept living space area, or a ground floor bedroom. A garage completes the property.

Whilst the property would benefit from some updating, this utterly charming farmhouse property would serve as a bucolic Provençal retreat, with seasonal rental potential.
summary: Charming Provencal farmhouse surrounded by vineyards

title: V2589 ST PANTALEON
body:
Nestled in a bucolic setting and surrounded by vineyards and woodland, this contemporary property offers a convenient single-storey layout, an impressive living space, and a private wooded garden – all in the heart of the Luberon’s Golden Triangle.

The front door opens onto a 55m2 living space composed of: well-equipped dining kitchen with decorative cement tiling; relaxed seating area arranged around a pellet burning stove. This space features a great ceiling height with exposed beams, a ceiling fan, oversized windows, and a remarkably chic décor complemented by waxed cement flooring. The living space leads into a large office space with the master suite just beyond.  The suite accommodates a dressing room area, a spacious double bedroom and a bathroom with shower and loo.

A garage, utility room and guest loo complete this property.

The large living room (55m2) could be partially divided to accommodate a second bedroom if desired (3D model provided below). The garage (19m2) could also be converted to extend the living space.

Amenities include; reversible air-conditioning and a ceiling fan in the living room, and modern double-glazing. The property is connected to mains drainage and town water. 

The 0.41-acre wooded plot provides complete privacy and grants a pretty view of the surrounding woodland and vineyards. Large sliding windows from the living space open onto an outdoor dining terrace. A swimming pool could be installed in the garden if desired.

A wonderfully chic and well-positioned Luberon property, within walking distance of the Luberon village of Saint-Pantaleon
summary: Contemporary property in the heart of the Luberon countryside

title: V2666 ST SATURNIN LES APT
body:
A stone’s throw from the heart of the popular village of St-Saturnin-Lès-Apt, this adorable 18th century village house was entirely remodelled in 2022.  It is suitable as a family home, a pied-à-terre in the Luberon, or an investment to let as a seasonal rental.  

The ground floor is composed of a fully-equipped bespoke Fabre kitchen (with plumbing for a dishwasher) and a sitting/dining room.  Adjacent to the dining area is a further south-facing space with a newly-installed pellet-burning stove gracing the chimney hearth, which is decorated with gorgeous Italian tiles.  The south-facing windows allow natural light to flood this space and with the kitchen windows also open, there is a pleasant cross-breeze through the house in warmer months.  On this floor is a bathroom with loo, bathtub, and washer and dryer.

On the first floor are the master bedroom, and guest bedroom with a lovely view towards the Luberon mountains.  The bathroom on this floor has a loo and shower.  Both bedrooms have reversible air conditioning.

The top floor is accessed via the master bedroom, and grants impressive Luberon views.  With its own air-conditioning unit, it is currently used as a home gym and bar, kitted out with a sink and wine fridge.  This space could also serve as a third bedroom or office.

This lovely village property comes with its own garage and vaulted cellar, accessible from the street below.  There is already access to water and electricity here.

An excellent opportunity to invest in a tastefully-renovated village house nestled at the foot of the village’s iconic medieval château and chapel, yet just a few steps from all the cafés, shops and restaurants!
summary: Charming village house, fully renovated

title: V2579 ST SATURNIN LES APT
body:
Located on the edge of a traditional hamlet on the commune of Saint-Saturnin-lès-Apt, this charming stone property has been tastefully renovated and benefits from a beautiful plot of land and pretty views of the surrounding countryside.

The accommodation comprises: living room with a contemporary kitchen and sitting room space with large wrought iron French doors; adjoining double bedroom; modern shower room; loo; second double bedroom with an independent access.

The generous 0.2-acre garden offer beautiful views of the surrounding landscape. A large hackberry tree provides shade to the terraced seating/dining area to the front of the house. A small shed serves to store garden tools and furniture.

The house is connected to the mains water supply and has a septic tank (conform to the latest regulations).

This charming property has benefited from a complete renovation to ensure an excellent level of comfort in a unique rural setting.
summary: Gorgeous stone property with 0.2-acre garden

title: V3052 SIMIANE LA ROTONDE
body:
Located in the old quarter of Simiane-la-Rotonde, a stone’s throw from the castle, and walking distance from the bakery and restaurants, this adorable property, a former post office, is the perfect marriage of authenticity and modern comfort.The views are drop-dead gorgeous. Behind its traditional stone façade, the interiors have been thoughtfully reimagined to offer a light, airy and elegant living space.

The ground floor accommodates: fully-renovated kitchen with exposed stone walls; dining room; guest loo; spacious dining terrace.

The first floor enjoys: sitting room; south-facing terrace with incredible views.

The second floor offers: pretty bedroom with closet space; shower room.

Clean lines and a Provençal palette enhance the sense of space and calm, while carefully preserved original features —exposed stone walls, ‘tommette’ tiles – provide character and charm.

Behind the house, down old stone steps, is a private garden with plenty of space for raised vegetable beds, outdoor dining, a hamac in the shade and glorious 180° views.

Amenities include: reversible A/C; double glazing and wooden window frames; fibre optic internet; mains water; mains drainage. On the lower level, there is a further 27m² of utility space with laundry. Free public parking just steps away.

The renovation reflects a deep respect for the house’s history, with a harmonious blend of old and new: sleek contemporary fittings sit comfortably alongside rustic elements.  Enjoy the delightful street-side terrace for watching the va-et-vient, or relax in the shade in the garden, overlooking the valley. With its undeniable character and breath-taking views, this property offers comfortable and convenient living, in an historic Luberon village.
summary: Authentic house in the heart of the village with fabulous views.
